review_body: My daughter and I visited from Memphis,TN in March 2019 for spring break to see Broadway. The hotel was very nice and accommodating. Most memorable was the accommodating and informative concierge, Patrick! He was a wealth of knowledge regarding Broadway and places to dine, and always greeted us with a smile. We came back a year later for spring break once again, and he even remembered us from the previous year! We will definitely stay at Night on our next visit to NYC!

We stayed here for a week and although didn't enjoy the rooms themselves, Patrick made us have a fantastic stay! He was super friendly and made my partner feel happy (somehow!) after losing his wallet. Would definitely recommend just for him! (And the location is also very good! You are literally staying at times square)

I booked the hotel for 3 nights.Overall It was not a very comfortable stay.First, location is nice but can be very hectic since it’s too busy and fussy since there is too many tourists in this area.Cleaness and management was below my expectations.( what I expect for the 4star hotels)There was lots of human hair on the bathrobe. So l asked them to change it twice since there was hair on the second robe too.And the carpet was spotty the bathroom faucets were lose.Bed linens were too old had scratch feeling flakes on them.There were too many holes in the closet.The room is too dark and it’s lack of lighting. I had trouble with adjusting the lights.There were facility fee which included gym outside the building but never instructed by anyone.When I check out I told the front desk about these issues but they only told me to email them.When I email them they refused to accept what happened and did not apologized.They keep saying that there were no evidence for that.So I will share the photo of evidence here.

I would highly recommend this hotel due to the staff at the front desk, the staff at restaurant, and the house keeping staff. Everyone was nice and responsive to our needs. In addition, it’s right next to Time Square and next to the major subway station at 42nd. The decor was dark and sexy, so I wouldn’t recommend it for kids. There is parking next door at a reasonable price and the rooms are not bad if you are looking to spend your time out and about. I would stay here again.

* Perfect location* The decoration is dark - we liked it and found it stylish* Nice stuff* Good japanese restaurant (you can take away as well) * Tea, coffee and hot water available in the mornings free of charge as self service* Nice restaurants for breakfast, lunch and dinner near by* Good subway connections* No screaming kids* Broadway musicals easy to reach* High quality bath productions available every day* Luggage room available free of charge* Flexible and good cleaning (if you want to postpone the cleaning from morning to afternoon, just agree with the cleaning lady) * The heating system did not work correctly but was fixed right away we reported to the staff* The air condition/heating system is noisy* The furnitures are partly worn, they need updating in near futureHighly recommended!

We booked the penthouse here for two nights to stay after our cruise from NYC to Canada and back to NYC. We were so excited to stay here and have our own terrace in NYC!! This was a huge part of the trip we were very much looking forward. We called a month or two ahead and paid for the whole stay in full and even verified that once we got there we would not have to pay anything so we can plan our expenses accordingly. Come the day of flying to NYC from FL we land in NYC only to find out we have NO ROOM!!!!! Imagine flying to a new state for the first time with two young children to find out the hotel you have the confirmation for has canceled on you with absolutely no head up or warning. They somehow "lost the card on file" and could not help us any further. We had to book a last-minute hotel 30 minutes out of the city luckily they weren't fully booked out. The hotel manager had zero remorse for what happened they said over and over there is nothing they can do to help us.

Had to wait 15 minutes for someone to check us in. Guy turns up in a hoody, with air pods in - not professional at all.Was then confronted with an expensive “resort fee” that covered the “free WiFi” and gym which i didn’t need, but had to pay. Room was missing half the advertised amenities (like an iron). Room was dated and in desperate need of upgrading. The “city view” was of a back alley. Had a better city view from the street outside. Room was next to an outside generator, could hardly sleep. Whole ambiance would have been good in 2000, but not 2019.

Very Noisy, couldnt sleep at all, No robes, had to ask for them, room was not ready for guest ...TV not working the whole trip... as I said I had to ask for robes and towles ...we were only ones who didnt get umbrellas , couldnt fine mini bar till last day when packing , it was hidden under the table, with long tablecloth on it so I didnt know it was there ...room so small you cant walk past eachother ... but NOISY as heck, got locked out of room a few times, ...NO LIGHT in rooms, its so dark I couldnt see to put my makeup on...sadm, sad... just a big disapointment for $1400.00 ...Hopefully they refund part of this, only nice thing was front Desk person Patrick....wont ever stay there again, oh and I got pink eye from dirty pillow case ...

The total price for two nights came to c. $729 for a single room with a view of the air shaft. After check in, room was promised to be ready in an hour and was not. The room was TINY, the bathroom has a step up and is a definite fall hazard and the shower had NO pressure. Only free coffee and tea between 7-9 am and it took 8 hours to get a wash rag on my second day. NOT worth the money!

This place is extremely close to time square. And the staff is very helpful in guiding their customers. Overall for the price point this is a good place to stay in. At first my wife and I were a little worried cause the deco and pictures suggest it’s a sex club but once we checked in and got the good service we were happy. The deco is set up for the younger crowd but grows on you.

Just got back from a weekend in NYC, what to say about "The Night?" So this was a fun couples weekend in NYC, so we did not mind that the lobby featured photos with full-frontal nudity and looked like a place the vampires on True Blood would hang... I mean we were in NYC to party right? That said, If I had brought kids I would have needed to cover their eyes in the lobby, and on every floor when I got out of the elevator. The staff was very nice with us. I do not think they were vampires, but the girl in the sushi resturant may have been... she only comes out at night.

I had countless emails back and forward to arrange a bottle to be delivered to my brothers room for his wedding day. I even had sent a form with a copy of my credit card details and drivers license with clear instructions despite having confirmation in the emails that this would be done.On the day I called the hotel to check and see if it had been delivered which they said it had. I checked with my brother later on and it had not been delivered. I called the hotel again and they said he was not staying there. I confirmed the room number with my brother and called the hotel again and they agreed it had not been delivered. At this point my brother and his fiancé were leaving the hotel to go and get married. I am in Australia and this was the only way to put a personal message to them and moment I can never get back.I’m so disgusted and disappointed with this hotels customer service.They were also rude and inpatient on the phone.

The hotel is in a perfect location, very clean, modern has a mini bar. If you need anything just call the front desk. It’s very dark in the hallway and in the room it was hard to put my makeup on. I would recommend this hotel.

Wow wow wow what a lovely stay ! I highly recommend this hotel not only because it is located in the heart of times square in walking distance to times square subway station but also because the staff are so friendly & the rooms are super comfortable with a sexy interior. I would also recommend their lounge & restaurant red moon for an authentic asian dinner and a cocktail happy hour. Special thanks to the luggage guy with long hair (sorry i didnt get your name) for his directions & recommendations around the city. Will most def be back !

Excellent place to stay. The ambience is amazing. Leena, the best bartender was AWESOME!!! Leena is the bomb. Best Experience ever!!!!!!Thanks to LeenaAlso ran into DaBaby coming out of Hard Rock, represent North Carolina

my sister booked this for me for 3nts in Sep. Location is the USP for this hotel right in the Theatre district, amidst the action and colorful times square with restaurants, lot of attractions and hop-on ho-off bus tours starting points. Their front desk staff is courteous and helpful. Specially the wonderful and amiable Daniela Sava. She is a gem and was helpful throughout even before my sister confirmed my booking she patiently answered my sister's questions and guided her. She was caring enough to safely keep somethng i forgot in room at checkout and emailed my sister about the same so i could come and pick it up. Thank you Daniela, you made my stay at the hotel even more memorable.Some cons though1) The rooms are quite small so not ideal for families2) Water bottles were not provided daily in the room even though I paid the mandatory property fee of $25+plus taxes which entitled me for this water

Pros:- Modern, dark with sexy feeling. I love the combination of black and white in the decor!- Less than a block from Time Square. Killer LOCATION!- Clean and Quite.- Reasonable prices.Con:- Small room with a tiny bathroom.

Happy with our stay here . Helpful staff and smart hotel . Rooms on the small side , but bathroom was large , bed was comfy and everything clean . No breakfast included , but just go to 'Cranberry cafe' 50 yds up the street . They have everything you need for b/fast or lunch , eat in or take out . Times square 2 min walk and subway stations about 5 - 10 min depending which line you need . Hotel is modern and chic .2 Irish bars across the street are good for a drink and decent value food . I would have given full marks if they provided tea/coffee making facilities in the room , but they don't . Overall would stay here again .

I chose this hotel for it's location. You're right in the middle of all the action, and steps away from Times Square and all the theaters. I checked in a bit before 3pm (more like 2:30) and they did have a room available for me. It's a small boutique hotel with a sushi restaurant (Red Moon) right on the first floor. If you're walking by, and you blink, you may miss the entrance. Whoever is at the front desk could greatly vary from cold as ice, to friendly and welcoming. It just depends on who's working that shift. The decor is all black and white, so it's very bougie/chic with a nighttime vibe (hence the name). Yes, the elevators are a bit on the slow side, but if you get a room on the 2nd floor, the stairs on the left goes right to the floor. It seems like since this hotel opened, it's been run down by tourists. It'll always have business because of location, but my ironing board was missing, no bathrobe, and only 2 hangers in the closest (one of which was broken). BUT it's a good thing I'm a low maintenance person. All these people that left bad reviews are spoiled. It just took a quick phone call downstairs to get a robe and more towels, and they were more than accommodating to bring me whatever I needed. They honored the do not disturb sign on my door, but if housekeeping ran into me in the hallway, they'd ask if I needed anything. My answer was always "no". My room was perfect for a solo, but will be crowded for 2 people. There was no drawer space except for the 2 night stands on either side of the bed. The bed was like sleeping in a soft cloud, and the hotel was very quiet at night, since it seems to cater more to adults than families. The bougie black and white decor gave more of an urban feel, but the room stayed dark when all the curtains were closed.  I personally had a GREAT time staying here. It was close to everything, and it seemed like my own private getaway from the Times Square craziness. And it's great to have a staff that's respectful to my privacy. I would DEFINITELY stay here again!!!

The staff were brilliant. The receptionist who was on when we arrived was great. Funny, friendly and very welcoming. The rooms are very clean and love the black and white decor. Definitely recommend this hotel x

My sister and I just returned home from 5 nights at this hotel. Our flight was delayed, so we called the hotel to let them know. My sister provided her name but the hotel desk person was very short with her and just said, "we got it." When we went to check in, we were put in a room on the 8th floor. When we got up to the room in the EXTREMELY slow elevator, the door looked like it had been broken into and didn't fully shut. The key cards we were provided didn't work, so we had to go back down with our luggage to the front desk. The front desk guy took us back up to the room, and the keys still didn't work. We were then moved to a room on the 7th floor with a door that also did not shut all the way. There are no amenities at this hotel. To make things even worse for our stay, the AC went out in the ENTIRE hotel our 2nd to last night. When we woke up Tuesday morning, our room was 76*. We went about our day and returned back to our room around midnight at it was 81* in our room!!! My sister called the front desk, and was told by Patrick they were "fully booked." We knew that couldn't be true. My sister then went down to the front desk and demanded we be moved to a lower floor. Magically, a room was found and we were moved to the 2nd floor where our room was 74*. I changed our flight to leave at 8:10AM instead of the original 2:45PM because our stay in this hotel was THAT horrible. The rooms and hallways are very very dark. I couldn't even see to put on my makeup in the bathroom.

Spend your money elsewhere. They charged my credit card for the full amount before I stayed, despite the fact they were supposed to only take a small holding deposit. Then they took 100 dollars for a deposit from my boyfriend's card on our arrival without telling him, and then proceeded to take further funds from his credit card once we had checked out. This was despite the receptionist assuring us there was nothing further to pay. We both sent emails chasing for a refund of the 100 dollar deposit and extra charges and only had one reply from Anna Soibech telling us she will look into it. Since then we have heard nothing back from her but I noticed last week they made the refund on my credit card for the extra charge and not my boyfriend's, and we have received no explanation nor apology as to why taken in the first place.Despite the fact we found the hotel to be ok, I would not recommend nor stay again due to them taking money from our credit cards as and when they liked without our permission. You also weren't allowed to use the fridge in the room and the area can be quite seedy at night.

First time in NYC, so I wanted to book a hotel close to Time Square. Excellent location, literally, steps from Time Square. In hindsight, visiting TS one or two days would be just fine. Beautifully chic hotel with friendly staff. We had two big windows in our room.

First and foremost, I need to thank Patrick at the front desk. While I was checking in, he noticed my Playbill for "The Prom." This opened the conversation to all the shows we've seen, our friends in the theatre, and New York sites. Of note, during the check-in process, guests walking in took time to stop by and just say "Hi" to him. He wished them happy birthday, conversed in Spanish, and never missed a single beat in our conversation. Check-in was not only seamless, it was enjoyable. The room on the other hand left a lot to be desired. To start, the only AC was a free-standing portable unit with plastic tube connected to the window. At some point prior to occupying the room, the hose had become detached. As a result, it was hot in the room and it never cooled down. Also, the smells from outside made their way into the room, which is unfortunate during the baked sewage heat of summer in Manhattan. In the bathroom, the shower curtain didn't fully reach the floor, which partially flooded the tile. This might explain why one tile was loose and rocked back and forth. Between the smells and the heat, I didn't sleep the best. I got a great rate by booking direct. Location couldn't be better.

This hotel is an absolute joke.Upon arrival we were told our room was not ready, so had to wait 30 minites, bear in mind this was at 8pm.When we eventually got to our room, the air conditioning noise resembled an aircraft taking off, which made trying to sleep so much fun.1x bottle of complementary water which felt like it had just come out of an oven and filthy bedsheets.Once I had arrived home, I checked my bank records which indicated I had been overcharged for my room, so I decided to phone up and enquire the reason for this, BIG MISTAKE!I was greeted on the phone by some vulgar receptionist named Daniella, who has clearly never had of the word customer service, I have never spoken to someone so rude and arrogant in my entire life, and I would urge anybody thinking about staying in this hotel, DONT!

We had a great stay at the Night theatre district. All staff from front desk to security to cleaners were very polite and always said hello. The guy who works evenings on the front desk was extremely helpful (I am sorry I didnt catch his name). Our maid did a fantastic job each day and we came back each evening to a spotless room and she would even leave the radio on for us which was a nice touch. Perfect location, so close to it all. Would reccomend and would stay here again on a return visit to the city.

As we enter in the hotel its smells like sewage. Its hard to stand few minutes in the lobby because of sewage odor. Lobby was hot, either no air condition in lobby or it was not working. When we get in the room a small portable AC was placed in the room. My wife got angry and we just left property. I recommend not to stay here..

This was our first visit to New York and what a fabulous boutique hotel in a wonderful location!The hotel itself is a stones throw from Times Square, 10 minutes walk from Central Park and close to lots of attractions, bars and restaurants.The hotel has a monochrome theme throughout. Our room was nicely decorated and the bed was unbelievably comfortable! The rooms are relatively small but we’ve been told this is to be expected in New York. Our air conditioning stopped working and although it wasn’t fixed the first time, on second request it did get cooler. The hotel is good value for money, excellently located and certainly worth a stay.
user_name:
RichandCharli1
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: The hotel is very well located, 30 meters from time square, but its remains expensive comparing with the rooms standard and offering. we didn’t like the room very much, equipped with small window with no vue, you have ugly wall in-front of you, the room is not equipped with king bad, i found difficulties to stretch my feet, decoration in black and white make the room dark. Hotel prefer to deal with credit card and don’t accept cash, which make the checkin little but longer. The staff are helpful and try to assist, but always need to check with manager for exception especially for this cash and credit card issue.

My closet is bigger than this room. You could barely fit two people on a full bed. The front desk was rude/curt/pompous and condesending. Stay far away from this hotel. Also bring a flashlight - you can't see anything in the hallways

Read the reviews and selected this cute little place for a 2 day stint in NYC. So happy with cute little room and how close it was to everything - but the staff was AMAZING!!! Robert, Barry and Anna - you three were a blast with your warm smiles and genuine hellos!! A 5 star amenity hotel can fall to 3 stars instantly with bad staff - you three lifted this place from a 4 to a 5 in our book and we will stay here again next time!!! Super cool small lobby and lounge as well. The thoughtful bottle of wine for my 50th birthday was an over the top touch. Thank you again!

Two stars ⭐️ is only for the nice hotel decor. During check in, we learned we cannot use the refrigerator for our own use. Ok, that’s understandable. We check the refrigerator after check in to see the fridge does not even include any hotel snacks. What’s the point of having it in the room? Is that a part of the room decor or? Second, we tried taking photos in the lobby before dinner with a good quality camera, just to have the front desk say they don’t permit professional photography... really? We received a business card to the media team to set up a photo shoot. What a joke! Overall, the room is OK for a NYC hotel room- very tight. The sink however, is broken, and the elevator fits 3 people max. (Lol). Lastly, we requested new towels for the room just to receive one set (for two people) 30 min later...Can’t do this, can’t use that, what else can’t the guests do? I do not recommend this hotel to anyone.

I think before booking this hotel, you need to be very clear in your mind what to expect and if it suits you.1) the Hotel and the room were dark in terms of decor and lighting. But because we were there to sleep only as we were out all day/evening, it didn't affect us. We did know about this before booking so weren't shocked and hence it was fine.2) The room is small, but as per the reasons above, it was fine and I believe space is an issue in all Manhattan hotels.3) It was billed as having a safe which it didn't, but when we raised with reception, they sorted one out for us, but it isn't fixed in, it is portable so can be removed.4) There is no wardrobe/closet. There is a mini rail above the fridge to hang clothing on and we had to ask for more hangers. Not great, so we lived in/out of our suitcases for the week, but we did have an iron in the room so that helped. But we managed.All in all, it was a comfortable hotel, only 8 floors so not too vast and the reception team were helpful. The location of the hotel is its biggest advantage and it is opposite Planet Hollywood and at the end of the road is Times Square by the red Ticket Steps. Great for walking to a lot of the sights plus subway stations. I would stay there again and would recommend to others, but bearing in mind all the points I made above and then you won't be disappointed. If you do want more 'home comforts', then you may wish check out other hotels but then you will have to pay a higher price and may have to compromise on location. But all in all, it proved to be a great base for the type of trip we booked.

This hotel is well placed for Times square and Broadway right in the centre of midtown. It has a small bar and eatery which we dint use but no coffee/tea facilities in room. There is one lift to service all floors and the staff are pleasant enough and helpful. There are coffee shops, eateries and pubs on your doorstep. So this is a case of what you want from your stay.

Good location. Decent room service. That’s it. Small rooms. Rugs look and feel dirty. Dark. The bar is a rip off. Sneak a 20% service charge on to bill without disclosure. Still ask for a tip on charge slip. Sucker Tourist trap. Don’t fall in to it. Will not stay here again.

My sisters-in-law and I made a trip to NYC to see the new musical“Tootsie”, -which was awesome! None of us having been to this theater before, we used our google maps to get there. The directions brought us to the wrong side, no sign for the theater! We asked the doorman and he pointed us inside the hotel.. and the theater is on the 2nd and 3rd floors of the hotel! The seats were comfortable and there didn’t seem to be a bad seat in the place! The soda was $8, mixed drinks-$16. Kinda normal for NYC. My main complaint is that there are 2 main floor restrooms, only 5 stalls each! You can imagine the lines! So hold off on too many of those overpriced drinks! It was fairly posh inside, as it’s a newer venue, and I would go back again.

The hotel has a very cool, hip vibe. It’s more modern than other hotels, which I like. The location is perfect, right around the corner from Times Square. Very close to subway lines. Any question I had about NYC was answered by the friendly front desk people. There is also a Starbucks next door, which is a plus.

I booked this hotel for my Sister and brother in law who were celebrating their 25th wedding anniversary and got in touch with the front desk to ask if they could do anything special to mark the occasion. I got a quick reply from a guy called Robert who said he would put something together. When the happy couple arrived they were overwhelmed with a treat awaiting them in their room and as for their stay as a whole they enjoyed the excellent location. Thank you Robert for fantastic customer service.

Great location in the heart of Times Square, clean room with a comfy bed, helpful staff. Hotel was surprisingly quiet - you couldn't hear street noise or noise from other rooms. There is a Starbucks 2 doors down, which was also convenient.

So close to Times Square, room was nice (just don’t expect a view) and staff were all good. And (when I was there at least) great value for money. Didn’t try the restaurant as I’m not really a fan of Japanese or Vietnamese cuisine, but there’s so many options nearby it’s not really a problem.

The value for the hotel considering the location and comfort of the room was excellent. We had the queen-sized room, it was average-sized, it can be a bit small if you leave your luggage lying around but thankfully they have a closet where you could fit 4 big luggage in. The bed was very comfortable though.The location is excellent as well; you can walk everywhere (as far as central park) and there are numerous subway stations in the area so it's pretty much easy to go anywhere.It is important to note that when you get to the hotel you will be asked for a 200$ deposit (from your card), this will then be returned 10 days after you check out.Whenever we had an issue (like for example not knowing how to navigate the heating system), they sent someone to the room within minutes to support.On the other hand, the rooms were too dim. The hotel is dim in general but that can be overlooked considering all the other positives.

Amazing location, the end of the street is Times Square, comfy beds and clean and well decorated rooms. Lovely reception staff, always happy to give recommendations and say hello whenever you walk past!

Everything was great except for the fact that the one and only elevator went out of service half way throughout the day and had to carry luggage thru 4 flights of stairs, slight bit of discomfort for sure.

Concept is cool but does not live up to expectations. The floors were dirty, someSort of light fixture was on the ground under foot of the bed. Stains on carpeting, been on the hallways. Just not a clean place/

Room 87 was very dark, with harsh overhead LED lighting, which made it nearly impossible to see in the bathroom, where there was also a leaking pipe. And there was no safe in the room. Staff was responsive and found a safe and had the plumbing repaired the following day. Daily housekeeping was prompt and well done. Overall, this is an old building with renovation done on the cheap. The staff was friendly and made very effort to be helpful. The mid-town location is very convenient.

This place was great location, you were in Times Square within minutes. The staff went over and beyond for us and provided Exceptional staff service, really made our holiday positive and the bed was the best I’ve ever slept on, best sleep I’ve had! Highly recommend.

We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. It’s opposite Planet Hollywood on Times Square so the location is ideal. It’s a small hotel with small rooms but clean and comfortable with a nice bathroom and adequate for the time we spent in our room. The staff were all helpful. No resort fees to pay but $50 dollars added to credit card at check in which was later refunded in full. I’d highly recommend it and would rebook if visiting New York again.
user_name:
MrsStipetic
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: I sadly had to cancel my trip, but I still wanted to leave a review as, the staff from the hotel and especially Anna, we wonderful in helping out and were so fast to reply.I cannot recommend enough !

Okay place to stay if you want to be near times square. Rooms are relatively smaller than they look online and they aren't as appealing in person; nonetheless a good place to just sleep. The service is great, just don't expect the room you see in the pictures.

We stayed for a few nights recently on a quick trip. This was the most convenient location for a few things we were doing, and based on the reviews, we gave it a shot over other nearby hotels where we have stayed.The good: Employees / service could not be better. When we had an issue, it was addressed very quickly after we contacted them. Location was also very good.Not so good: This place is really in need of some maintenance. Floors, walls, paint, windows, fixtures, plumbing... there were issues all around. Our shower was unusable and although it was fixed, the delay in being able to get ready and go about our day was frustrating. It was also very noisy. This is a noisy area, sure, but I was surprised they didn't have better soundproofing on the windows and/or white noise options. We didn't have a bad stay-- we'd packed earplugs and they maintenance issue wasn't a huge conflict, luckily, but I would not stay here again or recommend it to anyone. I wish I could because I did appreciate the friendly and helpful service, but it doesn't cancel out the bigger problems.

Lobby area and restaurant excellent, room a bit small and slightly tired. Service good and location fantastic! Other rooms are probably better, I can`t really complain as the price was very good for what I got.

I would like to start by saying that I only created a trip advisor account so i could rate this property. From the moment I checked in I was told that I had been upgraded to a queen from a full and that was proposed to me as some sort of favor. I am staying in room # 60. First impression was bleek. Room smelled like mold and cleaning products. The carpet was stained and ragged. The lamps were dented and had paint on them. Holes in the walls and peeling wallpaper dotted the room. The bed frame seems to be coming apart and in the cracks as you can see in my pictures there is nothing but filth. I woke up in the middle.of the night numerous times due to the sound of the air conditioning system. It literally sounds like there is construction equipment in your room and I dare anyone to say I am lying. I would also like to say that I made my booking on Hotel Tonight which the front desk seemed to have a disdain for. I work at a hotel here in Manhattan and the general manager of this property is welcome to check my credentials. I was completely shocked by (Night Theatre District). My advice is, check the room before you sign on the dotted line.

Very comfortable Times Square Hotel. The staff went out of their way to make sure we were happy. Thank you to Patrick at the front desk for solving a minor problem quickly and with a smile. My only complaint is that the room lighting was too dark but otherwise I will stay here again.

I booked the Night Hotel theater district for a one night stay. When I arrived they told me that my reservation was moved to a different hotel a few blocks away. They offered no explanation as to why they moved my paid for reservation and when I requested a manager, I was told no manager was on duty. I had to walk with my bags to the other hotel because I already parked my vehicle at the nearby garage. The management at this hotel is horrible. Never received as much as an apology for the serious inconvenience. I paid to stay at their property and was moved without my consent or any additional accommodation for my inconvenience.

I have just completed a stay at this hotel and all I can say is I'm looking forward to returning. From the warm greeting upon arrival to the comfort of the room it's all positive from me. Yes the rooms are dark and small but what do you expect from the prime location? I was staying on the 5th floor and could not hear anything from the other guests. Thanks for a fantastic stay

The service we received during our 6 night stay here was top quality. The rooms are nice, but small - which shouldn't be too surprising given that space is a luxury in the middle of Manhatten. Be warned: I'm 6'3 in height and I struggled to fit in our Queen-sized bed comfortably. The bed has a wooden end, which means you can't just stretch out and hang off the bed. Also worth noting is that you can hear everything on your floor. People coming back from a night out and making noise? You'll here it. Someone opening their door and closing it behind them? You'll hear it. However, other than that - the place is a gem.The look and feel of the place is supurb. It's not a coincidence that the place is called Night. The dark feel as you walk through the main lobby, or along the hallways is great; also creepy (as if in a thriller movie). The rooms are much the same in style as the rest of the hotel. The windows are shrouded with black curtains which do well to keep light out, and the bed is shadowed by an immense bedhead/art piece. The bathroom with its black tiles follow suit to the theme of Night.The location is outstanding. Right near Broadway and pretty much a breath away from Time Square; you are truly in a key spot to visit the rest of Manhatten from such a central location. We pretty much walked during our entire trip, except for when we used a hop-on/hop-off buss tour to visit the far ends. But, if you're up for a bit of exploring, its very easy and simple to do.If you're tall and looking at staying here, I'd simply suggest considering a King-sized bed. The extra $$$ will mean the world for comfort. Otherwise, this is a great hotel to see the sights in such an amazing and busy city.

Everything was fine here except for one thing. Called about 3:40 am to ask for toothpaste, overnight guy said they don’t have toothpaste.. I told him they gave me some the night before, he says ‘well we ran out’ so I say ok cool.. next morning I call and ask for toothpaste and they bring me a 2 toothpaste and toothbrush literally in under 1 minute... Unless you guys got a new shipment of toothpaste within that timespan (which is possible), you guys got some lazy/untrustworthy agents. Also whenever i made contact with that same guy, he always seemed super uninterested to help me out.. by the way I rarely write reviews so this means something. That type of service shouldn’t be received by a guest at any time of day at any hotel.. Gotta say, the design is super cool.. super cool art in the lobby, if you like artistic, weird but cool design, definitely recommend this.. just avoid asking for anything from the overnight crew.. Also Patrick was super helpful, really helped me out with a lot as far as getting around in the city and helping me out with things I should do while I’m there. A+ for him, also Robert was nice and accommodating ( I think his name was Robert) girls at the bar were awesome, good company.. housekeeping was super awesome and friendly

Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Night Hotel Theatre district.Positives;Great location just off Times Square with easy access to restaurants, bars shops & travel links etc.Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.Hotel is clean and daily maid service was good.We were on the 5th floor and whilst we were close to Times Square in the middle of NYC we heard no noise at all.Negatives;The rooms are tiny. This is our 3rd visit to NY and these rooms are the smallest by far we have ever stayed in. In fact it is the smallest room I've stayed in anywhere in the world.Whilst we both liked the decor and the 'sultry' lighting it would have been nice to increase the lighting when getting ready for going out (well for my wife anyway).In summary - only problem with this hotel is the size of the rooms, but due to this, as good as it was in other areas, I would not stay here again.We had another great time in NY and went to see the Rockettes Christmas show which we highly reccommend it. We also went to our first hockey game. It was a great night and if you are neutrals like us, take my advice and get over to Brooklyn for tickets less than half the price of MSG. The price for food and drink at the arena is extortionate though. £11 ($14) for a can of beer.I also have to say that Blacklane, who we used for our transfers were great. WE ordered a exectutive car but got an SUV upgrade. Free WiFi in the car, water and a really good & professional chauffeur, Carlos.

After reading several of the previous reviews both positive and negative I thought I would share my stay with future guests:On arrival: The reception area was very smart clean and ambientCheck in: I was greeted by Robert, super friendly and efficient with great personable service (So far very impressed)Room: Was small but very clean with all amenities including a closet to hang clothes (Housekeeping bought more hangers straight away) and two side drawers in bed stands to put clothes in.Bathroom: very clean with soaps etcThe Pro's and Cons: For me the positives weighed out the negatives (There was one really and for a four star hotel I thought they were minor issues) The air Cond I had a few issues but Robert gave me advice and it was all sorted.From previous reviews the size of the rooms are expected for major cities ( I have stayed in smaller rooms in five star hotels in London and Singapore)The rooms are dark!!!! Hello it's the night hotel ( Its an ambient thing) I had no issues with this at allMy overall review of this hotel deserves five stars, I have had an enjoyable stay due to customer service, location, ambience and above all the cleanliness thanks to the housekeeping team, I would recommend this hotel and will stay againRegardsPJ ( Australia )

Liked the decor and the mood of the hotel. Staff was very friendly and when our tv remote wouldn’t work, they sent someone up right away to assist. The restaurant was good as well. The room was missing some key things that impacted the experience...outlets by the nightstands, USB ports by the nightstand, hooks on the wall to counter the no closet, fan in the bathroom and a better tv. If those elements were upgraded, it would make a huge difference.

We did stop on Night Theater District hotel for 6 nights.The whole hotel is dark like the name. We where two adults and one 11 y girl. We did have Deluxe Room with Queen bed. Beds are small, two adults fits only in Queen size bed!Priceline offer: child under 12 stays for free with adults work ONLY with infants!They are sellin in reception extra beds for 50$/night!!Our room where on 5th floor.The floors were dirty in our room, dust and glass pieces.Wi-Fi did not work in room, We were sitting in loddy to read news!You can’t work online in this hotel.Customer service is not 4-star hotel level. No hairydryer in room. No unbrellas in room.Air condition were noisy!We did make an claim, and had to wait for 10 days before they did answer! This hotel in locaited well if You want to see Times Square or watch theater show’s.Starbucks is 10 steps from hotel.Most of the pictures on hotel’s website has been taken from PH floor.

This hotel is literally a stone throw from Times Square which is great for shopping and seeing theatre shows. The hotel is clean and housekeeping come daily. Lots of food options in walking distance. Wifi is very unreliable and works then doesn’t work. Rooms are small but serviceable.

We went to NYC to see a Broadway play. We knew we would spend most of our time around Times Square, so we wanted something close. There are 2 Night Hotel locations within 2 blocks, and we went to the wrong one first. The hotel was nice enough. It was loud, but earplugs were provided. It was clean and nicely decorated. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

The location is fantastic! A quick 1-2 minute walk to Times Square and right next to Starbucks. As reported in many reviews Patrick is fantastic & very helpful. Unfortunately, those are really the only 2 benefits of staying here. We had a 5 night stay planned but ended up leaving after 1 night. We had two different rooms that were either 85 degrees or 60 degrees and neither thermostat worked. The rooms & lobby are WORN! The elevator is SLOW and unpredictable (and that's being nice). The "artwork" in the lobby does have frontal female nudity which was not disclosed when I called and asked about it prior to our stay. This is NOT a 4 star hotel. It could be, but with holes in doors, tiles falling off walls and broken heating units it's really only a 2.5-3 star hotel at best. If you want the great location and a great hotel head across street to Hyatt Centric. It was the same price for Thanksgiving weekend.

GREAT LOCATION, and that is the highlight. Room and bathroom kinda small and dark, but always clean.Close to EVERYTHING from theaters, restaurants, cafes, metro and Port Authority. We had no problem getting around town, dropping by and leaving again.Didnt go to restaurant (Red moon I believe) though so cant say anything about that

We stayed at this hotel for my (early) birthday and Christmas present. We were greeted by Patrick (chatty man lol) he was extremely friendly and polite. They also upgraded us to a larger room for no extra charge that had a window albeit no view but this is NYC after all. The room 66 was clean and cosy with a bed that was extremely comfy. Patrick helped with advice regarding travelling around the city and apps to help with travel and finding our way back to the hotel. The hotel is very close to Times Square and several friendly bars and restaurants. We will definitely stay at this hotel again very soon.

I have stayed at this property several times now, and each time it has been a pleasure! The location is simply fantastic for anyone who wants to feel the energy of Times Square! It's also is perfect for being SO close to all the Broadway shows and fantastic restaurants! What also is great about this location is their staff. Always super attentive to anything you need. The ice maker went out one night of my stay, and the concierge went two hotels over to get me ice! Patrick at the front desk is simply the BEST! SUPER helpful not only with making check-in a breeze, but he was so accommodating with helping me with helpful tips on places to go and things to do. He simply goes over and above what most hotels offer when it comes to a knowledgeable front desk staff. A++ to him...trust me, don't feel shy in asking him for help, you won't be disappointed! I can't wait until my next visit to the city and stay at this property again!!

An area that you should go in order to see and feel it! Words can’t explain it; and all I can tell you to go there for dinner followed by a show in one the area theater and then stroll on the streets before you want to head back to home/hotel!

A small hotell located close to Times square and shopping. Patrick who checked us in was very serviceminded. The rooms are small, the bathroom could need renovation But the cleaning is good. I would recommend the Hotel, especially for the location.

Excel location. Very dark and masculine hotel. Rooms very nice and clean. I had a window with a so no view.. So the room was a bit dark.. Nothing if your claustrophobic. Staff not very attentive. Some concern about safety. Anyone can go in the elevator and get to the different floors.

Dark and quirky hotel,has a brilliant and sexual feel to it arrived to a very warm welcome from reception(patrick)thank you for your input on everthing we needed to know very pleased i chose night hotel. Credit to all your staff who work hard 24/7. Rooms medium size but clean and sufficent had everthing needed for our stay would i stay here again 100% yes, times square was a step away from hotel close to bars and restaurants.metro close by so easy access to surrounding areas thank you so much for all you done to make our stay memorable. Andrew&hayley room 66

spent 5 nights here in august.pretty small room,lack of storage space which could be awkward if your not living out of a suitcase.room was very nicely decorated and the bed was very comfy.good shower with all usual extras:shower gel shampoo.clean linen and towels every day.the staff were very friendly and helpful. .although we didnt use the restaurant,it looked very nice,there was a bar which was good and not too expensive.from the front door it was about 100 yds and your in times square,2 irish bars opposite the hotel and also 2 diners for meals and sandwiches to take away if your going exploring. easy walking distance from empire state and rockefeller building. £600 pound for a double room 5 nights in august in the center of new york was a good deal i thought and will go back next time were in the big apple.

I booked my stay through hotel tonight. I checked-in October 8. The room I was given was small and had a funny smell. I went back down to the front desk and asked for another room but apparently, I had to upgrade and pay $90 more to get a better room. It felt like a scam. Do not stay here, there are better hotels in new york city with better hospitality.
user_name:
Temp S
New York City, New York

review_body: I booked this hotel through Priceline and didn’t know what the hotel was until after the booking. When I read the reviews I was pretty nervous and disappointed, however when I got there and saw the room I was pleasantly surprised. PROS:- we had the one king bed room. I did not find the size of the room to be overly small like many of the reviews suggested. I was expecting a closet sized room but it was a comfortable size, definitely enough space for 2 people. - the decor is cool. Really modern looking, created a nice atmosphere.- Great location. Less than a block from Times Square, so you’re definitely within walking distance but you’re not subjected to the noise that you would be if you were staying directly in Times Square. - front desk staff were great - they use soap/shower gels/shampoo from a local company (CO Bigelow) which is based in NYC- very clean, very pleasant house keepers who do a great job. - bed was nice and comfortable - I got a great price through Priceline, (although it was still expensive.. it is Times Square!)- we had a mini fridge - 24 hour food and convenience store across the st and Connolly’s pub which is open until 4am. CONS:- my boyfriend was 6’3 and he couldn’t fit on the bed, his legs were hanging over the edge. - we found a very large, dead cockroach in the bathroom which the housekeeper promptly took care office - no coffee maker- had literally no view, when we opened the window it was the side of another building - depending on whether or not this is a pro or con, I think there’s an underlying risqué theme to this hotel as there was a kama sutra manual in the drawer beside our bed. I don’t think I’d want to take kids here, in fact I didn’t see any while staying here, which is a pro for me! I’d stay here again if the opportunity arose!

Stayed at this hotel for one week in September.The rooms are great- big and clean, but noisy. And believe me I'm not exaggerating:- The air conditioner is loud (waking up at night loud), and you can't control its strength- only on/off/cold/hot/temp.- The doors hardly block noise from the hallway- this includes very loud sounds of other doors being shut (especially the housekeeping's supply room in the morning).- You can here very loudly when someone in the nearby room is taking a shower.Other than that the hotel is in an incredible location: half a block from Times Square, 3 blocks from Bryant Park, a few minutes walk from many subway stations, and if it matters to you- two buildings from Starbucks.

WOW!! this is a VERY centrally located hotel. It's perfect if you want to be right at the heart of everything. It's just over 100m from the front door of the hotel to Times Square.I really can't fault this hotel. The decor is dark. Really dark. Gives the place great ambiance. Lobby is small and well decorated. Reception staff are extremely friendly and accommodating. There's a small bar at the rear of the lobby - it's a hotel bar, so it's small. Space is at a premium - you're not in Kansas anymore Dorothy!To the rear of the property, there's a smoking area if you don't want to be seen partaking on the street out front.The elevator is small, but adequate - remember where you are -space is always limited.Easy access to all floors and rooms.Again, the dark theme is continued throughout the hotel corridors and into the rooms.We had a Double room with a cot for a child. Just a side note: My attitude to hotels in Manhattan is that they're for sleeping in - not lounging around in. If you want to live in your room and spend hours on end relaxing - get a suite somewhere. For the purposes of our stay (2 adults and a 7 year old child), the room was perfect.Small and compact.Comfortable bed (and cot)Excellent selection of channels on a large TVFully stocked mini-barPower Shower with selection of good quality toiletries.We stayed for two nights and the room was cleaned and beds made as we requested.This is a very good quality hotel. Pricing isn't over the top considering the location. it's well within expectations for a centrally located hotel over Saturday/Sunday.Staff are professional and warm.I'd stay here again - without thinking.Excellent work Night Hotel - it's a sparkling 9/10 for me

When we arrived the room was not what we expected, air con was very noisy, toilet not working, no safe or mini bar even though we were told it would be there, the walls around the window had chunks missing but we were soon upgraded to a new refurbished room which was much better! The reception staff were great and the room was always cleaned well! Could not fault the staff, friendly and very helpful!

Okay, the rooms are small but very stylishly decorated in black and white. In fact, most of the hotel is black ,including the hallways and lobby, even the showers (!) making it VERY "moderne" (Families with kids may not like it). For a single person, it is perfect. I would imagine a couple would have a tight squeeze, but it is do-able. The staff was very helpful. The accommodated our early arrival and we happened to be in the lobby when a very rude guest accosted the clerk who managed the situation in a highly professional way. Patrick at the front desk is willing to talk to you on ANY subject and is a hoot. I did not find the attached bar or restaurant very inviting. Obviously neither did any of the other guests because it was always empty when we went by.  As the other reviews state, it is location, location, location. Do not miss the Irish pubs across the street or the very inexpensive breakfasts at the two delis across the street (One is Cranberry Café). P.S. What they say about NYC in summer is true. Heat and humidity is BRUTAL!

I stayed at the Night Hotel on 8/18/18. I arrived at 2:40pm and check in is at 3:00pm. The night before I called and ask if I can check in earlier if my room was ready and whomever at the time told me it was not a problem. So DANIELLA who was working the desk tells me I can’t check in until 3pm. I told her of my phone call from the night before and with the most smuggest dismissive attitude she tells me my room isn’t ready because I still have 20 minutes left to go….. Wow! I figured because they are in the hospitality business she would have checked to see if my room was ready but she couldn’t bother……So after I walked the streets for 25 minutes I check into my room because it was now “ready”. I have 4 guests arrive all mid twenties and BLACK. I get a phone call a few minutes later to ask me to come down to the front desk. First of all I don’t appreciate being summoned to a hotel’s front desk like I’m being called down to the principal’s office. So I oblige and I go. At this point it isn’t the smug DANIELLA it was some other gentleman. He takes it upon himself to tell me that I am not allowed to have a party in the hotel. I explain to him I’m a director here on business and he will see numerous people coming in and out of the hotel however it will only be 3 overnight guests. He said no problem. Now why he felt the need to tell the BLACK GUEST with his BLACK GUESTS that he cannot have a party, I am not sure. Not only wasn’t loud music being played, THERE WAS NO MUSIC BEING PLAYED AT ALL. I wonder if he gave all the other white guests that same warning……..So after more BLACK PEOPLE come in and out of the Night hotel. That became a problem and an investigation ensued…. I received another phone call from the principal’s office, I mean the reception desk. And now I am being yelled at by the same gentleman that called me the first time saying that I am having a photo shoot and I cannot do anything commercial. So once again I have leave the relaxation of my room to go back downstairs. The receptionist tell me that “my manager asked the people leaving my room what’s going on and they said they are coming from a photo shoot and you cannot do anything commercial here”. First of all the Night Hotel is too kind in crediting me the attendance of all the BLACK PEOPLE they see exiting their hotel to my stay. And what would make them want to stop all the BLACK PEOPLE and ask them “what is going on”? Was there too many BLACK PEOPLE there that you became alarmed??? So the manager that the receptionist was referring to was DANIELLA. So I explain to him again but now very sternly what I was doing. Yes I have to take headshots of people being I’m a director doing interviews. Then I start questioning him is it Night hotel protocol to ask their guest what it is they are doing in their hotel rooms or is this just a practice for BLACK PEOPLE?? Let me reiterate there are no noise complaints because there is no music or party going on. Fast forward this place double charges me for my stay. So instead of paying $800 for an offensive poor stay, I got the honor of paying $1600 and my bank account as I type this is in the negative. I called the Night hotel and DANIELLA did not want to accept responsibility for the double charge and told me to call my bank and hung up on me….. WHAT!? I called my bank and they confirm that they double charge me and I have to wait till tomorrow for them to refund me my money. So Night hotel, after that terrible racist experience you have given me, I wasn’t even going to write this. However! After you guys double charge me and DANIELLA was still rude to me and still didn’t try to fix my issue, well I can’t let that slide. You are not going to discriminate against me and then overdraft my bank account. The hotel NEEDS A BIG RENOVATION. The rooms have peeling wall paper, brown stained 90’s zebra tie-looking carpet. The TV was at least 10 years old, it did not even have HDMI port!I highly recommend everybody stay far away from this place. They are racist and do not understand the word “customer service”.
user_name:
wildcard1906
New York City, New York

review_body: The room had no natural light and was a very small room. However very well located 5 min away from Times Square.Staff in the reception not so nice, and when I asked a question it’s like they were doing a favor to answer..

When researching this hotel I was hesitant because of some of the negative reviews. After staying here, I don’t understand! The photos are very accurate, which was something I was worried about! It is a striking black and white motif. Not kid friendly but fantastic boutique hotel for a solo or couples trip!The gentleman at the front desk (blond-ish with glasses - I forget his name!) was a total sweetheart and more than accommodating. The room was funky, adorable, clean, and well maintained! If you’ve ever stayed at a Times Square/Broadway boutique, you’d find Night a total breath of fresh air!

I stayed at Night Hotel Theater District for a week, from August 2 to August 9 2018 as a single traveller. Apart from the building's amazing position, a stone's throw from Times Square (that is just few steps away from everything one may need: restaurants, entertainment, pharmacies, shops, theatres, as well as such landmarks as Bryant Park, Fifth Avenue, the Empire State Building and so on), the hotel itself is seriously stylish, beautiful and clean; towels are changed everyday, the wifi connection works perfectly, my room had an air conditioning system, a large TV screen, a closet, an ensuite bathroom, a Bose music player and a big, comfortable bed. The staff were always smiling and helpful - they were happy to help whenever I had something to ask and this really nice guy even offered to call a cab for me and carry my luggage outside when I checked out.I was asked for a $50 deposit when I arrived, which will be returned to my credit card over the next few days and is a customary policy in New York.To sum it up, this is a hotel I was happy to return to after spending a long day out and about in New York City and one I'd enthusiatically stay at again in the future.

Location was good that’s all! Booked it through booking.com, you see the photos and you say WAWWWWW then you arrive in such a tiny room, can hardly move... next room they talk and you can hear all the conversation you pay for a four star hotel and you get zero star

Playmill is a have to see if you are visiting West Yellowstone. The playmill never disappoints, the do sing along, Birthday, Anniversary celebrations you will be missing the best part of West Yellowstone. This is a theater that I have been to since I was 5 years old and we love it, as much as we do the FUDGE!

The rooms are dark but obviously that’s the point, I don’t understand why people are surprised when the name is Night. There is an extremely rude and unprofessional woman at the front desk named Daniela who was more concerned with her personal phone than her job or the guests. Other than that the entire staff was great. Rooms are small but efficient. Drinks at bar were decent.

Stayed here in January 18. Location could not have been better, 1 minute walk to heart of Times Square, where you can then go to basically anywhere in NewYork via Metro. We also walked to hotel with suitcases from Port Authority bus station which took approx 10mins. The first room we were given had a dodgy shower and loose tiles in the bathroom however after telling staff we were quickly moved to another identical room. The bed was very comfortable and large, flat screen tv on wall with a lot of channels. The staff were friendly. Although people may recommend that you do not stay near Times Square due to noise, I would say that we did not hear any of this noise from our room and got a good night sleep every night. The only reason that I am giving it a 4 is due to the mishap at the start of our trip with the faulty shower. Also the room was quite small and decorated with dark colours- if it was decorated with bright neutral colours it would feel a lot larger and cleaner. Other than this, I would recommend to anyone and would definitely stay again.

I rent both penthouses they have, for business meetings. Spaces are super old, very, very noises and nothing works in there. You can’t lock the room door because it’s broken, there’s terrace on the right of your bed, connected to other accesses, and that door lock is broken too, so you have to sleep with the fear of someone getting inside your room. They don’t serve breakfast. It’s a nightmare, not a hotel.

My son and I enjoyed our 3 nights stay at the hotel. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. The receptionist Patrick and Robert were very helpful. The hall ways are not that wide to think I have an Asian body built. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you don't want to lose any travel long or walking to get to the theatre or near by tourist spots.

Stayed at this hotel for a week as a base for our first trip to New York. Rooms were stylishly decorated - although very dark in keeping with the hotel name - with very comfortable beds. Staff friendly and accommodating. Very close to Times Square and all the Broadway theatres so you have to contend with large crowds every time you go out. However if being in a place that goes all night then this is perfect. Despite being so close we were never bothered by noise once in our room. Room rates were reasonable by NY standards. Great Asian fusion bar and restaurant located in hotel with happy hour specials each day. 2 Irish pubs straight across the road as well as a Planet Hollywood on the corner.Would definitely stay here again.

First would like to say how incredibly amazing the staff are. They were so friendly & accommodating! Hotel is smartly decorated with modern decor. Rooms are on the smaller side but super cozy & clean with comfy beds, crisp sheets & good AC. Bathroom lighting is dim for putting on your makeup, but decent size with decent water pressure for the city. Perfect location in midtown.

One of the worst hotels I’ve stayed in. The rooms are miniature. Some have minibars, some don’t. Some have robes, some don’t. The A/C is incredibly loud and no matter what I set it at, once the cleaning staff came in to tidy up, I’d come back and it would be blasting at 62°. The only thing going for it was that it was clean enough. The windows faced a brick wall. You will barely sleep because you hear every door on the floor shut as if it were in your room. It’s incredibly poorly lit. If you have plans to do your hair or makeup at all, best of luck. The overhead bathroom lighting is horrific and shadows your entire face. Restaurant/bar is tiny and super dark. There is one elevator that fits about 4 people. Staff was a bit judgy, but fine. WiFi didn’t work. I would never recommend this hotel.

Decor drew me in; size pushed out a second stay ... and, the zero coffee in room feature. Overall, the room proved itself to be a bit weary, though still sexy. Remote batteries barely working. Paint on bench, bathroom door trying hard to look good, but worn away in some places. Bathroom under sink cabinet door opened, but refused to shut. One of three pillows had better nights ( eg smelled of other visitors ). No evidence where to turn off a floor lamp, so extinguished it at the socket. Bathroom floor/shower rug fraying. On the up side, linens were yummy. The single thing to consider if staying is whether you can cozy up to an air conditioning system with a very, very loud voice. All this in Room 61. Desk staff were charming. Sushi/sashimi at Red Moon satisfying.

I feel rather mixed about this hotel. I came here on business so I didnt have too many choices. Work recommended this hotel so I complied. I called early to see if I could get an early check in as I didnt feel up to roaming for 3 hours awaiting checkin. They were able to accomodate me but to an upgraded "deluxe" room for a small additional charge per night. Well I was like... 30 more for a deluxe room when I knew the rooms here were small to begin with? SURE! First impression of the hotel, the entrance is dark and recessed off of the street. Upon entering the hotel still dark, but this was expected. And also expected was the erotic art on the walls. I dont mind erotic art in the least, but if you're travelling with children, you may need to explain things you arent ready for. Checkin was super simple so onto the elevator.Ok this is small. You could get 4 people without luggage rather snugly. With luggage? Depends on how much luggage you have. 2 people and one carryon style wheeled bag can fit fine. Otherwise you'll likely want a solo elevator. The elevator is fast though.On to the room. Yes its a new york room, its going to be small. This room was no exception. It was small but functional. A few quibbles though with the room. There was no chair, only what appeared to be a stool at the desk. NOT comfortable at all to sit at to work but I managed. The bed was comfortable with a suitable summer duvet. The beds are short sheeted however which I noticed after tucking in for the night. I mean, its your mattress, you want feet all over it that have walked all across times square? The bathroom was well stocked with soft towels and nice shampoo and soap availableI did have an issue with the desk however. What is up with just having a stool to sit on at a desk? Not even a proper chair. This could have served as a footrest. It was hard and uncomfortable. I did come to this place for work,and I would have preferred going to the office than sitting on this uncomfortable stool chair. The staff were very friendly and accomodating, I asked for an early checkin and they stated that they had an upgraded room available. If this was the upgrade, I actually fear what my original room was going to be.People do complain that the rooms are dark. There are plenty of lamps in the room and they provided more than enough light for me, but I am fond of a more muted lighting, not the kind of lighting you can do surgery by. All in all, it suited its purpose. It had interesting decor and stuck to its dark theme. I cant beat its location for work though

Stayed here with my husband, while visiting Manhattan. The room was small, however good location and easy walking to restaurants and shopping. The staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel has nice decor. My husband and I enjoyed this hotel because of its location. Manhattan is a place we love to visit. One advice, when taking a taxi after 12am, be prepared to wait a long time to get a taxi to go back to the hotel, on weekends.

Excellent Location - Walking distance to Time SquareRoom - Small but clean and comfortable. It’s NYC though!!Japanese Restaurant - Really good and a great price. Portion size was great.Hotel - Decor was really cool and music was always good. No issues with noise levels at all. Staff - Friendly, especially Patrick - he was the bomb. Patrick was very informative and always had good suggestions on where to eat and how to get along. All right n all it was an excellent visit!!

Unique place. Dark and sexy. Close to it all. Small but from what I read all NYC rooms are small. And we weren't in the room much. But when at the hotel we thought it was great. Room was clean, bed was comfortable and our room was quiet. Patrick was the best. All the reviews that mention him and how great he is are true!!!! He was very helpful with directions and eating recommendations. He made us feel welcome and at ease with his great personality as soon as we entered the door. And everyone else here seemed friendly and helpful also. Probably not a place I would bring my daughter on a family trip. But I would definitely stay here again with my wife on a couples trip. And would recommend to others as well.

Since moving far away, I miss traveling to NYC on sundays to see shows and eat, window shop and people watch. I will get back there! So much to see and do. Broadway shows are the best and eating in one of the thousands of restaurants is always an experience. A must see!

The hotel has a very sexy and dark, noir theme.There is a Japanese restaurant downstairs,but we never tried it. The lobby has modern furniture, but some of the couches are clearly worn and need replacing. The room we were in was very small and looking out a a wall, but that's NYC for you. Otherwise, the room smelled amazing, bedding was very comfy, the room was clean and the decor was consistent with the rest of the hotel. The bathroom was also very nice. Before walking into our room, there was even classical music playing. That was a nice touch. The atmosphere of the hotel is very nice. I do have a few complaints though:1. We asked for a pack n play months before arriving, 2 nights before arriving (note was never in the system), upon arriving - was not in room, and an hour after arriving! 2. The 90s music playing in the hallway is so loud! This was an issue for us because we had a toddler needing to sleep at 8- this may not be an issue for everyone.3. The light scones on the sides of the bed get so incredibly hot that you cannot turn them off from the light itself while in bed. Literally almost burned my finger! Beware. These need to be replaced. Would we recommend this hotel? Yes. It was perfectly located for all of our sightseeing needs and enjoyed the ambiance. It provides a feeling of luxury without paying an arm and leg.

As soon as we arrived (exhausted from a turbulence fueled flight), our concierge (Patrick) ticked our names off and allowed us to freshen up in our glam room. Once we were rested, Patrick was waiting for us to give us all the tips and anything one must know when visiting NYC. The room was gorgeous, bathroom had a nice big shower and the location was perfect! It was under a minute walk from Time square and all the broadway theatres, close to subways which is a must if you want to see more than just time square. My partner surprised me with a proposal and Patrick congratulated us with a bottle waiting in our room!!Oh and let’s not forget that yummy big cupcake too!The room service was also great.If you’re a tall guy like my partner, the bed may be too short.For our departure day, Patrick had talked to us about the options we had, in order to get to our airport which helped us out a lot!!! Having someone who really knows NYC is the most helpful asset a hotel could have at their front desk. Did I mention how amazingly friendly and funny he was too? Really made you feel comfortable asking anything and never rushed like other hotels.Thank you once again for making NYC amazing, thanks for your fabulous service!

As the name implies, this is a perfectly situated hotel for theater. Its got a dark, contemporary decor that makes it unique and appealing if want a non-cookie cutter hotel. Other than the cool vibe, I found it to have excellent customer service, particularly with the front desk staff. During my short stay, they were very helpful, professional, and friendly.The hotel does have shortcomings. My room had several signs of wear, including a damaged bathroom door handle, marks on the ceiling, loud a/c, and worn spots on the furniture. Be aware that the rooms are small, especially the bathroom. Also, there are few amenities on site - no business center, no fitness room, and no bar/restaurant other than an attached, small sushi place. As a side note, I recommend the sushi place for their happy hour. They have very good sushi at great prices from 4-7 pm.All in all, its a good choice for the theater district, just beware of the limitations and hopefully the rooms will be spruced up soon.

The Night Hotel Theatre District was perfect for a weekend trip I had with my sister. The location is great if you plan to see some shows and hit the “NYC Must Sees.” We were able to walk almost anywhere we wanted to go and a subway entrance was nearby for the rest. The room was clean but we did have to ask for a bedding change when we arrived. There were knats on the bed pad which may have been due to open windows when the room was cleaned ( there are window screens that roll up/down to prevent that but ...) but it just felt better to start fresh and housekeeping was fine with that. Water pressure was good, air conditioner worked well but we opened the windows at night because the weather was great for it. The rooms are small yes but completely adequate for couples. You will see references to Patrick in other reviews and I’m going to brag on him too. He is the friendliest and most helpful person you may ever meet. (Hey Patrick, I survived the extra desert! thank you!) Final note is that this hotel is NOT for children. It has an adults only atmosphere that is not appropriate for them.

The staff at Night bent over backwards to make our trip successful. Rajiv and Patrick were especially helpful, but the whole whole hotel staff put extra touches from everything to our check in, to the manager checking on us when we checked in, to giving us tips for the return trip to the airport.The hotel itself is also great. Very chic and original style and a location impossible to beat if you're looking for a great hotel near Broadway. Would definitely recommend to friends and family and will be back!

JFK to NY: 1. Air Train. Runs 24 hrs a day, 365 days a year. Cost: $7.50 one way to Jamaica Station. Trains run every 5-10 mins and the journey is about 1 hour.It is well sign posted in the airport. Take a short train ride to the Air Train station and buy your Metro card there.Metro Card: Buy a Metro card from the machine (like an Oyster ticket). You can put up to four people on a card. You can load it daily and be careful because if you overload, you cannot get a refund.Take the train from JFK to Jamaica (last stop).Take the elevator to the subway. Get the Manhattan bound E train towards the World Trade Centre.Get off at 7th Ave. it is a short walk to the hotel

Well very nice hotel , location os great ! The staff is very nice and helpful specially Patrick !!! Room are a little small but nice designed! The closet is little small and no light which is a must to add! For 1 or 2 people its a very cool place! Hope to see you again real soon

The only good thing so far is the location. Wifi neither connecting nor hope for it to work any soon. Apparently only works in hotel lobby ! ( as per other guests who have been here for last few days) They denied booking for our son due to sotheir miscommunication with booking.com and no owning up to their mistakes while we had printed email confirmation from hotel.No kettle in the room and one cant use the fridge in room? Decor is acceptable but layout of random things in the room isnt thought through. Heating /cooking is a hit and miss so far! Hotel reception very dishonest in communication and wasted nearly my all first day after checkin with petty matters Will update the review latter in week.

We can't say enough great things about our stay at this hotel. The hotel itself is sexy, trendy, edgy and chic - as well as clean, quiet and with an incredible view. The concierge, Patrick, was above and beyond amazing! We planned a quick trip after our town hall wedding, and he made it priceless and more than memorable! Everything you could want or need is within walking distance, but the hotel will make you want to spend time there!
user_name:
Jo R
Lake Ronkonkoma, New York

review_body: The hotel front desk concierge (Patrick) was amazing! When we arrived, we realized that we accidentally booked for the next day and he was quick to find a solution and work with Expedia to swap. The room was super small but surprisingly quiet to be in the middle of Times Square. The bed was comfy.We stayed for one night and it met our needs!

Beautiful hotel! Lovely welcome! Very clean and warm (it was minus 6 at the time!) Close to Time Square and walking distance to 5th Avenue Empire State ... the list goes on...would definitely stay here again!

We stayed here for one night, just a quick trip up from Philly for an event. The staff was amazing and the hotel was quiet and comfortable. The decor is dark, fun, and trendy. It was perfect and just what we needed!

Loved the room. We originally had reservations at the sister location (where there was very loud construction next door) and they relocated us. We were very pleased at how they resolved our grievance. Awesome customer service!!

very fun and clean! Door to bathroom was pretty annoying to use but other than that it was a good stay. Great to be able to go to the club on the roof without a cover since you're staying in the hotel.

This hotel has an excellent location, great look and feel, outstanding staff (seriously, ask for Patrick, he knows everything). Even though we were there during a snow storm, we were able to see and do everything because this hotel was so perfectly located. And we could walk to Hell's Kitchen for good food.

The hotel was directly in Times Square, and minutes away from broadway. Very clean and comfortable hotel. Friendly staff. Would definitely stay here again. Little to no noise in the room either which was a bonus as NYC never sleeps.

Set in a fantastic location for Times Square, couldn't be better. We had a few problems when we stayed, toilet didn't work 2 different times, no hot water one morning - was fixed within 4 hours but it isn't what you want on holiday. Very dark decorated rooms and hotel in general. Mostly nice staff, one or two were very blunt when asking about the water and toilet. Overall, OK for price and if it's location you want, this is value for money. Small rooms, but in NYC you are out all day. Thank you to the lady receptionist who persuaded us to use the underground, so pleased we did and it saved us a fortune. Thank you

When I travel to NYC, the only place that works for me is The Night Theater District. The ambiance, the service, the staff and rooms keeps me coming back time and time again. I would highly recommend staying at The Night Theater District on your next visit to NYC Midtown!!!

Look the room was small but for a business traveler it was nice and I didn’t mind. The room was very clean, the front desk folks were very helpful and while my room had no window that didn’t bother me. The room appointments were just as pictured and close to midtown, the Rock and other place for business and tourists. Oh the room was very quiet because it was sheltered from the street noise.

I travel to NYC frequently for work and have stayed at many of these types of hotels in midtown. I have a few faves I go back to but am always interested in something new.The Good: Very effiecient check itn. The room is very cool when you first see it, with the funky wall paper and giant headboard. The radio was set to a classical station and the tv was on local news (nice touch). The bed is comfy and I was thinking I would add this to my ususal list of go-tos. Alas, it was not to be. The Bad: House keeping. The sink was missing a stopper. good think I didn't lose my wedding ring. A little elbow grease could have gotten those smudges off the night stand. I usually use my phone alarm and the hotel alarm clock as a backup. I set the nice Bose radio. However, the outlet the clock was plugged into gets turned off by one of the switches next to the bed!! Who does that? I accidently shut it off. (Fortunately, my phone worked). A knob was missing from one of the lamps. The need to have a word with housekeeping. Also, the bed has a footboard. I like to hang my feet off the bed sometimes and ended up clunking them during the night. It also makes a small room smaller. Note to designers, when you have a small room, minimize the hard edges. Stubbed my toe the next morning. The shower also didn't drain well.
user_name:
Beatbox2018
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed here for 3 nights. There were hits and misses, but it was overall a fine stay.Pros:1. Excellent location that's right near Times Square. Great for tourists.2. The room decor is very dark and sleek.3. Good experiences with front desk staff.4. I liked that there was a king bed option--some hotels in New York will default to queen beds.Neutral:1.
