The hotel is called the Night hotel, and the rooms are extremely dark. That's good if you're looking for that, but it's not great if you're trying to work. There was no desk and chair, and the lighting in the bathroom was very dark. Cons:1. The water pressure was extremely low. When I called housekeeping, they said that the hotel was having water issues for a couple of hours. I would have hoped better from a 4-star hotel.2. The rooms are on the smaller size, even for New York. But, the decor was on point.

From the moment I stepped into the hotel I was greeted with a very sexy black and white themed Boutique Hotel. The front desk man was very polite friendly helpful and communicative. You made me feel welcome. On each floor, it's worth checking out, there are interesting black and white photographs. The rooms those small I was standing is staying in the standard King they were comfortable warm cozy and inviting. The bed was delicious. The shower and showerhead or very good. They use color products. And the shower was a lovely rain shower. They have a big screen TV and for you audio files they also had a Bose Wave radio CD player. There's warm lighting that's dimmable room control temperatures both air conditioning and heating a small bar area where you can buy snacks wine and water and they have a restaurant downstairs featuring Japanese food that you can also get for room service. Everything was delightful about this hotel I could not have been more happy. Oh and just as a side for rainy weekends like mine was they even have an umbrella and worm housecoat to wrap yourself into after you get out of the cold rain

Good location, good value for an overnight stay ..near Broadway and close to Bryant Park and Rockefeller Center for Christmas decor and sights. Major construction next door but that didn’t really affect us.

We had a great stay in New York at the Night Hotel. The room was cosy and more than adequate for two of us, comfy bed room kept nice and clean. As we didn’t spend that much time in the room location was most important for us and this place couldn’t be more central.

We stayed in this area on our recent trip to NYC. It has a very electric sort of environment which stays with you even when you have left the place.Apart from the plays, Night Theatre district offers varied options in pubbing and live music front. Not a place to be missed while in Newyork for those who enjoys lights, music, crowds!

Excellent location for visitors going to NYC for the first time. If your wanting to stay out of the hustle and bustle (hard to do in NYC) then this is not the location for you. It is walking distance to subway stations, Times Square, restaurants and theatres. Regardless, taxis are abundant in NYC and reasonably priced (based on Australian prices) so it is easy to get to where ever you want from the hotel. It's only 1 or 2 subway stops to Central Park. As for the hotel, it's lovely and very artsy. Front of house staff were a bit hit and miss. Sometimes they were pleasant and sometimes they were just really unhelpful. I was at this hotel in NOV/DEC 16 (however I have selected FEB 17 because trip advisor wouldn't let me select any 2016 months) and in a moon boot after a fall in another city, staff didn't seem to really want to help me grab the bags out of the taxi and the lady at the front desk was rude on arrival, her attitude came across as if she was superior. By about halfway through the stay they seemed to be a bit lighter in mood. I was staying there with my mum but if you were going to NYC with your other half I would highly recommend the hotel as its kind of hot and sexy in appearance and vibe.Rooms are small and the lighting is very low, so applying make up can be difficult. But its NYC unless your staying at The Plaza your rooms will be on the small side. Overall good stay. Bed very comfortable.

Stayed at the night hotel for the weekend, first time in NY!. Was greeted by Patrick on reception and what a lovely warm welcome we received . Friendly, chatty yet professional . Was full of useful information and nothing was too much trouble. felt very welcome. The room was on the 8th floor and was beautiful. Black and chrome modern room with all amenities. For what we paid we were extremely pleased all round it was a bargain! yes we didn't have a view but i'm not there to look out a window! It was extremely quiet at night, which i wasn't expecting so slept lovely in our comfy bed! Unfortunately i don't like sushi and the hotel doesn't offer breakfast but no issue...you're right on times square!. Hotel was perfect location . Shower took a while to get warm but once warm was lovely. Perfect customer service. Patrick is a credit to the hotel.

Super cute boutique hotel..Rooms are extremely tiny a little difficult if u have 2 to 4 bags.. room is very dark including the washroom. I get that it is the look they were going for however adding a few lights in for guest that might need it would help. Absolutely no view or sunlight in the room. Then again in NYC you need to be outside the room. No complimentary water or tea or coffee available. Location is perfect though. It was a little difficult to find as no big sign of the hotel name.

Just spent one night here on January 9. Very friendly staff and they were very helpful. The room was great....and very clean. We loved the sushi restaurant and bar there. I will definitely stay there again!

Nice looking room, good bed. Window looked out to a tiny area between two buildings, almost no light even during the day. Main problem: room lighting fixtures had various problems: (1) table lamp had exposed wiring, (2) light in shower didn't work, (3) room lighting fixture switches became so hot after leaving the lights on that you could burn yourself if you tried to turn the lights off with bare hands.

Second visit to NYC- first time staying at the Night Hotel. The location could not have been better. Close to everything! The Irish pubs across the street were great with live entertainment and reasonable food. Hotel room was small, but that is to be expected in the city. Very clean and updated. Staff was helpful and attentive! Would definitely stay here again. :)

Just got back from staying 4 nights here. Great hotel, staff where so friendly and helpful and made our stay a good one.Fantastic location a mins walk to times square and easy to walk around to other places of interest.Thanks again for making us so welcome,we will be back again for sure.Dan n Des
user_name:
Desmond Beenham D
Glasgow, United Kingdom

review_body: The hotel is great, the rooms are lovely, spacious and clean. The bathroom facilities are great and also very clean. The hotel is small but the decor is lovely and modern. it’s very dark and the only lift isn’t great, we had to take the stairs to the 5th floor a few times which wasn’t great. The location couldn’t be any better, literately a 1 minute walk to Times Square. Patrick on the reception is such a lovely man, he needs more recognition, he couldn’t have been anymore helpful and is a credit to your hotel.

The hotel is located very close to Times Square, so it is perfect for tourism. Very new hotel, rooms are not large but very clean though. Service by staff is excellent. There is a small Asian food restaurant inside although se did not try it.

Booked online. The booking site was unclear so exited and determined rooms had queen size beds. I then when back into the booking site and booked two rooms for four nights. When we arrived we got rooms with a double bed. When we brought it up with reception, they were very quick to point out that our confirmation would clearly show what we had booked, which after checking the fine print, showed a double. Clearly a scam to attract bookings, leaving you no alternative after you arrived in NYC. it was very obvious from the reaction at reception this was a common issue. This is shown to be a four star hotel. It is NOT. Internet signal was poor, TV remote not working properly, small rooms, elevator mechanical condition suspect, and more. Not a hotel I would recommend to anyone.

Hotel is in a great location for overall tourist attractions. Cost is reasonable considering being New York City, but watch out for the mini bar in the rooms. Overall though the room we stayed in was clean, the staff was nice and location was convenient. Pro-Tip this is not what you would call a family friendly hotel... so choose wisely.

Had this hotel for 7 nights with my wife in early November 2017. The hotel is in a very convenient location just 1min walking away from Times Square, the room we got was big enough and very clean, the furniture is well mantained and the bed very comfortable. The staff at reception was very friendly and helpful, so I will recommend the hotel to anyone and will try to get it again next time we visit N.Y.C.

Had a fantastic stay - after reading a few comments on trip advisor was a little apprehensive. We were greeted by Reception who were fantastic and extremely helpful. Was not told by holiday company we would have to leave credit card details at the desk so as we didn't have one we had to leave $100 in reception. This did put a stop to using the fridge and also making any outgoing calls from the room but this was not the end of the world. Hotel is very dark and sometimes with the time difference it felt that it was later than it was at times. Bed was very comfy, shower wasn't great but it was enough to get you clean. It is literally 100 yards into Times Square which was amazing. What I did like is that once you were in the hotel you could not hear anything outside maybe the occasional horn if it was a truck. Only downfall is the bar was not open during the day but a fantastic little diner was across the street for breakfast, lunch and tea at really reasonable prices and sold everything you could think of for breakfast. I would definitely stay here again - even just for the location but it really was a comfortable stay.

Great stay first day asked for a upgrade to bigger room and staff was so helpful guy called Robert and Patrick who was so gud with his help and advice got champagne in room on the day of my girlfriends birthday and he helped me find nice restaurant for her meal too never ever did all the staff have a welcome for you

Stayed for 2 nights at this hotel. Perfect location for Times Sq just off 5th Avenue. Rooms small but very clean and tidy as was the whole hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We were only 10 minute walk from central station, central park, and the Rockefeller Tower. Lower Manhattan was a €3 subway ride away .All in all a very nice hotel.if you are looking for luxury then look elsewhere, but if you want good value in a good location then this is perfect.

The hotel decor is super nice. The concierge go above and beyond to help out guests and accomodate any requests. The room was clean and a good size compared to other hotels in new york. Location of the hotel was excellent! Foot steps from the heart of time square. Only downfall was poor wifi which doesn’t matter much because we did not spend much time in the room.

We stayed here from 31st October for 5 nights. It was me & my partner plus 2 friends. We were in New York as me & my partner were getting married. On arrival we were upgraded to a bigger room. I always check reviews on hotels & was slightly worried as this hotels reviews were a bit mixed. I genuinely don’t understand. Yes the room isn’t massive. Yes the views are buildings (who would have thought in a city ) & yes the hotel has a dark theme ( kind of the point of the hotel). Who goes to New York & spends loads of time in their room anyway?! We had suits, dresses & 5 days worth of clothes etc and didn’t struggle to find places to put them in our room. It was clean, the staff were amazing & so so polite. If I ever visit New York again I will definitely be staying here again!Times Square is literally at the end of the road, yet at night I didn’t hear a thing (& we had a front facing room). Yes the odd toot from cars etc, but once again. It’s New York, what do you expect. The hotel was clean, sexy & everything we could have wanted for our trip. Thank you to everyone there who made our time so perfect!

Nice location and a semi-private rooftop terrace which was great, but the only furniture in the room was the bed, a desk and chair and a ottoman/storage chest along with an armoire with no drawers. Several rooms, seemed pretty bare with lots of light switches on the wall that weren't connected to anything. Looks like the room at some point had furniture in it but appears someone removed it all. Would have at least expected a chair or sofa/loveseat in the room.

There's lots of mixed views about this hotel, so we decided to take a chance and was not disappointed. At first there was a little confusion over the booking but it was all sorted in minutes and we were upgraded to a bigger room. The whole of the hotel is very dark decor but it works. The rooms also dark and at night pitch black. There is a small window which we didn't open as it looked down a the back of another building. Bed very comfy bathroom clean good shower hairdryer provided. Plenty of space to hang clothes up with a mini walk in wardrobe also a ironing board and iron. Very large tv screen and also nice music system on the bed side. The hotel is a great location for all attractions less than 5 mins walk to Times Square also 15 mins walk to Central Park. They offer a taxi service back to the airport for $70 give a good hour travel time due to the traffic

The Night on 45th. is a small boutique hotel...ideal Times Square location, walk to anywhere. Very well designed and attractive rooms...small...no views...great bed and water pressure in shower (important to me) very clean and well kept. My room door was very loose and I think you could open it with a credit card. large T.V. I found this Night hotel on 45 to be too expensive, my fault, I booked not realizing I couldn't cancel and then was offered equal within a block for half the price. I am staying in the Night Hotel on 47th. in Feb. for half the price. No idea why this was so high. I liked it but not value for money unless you get a better rate.

This hotel is dark and dingy. Lobby is old and dingy, chairs dirty, There is one tiny elevator for the entire hotel. When housekeeping is using the elevator you have to wait for ever.The rooms are tiny and in need of updating and refreshing. Dirty carpets ect.No housekeeping by 3:12pm one day. I called twice and was told by the manager they would get to me when they get to me. Unfortunately we needed to get ready to go out again so we told her to forget it. They did end up coming when we left.Drilling outside our window the first day. Our room was so aweful the first time we had to pay an additional fee just to get a decent room.If we hadn’t prepaid we absolutely would have left. There are so many hotels in this city. Do yourself a favor and don’t stay. Staff was nice and did try. The manager was not so pleasant, unfortunately.

we enjoyed our stay at the Night, Steven our front desk person was so helpful and courteous, he literally saved us hours by giving us the best advice for what to do see and eat!! We would highly recommendthe Night if you'd like to be in the heart of times Square!!

This hotel is great for being in the centre of New York. The rooms are very small but that never bothered us as we were over to explore New York. We would do our shopping or sightseeing and nip back to the hotel to drop our things and freshen up and were straight out again as we were right in the middle of times square. We didn't eat much there as when we did go for breakfast on 2 of the mornings we stayed there, the breakfast was decent but overpriced and the staff were very overbearing. Every few minutes they were at the table or circled around us. Quier off putting. The reception staff and the gentleman who helped us get a taxi back to the airport were very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again if we ever go back to New York.

Nice, clean, stylish. A little cramped and somewhat dark, but overall I'd definitely stay here again. Very friendly staff. Located IN the theater district, easy walk to Times Square. Lots to see and do in the area.

My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. We love staying at boutique hotels because they are small and unique, and this one didn't disappoint. The hotel had tons of style. We checked in early in the day and the front staff graciously offered a free upgrade on our room which was appreciated. The front desk is 24 hours and were very helpful and friendly throughout our stay. They also allowed us to leave our bags with them while we continued to site see after checkout the last day. The hotel is conveniently located about a half block off Times Square and within a couple blocks of a few subway stations. I would definitely suggest this place to a friend or stay there again if in NYC again. One word of warning is that the place definitely caters to adults- not kids. The erotic (but tasteful) art in the lobby and hallways is a bit strong for kids.

The hotel was pretty much what I expected from their webpage. The room was nice, quiet and modern, although small. The hotel staff were very helpful mostly. The best thing is the location, It is in the very heart of Time Square, and there's a subway station some blocks away, so you can practically go anywhere. There are also some pubs crossing the street, so you can go for a beer or a nice meal without having to walk too much.

Although the rooms are attractive, they are very small. The size really is an issue. My luggage was not well organized and I was looking forward to laying out all my stuff after my long trip. That was not possible here. Not much furniture, not much closet space. Small is the keyword here. Electrical outlets are not conveniently located and there are far too few of them. I like to charge my phone on my nightstand. I couldn't do that here. The room is too cold. It's taking way too long to warm up. It's dark in here. If you drop something on this patterned carpet, you're never going to find it. The TVs are not high definition. Also I had heard that this was an adult-oriented hotel. It's not. There are no copies of the Karma Sutra in the nightstands as some reviews have mentioned.

Had a fab time at the night theatre hotel in New York, This hotel is just off of time square. It was all we needed, central to everything, the hotel is very clean, lovely rooms , got a good night sleep , as we had lots to see & do in New York

We flew up to NYC from Florida for the weekend to go see a broadway show, so we picked this hotel for its location and the reasonable reviews on trip advisor. What I can say is the name says it all; It's dark! From when you walk in to when you get into your room. There was virtually no natural light as my picture attests! However the rooms are clean and well appointed, if not a little small as with many hotels in NYC. It's absolutely fine for one or two nights but any longer I would have gone mad with claustrophobia! Can't give it a 4 but definitely a high 3 and I would visit again.

I spent one night here. The room was small and had no closet or storage space for a multiple night stay. The bed was quite comfortable. On all the pictures I saw the beds had black canopy headboards. However, my room had a white headboard. I went down to the desk and asked if I could switch to a room with the black headboard and was informed no more rooms were available. I was informed to request the black canopy headboard when I reserved my room, in the future. The staff was helpful, the hotel location was excellent. I like the feel of boutique hotels, they feel more personal. I would stay here again.

From the moment you walk in you can tell it is a unique, thought out hotel. The check in was seamless and fast; the staff is all very friendly and accommodating. Patrick went above and beyond to help me with my check in and the problem I had at the prior hotel. I think the word for the room would be sexy, black headboard with different wallpaper than the boring hotels you are used to. Definitely Recommend!
user_name:
jovanh12
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed for 4 nights here, superb location and greeted on arrival to the room with a bottle of Prosecco due to a special occasion. Room was plenty big enough compared to some and is on the door step of times square.The air co ditioning unit was very very noisy, however no sounds from outside bearing in mind location.Super clean, a big shout out to Patrick at front of house, he was a lovely man and a great help, genuinely happy and wanted to talk, unlike some in New York.Would visit visit again in a heartbeat.

My wife and I stayed here for two nights. The room was very tiny, just enough room for a double bed and mini bar. A very tiny (open) closet to hang a suit and dresses. An in room hair dryer as well as an iron and board are also included. The room and bathroom were very clean. The bed was very comfortable and had nice linens. It was quiet on our floor, the only noise coming from the in-ceiling air conditioner and an air handling unit outside our window. We both had no problem sleeping even when we returned for an afternoon nap. There was no view from our window and we simply kept the curtain drawn. There is a nice little bar-lounge area that we visited one night. It closes at midnight. The staff are great, very friendly and accommodating, allowing us to store our luggage on the last day following checkout. No coffee in the rooms. Time Square is literally steps from the from the front door as well are many theatres, coffee shops and eateries. We ate one night at the Chophouse restaurant off the Square. Finally, we arrived to NYC via Penn Station and walked to this hotel with our bags, about 20 min.We will return to this hotel, it was exactly where we wanted to be and was a very european boutique-stye hotel.

Arrived to meet the rudest man on the planet 'Robert' according to another member of staff. I don't believe this was his name so to describe him - Blotchy skin pigmentation on neck, had glasses on sometimes, dark hair, Japenese, young. He changed his story several times wanting more money for a room deposit. He shouted, insulted us several times and was out of his depth when the manager was not present. When arriving at our room, we discovered marked wall paper, not enough floor space to open suitcases, no bath, no view from the window as it looked on to a brick wall and it was annoying to see air con blasting and TV and music on wasting electric when no one was in the room.The next morning, we tried to get ready but the lighting was very poor making it impossible to put makeup on. After using the shower, there was no extractor fan and so the 1 mirror was steamed up and the room unpleasant. Outside of the hotel, the road wasn't very clean and the drain smell wasn't nice! Shout out to one man who helped us with our bags and was very polite. I think he said he was called 'Nick' - long dark hair, great teeth, 20/30 year old and the complete opposite of the reception staff. he was polite and gave us great taxi advice.

The location and overall style of the hotel is great.However, the AC unit was very loud, the room very small and abit dirty, the only available water in room was fiji water for 5usd per bottle. I had to go walk 2 blocks down to get cheaper water.The front desk lady was rude and check in was late (3pm)... So if ever you arrive early you can't take a shower or anything..Overall the hotel is OK, not a 4 stars anyhow.

Went for my 50TH BIRTHDAY 1st night boiling aircon not working reported in morn went out for day came back said it was fixed opened door heat hit us went down and told reception we were upgraded to a king room Staff were polite and friendly no complaints at all

If I was staying here for one day, this would have been a 5 star rating. But after 5 nights here, I am just disappointed. So lets start with what I absolutely love (aka the PROS:)-this place is Dark. Alot of people complained about the darkness of the rooms and the overall aesthetics, but if you are a fan of dark decor this place is awesome. I personally absolutely loved it over a bright airy room. The Black walls, and cool wall paper and overall vibe is awesome. -I like to travel without a lot of "Pomp" and prefer to be left alone as I come and go, so the fact that the stuff was not "cheery and greeting me" every time I walked through the door is fine with me. -I don't care about valet or parking when I uber in somewhere, so that was no issue. -Hotel location, for times square, pretty awesome. (Even though it says theater district, it's times square-My room was awesome(at first) I had a king room, and despite what many have said my room was plenty of size for me, and probably would have been fine for two. Bathroom good size, room comfortable. -IN short, if you want Westin, Intercontinental, or Marriott, then this is NOT the hotel for you. So the bad. (Aka the cons:)this is what sucks, cause I really really lvoed this place for about the first 36 hours I was here, then I started noticing things. -Housekeeping, they do not care at all. If I had to guess I would say they are allowed roughly 2-3 minutes per room for a turn. It was horribly inconsistent, and trash I accidentally left on the floor was not picked up. A take out food container bag, obviously garbage, sitting on top of the garbage can, was moved to the side of it and left. -Light bulb was burned out on arrival, ok, no biggie, they'll fix it on day 2. Nope. So I took the bulb out and placed it under the lamp, They put it in the cup with the wine key. Repeat this process everyday for 4 nights. Still no bulb. -Window, well I am pretty sure it is not supposed to fold down, also note that it could not close and latch this is two fold, one it made an incredible amount of street noise, and two, made the ac in-efficient. and then the ac...-Day 3 finds me back at my hotel after work. It is well over 80 degrees and blowing hot air. I call down and the front desk guy gives me a ludicrous story about cleaning the water tanks and it makes the ac stop working, but it will cool down shortly. Well it never does. Thankfully the window is broken, so I can at least get air, but god was it a hot, uncomfortable, loud, sweaty night. I complain via the expedia app the next day and about 4 hours later manager messages back saying it's been fixed and she credited my room, Im not sure how since I Prepaid on expedia, and have seen no refund. -Bathroom, well it has seen better days. The sink stopper was missing, but deep inside the sink is a toothbrush topper, so there is that, not to mention and earing on the shelf above. -if you have any kind of toiletry kit know the only place to open it is on the floor, toilet or in the bedroom, no space for anything in bathroom. -sink main faucet was loose and leaking and caulking job was horrible. -There are three light switches when you entered the room, 1 worked. The other two??? I have no idea. - There was a $5 bottle of fiji water when I checked in, I used it. They never replaced it once. -Furniture was a little beat up, but I could live with that. -as others mentioned, the walls are a little thin, and you hear every door, but really that's in most hotels. So I love quite a few things about this place, but as much as I would have given them 5 stars each day I stayed made this place less and less enjoyable. Aesthetics and style are 100% my style, I loved it, then sadly it showed it's colors. I would not come back here again. I would check out their sister property to see if it is as bad, but this one, sadly, I will not return. and just in case you are still booking, I was in room 68

I stayed at this hotel for four nights. The room was very small. The whole way also was very small. I honestly don't like. I stayed at forth floor. I don't think I might come back again to this hotel. The staff were very helpful. Everything else were good except the size of bedroom.
user_name:
Alashkhari
Al Ain, United Arab Emirates

review_body: I am here with friends and we found a very good deal on groupon and expedia.We called the hotel and front desk person offered the same rate.Hotel is small but you only need it for sleeping, so it was perfect for us. We booked 3 rooms. Employees are very nice. Robert helped with tours and amazing dinner at Blue Fin and Del Friscos for our big group. We received free wine at these restarants because of Robert. Very good service!

This hotel is in the perfect location for anyone wanting to stay in central Times Square! Past reviews said this hotel was noisy but I didn't find this at all! The staff are very helpful and the rooms were cleaned everyday! A room safe came with the room with no extra charges which is always a bonus! It's a beautiful city and this is a fabulous modern hotel with great staff and brilliant location! I would definitely return to this hotel!

first of all...I booked the grace hotel across the street for my girlfriends birthday. We got to the grace at 8pm went to go check in and the concierge told me that the reservation was cancelled. i was livid. i had the birthday girl with me and her husband so you can imagine how embarrassed i was that this woman is telling me that we pretty much had no room to stay in. Anyways i immediately got on my booking app and saw that there was another hotel right across the street with a king size bed so i booked it and went right across the street. First when we walked in it was very nice. Very dark and very intimate nice vibes staff was super friendly. We got upstairs to our room and the hall wall leading to the room was mirrors!!!! and dimly lit. the rooms were gorgeous. small but it didnt even matter. the decor was absolutley amazing bed was comfy. if you dont like small rooms then perhaps this spot isnt for you. but if you into great decor and awesome staff and nice comfy beds, COME HERE!!!! at the end of the day this is times square i know most of yall only gonna book this spot to sleep in

Me and a friend booked into Night for just one night on the 4th July 2017. I highly recommend this hotel, I've told all my friends and we will be back.I'd like to point out excellent customer service from Patrick at the front desk who made my stay a memorable one to say the least. Made us feel relaxed and went above and beyond to make our stay a comfortable one. The room was very spacious, I loved the dark theme, I have not a bad word to say on my Night experience.

This hotel was great for my significant other and I. It's very small, smaller than I expected, but we didn't spend much time in the room. The hotel is extremely dark. Everything is black. If you have vision difficulties, I wouldn't recommend as it can be dizzying how dark everything is. Mini bar prices are outrageous (to be expected) and parking was 30$ per 24 hours, across the street. The staff was great, and held our luggage before and after we checked out so we could explore the city. Perfect location 1 block from Times Square and subway. We probably won't return, mainly because we want to experience other hotels in NYC, but our overall experience was great!

Hotel in great location just off Times Square. Rooms are small but it is New York, very clean and comfortable beds. Clothes stayed in cases as no where to put them. Good shower in Bathroom with towels and flannels provided also small bottles of toiletries. Safe, Mini bar chargeable and Hairdryer also included. Air conditioning could be noisy but we had our room changed as noise from the Bar/ Asian restaurant patio. New room very much better. Concierge helpful. Would stay here again.

Had a great stay in NYC. Night Theater District was comfortable, spotless but lots of construction noise. Stayed overnight with friends and found the location to be perfect. We were within walking distance to Times Square, the Theater District and Restaurant Row. The room was small but adequate. Bed was comfortable and the view was really not worth the extra money.The personnel was extremely friendly and very accommodating. We were able to leave our bags safely after check out. Also visited the restaurant and had a GREAT Lemon Drop martini!!! Definitely worth stopping in.All in all The Night Theater District was a great find. Would recommend it.

Night theater district was a great place for us to stay. We only stayed one night in the city. It was nice we got upgraded to a king bed. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The room was clean. The bed was SOOO comfy. The bathroom was on the smaller side, but still met our needs exactly. We didn't have too much of a view, but we didn't care too much. All you have to do is walk a few feet down the street and you're right in Times Square! We loved the location so much as we we're mainly walking and taking the subway all around the city. Would definitely stay here again! It was so nice and affordable for us too.

The hotel was nice, clean, and comfortable. The beds were nice, the TV worked well and my room was big for NYC. The negatives was that it would LOUD!!! The windows were not sound proof and it was so bad that even on the 6th floor you could hear conversations on the street. From midnight-4am it was fine, after 4am it was so loud and made it hard to sleep.

Very stylish boutique hotel. Unique decor and great first impression. Staff great, had problems with check in (my fault!) and Robert extremely helpful and patient. All front desk staff warm and welcoming and very helpful. Personnel definitely the best thing about this hotel. Location also great, moments from Times Square but noise level from street low. Lift was broken for first 2 days we were there. We were given room on 6th floor up steep narrow steps and no offer of help with bags! Not fun after long haul travel and hot June day. Also not fun after long hot days walking round city and discouraged us from returning to room during the day. Room very small, no storage space and 'view' was brick wall inches away. Furniture a bit tatty, marked and worn. Overall impression - this is a bit of a faded glory. Unique hotel experience but in need of maintenance to justify price. Didn't feel as luxury as it looked at first glance. Think there are better options if you look around, although staff here are the definite plus.

The most amazing show on Broadway! Tiny theatre. Acoustics good. Scenery and sets out of this world. Clear singing and the story was easy to follow. Costumes and actors amazing. A small selection of memrobilia available.

We were moved here by our travel company after having a bad experience of our first hotel. The hotel was very central and situated right by times square, something that was worrying at first due to the noise level outside however when in our room it was clear that this was not going to be a problem and we heard nothing through the night! The hotel was quirky with its dark décor, and the rooms were small but cozy and provided you with everything you needed.We had problems with retrieving some tickets through our email and when my partner visited reception for some assistance Patrick was extremely helpful - we thank him for this greatly! When leaving the hotel we asked how we could get to the airport, the hotel has a private car selection who have air conditioned SUV's making the ride to the airport chilled and guaranteed. This proved a little difficult for us as we were leaving during 'National Puerto Rican Day' meaning the traffic in the city was chaos, however the staff at the hotel did all they could to keep our timing and we arrived at the airport with plenty of time.Thank you for making our experience of the big city a great one.

I like staying at boutique hotel like this because there is certain uniqueness that represents the city. Night Theater District is certainly one of those. The interior decor is chic and just like the pictures, a lot of black and white and massive headboard. The room is not very big but it is alright for 1-2 people sharing a room. The location, just like many other hotels in the area, is wonderful. The only drawbacks is there's only one tiny elevator so you either have to be patient or take the stairs and work on some steps instead. There's only one tiny window at my room and the view is meh...
user_name:
HotHotelReview
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel is very small but is very comfortable and clean. The bed was was really comfy. Centrally located and in easy reach of all the popular tourist spots. Surprisingly very very quiet. We had no traffic noise, no noise from other guests, really peaceful. We had a couple of minor hiccups with our room and the maintenance guy arrived in less than 5 minutes. When they were unable to repair the bedside light they replaced it with a standard lamp and gave us a free bottle of wine. Great service. Patrick on reception was particularly helpful with local info and went out of his way to help. The only negative is some of the bar staff weren't very helpful or friendly, but the reception staff made up for this. Overall a great place to stay for a comfortable convenient place for sightseeing.

Stayes here for 4 nights. Great location if you want to be in the heart of times square. Room was very clean but it was SO small. Add to that, the window was looking into a brick wall. I guess you are paying a decent price to stay in times square but I honestly think there are better options if you look around. I would stay here again easy I had too but I would look elsewhere first. 6.5/10 imo.

I visit NYC 3-5 times a year. I come from a 15-year hotel background prior to my current career. It's rare I write a review unless a property over-exceeds my expectations ... or ticks me off ... this is the later of the two ... The pro of this property is the LOCATION. Unfortunately, that's where is ends ... the rooms are small and fairly claustrophobic (I can live with that for a night). The a/c is loud (starting to annoy me). When the wind blows, forget about it, you're not going to sleep with the howling from the wind tunnel outside.I write this review as I sit "trapped" in the hotel. Last night, there was a "partier" in the hallway and we didn't get much sleep. Security came up, but that didn't stop him.This morning, I advised the front desk (Robert, who was very nice) that we wanted to check out and drive home today and asked not to get charged for tonights' stay. He said he had to talk to the manager. He called back and said we could not get a refund for tonight if we left. NOT CUSTOMER FRIENDLY. I shared my dismay; he said he'd call back. He called back and said the manager offered 20% of tonights' stay. Not what I was looking for. If a product isn't used, why should I have to pay for 80% of it?There are MANY other choices in the area, check those out before considering this property.

Arrived for four night stay, initial impressions were favourable regarding décor etc ,and especially customer service on the reception desk. However the good impression was spoilt on the first night by the level of noise, from the street below - it sounded like a building site, but in reality it was the NY bin men, taking away an incredible amount of trash from local hotels, apartment, offices etcWe did get moved and what a difference it was, so the moral of the story is if you choose this hotel, please insist on Not having the rooms looking on to the main street.They need to invest in some serious double glazing and or sound insulation in the front - I don't know if this is feasible.I cant emphasize how helpful the reception was on this and other issues, so top marks for customer service and dealing with concerns

After an exhausted search I booked this hotel as a surprise trip for my husband. I was drawn in by vibe of their website but took a wait & see approach since I been burned in the past with other boutique hotels. At the end our stay was brilliant, the staff was amazingly friendly, particularity the MANAGER VICTOR who seemed to anticipate every one of our needs and was extremely patient. Brilliantly well trained manager!The ambiance had a very European feel with a beautiful huge fish tank in the lobby. Rooms are simple but comfortable & very clean. Construction work was going on next door but hardly noticed it.Main selling point was the location but the friendly staff is the reason why we will continually give these boutique hotels a chance, particularity this one!

By far this is the best location and best room in time square! NYC is a very loud city and there rooms offer the most luxury affordable service! Never do I hear anything outside my window. All the rooms are very clean and up to date! Patrick checked me and and showed me some great places to check out! If it wasn't for him I don't think I could of had a better stay !

So, the AC was so loud I downloaded an App just to measure it. It peaks at 105 decibels and averages 90. Hotel room itself was cute and clean. Good location and good price. If you can handle the insufferably loud AC.

Recently checked in for a 3 night city break that was booked last minute so didn't have time to read reviews before choosing our New York hotel but booked the best valued flight and hotel package via the British Airways website and found ourselves staying at Night Theater District.From JFK we got the airport link train to Jamaica station then got train tickets to Penn Staion and walked the just over 1km to Night hotel.Location was just perfect for us with Times Square just round the corner - We could walk home each night from the Theater.The accommodation was better than expected - The room was a fair size and had everything we needed for our stay including robes and a nice comfy bed. Would have expected complimentary water in the room however this was charged at $5 + city taxes!

All in all the hotel met our needs, the location is great right on the doorstep of times square.The most disappointing part for us was upon arrival we were met with quite a curt receptionist, unfortunately we had an issue with our credit card when paying for the room as it hadn't been authorized to be used abroad yet. A call to the bank soon sorted the issue but after a long flight and traffic in the taxi from the airport, the curt welcome and unhelpful receptionist really didn't start us off on the right foot with this hotel.The rooms are small and very dark, our window looked out on a shaft so no natural light. The air conditioning is very noisy and cannot be turned off without the engineer turning it off on the main switch.We didn't use the bar or restaurant in the hotel so cannot comment on these.If location is important to you then go for it, but I am sure there are much better Hotels there within a short walk to times square.

You can't except a better location just a few minutes away from Times square. I stayed there for a week with my girlfriend and we couldn't sleep properly due to doors opening and closing, people talking and making love at times...and we are still a young couple. This is because the walls and room door are not soundproof. So we could ear anything really. The room was very small and without any natural light. I find it too expensive for the room quality they offer.

Did book the night hotel for this business trip to NYC. Location is good for midtown.Rooms are extremely small and you hardly have any view out of the windows. Guess that's why they call it Night Hotel as you just wanna be in the room the freshen up and sleep there. Rooms are clean and tidy. Staff is attentive and quite helpful. I could get an early checkin upon request without a problem. Not sure if I will come back again as I expect a bit more from my room in NYC than just staying there for sleeping. For city travelers or those we don't plan to spend much time in the room the hotel could be a good choice as the location is very good to explore the city.

I was there at February 2016 Very nice Hotel!Friendly stuff and very helpful! Great Location very close to times square!!! The air condition was a bit noisy but wasn't a big problem!!!The Rooms were very warm and clean!!

The room was clean and comfortable, however it was tiny and very dark. The facilities were not very good, waited up too 20 mins to order some drinks at the bar and the wifi did not work. Staff were pleasant and helpful!

This hotel is smack in the middle of time square. You are within a 15-20 walk to Central Park. 15min walk to Madison square garden. It was our first time in the big apple and the subways are easy to take and are the best form of transportation. This hotel room is very small, has a dark gothic feel to it, I don't recommend if your bringing young kids, some of the wall decor has pictures of naked females. Patric at the front dest is amazing, very friendly and knowledgeable with the city. I liked this hotel for its location and if your into black and white, old gothic feel, you will love it too. Below is a picture taken outside our window. This bar can get load at times, but hey your staying in Times Square Area not lower Manhattan.

I thought this hotel was relatively good value for the location but the "dark" "black" night theme was not very fun after a few days. Especially if you're over 40 and your vision is going, I do not recommend this hotel for you. Yes, rooms are small but they always are in Manhattan. Yes, walls are thin; my partner on speaker phone even thought someone was in the room with me but it was someone outside in the hallway.The restaurant is quite delicious and inexpensive, even with the 18% gratuity and $5 delivery charge. I went to their sister hotel, Time Hotel, by mistake and that hotel seemed much brighter, nicer and just as well located. However, the service was excellent all around; front desk, valet, housekeeping. The staff was very good including accommodating my colleague in a larger, brighter (relatively) room and a late checkout. I was in 86 and she was in 80 and her room was smaller, darker and faced onto a shaft, even though we were both on the 8th floor (9th is penthouse).

The hotel itself, is a modern gothic - great atmosphere. The rooms are a bit small; however, we were in town for entertainment, not really looking for a luxury suite. Hotel staff was very accommodating with an abundance of local information for us. Everything was clean and in working order with the exception of the cable which continuously cut in and out. We opted for the lover's package and received a complimentary bottle of wine, which was a perfect end to a crazy night at Madison Square Gardens. Because I don't normally go to NYC to watch tv, I will definitely return to this hotel.

We have just returned for a four nights stay at The Night Hotel which was booked as a complete surprise by my boyfriend -so for once I had no control but he chose well!. The location was amazing literally on the steps of Times Square and subway. I agree the rooms were on the slightly small side but we didn't see this as a problem at all - we literally slept in there as were out all day exploring!! All of the staff were SO SO helpful and friendly, in particular Patrick. He recommended some fantastic restaurants, helped us with directions and really went out of his way - thank you so much! For the location and service would definitely recommend this hotel! Thank you :)

Location was fantastic. A stones throw from times square. We walked to local subways and attractions. The rooms we very well decorated. On the down side the rooms were tiny and very dimly lit so it was hard to make sure your make up was done ok. Also had a slight problem with the heating/air con. It was really cold then went really hot. The window also backed onto a brick wall which wasn't ideal. Very expensive but I suppose you pay for the location! Otherwise staff very friendly and helpful

Ideal location however room was extremely small and small window looked out into a brick wall. I was travelling with my adult son and there were no twin beds - just doubles so I had to pay extra £25 per night for a small camp bed in the room. This left no room to move or sit apart from the bed.Loud music is piped throughout the hotel corridors and the walls are very thin so noisy guests (whooping and hollering and partying next door) deprived us of sleep. People shouting in corridors late at night and banging doors loudly spoilt the trip.

Room is small, once we opened 2 luggage there are almost no space for walk.Love the dark theme, this is one of the reason we chose this hotel, nice deco at the lobby.Walking distance to Time Square area.But very important, DO NOT MOVE the drinks in the mini fridge otherwise they will consider it's consumed. Even the drinks still in the fridge?If you look carefully there are a notice placed on the table above the fridge, but very small. Not really happy about this.

This hotel was given such mixed reviews online. While it wasn't the nicest hotel I've stayed in, it definitely wasn't as terrible as everyone made it out to be.The superior queen room we were checked into were a lot more spacious than what people had previously described. Night Theatre District is not appropriate for anyone younger than 18 or those who are uncomfortable with the "sexy" theme of the hotel. One thing I will mention is that it is EXTREMELY dark regardless of what time of the day it was. If you're used to waking up to some natural daylight and have set plans for the day, make sure to set about five alarms so you wake up at the appropriate time. If not, you'll wake up at 8 AM thinking it's still nighttime.Our "view" was of a dark alleyway so we did not see any sunlight in our room during our entire stay.Personally I wouldn't stay here again just because there are so many hotels in New York to choose from however it was decent... Not 4 star decent but okay.

Such a unique hotel. Room was so so small, the fridge was positioned in the room taking up so much space it was hard to get around one side of the bed. Loved he wall of curtains but realized quickly it was literally just a wall behind them and one tiny window overlooking a water tank on top of neighboring building and surrounded by 3 others. Zero view/ slightly claustrophobic. This is probably the quietest space I've ever slept in NYC! It was so nice to come back to our room at night and enjoy peace and quiet. Heard nothing from the street or sirens. Loved that part of this stay. I would definitely stay here again, but only wish the room could be bigger. Location was awesome too!

As most boutique hotels in new york, the room was rather small, but we had a great stay. Everything in the hotel is black&white designed. The staff is very friendly and helpfull. The best thing about this hotel is probably the location... only steps away from timesquare... so right in the center of manhatan...

The room I got was very very small but, I am very aware that i was in NYC in the middle of Times Square, so you can't really expect much more. The lobby was modern and stylish and everything was clean. The staff was courteous and helpful.

Good for an affordable hotel in a prime location, lack of daylight really bothered me (understand though as it's called the night) but the window faced a wall and the lack of natural daylight was frustrating after a while. Friendly staff. Horrible old small lifts and compact room but worth it for the location.

Chic hotel, but the room was SMALL!! We had a King bed. Room size was maybe 200 sq ft at the most. Upon entering the room, I thought OMG, I have to go down the hall for the bathroom. As we closed the door, the entrance to the bathroom was behind the door. No closet, No dresser. Hanging bar over the mini-bar fridge. I have stayed at several boutique hotels but this takes the cake. The view was horrible (gangway view). We moved to the Marriott the next day. If you are by yourself, this is ok. But as a couple NEVER EVER AGAIN!! No place to store luggage. Not even under the bed. The decor is nice but too dark as it makes the room appear coffin like. The furnace was loud when it turned on. Luckily we were so tired that we slept through it.
user_name:
Charisse W
Chicago, Illinois, United States

review_body: First off if you've never been to NYC before and are walking to the hotel just beware its not the easiest place to find. Signage is there but doesn't really jump out at you. Our room was nice, not huge but pretty much in line with the size we've come to expect when traveling in large cities like this one. Our experience at the front desk was good no issue there and the lady that cleaned our room was wonderful and friendly. On the downside, VERY noisy, but internally (our room was insulated from the street). You could hear people walking through the passage ways, doors banging shut etc at all hours of the day. To surmise...great location, nice rooms - but very noisy. If you're looking for a great and peaceful nights sleep you might not get it here...

I was greeted with a warm hug by Patrick, the concierge, who I had emailed before I arrived asking him advice & questions in relation to my stay. He couldn't have been more helpful and made our stay in New York the best ever! Yes, the hotel room might be abit small, but you are in New York after all and yes the decor is very dark, but you can see all this before you arrive, the rooms were kept very clean and the housekeeper very friendly. The hotel is in a brilliant location and we were able to walk everywhere we needed to go - would we stay there again - definitelyJulie & Brendan Smithies, Leeds, United Kingdom

We spend 5 nights here on the lead up to Christmas. The only good thing about this hotel is the location.On arrival we had asked to pay upfront for our stay. This was no problem but then without asking $200 extra was taking as a deposit from our account. Now I dont mind doing this, but the lady on reception could have at least asked us was it ok. It gets better, we checked out over 4 weeks ago and our $200 still has not been refunded to our account and we were told when leaving 5-10 days max. Still nothing I have a feeling we will never see that $200Rooms very small but clean. The noise was just unreal from outside to the rooms around you, we could hear everything. Over all would not stay again.

My husband and I recently stayed here over the Christmas period for 7 nights. This would have to be the WORST hotel we have ever stayed at. Our room was so small that you could not even open a suitcase or have any room to move. It was like staying in a closet. After talking to the concierge about getting a larger room we were rudely told nothing could be done until the manager was in the following day and were totally dismissed. Thankfully we were told the next day via phone by the manager that we would be moved. Thank goodness! But this was probably the only good thing about our stay. On our way out for the day we checked with the concierge about what to do with our luggage. We have never been so rudely spoken to before. The absolute look of annoyance on his face was unbelievable. He told us he knew nothing about a room change and continuously rolled his eyes at us. He then called the manager and spoke to her just as rudely as he did to us. Maybe he was angry about working over Christmas? Who knows, but his attitude was disgusting. The concierge's final condescending response to us with an eye roll was "It will be fine".On returning to the hotel we noticed that our suitcase had been destroyed and the metal handle being totally bent and unusable. The same concierge was there so we knew there was no point in even asking him about this. If you want a nice friendly hotel to stay at in NYC, do NOT stay here!!! Towels are not clean, rooms are so dark and small, the corridors are extremely noisy and the staff are the rudest. You are not made to feel welcome here at all. THE WORST HOTEL IN NYC.

We stayed 2 nights the week after Christmas to see Broadway shows. The location was great - just 2 blocks from the TKTS booth. It is very dark - everything black with accents of silver or white. Hallways are narrow. Our room overlooked an alley. The room (superior queen) was small (it is NYC) with just enough room to walk around the bed. Other than the window sill or on top of the minibar in the closet, there isn't anywhere to put luggage. We were there for 2 nights and had little with us, so it was fine and it did have a small closet. The bathroom was bigger than some other places and the shower was great as it was in the space that was once a small tub. It had a half glass wall and a shower curtain. I hate the half glass that's then open to the bathroom! The water pressure was usually good with a few times it dropped but came right back up. Nice Bigelow toiletries. The elevator was tiny but relatively fast- 2 people and 2 pieces of luggage would fill it. We did use the stairs once during a busy time.There is a thermostat in the room but it didn't seem to control the temperature. It was hot so we had to open the rickety window. Bed was comfortable. We didn't notice any noise, but the room was dark and we were exhausted so we slept well.All staff was very professional and pleasant. We couldn't check in early but they will hold your bags. It isn't the Waldorf, but it worked well for us.As an aside, it bills itself as NY's sexiest hotel. The artwork in the halls is of models in sexy poses. Where you would normally find a bible or book of mormon in the bedside table, was the Kama Sutra! Be aware if you're traveling with someone whose sensibilities might be offended!

This was our first experience in NY and we were so pleased! The hotel is a boutique style with upscale decor and great customer service!! We highly recommend it for couples, no rooms available for parties of more than 3. Great location!!!

I never leave bad reviews but this is justified. Waited for 30 min because they could not find our reservations. We booked directly through the hotel via phone hours before arrival. Because of the mixup (and because I think they offer on all booking sites) we were promised a bottle of wine to be sent up to the room. That never happened. After calling and stopping by the front desk inquiring about our "complementary bottle" and being assured by Patrick that it would be delivered to our room upon our return they never followed through. Rust in bathroom, water stains on ceiling, chipped paint on the walls throughout the room. Night Hotel is aptly named as it is best viewed when poorly lit. Disappointing.

Nice place to stay in New York. The location is really great, everything is near, the hotel is clean and safe and the parking is not too expensive. The only thing i would like to have in our room is a cofee maker. Rooms are a bit small, but for the location it's not a surprise.

We arrived 25th November to average welcome, just asked for name very basic welcome. Didn't tell us any information about hotel I.e. Bar or check out times. We went up to our room, when entered I was shocked as it was tiny box room with no space to move very boxed in with tiny bathroom. I knew straight away we was in wrong room, as we was meant to be in superior king size city view room. My boyfriend went down stairs to find out what was going on for them to tell us it was our travel agent fault, who was in fact my sister in law and when she booked the hotel she rang the hotel direct. They said we don't have a room available tonight but we can move you tomorrow which was a bit of pain for how long we was there. They gave us complimentary cocktails which was nice though. We was told to come back the day after after 3 and your room was ready. We arrived at 3.30 to find the cleaner still in our room and to tell us the shower light was broke somebody will be with you soon which they was but we got disturbed again after waiting to get into our room. This room was much better spacious and really comfy beds and super hot shower. The rooms where dark and needed a brighter light and mirrors in bedrooms where in wrong place right behind the light not good. Staff were okay but not brilliant customer service. We left our complimentary cocktails till the last day while we waiting for our taxi, but when my boyfriend went to the bar the bar man said sorry we can't do them :/ so we didn't get complimentary cocktails after all because apparently they couldn't do them even though the manager at front said we could, what's that all about? They said we could only get beer and wine which we didn't want so we just left it. Another fault was there was no hot drinks available which is very strange!! The location of hotel was excellent and the man on the door was very good and helpful getting the doors, suitcases and sorting out our travel to the airport. If I was going to come back to New York I probably would stay somewhere else. Sorry :( I expected better from this hotel.

The hotel was great check out was not as easy as check in...no one was there only some guys that were vacuuming other than that it was great....everything was in walking distance.. Didn't try the restaurant short stay...rooms was clean though it was small it was cute and cozy..

The worse 4 star or even 3 star hotel i have stayed in. Very small rooms, rubbish bar, small lobby, worn out furniture, very cluster phobic, SUPER SUPER NOISY!!! CANT SLEEP!! Old non functional windows, one very old and slow lift. You wait for this lift for ever and it can barely fit 4 people.DO NOT PAY THAT MONEY FOR THIS HOTEL! Any alternative is better.

I booked this hotel after looking on TripAdvisor I wasn't disappointed staff was friendly and helpful would definitely stay here again on my next trip to New York. Times square was about 2min walk from hotel

the idea for the hotel is great - high design and chic/cool.the hotel seems to need a little work. also - the room smelled of marijuana the entire time, and our neighbors were insanely loud. kind of seedy.

Really good hotel,clean and stylish hotel. Had everything you need and fantastic location. Subway couple streets away, time square on your doorstep . Quite peaceful hotel. Rooms small but not cramped, it's New York you spend very little time in hotel . The most comfortable bed ever !!!

Hotel was very dark and sexy. Perfect for a weekend getaway or anniversary. The room was on another level. We have never stayed in such a nice room before. We didn't want to leave! The balcony views from the Penthouse Duplex were awesome! What a nice experience.

Perfect hotel!!! Patrick and Daniela are very attentive and friendly. I had a problem with the Super Shuttle and Daniela tried to help me promptly. All the team is to be congratulated. I'll back and. Tks for all!

I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. From start to finish it was an horrible experience. Upon arrival we asked for two beds, we were told that only a "twin bed was available", we asked for a roll away bed and was told that the room would not fit a roll away bed. It was late so we didn't have much of a choice but when we got our room it was a one double bed, it was the smallest room I have ever stayed in. At the end of the bed there we stains on the sheets and the carpets, we look out our window, our view was the fire escape stairs. We did not feel safe so we had to go to another hotel for our second night stay. Not sure how this is rated a four-star hotel! Also, no available coffee in the entire hotel. The only thing that I would say is nice about the place is the location, it is in the heart of Times Square. We were on a girls weekend so a little stressful start, but ended up loving NYC due to changing hotels!

This hotel is stunning. Such a beautiful back drop for any photos. The accommodations were very comfortable although smaller than I expected. I would happily stay here again and/or recommend this hotel to a friend.

I found the staff to be friendly and helpful, the decor is amazing. The location is excellent! The rooms are appropriately sized and I think it would add value if u could use the refrigerators to put items in as well as the stocked drinks.

The location is outstanding. The room was just the necessary size, quiet, very clean and well decorated. The staff was friendly and helpful. TV and radio were good. Bed comfortable and clean. Bathroom nice.
user_name:
joao0902
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Overall the hotel service was very good. In a good location close to work, shopping area and restaurants. The room was clean, but just felt a bit cramped. I would recommend this hotel to co-workers visiting the NY office.

Very nice place. Stylish, individual, unique, well defined hotel. Staff friendly and always available. Room cleaned beautifully every day. Quiet room. Small and cosy hotel. Amazing location off Broadway, Times Square. The only element I didn't like were the pictures on the wall of semi clad women.

Very expensive. No natural light in room 20. Had a bottle of Japanese IPA with dinner, $12?? The air conditioning was very loud. I can only describe the noise as being similar to being seated over an aeroplane over the wing ext row. The location for Times Square was perfect. No tea or coffee making facilities. We had dinner in the hotel on our first night, food was good but extortionate. Staff very friendly.

This hotel has lots of class just 1/2 block from all the action of Times Square and the theater district. The decor is themed consistently throughout and felt fairly fresh. The rooms are not overly spacious, but the beds are super comfy and all the basics are there. Parking is very reasonable and close by. The staff is super friendly - shout out to my man Patrick at the main desk who quickly ascertained we grew up in the same town! Our stay was very enjoyable.

Arrived at this small hotel and plunged into darkness from the moment we arrived until we left, it can be quite depressing to be so dark all the time. The lights were dim, the walls black, even the shower had black tiles and a black shower curtain. The first couple of staff we met very unfriendly but after that everyone pleasant. The food was out there, maybe it's just me as I don't eat seaweed, quite glad really as restaurant dark also and I could be eating anything. Again I can't tell you how clean or otherwise the hotel was, due to the darkness. It is the first time on holiday I wished I had brought a high powered torch. Great location put this was the one and only positive. Sleep was difficult due to rubbish being collected at 3 in the morning, roadworks all night and traffic. Make sure you bring earplugs.

My mom and I came to New York to sight see and explore the city! We had never been before and the Night Hotel was in a perfect location that was walking distance to a lot of the things we wanted to do. It was very convenient and the staff was very pleasant and helpful! Our room was great, we didn't really spend a whole lot of time in the room, only to sleep and get ready. It was perfect!!! Thank you for helping make our New York experience even better!

Well placed in the Theater District. We booked three rooms for our family. All were different sizes, though all were the same cost. A good addition would be tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms. Beware of the twenty five percent gratuity charge in the bar at the back of the reception.

The hotel has a great location and cool, adult-themed vibe, but our room and bed were simply too tiny to be comfortable (we are 5'9" and 5'11", average build). I would recommend this hotel if you are a very small couple looking for a sexy, kids-free getaway (but ladies, be sure to bring a lighted makeup mirror because the rooms are very dark). Other than that, there are better places to stay at the same price point. On a more positive note, the gentleman at the front desk was exceptionally helpful to us and every customer we heard him interact with.

Rooms seemed dirty and outdated. Needs bathroom renovation. Sheets had hair and mold spots on them. Hard to apply makeup in dimly lighted bathrooms. Construction during the night made it hard to sleep.

Night, a small boutique hotel steps from Times Square, countless Broadway shows, the subway (NQR, S, E, and 123), and Rockefeller Center, is a Manhattan best-buy. The rooms are quite small, even by Manhattan and Times Square standards, but management does the well with what it's got. The closet is extemely small (maybe 18 inches wall-to-wall) but the bathroom is quite spacious. The bed is large and comfy. There is a sizeable work area, and wireless is free.Despite being right smack in the middle of Times Square, Night is fairly quiet. There are no work-out facilities at Night itself, but guests have access to the rather capacious full-service Equinox at Rockefeller Center. Equinox provides free gym clothes (shorts, T shirt, even socks!) and will even press your suit while you work out.Staff was courteous, helpful, and proactive. Special kudos to Patrick at the front desk who worked tirelessly to make my stay comfortable and convenient. He made me feel welcome and appreciated.Location cannot be beat. Just a shame Manhattan is so short on space. But again, hotel management does a great job with what it's got, and for what you get, Night represents a true best-buy among Manhattan hotels.

Firstly, what you can't fault:Location- you're about a minute's walk from Times SquareLook of the main areas of the hotelTV channels are fab. I got to watch loads of brilliant tv when I got in and when I got up!The staff on the front desk, and the doorman were all brilliant. Really helpful and approachable. The beds are made up beautifully each day, and fresh towels given.The design of the room, bathroom and the comfort of the bed. The bed was really comfy.The ability to have air con in your room.The products given in the bathroom were lovely, and replenished daily. There were loads of sockets in the room to plug things in. Yes, it sounds strange but...plugging in phones to charge, hairdryer, curling wand etc...it all takes up sockets!I found there to be plenty of room in my room, and some wardrobe space too.There's a complimentary umbrella in your room for those rainy days!There's a loft, save you hauling everything up the stairs (lift isn't always there in NY!)A couple of issues:We made our booking through booking.com and it was stated that they had tea and coffee making facilities and an iPod dock in the room. The rooms didn't have these, though we believe this may be a booking.com error, so we have emailed them regarding this. I would've welcomed these facilities.It is easy to hear noise outside your room, though the people on my floor were very quiet! Don't get too amorous unless you don't care about people hearing!The bar is pretty expensive, though we found the prices to be a bit high in lots of places... 8 drinks was over $110.Would I stay again? Yes.

Fine Hotel. Location too close to Times Square.Hotel needs a little maintenance, but seems they are going to renovate soon.Staff are really nice.Cons: no business center. Elevator takes time to arrive. Cleaning in the morning is noisy.

Very modern, room was decorated very nice. We had a very late arrival, staff was friendly and informative! Willing to go above and beyond for us guests. We were upgraded to a larger room! Would def stay again.

Me and my partner recently stayed here for our wedding in Central Park. The staff were lovely, esp Patrick (sorry if I have gotten this wrong!) who was so helpful during our stay. If you don't want a big corporate office like hotel, go for this one, it is unique and in an ideal location. There are some signs of wear and tear but lets be fair, its a busy place! and it can be noisy, but only due to the road outside, I never heard noise from other rooms etc, its NYC, where isn't noisy!? We booked the king room, well worth it. I would return :-)

This room was small. There wasn't a good place to open your suitcase except on the bed, as the footstool and desk were both too small & there wasn't enough floor space. Otherwise well appointed and nice

The hotel was nice - good location & clean! The rooms were a bit too dark for my liking and poor lighting but we had a great week! The staff were helpful with printing tickets and boarding passed as well as recommending places to eat/drink and the best way to get somewhere on the subway

I felt I had an awesome NY experience the two nights I stayed. The location is fantastic- you really feel that you are in the heart of the city and the staff were excellent. The food is excellent- great sushi and contemporary Vietnamese/Chinese food. Faye is one of the best bartenders I have ever seen. Ask for a 'nice rum' and pineapple and see what you get- be prepared for the next morning mind you. All in all a fantastic stay. Couldn't recommend it highly enough.

This was my first time staying in NYC. I had a great experience at Night Theater District. The rooms were very nice and clean. Check in was great. Robert at the front desk was professional, friendly and very welcoming. He answered all of my questions and was able to make excellent recommendations about where to dine. I will definitely be returning to this hotel the next time I'm staying in the city, and will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends!

Nice rooms, cozy and with an amorous vibe. Staff was professional and with great warmth and attention to detail. I enjoyed the hotel decor: black and white pictures of masquerading characters in the halls, mood lighting, black and white color palette, etc. It gave me the unique feel of an 18th century aristocrat at a secret sex haven. My only complaint was the construction outside my window.

This hotel was in a great location, very close to the theater for my tickets for the Lion King. Service was great, the AC unit in my original room started leaking when I got back from the show - because it was so late they watched me rooms and compensated me for the trouble. Was very satisfied.

Great location for sight seeing, quirky decor and comfy, clean room. Perfect for a few nights in the city. All members of staff we spoke to were helpful and friendly. There's plenty of places to eat nearby as well.

Rooms are small but it's New York! However the rooms are far too dark. Women ... Be careful when applying make up in that light!!! There is no breakfast either, which is fine because you are surrounded by places to eat. But some coffee making facilities at the very least would be useful

We stayed 4 nights. Check in was great and Patrick was welcoming. Yes the rooms are small, but all NYC boutique style hotels have small rooms. We managed. Especially if you're not in the room all day. Very clean. We had a room in the middle of the floors so no noise from the street. You're about 30 seconds walk from Time Square on 7th avenue. Will certainly stay here again.

On the first night we checked in we were stuck in a smaller room because ours (a higher priced room) was unavailable due to a power outage. The room they put us in had a double bed and was the size of a shoebox. Exactly what you'd be looking for after 1.5 hours on a bus, followed by 4 hours on the train. They "upgraded" us from a Queen room to a King room for the remaining days. I've encountered similar circumstances in other hotels, and they've been far more accommodating by provided hotel restaurant vouchers in addition to a hotel upgrade, or left a bottle of champagne in our room. We were not permitted to get into our new room until nearly 3 PM the following day, and in the morning they took away our cards to get into our shoebox room. It was hard to get a hold of people at the desk, around 7 AM they were not there. We asked for a late checkout of 2 PM, and were told no multiple times. After pushing a 3rd time they allowed us until 1 PM. Really? After sticking a couple in a shoebox sized room on their check-in night this is the best you can do? The bathrooms in these rooms were ridiculous, tiny, poor lighting, no vent, and extremely limited counter space. For the prices you pay, the quality/size of the rooms and the service you get, I would never recommend.

I enjoyed the room they up grade us to the Penthouse. It was a bit nosey the bathroom sky light start to leak. Other than that its in a goodlocation. I'm not sure if I would come back again. It was a bit pricey but it was for my anniversary.

Our hotel room was near the street and we could hear everything all night! cranes, people talking, sirens! I am a seasoned traveler and rarely write a negative review. They need to install some sound proof windows.

In the middle of time square. The people at the hotel are very helpful and ready to help. The room was a little small but very nice. It was a last min reservation so im happy i was able to even find something. The cleaning service is amazing.

Very nice hotel, close to Times Square, Theaters and Restaurants. Rooms are small but clean and nicely decorated. Very quiet- no noise problem. Staff were helpful. Irish bars across the street for late night snack and drinks.

Close to theatres, subway, pubs and restaurants. If you're in town for a couple of days, this is a good base of operations to start from. Patrick was very friendly and helpful in suggesting a comedy club.

Wonderful hotel with a fantastic staff including Patrick who was not only knowledgeable and efficient, but friendly and full of personality. The info, suggestions, and ideas he gave us throughout our visit to NYC were invaluable.The room we had was on the smaller side but well appointed and fashionably decorated. The bed was super comfortable, but just a warning for tall folks--there is a raised footboard which can make it a bit uncomfortable (I had to sleep slightly diagonal) if you are taller than 6ft. I can only speak for our room as I'm not sure if it's the same bed frame in every room. The bathroom and shower were very nice and modern.Location is great--right off of Times Square and a short 2-3 block walk to any of the subway lines we needed during our trip. Looking forward to our next trip to NYC--we definitely want to look at Night Theater District as our place to stay.

Great hotel centrally located just a 1 minute walk from Times Square and 2 mins to the subway station. We had booked a Queen size room, but there had been an error with our travel agency who hadn't communicated our booking correctly to the hotel. For this reason the first night we were placed in a standard room (room 82) and then the hotel kindly upgraded us to a King (bigger than a Queen) for the following 2 nights. The standard rooms are tiny, the rooms as much as the beds, so if your partner like mine, is more than 6ft tall - don't even consider a standard room - you won't sleep as it's just too small and there's barely space in the room to have one large suitcase let alone two. Once we were in the right room, space was much better, as was light as the room was externally facing with two windows (room 57). I like the black and white theme of the hotel, it's different and very boutique - although it does make it testing to do your makeup in the morning lol. Front desk staff, particularly Patrick, are super and always there to help with any issues that you have (and share with you their hilarious renditions of overseas accents, his take on my British one was hilarious!) We didn't realise Breakfast isn't an option at this hotel as they only cater for evening meals, so if you want B&B option just be aware of this.
