Having said that though, as it's so close to Times Square, there are a mountain of options right on your doorstep for all types of eating options, we favoured Europa Café on the corner by the subway who do a great and reasonably priced breakfast. Overall nice hotel and would recommend to a friend if I was asked.

Stayed two nights at this hotel in October. Overal the hotel delivered well. Service was very good and the staff friendly. The room was a bit small, but still ok for one person (was a double room though, maybe too small for two). The bed was short. I'm not super tall, but my feet reached the end of the bed. The location is great if you want to be around Times Square. Overal, the hotel was nice, clean enough and convenient for a good price.

This experience was wonderful. The service was friendly and efficient. This is first hotel where I did not have to ask for anything twice. The room was sexy and perfect for a couple getaway. I was greeted in my room with a complimentary bottle of wine. What a treat!

The staff greets us gently when we arrivederci and the hotel was in a nice position. Rooms were a kindle spalle buttare this is normale in hotel with that sort of locazione. Our vacation was really enjoyable

The room was very small but clean. And it was very dark needs more light in the hotel. I'm very bug conscious so. It kept me looking around for bugs when I was in the room. I would prefer a brighter hotel and it was the opposite.

Hotel for a brief stop in the center of New York City near Times Square. Stylish design and a pleasant and nice staff. Small rooms, we got facing the wall. Noisy air conditioning. Was used a mini-bar as fridge. In the morning received a bill for the beer, which lay next to the mini-bar. When leaving explained the situation and the account was canceled.

Good clean hotel in a convenient location. Helpful and friendly staff. Rooms were small without being cramped though there wasn't much room for baggage/hanging clothes in our King room. Very slow elevator, though that's not the end of the world...

Booked the deluxe California room but the bed in the room was no where near a California size! Both my husband and I are only 5'8" and if we didn't sleep with our heads against the head board our feet would hit the foot board....very uncomfortable!

Great location, good hotel. Room was just what is required when in a place like NYC and the location is literally just off times square. Perfect base to venture from every day. The only improvement I could suggest is another lift to make it a little easier going up and down from the room.

I was booking last minute and was happy to find this place - as it was the most affordable and in a great location. Close to where we needed to go too. The only issue was that we stayed on the second floor and were right near the emergency exit door. I stepped outside for a second and the big sign said something about the door will lock and you will need to enter from the first floor. However, the door definitely did not lock, and that made us a little uneasy since it was adjacent to a very dark alley. The only other issue was the huge window in our room that was also unlocked and would not lock. We were about to request to change rooms (as this window also led directly outside and we were on the bottom floor...) but were in a rush and we managed to put all our strength into locking it. Was disappointed that that was probably left unlocked for previous guests as well... Other than that, everything else was fine. Everyone at the front desk was very nice.

Wonderful stay. The front desk was great and extremely friendly! The ONLY thing I can say is that I wish the lighting was a little better in the bathroom so that it was easier to do my make-up. It was plenty bright enough for everything else, but the lighting was tough for putting make-up on. I also wish there was a coffee maker in the room, and a full length mirror.The room itself was great. The bed extremely comfortable, and Time Warner on-demand came with the room. I'll definitely stay here again, it's right IN Times Square, and right across from my NYC office.

Great location! No need to use subway, you can walk easily to everywhere. Just few steps to Time Square! There are many restaurants, shops around the hotel. Comfortable and clean rooms. I rocommend here to everyone!!!!

What a wonderful well situated hotel. Was here on an extended business trip on my own and was looked after as part of the family. What I thought was going to be a difficult trip was made so enjoyable. Cannot recommend this boutique hotel more for the standard of the rooms to the excellent position and customer service.

i liked the hotel but I recommend to couples. Internet wasnt good in the room. clean and I loved the atmosphere of the room.perfect location, very easy to find ways to subways. the card keys were not working well, they told me I cannot put cards near my phone because I was keeping keys in phone case that i have. i needed to go to reception several times to activate.
user_name:
mm1208
New York City, New York

review_body: Quite small rooms (but how long are you in them really, when you are exploring NYC)! Funky room designs, beds were only doubles but comfortable. There was quite a lot of street noise (but you are in NYC, if you want a quiet place, maybe rethink your visit)Had a little bar downstairs, never lots of people around as it only has a small amount of rooms, so it was nice after the busy hustle and bustle of the streets to get back to a quieter place! Concierge staff were always more than helpful and SO friendly! You cannot argue with the location of this hotel either. We were a 2min walk to subway, about a 30sec walk to the centre of Times Square, HEAPS of restaurants within walking distance, Starbucks right next door. If we visit NYC again, this is where we would stay!

The Night hotel is surrounded by the main theatres of the district. You´ve all the connections to enjoy this great city, just a few steps of the hotel. The attention of the staff is great. The rooms are comfortable, and have anything you need. In my case, the bed was a little short, I´m 6.3 feet, so, comfortable, but short. Not great problem. I enjoyed a lot this modern and kind hotel.

Fantastic location! So close to Times Square and Broadway. I received welcoming, friendly service from the moment I checked in. I did chang rooms after the first night as the room was terribly small, no where for both my suitcase and my partners, I had to walk/shuffle on the side to get to my side of the bed. The fridge/mini bar in the room took up way too much space in such a small room. The King room I changed too was fantastic. Yes the rooms are quite dark, and I had four different lamps in the room of which they all turned on/off differently - one I couldn't work out so had to pull out of the wall. I would stay again, I didn't have any issues with noise.

Where do I begin how awful my stay was here? I pulled up to the hotel zone, no one was out front. In fact, they has two cleaning vans blocking the way. I called from my cell in the hotel twice for help. Has to wait at least 15 min until someone came out. They came out and unloaded my bags. Told me to park my own car blocks away. NO VALET PARKING! So in a hurry I had to park at the lot next door for $65.00 a night. Then I got to my room walking through a stuffy hallway with NO AC. Looks like a coffin. NO natural light, BLACK decor. DEPRESSING. LOUDEST AC ever. SO LOUD that could not sleep well, like a train rolling by outside. People talking in HALLWAY at night, very loud too. YOU can hear everything in the hallway. I went downstairs in the morning, no coffee. Then I went out to get coffee and there is a street party going/ LABOR DAY PARADE going on! NO WARNING from the HOTEL, they knew I parked in the garage next door and they did not warn me! I can not get my car out until way after check out. I fear I will miss my flight. There were lights on under the bed I could not get off, and had to crawl under the bed to unplug them. TV clicker did not work, when I called for help from the bellman, he said it is because of the air conditioning. The TV was too "cold." Check out is at noon!!!!!! The same bellman came in my room at 11:30 am without knocking. I also itched all night...bed bugs maybe??? I want a refund but the front desk seems arrogant.... I hated my stay here. The decor is great for DRACULA and the S and M like photos in public areas make me uncomfortable....

Art-Deco rooms, nice service and easy access to all places of NYC.Only problems: shower with low strenght and and not-so-easy A/C system but minor.Anyway, very advisable hotel to stay in.Lastly: known problem of NYC: taxes, taxes and more taxes...

The location was excellent but the room was small. My room was suppose to have a City view but it wasn't a good view. The hotel was very dark with little light. It cost me $329 a night and it wasn't worth it.

We really enjoyed our stay, although the bed wasn't as comfortable as it looked, it still was an awesome room for a really good price to right in the middle of Times square. Definitely a nice place for young couples
user_name:
Allnyter
New York City, New York

review_body: The only reason I won't stay in this hotel again is the size of the rooms way too small, bathroom definitely too small only one person at the time not enough space to put your shaving belonging. And also the hotel was too dark as well.

So close from time square the Subway. But very quiet. Pur star was perfect especially thanks to the employees. I highly recommend this hotel. The only point is That the Windows offer no view on the bidon Apple. But Who want tô discover new york thru a window.

Very nice hotel with an excellent staff. Very helpfull and smiling. The interiour is a bit shabby some places, but it's cosy and has a FABULOUS vibe. Just around the corner from Times Square, loved every minute.

Great location if you are looking to be close to Times Square, nearly a half block walk to the chaos. Very quick walk to Shops, Theatre venues, everything really. It is Dark!, it is called the "Night" Hotel. Everything is Black, or white (little white). Very cool theme. I booked when my daughter saw the pictures of the rooms, and thought it was awesome. Rooms are small, but perfect for 2 people. No dresser. petite closet like space, included a umbrella, 2 robes, umbrella. Bathroom is small, but it has everything you need. Hair dryer in cabinet. Shelf along wall for all your necessities. We didn't visit NYC to hang out in the hotel. So it was perfect for our needs; a place to sleep and close to the places we needed to go for the week.Now the downfalls, Air conditioner is LOUD and makes huge pressure change in room, I am sensitive to headaches and the pressure change triggered them. Most rooms are backed to an alley, so there is no change for a breeze or fresh air.Room wasn't the cleanest. First thing I do entering a hotel is look under the bed. advice: HOTEL STAFF SHOULD CLEAN UNDER THE BED! Candy wrappers, charging cord (thankfully nothing really gross) and I found a pair of tweezers in the middle of the carpet in the room. Mind you the carpet is black and white and the tweezers were black, but....didn't you vacuum? The paint was chipping in places and other minor maintenance lacking.The Lobby Staff was standoffish and gave off a slightly condescending attitude. I couldn't tell if it was protocol or if they were just snobs. After a week there, most recognized us, and warmed up to polite greetings. I had a slight issue with my checkout bill, and front desk clerk explained why it may have been there and fixed immediately. The Cleaning Staff when encountered in the hall, just gave us weird stares and actually made me uncomfortable.Overall, good hotel at a decent price with a fun theme

Loved the hotel. It's a great location if you're walking or taking the subway, but if you're using uber it kinda sucks cause the car has to go around a couple blocks to get to you plus the traffic of times square. (Tip: if you use uber to get around it's easier to go down a street or a block away from times square and get picked up there). Rooms are small but then again so are most of the hotel rooms in NYC. Only downside was we didn't have a safe in our room, we ended up using the one in our friends room on the same floor so it was fine (although they offered to bring us a safe). Otherwise, the room was clean, staff were friendly and price wise it's not bad for it's location.

Arrived early to the hotel. That wasn't a problem and we even got an upgrade to King size room. Staff made some great eating recommendations. Very helpful and location was perfect for Broadway show. Clean and quiet rooms.

I have stayed at this hotel before. It is small but very cool and sexy. Great for a couples night out or away for a sexy weekend. The lounge is modern and dark lighting which again is a very sexy moody vibe...I will stay again...

Great centrally located hotel for business or couple's getaway. The staff is friendly, helpful and accommodating. You can walk to everything in the business district and Time's Square. Overall, a great trip and we will be back.

I had originally planned on staying one night just to get out of our stuffy apartment uptwon. I liked the place so much I stayed a second. The staff was very friendly; they did not bother us one bit with like most places with "housekeeping" knocking at regular intervals. They didn't even bother us to rush us out to check out! I can't wait to stay again.

The hotel is located in an excellent location.Don't be fooled- the rooms are VERY small. Yes, this is New York and things tend to be this way- but it was much smaller than the pictures had led me to believe.The front desk seemed to speak a lot of Spanish, so if you're a Spanish Speaker- I would imagine that this would be a plus.The night club theme was cool, nice music played in the lobby and the hallways. Pretty clean (There were a few spots in the bathroom where dust had accumulated, but it wasn't anything crazy. The staff that cleans up after you was decent- not 5*, but better than your average cleaning lady. The air conditioner was loud and not super consistent. But if you're coming here- definitely ask for a room not facing the street- that made all the difference in the world.

Great locationComfortable bedShower and sink with hot waterHotel theme is really interestingWe've booked 2 rooms on different stays, one of them had a kamasutra.There is no bathtub, window and exhaust fan in the small athroomWe had a huge rate issue with the receptionist. They wanted to charge more than we agreed.They didn't exchange our sheets when we requested for itThe doorman didn't open the door when we arrived and we were carrying five bags of 50lb each.Elevator: small, stale cigarette smellTerrible wifi signalYou have to pay daily ($30) to use the refrigeratorVery loud air conditioning Make sure you ask for a room at the back - rooms overlooking the street are very noisySmall wardrobe

I booked in last minute that room in Times Square, first time in USA and before there I visited one of my dearest friend in west palm beach... About night hotel situated obviously in the centre of New York close to everything, room was clean but very dark in white and black colour (that s the atmosphere and the concept of the hotel) from mine I can't see some special view of the city just a wall in front of my window so very sad... The price was almost the same of Sheraton hotel. Well I suggest to young couple

Great service and excellent location specially for tourists who visit NYC for the fist time (just in Times Square and really well located to visit the musts in NYC). We were really happy with the experience at the hotel and it was the 2nd time in Night Hotel!

Lovely welcome after a delayed flight. Was upgraded to a Queen room..do not know why, as the below area from room very loud and room very dark, even in the day...? Air con very loud, and didn't seem to help... Shower was lovely, but towel rail fell off wall... Twice! Was promised a little something for a birthday treat but received nothing.. Mini bar very expensive and no fridge! But overall staff great and very welcoming, location great, just s few tweaks and would be great

The only advantage that save this hotel is the location, just walking distance to Times Square are! Staffs are very unfriendly with distant attitude, noone smiles whenever the guests pass by. AC operates very loud, no breakfast, only have Japanese restaurant
user_name:
DanielTran
Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

review_body: While the hotel was in a great location and I really enjoyed the aesthetic decor of the lobby and the room, I thought the quality of the room was very poor for the price I paid. I stayed in room 44- I came in very tired and did not realize there was a step up into the bathroom. I stubbed my toe on the step & hurt it. I thought the shower was very small and did not like that there was just a curtain and the stall was not glassed in. I thought the shower was too small and the lighting in the bathroom was weird. I did not like that there weren't electrical outlets located beside the bed to charge my phone- had to plug my phone in on the other side of the room under the television. I didn't like that there weren't any windows in the hotel. I stayed at Cassa the three nights prior and it was much nicer and a much better value for the money. I won't be back at Night and I wouldn't recommend it to any of my friends or family.

I stayed from 8/11/2016 until 8/14/2016 in the Deluxe Penthouse Suite. This room is a bunch of room for little money. Excellent value in the room itself. The room is two stories. On the first floor there is a small living room area with a couch and few chairs. There is also a very nice surround sound setup. From the living area you can go to the lower terrace which is good size. It has a few chairs out there. From the living room walk upstairs to a large master suite area. The king bed was very comfy! The bathroom has a walk in shower (no door or curtain) which I love. The double sink ensured by my wife and I could get ready at the same time. The upstairs terrace is 100% private and big. You get to overlook a part of Times Square. This hotel is an adult themed hotel. Nothing graphic but not exactly kid friendly. Perfect getaway for couples or friends. You are only 1 block from Times Square and close to the trains. One thing is that you call the front desk and they will bring you some ice just FYI which they did so very quickly. Get the Deluxe Penthouse as you will be happy. The only other penthouse suite I personally paid for in NYC was over 3 times the cost of this one. I was just extremely impressed with the hotel, the staff, the room and the location. Thank you for an awesome time! Also thank you for the Christmas tree in the room since we will not be able to come back until next year. See you soon!

Room doors are noisy when it's closing so you will hear it at all times. This Asian guy at front desk was not helpful or professional in dealing with my missing jacket from my room. It's not here I don't know what to tell you was only his answer.

We stayed here for one night so that we could go to a dinner and a show. It is located right off times square. The room and bathroom was small but that is expected for NYC. No view either from the room. However, for the location and the price you really cant beat it. There is a good pub directly across the street.

The hotel is small near times square and metro in the center of manhattan.exept this nothing else to worth it.small rooms,one window only.i dont know if the project is like this but is to dark everywhere in the hotel.good for few days to do sightseeing

Walk out the hotel and turn left walk down the street and you're in Time Sq, turn right walk 2 blocks and you're on 5th Ave. Grand Central, Radio City Music hall, Rockefeller Plaza, Empire State building are all within walking distance. While the rooms are small they are comfy. The only thing i didn't like was hearing every other room doors slamming/closing at all hours of the day/night. The staff are friendly and the hotel is clean, all round i would stay here again

As soon as you walk into the lobby ... and the entire time you are there ... it is "night." The gray, black & white decor with silver accents, the blackout shades in the rooms, all lend to the feeling that evening has come.Excellent, helpful staff; comfortable beds; small bathrooms but, come on, it's NYC.We will be back again, and again....

This hotel is super small, but still has a chic feel. The location is incredible - you are seconds away from all the action of Times Square & the Theatre District. My only real complaint about this hotel is that it is not very soundproof. You can hear the comings and goings of all your neighbors - doors slamming, footsteps in the hallway, conversations, and all - at all times of day and night. Same goes for the morning cleaning crew. Not ideal for sleeping in. Great for a single traveler, but would be quite crowded quarters for more.Be wary of hotel arranged airport transportation! My ride was very nice and the convenience of having the car waiting was appreciated, but the driver charged more than was proposed by the hotel, saying it was quoted wrong. (Their rates are clearly written in the concierge book in each room - not possible that this was a simple verbal miscommunication by a staffer!) I had already gotten to the airport before the driver mentioned the rate and I didn't feel like arguing at 4:30 a.m., but felt that I had been deceived.

The hotel is in a great spot, right next to Times square. It came with a very reasonable price and the facility was good as well. We would love to be able to have a breakfast in there so that could save some costs at our NY trip. Overall the experience was very good. Thank you.

My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights and had a brilliant time, it's not your usual hotel, but that's a good thing, we wanted something quirky and it was definitely that. The staff were brilliant and always available to help out with any problems or queries. Our room was on the cosy side, but not too cosy ;)) The only down sides to the room was that it was slightly on the dark side for my wife to do her make up and the beds could do with being slightly longer! apart from that it was very nice and it was also cleaned daily. The price we paid for the location to Times Square was also very good. All in all we left the hotel at the end of our trip satisfied.

Just got back from a 5 night stay at the Night Hotel. Lovely little place.So close to Times Square but none of the noise or bustle reaches it's doors.Couldn't have been happier with the staff. Each day I started by planning my daily route with whoever was on the Reception. They had a map ready and walked me through directions to everywhere I wanted to visit. And each night they gave me decent recommendations for restaurants that were spot on every time.The rooms we had were fine. Nice size. Clean and tidy each day. Couldn't fault it.I've read previous comments about people saying their rooms were too dark. I can agree that the cupboard in my room could have done with a light in it to see things, but I found it part of the charm of a place called The Night Hotel :)

The noise coming from air conditioning machines out of the room is too high at anytime of the day. Beds, even king size ones, are too small. We couldn't rest properly in the nights. The wardrobe is tiny. Wifi barely works in the rooms (we stayed at 2 different rooms in different areas). Staff at the front desk should speak spanish or at least make an effort to speak it as they do in spanish hotels with american guests.

Room was very tiny.....but it was just for one night, very clean, bed was comfortable and small for 2 people.....bathroom was tiny..felt like I was on a cruise ship but smaller room! No view had window but you saw a wall. Very quiet. Nice front desk people.

Confirm what you think you are booking before you leave home. I booked through a third party what I thought to be a room with two double beds. My payment voucher was for a "Double Room Superior". Upon arrival the desk clerk informed us that no rooms have double beds or rooms with two beds. He half hearted made an offer that they would move us to a king room the NEXT day. We had a lot to do and I had no desire to argue. Website isn't clear. Too late to find another hotel with vacancy in the Theatre District, the 21 year old student that I sponsor and I had to share a queen bed. Awkward!!!!! Fortunately, we were rarely in the room. We came to experience Time Square and the Theatre which was incredible. I was just happy to find a decent hotel at a rate I could afford in this location.

We Loved the hotel, very clean and nice, the staff was very friendly and helpful and the hotel was a great location!!! Lots of great restaurants close by and also close to Times Square and Broadway shows. We will stay here again on our next trip!!!

I wish that I payed more attention to the negative reviews. Yes, the stuff is very unfriendly. Yes the bed is uncomfortable. What bothered me the most is noise isolation. When someone on the same floor opens closes the door, the sound is so loud that you think it slammed your bathroom door.

It definitely reeks of a sex and seduction but the overall darkness can cause fatigue after a couple of days. The room is not lighted well so you will have to struggle putting things in the closet and managing the safety box. The a/c is loud and annoying and may not suit anyone wanting a restful night. Luckily I sleep with my music on so that was not a problem for me. Not recommended for family with kids but if you are single and fuss-free, this hotel is for you. The location is amazing though.

Dreadful hotel with arrogant staff. The room was suppose to be a city view! My bottom it just face the hotel opposite. I have travelled to New York many many times and stayed in different hotels. You can do far better than this dive with arrogant staff.

This is my third time staying in Manhattan and albeit the Night Theatre District did indeed have small rooms, they're comparable to other similar boutique style hotels in and around the general Midtown area. My one complaint stems from the foot of the bed frames which make it difficult for taller people (I'm 6'1) to lay flat when sleeping. It almost feels as though the mattresses may be slightly smaller than a queen size, but don't quote me on that. Either way, comfortable mattresses, but my sleep was rather disruptive from having to constantly adjust.All else aside, it's in a great location, near major attractions and main subway lines, and the staff are great. Definitely an option for travelling couples who enjoy boutique style accommodations.

We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Cool interior design, helpful friendly staff, comfortable bed, good AC, perfect location on a calm street just next to Times Square. We got some special attention because we were on our honeymoon, and that was very much appreciated. Would absolutely stay here again.

The room was small, the bed was hard and the AC very loud. I had a hard time to sleep here. There was no windows or the building next to it so close we didnt get any daylight at all. A claustrofobic felleing.

I find the lobby a bit dark. I almost bump into the glass door. The shower pressure in our Room 70 was very, very low. I keep on hitting the soap caddy because the shower is close to the wall. I had a hard time washing my hair. The guy who looked into it said, it was the normal pressure. Probably it was because we are on the 7th floor.

Very small rooms (much smaller then I have staying in before in NYC), we also found a packet of personal lubricant still on the floor. The manager upgraded us to a larger room where the bed sheets had food scraps smeared over it. Both rooms had tiles on the floor and I the shower missing or loose and house keeping move your stuff around the room. Pay a little extra and stay somewhere else.

The hotel exceeded our expectations! It is a true gem in Time Square, close to everything you need. Excellent staff, excellent in-site sushi restaurant! A great place to stay. We are definitely recommend it!

All the team were very interested about our comfort. We're so thankful with their managements.They changed our room the 2nd day because the inner fan was very, very loud.Moreover, despite the change of room (this last was much quieter), outside noise prevented us to sleep as well as we would have liked.In any case, we had a very pleasant experience at your hotel and the best of all it's so close to Time Square as well as train stations.

stayed here for 5 nights. Rooms compact but very clean, comfy, quiet and tastefully decorated. Window faced unto a wall, but was away from road and on street noise. All you need a comfy bed, good size wardrobes, bathroom equipped with a hairdryer and good shower! Staff friendly and helpful. A great base for New york sightseeing,. 2 mins from times square.

Everything was good,except when my air went out during our second night. The hotel quickly tried to fix the issue. They did upgrade our room to our delight. Overall we had a wonderful stay and a wonderful trip.

The location of this hotel was wonderful. The rooms are very very small but we were not in our room that often which made it ok. Patrick the concierge was amazing, he really made our holiday with fantastic advice daily on where to go and what to see. Overall loved the hotel.

Not my first time being here, everything was horrible once again. Every time I came here it was a bad experience. I would have thought it may have changed each time I came back, but it it still was a disappointment. I would not recommend going back or to anyone eles.

It was just as pictured. Black/white decor edgey/artsy design. Small lobby and rooms but we knew that going in. Dark but helped you sleep, created a unique ambiance. FYI- there is a small fridge under the tableclothed round side table (did not know that until we were packing up to leave !)- GREAT location so close to Times Square and walkable to everywhere you'd want to go/see. Take the hop on/hop off bus tour various vendors offer for about $75. This place was fun because it was not the usual/standard hotel stay, more boutique style.

This find was purely accidental. I ended up at the wrong hotel and decided to try the next night. Met all of my expectations and more importantly - I slept like a baby! The staff / service / value were all great.

We just returned from spending four nights at the night hotel and had a really wonderful stay. I initially wrote an email to the reservations department a few weeks before we arrived to ask a few questions and to notate that we were celebrating our engagement and ask for an upgrade if one became available. I didn't receive a reply so I wrote back again and promptly received a response with an apology about a week before I left stating that I would be upgraded and I would also receive a complimentary bottle of red wine. When we arrived everything was in order as we had been promised. We did wait until 3pm for our room to become available but I expected that. Our room was spacious, very clean and beautifully decorated. The whole place has a very sleek and sexy vibe. I enjoyed the low lighting. The king bed that we were upgraded to was great but it was a little shorter than a normal bed... I hit my foot on the footboard a few times so taller people may have a hard time. I also found it odd that while in the shower, every two minutes or so the shower would start to turn off and then come back on... No big problem, just strange. The toiletries they provide are all natural and great. I would caution people from dining at the restaurant "the red moon" as it is deceptively expensive with very small portions. Dinner with one drink each ran us over $100 and the quality, while good, was not as great as what you could find for cheaper on nearby restaurant row. They also add on a service charge. Robert, who checked us in was really wonderful. He was very personable and friendly and took his time to chat with us and offer suggestions each time he saw us. One member of the front desk staff we encountered when we first tried to check in seemed quite snobbish and pretentious... Thank goodness his computer froze and we ended up with Robert... Much better service. It's not fun to pay a good bit of money to stay somewhere and then feel like you are looked down upon by the establishment you are paying. Thank goodness Robert understood that. My only other concern is I have been home for 4 days now and the payment has still not been debited from my account. I've stayed in a great many hotels and have not experienced this before so I'm quite sure it isn't my banks fault. Other than those minor concerns we really enjoyed our stay and had a wonderful time. I would recommend this hotel to my friends or anyone looking to stay near the theater district and would return in the future if the price is right!

This place was fantastic. Can be a little on the dark side but we found this excellent when we wanted to go to sleep. Location is great, being just a short walk from Broadway, with lots of shops and restaurant options close by.The staff were really friendly and helpful, even the cleaning staff and they provided us with a complimentary bottle of wine.We stayed here for a week with our 2 teenage daughters, I would not recommend bringing young children to this hotel.The rooms are a little on the small side but I guess that is the New York style.My family and I really enjoyed our stay at this hotel.

Great hotel. Extra thick curtains really darken the room. So you wake up when you want. Not when the sun comes up. Room was a bit small and the cupboard could do with a light. Overall really nice I would definitely recommend a stay here.
Room were small but nice.Beautiful decorations and the staff was friendly. The location is awsome (1 min walking distance from Times Square, so beware the traffic and tourists. I recomend that hotel.

Too noising I also haf to change room. The bed at the feet is not confortable . there us the wood that stop. Really dark room . the shower should have also the hand ones. For the rest it is ok . thank you.

I stayed here when it first opened - it is now old and tired. My wife cut her foot on the bed that had a jagged edge. There is not food or drink until the evening at the weekends. The room we reserved was not available so had to take a smaller one and with no recompense just an apology. I could swear there used to be a gym here but I may be mistaken on that. Basically it was cool and a little edgy and is now just another mid-range average hotel with bedroom navigable dangers. Avoid.

Rm 67 ac loud, but if you lay in bed with head at foot...it's tolerable. Not allowed to use mini-bar as refrigerator...not good for diabetic. We had to be close to PlayStation theater and it was that. Now that I have knowledge of area, probably wouldn't stay again, unless price was issue. I had no problem with room, bed was nice. I liked having view of street.

Perfect location,Tmes Square, fifth avenue are nearby. Many places were you can eat are nearby. The rooms are very small, but nice. Staff was very friendly and helpfull. Drinks at the hotel are very expensive.

Perfect Location but rooms were very small.2 Mins walking distance from Times Square.Otherwise I don't have any other complains.Little bit expensive and sometimes you feel you don't get any amenities in what you have paid for.

Rooms were small but nice. Beautiful decorations. Staff was friendly. Restaurant was ok. Drinks were good but sushi wasn't fresh. Never got the voucher for drink tickets as promised. Don't be fooled. Although it says Theater District, it's smack in the center of Times Square so beware the traffic and tourists. Over all, I'd stay there again.

I was already frustrated by arriving to the city late. I was informed that there would be self parking available. However, there was a slight miscommunication with the hotel and parking garage that works with them. I was unable to self park my car and there weren't any self parking garages near times square. All of them are valet. The room was small and cozy and great for what i intended for the weekend. a tile in the bathroom floor was a bit loose, room needs some maintenance. The bed mattress had some stains. The cable box was on a piece of wood sitting directly on top of the tv which is unsafe. Location is noisy due to continuous road construction through the night. But patrick was an excellent help with answering all of my questions. He upgraded my room and went out of his way to fulfill my special request. Good location and lovely decor.

Everything from the staff, location, bar, and rooms was immaculate. I will be back to this hotel ever time I'm in Manhattan. Kudos and thank you again. U wish I could remember the front desk guy with the Boutonniere on his lapel. He was the best.

My partner and I had the best experience at the Night Hotel. We arrived earlier than expected in New York and they were able to accommodate us another night prior to our 5 night booking in the King Deluxe room. Ontop of the beautiful rooms, amazing bathrooms and the great location for Times Square (2 min walk), I would like to give a huge thanks to Patrick at reception who pointed out all the hotspots of New York (food, desserts, discount tickets for broadway), and was a massive help in directing us how to get where and actively seeking times, if there was any construction that might delay us etc. He gave us maps and wrote down the subway lines how to get to certain places, a service I have never received in a month of my American travels at any hotel. Overall, Patrick went above and beyond and we highly recommend this place for anyone and everyone!

When I arrived it was much earlier than anticipated, but I was greeted kindly and allowed an early check-in. I was not told that this would charge me an additional 50$. I booked a supreme queen room through travelocity and when I walked into my room I did not have the amenities that were advertised. I decided to overlook that. I opened the mini fridge and there were several cans in the fridge that were already open from previous guests. Thankfully after discussing this with the front desk, I was not unnecessarily charged but it made me question the cleanliness of the establishment. The problem with the room ultimately came down to being placed in a room where construction was being done right outside of my window. Everyday I was there. Very early in the morning. They were so close that I could hear every word in their conversations. I don't know if the timing of my visit had anything to do with it, but I would have liked to think that staff would be aware of these types of issues and make accommodations for it.
user_name:
melissawQ8635VI
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Good location a block from Times Square. Excellent and helpful staff. Tiny rooms, clean but not well maintained. Shower handle was falling off, soap dish was falling off, air conditioner was ridiculously loud - about 120 decibels. Might be OK for one person for a night or two, but not advised for two people for more time. Just too small. Priceline calls this hotel "4 stars" and it's priced accordingly. Sorry, but it's more like 3 stars at best. Quality of fit and finish is about the same as a Best Western motel room, with less space and a really loud air conditioning system.

The hotel's rooms and bed are small but they have a great location and discount parking price at a parking garage. The hotel was dark which to me made it different but interesting. For the price I would stay again.

This is the second time we have visited New York the first was for twelve days in 2014 and the seven days in 2016 would recommend this hotel,as close to Time Square and friendly and helpful staff. The room is clean. The lighting is quite dim but overall excellent hotel.

this is a very nice hotel with i't own character, just off Time Square it puts you in the heart of the city. The room was very nice and the staff were very friendly and welcoming and willing to help at any time if needed.

The check in took little on no time, the service provided by the workers was excellent. Check out was at 12 and they do offer to hold your bags if you plan on using the reminder of your day to visit places nearby. The rooms were a bit small but the location makes up for it!

There's both good and bad points about this hotel.The good? The location is fantastic, right in the middle of everything with Times Square subway around the corner. The price was also fairly reasonable for the 5 nights we stayed.The bad? Obviously this is New York so the rooms aren't the biggest but the issue was the darkness of the rooms. I'm reliably informed that for a woman it's almost impossible to do your makeup properly without taking your own huge LED light to be able to see properly.We did have an issue after checkout where they charged us for a bottle of wine that we didn't have but it was eventually sorted out and refunded.

My room was small (as is to be expected in NYC I guess), but clean and comfortable. The hotel was surprisingly quiet - and small! I had not expected a hotel near Times Square to be this small. Staff were helpful and friendly. The hotel is close to at least two subway stations and Times Square. The hotel does not serve breakfast, but it's easy to find a place to eat near Times Square anyway. Nice sushi restaurant for lunch/dinner/drinks on the first floor.

My wife and I spent 2 nights at the hotel.Lets start with the good- the loction was great! 10 seconds off times square.The bad stuff- the staff wasn't so nice and professional, we got a small room, the BED was TINY!! I'm not a tall guy and the bed was just short!! The room was demp, no air at all, the darkness was tolerable, the carpet didn't look clean....Bad experience for us...

It was a great experience the room was great!!!! Definitely would it again. Staff was very nice and knowledgeable. The view in my room was great. Restaurants were close and the location of hotel was perfect

Fantastic location, reasonably priced for location, very clean and fun design. Staff were very friendly. Room was slightly small for price. Construction was being done on the street but staff were very accomodating for making changes to rooms. Would definitely use this hotel again.

Great location, just around the corner from Times Square and the subway.Staff were very helpful.Rooms are on the small side but thats NYC!The only thing we weren't too happy with was the Air Con, when it did kick in and begin to work it was very noisy, so loud that we could watch the TV without the volume being all the way up.We would stay here again..

The hotel is close to Time's Square without all the noise and crowds. Street is full of numerous hotels that is nice so few late night street bars.Small details of hotel use is showing, broken light dimmers and switches. Frayed carpet in small areas...normal wear. Cool decorating style
user_name:
michaellU4264PP
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is in the middle of everything! 3 minutes walking to Times Square and 6 min walking to the shows! Amazing service, great bar and restaurant! The rooms are perfect for 2 people! Very dark decor, black walls in the bathroom, everything is very modern and new!

Loved the Dark theme of the Night Hotel.. The room was small yet cozy.. The only thing i didnt like was the broken shower handle wich made it hard to adjut shower temp and the broken floor tiles with in the shower. I was a bit disapointed because I love a good shower.... Other than that .. i would stay again

Warm, gracious staff, very attentive to any issues, quick response and the room was immaculate and very comfortable. The duplex penthouse suite is AMAZING with its large living room, a bathroom on each floor and outdoor patio on each floor! Best hotel I've ever stayed at among dozens in NYC and a few in other states, including one where President Obama stays at when in Denver. The Night Hotel Theater District hotel beats them all! Best possible recommendation!!!
user_name:
georgepM3183HV
New York City, New York

review_body: It was top dark Inside the room and a little bit small, with an even smaller window! Beside this, the location of the hotel is great, Patrick at the front desk is even greater and we had a Beautiful stay at ny .

I did not like the "night" theme. Everything was painted black and it felt like the middle of the night all the time - no matter how much the sun shined outside. It was just dark and depressing.We had paid extra for a room with a city view, and I would not recommend that. I appreciate that "a view" in such a big city just means looking at the building across the street and that it will also mean noice from traffic. However, the windows were so thin that we could here people talking in the street even though we were on the 4th floor. Apart from that it was a good experience. The hotel was very clean, the people very friendly and helpful and the location was perfect.

Best location so close to Times Square, amazing hotel, very cute and comfy. 10/10. Awesome staff they greeted me straight away and we're always smiling. I wouldn't stay anywhere else now it is my favourite place to stay at

The hotel is like 50m from The Times Square, in the heart of the city. Rooms are small but stylish - but you don't come to NY to sit in the room. Front desc staff is polite and helpful, we arrived very early after a long flight and they offered another ( smaller) room right away. So- worth the money, perfectly located, nicely furnished, you could even say posh.

We loved staying at Night Hotel Theatre District! The staff was great and gave us a great surprise with a bottle of champagne (we were celebrating our anniversary). Location is amazing: next to Times Square. Would choose it again! A++

We have stayed in this hotel for 1 night, the staff are friendly rooms are clean, but they are too small for comfort bathroom is badly furnished no space to but any thing not even your tooth brush!, Windows don't isolate outside noise! I would not consider this hotel 4 star maybe 2 star max, also We requested for late check out and I only got one hour.Will NOT stay in this hotel again!

Whilst it would have been nice for a couple of nights. I've since seen more value for money accommodation with bigger rooms for your money. A quick few nights fine, any longer the dark small rooms get on your nerves. No bath, just shower would have been nice after all the NYC walking

If you're looking for the generic big-hotel experience, this is not the place for you. If you want something unique and personal, then it checks the boxes. The decor is unapologetically bold. You either love it or at least appreciate it. Either way, it's a refreshing change from beige and brown walls and generic stock artwork. Fitting as it's in the heart of the theatre district. The location is great and it's easy to get anywhere on foot or metro. The staff are genuine and speak to you like real people as opposed to using the same script and demeanor that the big hotels share. Like any other NYC or boutique hotel, the rooms are small. They are however, clean, pleasant, and have character. If you're deciding whether to stay here, just ask yourself one question. Do you want mustard or grey poupon? Both achieve the same purpose, but one is far more interesting.

Absolutely loved it. Amazing hotel. Lovely and helpful staff. Perfect location. I was travelling alone and felt completely safe there. The staff was so helpful and friendly they made me feel very at home.

I've stayed here before and was looking for a chill evening after traveling from Paris. I couldn't recommend the gentleman who checked me in any more highly. He helped me sort out my room and was fantastic. The room ended up being very nice and quiet. It was great. THEN....I realized i hadn't remembered my US charging plug for my iPhone. And then it began...."We have lost too many of those""You can leave your phone here at the front desk""I'm sorry I can't let you take it" These were some of the comments from the afternoon/evening person. I offered to leave my license. To leave an extra "hold"'on my room in dollars to cover the precious $5 item I couldn't find in the surrounding shops that evening. Clearly disturbed, he exasperatingly have it to me and said "clearly you aren't taking no for an answer". "I'm a grown up. I'll bring it back" was my reply. So instead of relaxing in my room, I checked my charge to be sure he didn't have a stroke. Instead of recuperating from my travels, I checked my phone to see if I was fully charged. So the poor guy didn't have a stroke. Instead of enjoying my evening, I checked over and over and had to ration my battery life. I returned the plug about an hour later and was again told (by a new person) it wasn't possible for me to keep it overnight. I asked him to make sure the other guy knew it was back. After all, I wanted him to sleep well and not worry. So that evening, instead of being in touch with business and personal contacts, I rationed my charge. Not cool. To make it worse, on check out, they ASKED ABOUT THE PLUG. So, not only were they overwhelmingly concerned about the plug, the failed to note when it was returned. Despite my offering my room number upon return. So that's that. What began with a helpful and super efficient check in was completely ruined by someone with a bad attitude and disinterest in being helpful. Maybe you should realize travelers stay and want to rest. We sometimes forget things. In this case it was a super inexpensive item capable of making my stay more relaxing. Instead, it became the focal point of worry for me as i spent the evening charging and then worrying about work emails.The room- fairly clean. A little rough around the edges with the paper cover to shelf in bathroom coming off. Overall ok. Service score reflects a 5 for check in and a 1 for the other person. So averaging to a 3

Walking into the Night Hotel was interesting and unique. The service was very good. The rooms are very small, but the decor is very interesting. Overall, the location and service were great, they were very clean as well. ..... Just to small for our liking. It was fine for two nights and we were busy all day so we slept there only... Which made it bearable.

uncomfortable small dark room with an unpleasant odour in the bathroom. There was no closet. The airco had a very loud noise. The floor was full of stains and there were old handkerchiefs under the matress.

Visited at Christmas, great hotel! Rooms aren't huge but I didn't visit NYC to sit in my hotel room all day. Luxury hotel and it was an enjoyable stay! Staff are helpful and could recommend good restaurants on the evenings we didn't dine in the hotel.

NYC-sized hotel rooms (basically a bed with two feet on both sides), but there was also a minibar and a small desk where I could put my luggage. It seemed clean, smelled good. The shower was missing a bunch of tiles on the floor which need to be repaired. It had the usual amenities (hair dryer, ironing board, iron) and free WiFi which worked fine for me, but no coffee maker. My room on the 2nd floor was quiet (faced an inner fire escape) from street noise or noise from other patrons. I heard nothing. The staff was friendly enough, but somewhat self-absorbed (e.g., I had to wait for them to look up from their phones to get checked in or to answer a question when I came to the desk). Nobody seemed to have a lot of energy to be helpful. The main issue with the room had to do with the "night/goth" theme. Everything was low lighting and dark. It made the room feel very dingy and difficult for me to read or to do work in the room. The HVAC was very erratic--either extremely cold or extremely warm. The thermostat seemed to take hours to adjust and was very noisy.That said, it was in a fantastic location near the Theatre District and lots of sightseeing and shopping. Easy to get to subways. I walked from Penn Station (34th street) with my luggage with no difficulty (but I'm fit and carry one 22-inch roller bag and a backpack). If they improved the lighting options (for the over 50 crowd), I would definitely stay here again.

There were all the comforts in the room, but the hotel is an old one with small rooms.Also i didnt like the colour combination , black and white in the whole building.Finally its a hotel in the central of the city, near to all transportation means,is recommended for bussinesspeople.

We stayed for 2 nights at the Night Theatre District Hotel.Staff:Staff were very friendly and accommodating with suggestions on where to go and what to see.Room:We booked a king suite that overlooked the street. The suite (room 47) was surprisingly quiet and spacious for a downtown New York hotel.Location: The hotel is right in the theatre district right off of Times Square. Conveniently located to everything.I would definitely stay here again.

Location of the hotel is really good. The facilities are good but nothing extraordinary. The bed was good. The corridors were a little too dark at noght so it was kind of difficult to clearly see where to walk and insert the card in the room´s door.

Everything in the room was broken and the staff couldn't repair. Upon checkout, was overcharged by over $500! Never again! Kind staff and Time Square location couldn't makeup for completely nonfunctional room. Everything was broken. Everything.

Room was super small but great overall customer service from the desk clerk. I did feel like the rooms could again have been larger to allow to put luggage down but it is New York. The only thing I would like to see is some sort of drink coupon for the bar downstairs.

It looks nice on pictures but man it was small! Not bad decor but man it's small, if you like small then this place is for you, but for the price I paid per night, I think there's definitely better hotels

All tiles on the bathroom floor were loose. The sink didn't have a plug, so anything you might accently drop falls right thru. The old flatscreen t is way outdated, not even providing a HDMI connecting. The aux box, mounted on a raw piece of black wood above the tv at approx. 7 feet, sat in so much dust that it might not work anymore because that.The light design incl. "exhausted" dimmer switches only allow super bright or pitch black.It's a shame considering how hip and well thought thru the hotel appeared the first years after its opening.

Nice place overall, with a hip/trendy feel. it was very small for two. Friendly staff. It is a great location, just a couple blocks from Time Square. Near many theaters, subway and restaurants. I wish they had provided coffee.

It's John Wick meets Posh Spice. My husband and I came here for a weekend getaway and he loved the black and white theme. I think the rooms were average size for NYC, not too small. Great location, steps from Times Square. I do feel the hotel targets more couples and singles (as there are photographs in the lobby of topless women), so I wouldn't bring my young children here, but that's just me. The hotel bar was too pricey for my taste ($40 for 2 drinks). You can go directly across the street and get 2 pints of great beer for less than $15.

We love staying at Night and will again. The staff is friendly, courteous and helpful and the rooms are beautifully decorated and comfortable. The location is perfect if you are visiting Broadway or going uptown to museums.

I travel to NYC quarterly for work, and have stayed at the Night Hotel every time, the rooms aren't very big, but they are clean and comfortable which works for me. Also there are two locations, one on 47th and one on 45th, both are close to time square which makes it very convenient for anyone who wants to be close to the action.

I got bed bug bites from the room. The air was either freezing or warm and muggy there was no in between . And the lighting of our room was horrible, it was too dark and it was difficult getting ready or seeing.
user_name:
kittycrutch
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My overall rating is very good. The location at Times square could not be better, so central and close to subway. The team is fantastic and rooms are just perfect. A bit sad that no breakfast is offered.

This is the perfect place for vampires: The moment you enter the black hole the daylight is banned from intruding. The lobby is pitch black and so was my room. I actually needed a flashlight to see inside the closet. My window looked out into a 3-foot-wide alley, where I could guess that there was daylight way above. I had no place to put my shirts or socks, hanging room only in the closet. The staff is immensely friendly and attentive. Checking out I said "next time I'll bring my night goggles". The humorous answer was: "That's why it is the NIGHT HOTEL. Next time you might want to check into the DAY'S INN."

I stayed here for work, around the corner from my office. Otherwise I would have checked out after day 1. The rooms are SO tiny and so dark. The bed feels like you are sleeping in a coffin--it's depressing. This is probably the only hotel I have ever not wanted to spend time in. On the plus side free wifi is great (and it's pretty good) and it's very close to Times Square. But unless I have to for work, I will never stay at this hotel again.

Nice hotel - shame about the noise - between 3 and 4 am the bin wagons have a fight in the street for about an hour making more noise than you could think possible if they were really trying. Second floor room in the road was impossible to sleep through

The hotel was nicely decorated and the staff was fantastic to work with and greeting you as family. My only negative was that the minibar is placed so far under the table, it is hard to see and there is not light there which made it especially hard. My room was at the front of the building so the noise from the garbage trucks was especially bad during certain hours of the night and during the morning.

I stayed there for a week during my business trip to NY. I found the staff very gentle and efficiente, the room really comfortable and clean. Unfortunately I missed the chance to experience the bar and the restaurant

I booked last minute hotel stay, once arrived the checkin process took really 30 seconds, they just swiped my card and keys were ready. Same with check out.The room was NYC size, but very well decorated, clean and cozy.The hotel is located right by the time square, my room was not facing the street, so it was very quiet.I would definitely stay here again.
user_name:
Mikhail R
New York City, New York

review_body: Great location and excellent service, from the welcoming to the checkout.My room was very dark: though I appreciated the style of the hotel (with dark and grey colour choice), the lighting of the room was poor, making hard to read the tourist guide or a newspaper. Cleanness of very high standard, yet bed was short and uncomfortable.All in all, I'd anyway recommend the hotel.

Everything from the room to the staff was superb. I was greeted warmly and the doorman helped me take my heavy luggage up to my room.Reception was very helpful in helping me with my bags at the end of my stay and in booking a car to get to the airport. I had a very enjoyable stay.

Incredibly friendly and efficient staff make all the difference at this gorgeously furnished hotel right next to Times Square. Serene interiors and atmosphere make this an invaluable escape. Patrick on reception was a true stand-out although everyone we dealt with was amazingly helpful.

I saw the Hotel when I was looking for something close to Time Square and the price was better than some of the other chain Hotels in the area. I was skeptical, but decided to give it a tray. At the end of the day, you are in NYC and all you need is a bed. However, once we arrived, we were welcomed by Patrick at the front desk and he is probably one of the most friendliest front desk managers I have met at a Hotel. He provided us with great recommendations and reading our desires / price expectations for food, etc. perfectly. The room was just as expected. They did a nice job with the interior design to make the room look larger and to break up the square foot print. Wif wast fast and the TV had free on demand from all the major channels including HBO. Our room had no view, but who cares. We faced the next building behind, but because of that we literally heard nothing from the City at night and were able to open the window. I was really surprised and it was nice to have fresh air and no nice from the street. The beds were comfortable, although if you are tall, your feet might hit the rim at the end of the bed. But that is a problem you will face with every bed if you are tall. Location is awesome. 2 minutes and you are at time square. Across from the Hotel are three Irish pubs with decent dinner and prices, a shop/cafe if you need to buy water, coffee, or some food to go, subway stations are in close proximity. Broadway shows are in close proximity. The red line bus sightseeing tours are starting close by and you can easily make the walk to central park. So overall, nice staff, great location. I have found my NYC Hotel for future trips.

Not as luxury as expected. Poor response from management. Still waiting to hear back from management after replying with 2 separate emails. Wifi was very poor, non existent most of my stay. The light switch was broken and sharp to touch.
user_name:
j98scorpio
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Very small but perfectly appointed room. Couldn't get the temperature down. A bit cold. Nice resto. Love it all. Great location. Very easy to get out of city afterward. Rooms are a bit dark until you learn how to turn the lights up. Great decorating to optimize smallness of room. Nice welcome at front desk.

Incredible location being right in the middle of the theater district so only minutes walk from any and all the Broadway shows. Room was larger than expected given some reviews, bed was extremely comfortable, all in all a great stay for myself and my 12 year daughter.

Perfectly situated, the Night Hotel was a delight from check in to check out. The staff were fantastic, nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were spacious and clean, with good soundproofing to ensure a good nights sleep.. From now on no other hotel in New York will do.

Our stay at Night could not have been more perfect! Our room was clean, the bed comfortable and the staff could not have been more hospitable. This is our new place to stay while we're in the city. Enjoyed every second!

The hotel concierge was wonderful and extremely friendly to work with. The rooms are very tidy though smaller because it is in the city, exactly 1 block from Times Square. We decided to go with this hotel based on the sleek black and white look and the deal we were getting. The room we had was a full (which was a little small for me, a 5'4" female and my fiance, a 6'2" male, but we made it work for the 3 nights we were there). For what we paid and the location we were at it was completely worth it. We were in walking distance to everything so we saved a lot on subway, cab and uber travels. The only downfall for us was that there is only 1 elevator that seemed to take forever. The hotel has a bar in the back that is also very sleek and a great hangout spot for downtime in the city. I would recommend this hotel to friends.

The concierge was very friendly, the room was clean with beautiful decor, and the location was convenient. The rooms were very quite and easy to sleep in as well. The only negative was the view, the windows were facing a brick wall.
user_name:
kyles007
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed in the Night hotel which was just "around the corner" from Times Square , Fabulous location as we where there for NewYears, The rooms are a little small and a little dark but it is a boutique hotel and that was what I wanted, The Staff where excellent anything I wanted, from trips, shows and surprises for my wife where no trouble at all to Organise.

This is a cool little hotel right in the middle of the action. If you don't mind being in a small room with no view and walls that at times seem way too thin, then this place will do because everything else was great. Ours was a short stay so we did not visit the restaurant or bar.

The hotel is located in the middle of the night scene. A minute walk from Times square. The staff was friendly and welcoming and the room was clean and tidy. The room that we had did not face the street so the only window just opened to a wall....

Me and my husband came to nyc for a belated honeymoon, we initially booked a Airbnb but after some terrible reviews we was forced to cancel with literally 2 days to find somewhere. After looking multiple sites we found this hotel on hotels.com and at £589 for 4 nights we booked straight away as the location and price Awas amazing!!! The check in was quick and smooth and be known to me my husband had emailed asking for roses and champers to be put in our room which they normally cannot do but was added at literally $30 our room was lovely but after speaking to Patrick at the front desk and when he found out we was honeymooning he upgraded us to the King suite which was so spacious and amazing and we even a view of the street below. We was literally 1 min from time square and as a light sleeper (I have a 16 month old son) I found falling asleep not a issue! We filled In a quick survey in our room which also gave us 2 free drinks at the bar downstairs! I cannot stress enough how much we enjoyed our stay here and Patrick at the front desk was not only amazingly helpful but so down to earth and willing to help us find the best pubs in nyc! He honestly made the trip for us!!!! We would 1000% come back to this hotel it has everything u could need and more!!Thank u Patrick for making us feel welcome!!!! The vaughans xxxx

If you read a bad review on here - be sure to take into account what they are complaining about and then what they are paying. This place is on the cheaper side of comparable hotels, offers a free bottle of wine if you book through their website (same price), and will bend over backwards to make your stay comfortable. For the price, it was very well taken care of. Are there little things here and there that could use a little upkeep - of course - but overall the room was awesome, clean, funky, and yes - tiny. It was fun to take pictures in the room because it came out like a black and white picture. Daniela at the front desk was a rock star - and took care of everything that we could have possibly needed.

The hotel was ideally located in midtown Manhattan, No need for local transport, well within walking distance of several theatres and restaurants. Excellent service from the staff. Decoration a little dark but not off-putting. Very nice and comfortable room, but could be improved with the addition of light catering facilities, kettle etc.

Very tired... Extremely small and poorly equipped. I get that it's called the "Night Hotel". It was difficult to get ready without a full length mirror and proper lightening available.You have to leave the hotel to get breakfast or even a coffee in the morning.The restaurant that opens at lunch was excellent.There were several Maintainance issues that occurred over the five days.Realistically this is a quasi enonomy hotel trying to act as a boutique which results in mixed signals and confusion as to guest expectation.It is ideally located and the staff are extremely friendly

Location could not be better! Next to the Times Square, no need to use metro. Walking distance to several theaters and restaurants. Room was a bit dark, black colours and not enough light and street noices was heard inside all night long. New York never sleeps... Bathroom is huge but more space for your personal things would be nice. Cleaning works fine and the bed is good. Great place to stay, good value for money. Staff very helpful. Recommended.

I loved the Black and White Gothic themed Hotel, Location was perfect in the heart of Time Square. The hotel Staff are extremely friendly and helpful in providing advise on what to see and do, and how to best get there.

Really good price for the location, nice and helpful staff. Really weird shower (no tub, just a curtained off area with a shower head and drains) and very weird art in the hallways. Everything is black and gray, lowlit, going for a Fifty Shades vibe, but aside from that I'd definitely stay here again. Three irish pubs across the street :)

I loved my stay at this hotel. It was so welcoming when I walked into the lobby. Staff so happy! Has a few cocktails at the bar, and boy can they make an awesome skinny Magarita. I knew the rooms were smaller, but not that small! They were quaint and intimate. Would definitely go back for the price, quality and location!!

The hotel was very nice. Very modern, very clean. The bathroom and shower were very large. It's a great location - basically in the center of Times Square - and it felt safe and quiet enough. It did kind of feel like an erotic hotel, so maybe this isn't the best place for kids.

As a hospitality worker I know how it feels to work the late shifts, early morning shifts and still smile while assisting a guest. Alex was amazing from start to finish. At check-in he got straight to the point. It was swift and easy, I asked to add my accompanying guest name to the reservation and he did so she was able to get a key to access the room. I booked a king room with a view which was great except there was some construction noise that woke me up very early in the morning. I think I may opt for a room without view next time or maybe a quiter view. Overall I love the decor of the hotel lobby, hallways and room. I've always wanted to stay at this property because of its unique style. As others have said it is a very dark scene however I LOVE IT. It really just made me WANT to relax which is a plus for me as I'm always stressed after a long week of working the front desk at my hotel in midtown. I requested for an extra blanket and I swear whoever delivered it must have flown to us because it got there less than 5 mins. Also there was a light out under the bed, but I didn't bother to have it fixed it wasn't a big deal to me.In the morning we were greeted by Patrick very nice guy, he went over my billing and checked us out. We then saw Alex again who was covering for a bellman who called out lol. Again hes a pleasant and great worker. Thank you for your service guys. We will definitely be back.
user_name:
ClarkAshley
New York City, New York

review_body: Very small room (nearly impossible to move with 2 bags) , close to the fire excape (very noise, people constantly opening and closing it). Too dark. Not clean enough. They charge you to use the refrigerator.

I have one big concern about this hotel - it has just one elevator. There is no other elevator such as a service elevator for use when the one elevator fails to operate. The hotel has eight stories and there are no rooms on the ground floor. If you cannot walk up to eight flights of stairs when the elevator fails, you would be playing Russian roulette by staying there.Location - excellent.Room size - very small. I put my clothes in night stand. Very little storage. No luggage stand and virtually no room for open luggage except on bed. I stayed alone for two nights, and it was okay for me.Staff - wonderful.Hotel halls very narrow.Lighting in rooms and common areas is very low/subdued. I want brighter lighting.Everything was clean and sharp.In my opinion, hotel is 2.5 to 3 stars at most, but location is excellent.Steve McEvoyWest Chester, PA

Excellent location very close to Times Square. Located in the Theatre District with lots to do.The room was very stylish and modern. Perfect for a short stay in New York with a few friends. Also the pricing was very reasonable for New York prices.

The remore didn't work very well, we had to rase our hand to change channels, it was actually very annoying since my husband got sick we stayed all day in there.. The rest was excellent, very clean and everybody was nice

Very good location, 2 minute walking to Times Square.Small bathroom but clean, and the amenities were fantastic!If you open the fridge they count like if you have drunk something, but they advise it to you at the moment of the check in.The staff was not friendly, a little bit curt but correct.

Great service and great rooms! Patrick at the front desk helped me get to where I needed to go.My only complaint was the TV (cable) kept going out. Probably just a loose cable. Loved the shower and a great comfy bed!I travel a lot and people are not always friendly. The staff here is top notch!

You could not wish for a better location if you want to stay in the center of New York. Just a minute walk from Times Square, yet the hotel is quiet.Plenty of transportation available. Sightseeing points are quick to get to.Near restaurants and theaters.The room was very nice, with a small but functional bathroom with a great shower.Very friendly, helpful service. I would defintily recommend this hotel.

Room was very nice. Beautiful, tastfule decor without looking tacky or cheap at all. Great room at night, but my only complaint would be that it is a bit dark when getting ready in the morning. Very friendly, helpful service, and centrally located. Didn't try the restaurant, but it looked lovely. Would absolutely recommend.

Location near Times Square might seem an issue, but here it's an asset. Hotel is quiet, plenty of transportation available, rooms well appointed and staff is helpful with any issue. Near important business offices on one side and near theaters on the other. Short distance to Grand Central and to Penn Station. Best asset is the staff which helps both with the hotel as well as information about locations and resources nearby. Great choice.

Location was great but I expect a queen or king size bed (or 2 doubles) in a 3-4 star hotel. Room was tiny. With dark gray-black walls, I felt that I was sleeping in a box. Would have been a very nice 2.5 star hotel IF I wanted to sleep in a double.
user_name:
Cheryl M
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel is perfect for couples who want to enjoy Times Square and Manhattan. Sightseeing points are quick to get to. Unfortunately the standard room is very small and warm without ac. If ac runs, it's too loud. Check mini bar bill at checkout!

The night hotel is located half a block from times square so is an easy walk to every thing. The staff are really friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but for the price and location is whats expected. The only bad point for me was how dark the rooms were which made it hard to get up in the morning. Every thing else was great.

This dark sexy hotel is located next to everything ! Literally 2 blocks from everything .. Restaurants and theatres and nightlife and Times Square. The staff is wonderful. Mary was so helpful on the phone and Patrick at the desk was so pleasant and accommodating , and bi-lingual. The room was smaller but clean and sexy , and above all quiet and affordable ! Well worth it . We will definatly be back.

I was surprised by just how small the room was. but I was staying alone so I didn't care too much. I loved the decor and the atmosphere. Everyone was very nice and seemed to put much effort into making the guests feel welcomed. My only real complaint was the restaurant: the food was lackluster and the whole restaurant smells like smoke from the adjoining smoking patio. It made the food even more unappetizing. TINY bar so don't expect to sit in a lounge and have drinks. but you could them over to the comfy couches in the lobby. All in all, I would stay there again in a heartbeat - but I would go elsewhere for dinner.

nice hotel with great design very welcoming staff and but its very small there is no room to breath and AC was very old and keeps making noise that makes the sleep default . in conclusion I don't recommend it without a good deal.

We don't usually choose contemporary hotels but there was something unique about this place. It was lovely, comfortable and a fantastic location. We didn't use the restaurant so we can't comment but it is so close to everything you can't go wrong.

This property oozes mystique and dark elegance. For those coming to the City by auto, you need to be aware to drive to Meyers on W 43rd or 44th St to park. One can walk thru Millennium lobby if weather is inclement as a direct path to W 45th. We stayed in a King Suite which was lovely, beautifully appointed and super clean!!! Be mindful that hotels in NYC tend to be smaller unless you wish to pay King's ransom for a big room. But this location is divine for proximity to the Theater and some fab nightlife. If you are concerned about noise, bring some ear plugs. This property is one of my favs! I understand the mattresses were custom designed for the hotel. I had the BEST night's sleep ever....I would love to know the make.

The rooms are small, the view is nothing special (some have no view at all). But once you settle in, Otis comfortable and fit our needs nicely. It is very easy to get around from this hidden jewel. Time Square is one block away from the front door. There are very good neighborhood "pubs" near by for something quick to eat or drink. Near theaters and very nice restaurants.

We stayed for 5 nights in this hotel, the room was as it looks on the perfect, dark and sexy. The bed was more than comfortable and clean.The location is perfect, just cross the street to be in Times Square, the staff is friendly and helpful.

The Night Hotel Theater District is a great location for the Broadway scene. The rooms were comfortable although small which is normal for NY. This Night Hotel is appropriately named because it is very dark: the lobby, the bar and the rooms are all dark. We were happy to walk out in the daylight. We visited the other Night Hotel Times Square and the difference in the lobby was "night and day". The lobby, bar and restaurant were light and bright. Did not see the rooms, but one person in our group had stayed there and said the rooms were comparable.

Super location right in the middle of Manhattan without the worst noice! Small rooms and a very small bed for two persons, also very dark in the hallways. The room itself was cool. Overall clean, the straff was ok. Nice with the free entrance to a large gym near by.

Everyone was excellent....The room was wonderful..It was my birthday & I was comped a bottle of champagne...I will be staying again...great hotel...I would recommend this hotel to any one who wants to be close by Times Square...
user_name:
kashawnm2016
New York City, New York

review_body: A very convenient location. Wonderful staff. The rooms are very small. But clean and modern. Also a very good value for being right in the theatre district. The look is very modern and hip. The only negative is the room size but it worked for a one night stay.

I chose the Night hotel after a lot of research, due to the amazing price and location. When we arrived we were early and our room wasn't ready so they held our bags for us while we explored the city.
