Everyone we encountered at the front desk was very friendly and helpful w/ our questions. We were given excellent advice on where to get a good steak dinner at a place called STK. Great atmosphere, very hip and very good food. My only issue was how dark the room was. We had a room on the second floor that the window looked out into an alley. So even during the day it was super dark. The room was small as most people have stated, but that didn't bother me. I would definetly stay here again but would probably pay a little extra if needed to stay on a higher floor w/ a window that actually let sunlight in.

Funky hotel focused on sleep quality and they deliver. BEST LOCATION in the city and suprisignly great price. Use the DVD service. Great toiletries! Small rooms but this is New York. Get over it, and enjoy your Night.
user_name:
Lourdes B
New York City, New York

review_body: Gorgeous hotel. Fantastic location. Will definitely stay there if I visit NY again. Friendly and efficient service. Clean towels and bedding each day. Couldn't ask for more to be honest. Great value all round.
user_name:
dizzydonna18
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: Our room was not well maintained show knob was broken and there was floor missing fro the shower! Carpet lookedreally dirty and some howthere was miss communication whenwegothe room rented. Not recommened!

Can't ask for a better location! Very clean hotel and cool atmosphere with the black and white theme! Friendly staff at front desk - very helpful with guiding you on where to go and what to see. Would definitely recommend!

Excellent hotel in a prime location. Bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was really nice as well. The only thing i didn't like was the fact that the water from the shower did not go down, outside of that everything is perfect.

The hotel is well situated on 45th and Broadway and was easy to find. We were greeted by friendly staff and check in was easy. I can't fault the staff but the rooms were noisy - the air conditioning was so loud that you couldn't have it on when you were sleeping, and the rooms were hot! We were also woken up every time the next room used their sink as it was so loud coming through. The sounds of the corridor permeate through the walls easily which means you get often woken up. Not bad but could be better!

If you're visiting NYC, it's unlikely you will be spending a ton of time in your room. While the rooms are small, the entire atmosphere of the hotel is incredibly unique and oozes cool. Definitely not a hotel for children, the decor is super dark and sexy. The location is within very reasonable walking distance of all the popular attractions (around the corner from Time Square and all theaters). More importantly, this prime locations is super accessible to public transportation making it easy to explore the other great neighborhoods this city has to offer. Don't expect insane amenities, this hotel provides you with adequate accommodations for someone who intends to spend time/money exploring.

The hotel was great, conveniently located, decent size room, wasn't missing anything you'd expect a hotel to have. Room service was lousy. We were tired and starving when we checked in around 3pm. We were going to order room service but saw on the menu that the kitchen didn't open until 4pm. That wasn't too far off, so we waited and then called for room service at 4pm. We were told that room service actually isn't available until 5pm (with no apology or explanation as to why the menu says 4pm). We watched TV for another hour and then called again at 5pm...person who picked up the call said someone would call us back to take our order. 5:30 we get a call back and finally order our food. Another half hour later the food arrives. The food itself was just ok, but it was also almost complete cold...The hotel handled our displeasure excellently. I had just meant to give my feedback during checkout and leave; I wasn't expecting them to actually do anything about it other than apologize. I'm not sure I'd take a chance on the hotel restaurant again, but I'd definitely stay at the hotel again.
user_name:
V9073LBsarahe
New York City, New York

review_body: The accommodations were fine. I find it weird to charge to use the refrigerator. I could smell smoke coming into my room every time I used the AC and when I called to mention it they told me they could do nothing about it, it's the air from outside (most other hotels would offer to move you if possible). The AC had to be used even during the winter since the room was 78 degrees if I didn't. Pro was that it was affordable, no frills type of place that served me well for my purposes. The pillows were great and the location was fantastic.

I enjoyed staying here. The staff was helpful and very friendly. The rooms were uniquely decorated. The location was perfect, at the edge of Times Square and just down the street from most of the theaters. I will stay here again.

The Night Hotel was a fantastic place to stay and i would highly recommend to others. Central location in NYC, close to everything. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, especially Patrick at the front desk.

Location is perfect for time square area. easy to get around by foot/subway. Hotel is modern, Room was standard size for nyc(small) but modern, clean and nice and cleaned everyday. Good shower, big tv comfy bed

Hard to stress just how brilliantly located this hotel is - 50 yards from Times Square and rest of Broadway. Great value and you get what you pay for I suppose but stronger WiFi and room tea/coffee facilities wouldn't go amiss. Absolutely no problem with noise and although rooms are not massive they are more than adequate.

I booked the hotel for 2 nights with a room each for my friend and I. Quirky little hotel being all black! Great location for the theatres and Times Square. Rooms are on the small side but the bed was comfy and it was very clean! Staff were lovely to deal with. Will visit again!

Had stayed at Night at Times Square previously - this one is much smaller - small dark lobby. My room was so small I could almost touch all 4 walls & window opened to fire escape. No in-room coffee; no coffee in lobby & tiny restaurant not open mornings. Mattress way too soft. A/C good - controls in room & could actually turn on A/C instead of heat!

Perfect location to visit New York, à few steps from Times Square. The staff is teally helpful, offres concierge service and gives good advices. The room was good, clean. The bed was comfortable, a little dark though, and a bit noisy. We really had à great stay.

My fiancé and I loved this hotel!!! It's extremely modern and sexy. We stayed in a King Deluxe room and it was super spacious. I read a lot of reviews about the rooms being small but this was definitely not the case with our room. When we walked into our room we were super impressed. It was my fiancés birthday and they were kind enough to have a bottle of wine waiting for us when we got in. The bed was also very comfortable. So comfortable that we decided to sleep in extra instead of see the early sights. The hotel is literally one minute away from Times Square and really close to all the major sights! Overall, I would definitely stay here again. Thank you for going above and beyond while we were there!

Night Hotel was very nice. Black, but very chic and fixtures in the bathrooms were modern and environmentally water saving. Great location. Room was small but very well organized, and in NYC I do not stay in my room! My only suggestion would be to add coffee pots in the rooms. I definitely would stay here again. Price was very, very reasonable for NYC.

Since the moment we walked in, the customer service we received was great! All of the employees were very friendly and very helpful. The rooms at this hotel are beautiful and beds are extremely comfortable. Would definitely recommend!

The lighting levels were very low indeed. I guess the younger folks could read the NYT in reception, but I couldn't. My room did not have a trouser press or kettle which are important on business trips and the fan in room 42 rattles into life very loudly at regular intervals. Hiwever, the location us very central and staff are great. I would happily stay again.

Love the hotel. It was unique, friendly and lively yet homey and quiet in the room. Have already told 5 people about it and shown pics. Staff is friendly, efficient and really went out of their way to make my stay pleasant

Staff was great and very knowledgeable about local eateries. Room was small but nice. Very close to just about everything you would want to do in Times Square area. Overnight parking is just one block away. Would stay again.

The stay was lovly it's quite, clean and nice, the staff are great. I will always stay there when I'm in new york..they make you feel welcome.the rooms are design nice.I will definitely recommend this hotel anytime. I wish they had a swimming pool.I wish I could afford to stay every day

The staff were very friendly, helpful and efficient. My room was small but well appointed. The bed was comfortable with very nice bed linen. It was a great location, within easy walking distance ot the shows I wanted to see. It was also an easy walk to the nearest subway.
user_name:
Ladypatricia1952
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: I selected this hotel because it was right across the street from the theater I was going to. It proved to be easily accessible to most other parts of town that I wanted to go to as well. Great experience.
user_name:
Cara S
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: First time visiting NYC with my daughter to celebrate her 21st birthday. We loved the hotel and the staff was friendly and very helpful. The location was great! We will definitely be staying here again!

Great Place. Small rooms with nice decor. Don't waste your money on the Sparkling wine and chocolate truffles package. It comes with a $5 bottle of Andre and some mediocre chocolate. Just order an ice bucket and go around the corner and buy your own champagne.

Beautif hotel in beautiful position...nice room...good service and good bar!!! Too little The wardrobe and The bathroom...for one week The space is maybe too close...perfect for move during The day and night!

Very small hotel. Decorations were as advertised. Very Goth. Our room was the smallest in the hotel. Not sure how we rated the bathroom size room. We purchased the room from Priceline website. It was their pick of a 3 start hotel. Nowhere did it state tiny room. Two people could not stand next to each other. You could not walk into the closet as it was only 2 feet wide. Had to lean way in to hang up jackets. Bathroom was smaller than most cruise ship bathrooms. Smallest sink vanity i have ever seen. Bad was full size, or very small queen. Anything bigger would not fit in the room.

The hotel was ultra close to the Time Square and Broadway show area. The rooms were small, but that can be expected in NYC. The rooms were thoroughly cleaned every night. The staff was not only friendly but extremely helpful. We would specifically like to acknowledge the help offered by "Danella". They helped us use Uber, recommended restaurants, gave us correct walking directions. I'm not sure we could have stayed in a more convenient location. Thanks Night Hotel staff.

Located 1 block from Times Square and the main theathers in Broadway, Night Hotel is a near impossible to beat choice.I booked the penthouse room at an incredible discount rate and the experience was phenomenal.The sexiest hotel in New York!!!

The staff was very professional. The hotel was very clean and quiet. My stay at "Night" was superb! I would definitely recommend staying there to friends and family as well as come back a second time.

I love that the greeting was great and warm, also gave tips on places and things to do from Patrick and Nick was so helpful when it came time to unload the car. The parking could be valet for future reference.

We stayed here for valentines weekend. It was perfectly located so close to times square and walking distance to everything else. The irish girl at the desk was so friendly after a brief chat in the lift on our way out we arrived back to a bottle of bubbly in our room from her. Us irish stick together!! Haha! But all in all I would definitely stay here again on our next visit to New York.

Nice Place great atmosphere, half a block away from time square perfect location!! The staff brought us up a free bottle of champagne and gave us a nice upgrade. Everyone was nice and helpful, all in all made our stay that much better hope to be back soon.

Amazing!!!!!!!! The hotel was amazing and beautiful and service was the BEST! The check in, the restaurant recommendations and the cleanliness. Staff was the most knowledgable and made great recomendations.

I only could strongly recommend this place. Everything was EXCELLENT. The atmosphere, the staff, quality of the bedroom. And all this in a great neighborhood. I will get back there. Sooner than later!

We were very pleased with our stay here. All employees we came in contact with were very friendly and helpful. Hotel was very neat, clean & attractive. Couldn't have gotten a better location. 3 to 5 minute walk to Time Square, subway, restaurants, Broadway shows...

I was pleasantly surprised by Night Theater District. This was a business trip and, therefore, I was most motivated by price when booking. The price was INCREDIBLE. The room was small (common for NYC, but not impossibly small at all), but clean, neatly decorated and had what I needed for a few nights. There's a restaurant in the lobby with a small bar that's incredibly convenient. This hotel is also half a block from Times Square but wasn't overrun with people right outside (although February is a slow month). I'm not sure if every room has a window. Mine did, but I couldn't see anything out of it. This has bothered me in the past, but wasn't really an issue here. My biggest issue was that there was a loud humming against the wall that the bed was on. It's possible that no one else would be bothered by this, but it did bother me a little bit. That being said, I never mentioned it to the staff, so I can't say whether or not it was an avoidable inconvenience for me.The price was incredible for NYC, especially considering how nice the hotel is. I've stayed in far less attractive hotels for far more money. I would definitely suggest this hotel, particularly for the business traveler.

My friend and I stayed here for 4 days and it was the best. The room was clean and super gorgeous! It was a 3 minute walk to Times Square and very centrally located. I will definitely come back to Night!!! The bed, and rest room was very clean. The hotel was very quiet and had a very chic, sexy vibe.

The hotel location is great, very close to Times Square. We got a very good price, even when we switched the dates at the very last minute due to a snow storm, they did not have any inconvenience.The deco inside the hotel is black with some sexy pictures on the wall.

This hotel was awesome! It is so close to times square I could see the reflections of the screens on the buildings across the street. I wouldn't recommend paying extra for the city view though because all of the rooms look into the hotel next door (ours looked into their gym) Overall great hotel. Make sure you don't move anything from the mini bar around because we were going to get charged for alcohol that wasn't even in our room, however the front desk was very kind and fixed it right away. Everything was clean and the rooms were so cool! I will definitely book again!!

Great trip at the night hotel. Was in excellent location with nice decor (although small room & lack of mirrors) Very friendly service and overall good value for money over 3 nights.Bed was comfy, just small

I was travelling alone for a 5 night break. The hotel was an excellent location and next to all theatres as you expect with the name. The decor was pleasant and the room quite clean. Fresh towels etc were provided daily. The staff were pleasant except for the person who checked me out. Not friendly at all. My other complaint was a bug on a face cloth, which I literally couldn't kill was some sort of worm don't know what it was it made me cautious using them. Besides that I'd recommend the hotel and stay again, mistakes can be made and I realise the people in new york are very abrupt.

I spent an amazing time in New York mid January (just before the snow hit!) walking, seeing sights, meeting up with old friends and returning to my wonderful cozy room at the Night Hotel.This was my first holiday alone and I was desperate to see as much as I could despite the bitter cold! My room was warm and very welcoming at the end of a long day, it had everything I could need - great coffee machine, everything was clean and well looked after by the maids while I was out. Importantly quiet (towards the side or rear, I've no idea) and not disturbed by other guests, I'm quite intolerant of other people I'm sort to say.The management are second to none and their guests contentment is clearly very high on their list.The happy hour was much appreciated and the food in the restaurant excellent, though be careful not to over order as the portions are big.Internet was fine - I could even access films on my iPad which normally I cannot do in hotels due to lack of speed/strength/whatever.The hotel couldn't be better placed for visitors and I felt safe at all times.As a thought maybe some continental breakfast could be supplied in the restaurant area - just a buffet roll/croissant type thing, to get us going in the morning. There is a great eating place opposite, looks a bit downmarket (to a Londoner, it may be normal) with huge selection served as a buffet that I tried once and was very good and also a couple of Irish pubs serving breakfast opposite so eating wasn't an issue.I'm looking forward to returning, I couldn't think of a better place to be - thank you all.

The room I had was quite small but it had cool decor and was clean. Nice atmosphere and the staff were very friendly and welcoming . Decor is very cool and boutique-style.Would gladly stay there again .

I loved this hotel. I haven't slept so good in years! So dark & cozy in the rooms, it was so relaxing. The in house restaurant is amazing! My only complaint is there is no coffee pot in the rooms or lobby & no full length mirror in the room.Staff is very sweet & considerate.I woukd definitely come back!

I spen an evening at the Night Hotel for my birthday celebration. From the warm greeting, parking directions to the birthday card I received everything was awesome. I love finding a boutique hotel that goes above and beyond. The stylings of the hotel were eclectic and that was the initial attraction when booking. I love the black and white theme throughout and the details and imagery were on par! Thanks Night Hotel!

This is one of the best value for money hotels in New York. The room furnishings and photographic displays throughout the hotel really give it a "night" feel. Staff are super friendly and helpful. All in all, the Night Hotel helped make my recent visit to New York one of the least traumatic and most enjoyable yet.

Equinox pass- 5 stars. Dark/clean/hip vibe and decor. Awesome. Front desk crew couldnt have been more helpful and efficient. Bed length was a little short. Great TV selections. Sweet bar/restaurant scene. good location but quiet even close to the bustle of Theater District. Price was way too low and I hope others don't discover it because I wanna keep coming back at the super rate. :)
user_name:
Greg B
Lake Placid, New York

review_body: This is the place to go to if you want to relax and not get stress, people are nice and very helpful, very relax and nice atmosphere to be at. We went there 3 girls and spend 5 nights, our trip was for only 3 night, but do to the Snow Storm in Jan 2016 in NYC and many other states, we had to stay two extra nights and yes and without any issues they let us stay in the same room, same price we got in Booking.com and also very quit room, very clean. this hotel is very close to Times Square and easy access to all subways.

The hotel location is very good but for the staff service we not gate the help from two things the first one I ask them to book for me a airline ticket which is all the hotels they are do for their customer and your team service they told me sorry we can't do it.. And I asked them for late check out also he told me you will gonna charge for that. And they toke 150 $ for advance with out they let me know it be fore he do the transaction it was fine but he should inform me.. Wen I asked for my money they told me we will release the amount 3 to 5 days you will get it back now it's 16 days and my money not back.

The hotel is very well situated, right in the heart of Times Square. It´s clean, room is well taken care of, bed is very confortable, smoke free enviroment. Staff is polite and helpful. Had a great experience!
user_name:
Raul O
Rio de Janeiro, RJ

review_body: The stay was great, but there are a couple little things that could have improved it:1. get rid of the foot board on your beds. A fair portion of the population is taller than 6ft.2. The washroom was a little worse for wear. 3. The rooms are tiny, but I get that.

Hotel was clean. I requested a coffee maker and ice and got both. Room was somewhat small, but that is the case with many NY City Hotels. The Bathroom was also Very small...no tub, but clean. Great location for a Broadway show and dinner overnight.

Room was small but clean. The bed was comfortable. Check-in and check- out was smooth and efficient. I would gladly stay here again. The location is central to Times Square and all of the theater district.

What a fantastic experience we had. The Night Hotel was the perfect option. The front desk staff is incredibly helpful, warm and welcoming. Wish I could say that about every hotel. We were in fact in a Blizzard that hit during the middle of our stay and the management and staff handled the emergency beautifully. We felt very comfortable. The staff all made our unforseen two extra nights stay better by arranging the over bookings and allowing us to stay in our room. Thank you Night Hotel, I will definitely be back!

We had a great stay at the Night Theatre District, location is perfect for all the midtown attractions, transport links couldn't be better to see the rest of Manhattan and the wider area. We booked a queen room after reading some reviews about small double rooms and we were happy with the room size, the décor is nice and the dark theme is followed throughout the hotel. The AC is quite noisy but it is constant so bearable and it masks the city noise outside, our room was at the back so pretty quiet. The bed was really comfy and the room had everything we needed. We didn't try the bar or restaurant so can't comment. The staff were all very helpful and polite throughout our stay. We thought that the hotel was great value for the location and being small, it was much better than a huge hotel. Would we stay here again, yes.

This hotel is perfectly located to explore NYC and all its sites!!! A very small walk to the middle of Times Square (literally 100 steps max), a 10 minute walk to Macy's, Empire State and MSG and a 15 minute walk to Central Park. If you can’t be bothered to walk the subway station is literally around the corner!!The staffs are very helpful and will assist from anything from the hotel to travel and directions around the city and our check in and out was done very quickly and effectively - we even received a complementary upgrade to a kings room - the room is small, however you need to remember where you are located and how close everything is to you. YOU ARE IN THE CENTRE OF NEW YORK!!! The room was nice and tidy and cleaned every day.

Very trendy designhotel. Cool. Good food in restaurant. Very dark everywhere - as the name indicates - but I loved it!Just steps away from Times Square. My room was small, but hey, I only slept there a few hours a night..The air conditioner made some noise, but they fixed it for me as soon as I told them. Still hummed quite loud, but with earplugs I was fine.

We visited over the Christmas holiday- wonderful, warm accommodating front desk staff! Very nice room- clean, great sexy style and functional. I wouldn't really recommend this place for kids/families. Awesome for a couple looking to get some adult alone time in a wonderful quiet room. The black-out curtains can't be beat - especially if you have been painting the town in the city that never sleeps! Perfect location to Times square, transportation, restaurants, theaters, etc. Would definitely come back.

This is a very sexy hotel.Definitely a boutique hotel the front desk agents were very nice.The rooms were pretty small and we had one of the biggest rooms in the hotel.It was pretty inexpensive and cozy.I would love for them to have some kind of breakfast menu

Beautiful rooms and hotel right in the middle of busy NYC. Not as noisy as I thought it would be, good bed and pillows - lovedIt! Also any questions ask reception super friendly, would definitely recommend to family and friends.

my bedroom is excellent,and what i do is cheerful ,and the waiter is outgoing ,our friends feel like it is worth choosing itdsfdsf dsfd sdfsf sdfsdxcszfsdfsfsdfdsfdsfsffewfxcvsdfsfvsdfewrtfewdfvbgdsfgaewr dsfsdfff

Have stayed at the night hotel a couple of times and am always pleased with the rooms and the service. It's location is not my first choice, as it is super crowded, however, we were seeing a show, and only there for one night so the location was ideal. Note, the rooms are dark - including the bathroom where the lighting is not great, but passable. But the beds....are sooo comfortable. The rooms are a master of efficiency, small but inclusive of everything you need. There is discounted parking 1 block away - call the hotel to confirm the name, but don't park next door as it is more expensive. Staff is super cool and hospitable.

Most everyone was pretty awesome !! Room was very small but pretty and clean .. Great location .. Food very close , time square out the door to the left !! The location worked great for us !! Any issues are addressed immediately and corrected and thank god for Siizon our car cancelled last min and he had our transportation taken care of immediately... Thanks god !!!! Loved my stay , can't wait to return !!!!!!

Night is a great option for an inexpensive stay in the Times Square/Theater District. It's a bit off beat in its look and feel but we like that. Rooms are tiny but comfortable but the staff is super friendly and helpful.

Service and location are great.The problem was that I got an extremely small room with small bed and bathroom. It also had a very noisy air conditioner so all in all the room quality was poor and disappointing.

Stayed at the Night Theater District Hotel for December 2015. Danielle and Robert at the front desk were very attentive to my and my fiancee's requests. From restaurants to Broadway shows, nothing was impossible for them! Being from Connecticut, I have always felt that I can go around Manhattan like a New Yorker, but it certainly is different when you have real New Yorkers telling you where to eat, grab a drink, etc.This was for an extended weekend getaway for me and my fiancee and we absolutely enjoyed staying at the hotel. Simon, the bell captain was also very nice and always had a smile when we passed by him in the lobby. You can't beat the location. You are literally steps away from Times Square. Rooms are small, but that's a given because this is New York. Why would you want to spend most of your time in your room during your vacation anyway? I highly recommend this hotel for couples. Not so much for families or if you are traveling with kids.

Checked in Boxing Day to a wonderful hotel. Very dark and different as it's decorated mostly in black. Room was very comfortable but could do with drawers to store clothes. Staff were very friendly and Daniella was absolutely brilliant. If you walked out the door turned left you would be on Times Square in 30 seconds

I had never head of Night hotel prior to booking through priceline. It was an express deal of the day and a great price (well under $100). I am a bit confused by the 4 star rating but overall our experience was good. The hotel is clean and décor is modern/goth. The rooms are small, they are clean and decorated nicely. Some reviewers stated that you could hear noise all night long from the streets, but we didn't experience that at all. Very quiet most of the time. It may sound silly, but really the only thing that would probably make me not want to book again here was the lighting in the room and bathroom. With every light on, it still never gets bright, and the light that they do have is pretty awful fluorescent lighting. It's important to me when getting ready to go out that I can see my face in the mirror properly (you know, the whole makeup thing). The lighting will make you look like a ghost and I found the lighting hard on the eyes. It didn't bother my husband quite as much but he agreed it was strange why they would design the hotel rooms that way. We could understand the lobby/hallways going with the dim/dark theme but the rooms should be different. Sounds very trivial, and honestly, in the end it's not a huge deal. It was a comfortable, clean place to stay with very pleasant front desk staff. Make sure to request a queen bed when you're booking. Double beds are standard and queen is considered an upgrade!

Couldn't fault this hotels location- literally on the doorstep of times Square near Broadway, Shops and attractions. Close to central park and the empire state building- can get a subway to Statue of Libery & 9/11.The inside of the hotel has a gothic theme- lots of black and white- which is a contrast to the bright lights of Times Square- but it's nice to have somewhere to wind down after a long day.The restaurant was a Sushi Resturant and bar area which was great and the staff were very friendly as were the hotel receptionistTwo Downsides- was very small for two people- but i guess you can pay extra for a bigger side rooms- and i thought the price was reasonable for central new york.Also having to pay 10 dollars every 24 hours for wifi in a 4 star hotel was quite poor in comparison to other hotels in NYC for free.Overall- a very pleasant stay!

Rooms are clean, comfortable and stylish. Excellent location within walking distance to the theater district and Times Square. Really good resteraunts and bars on the same block as the hotel. This is our second stay at a Nights Hotel and we will always check with them first when booking a room in NYC.

Yes its dark & dim, but it carries that theme for the purpose of its title. Its unique and niche! Trendy & for the fashionable! Our stay was great. 6 room from King, Queen & Double beds along with a 2 floor pent house suite that I booked for my company party. We had a great time. Fast check in, MarLou at the check-in desk was on top of it all. I had called weeks prior for the reservation and she had remembered everything, all my special requests were met! Super friendly representative, she was and is an asset to the hotel. Personal Thank you goes out to her! Also Thanks to Mary O'Sullivan for the wine bottle sent to our room! Showed us great hospitality. Parking discounts were great for our cars saved us nearly 40% off Times Sq rates! Great location saved us so much on Uber and Cab fares! Walked everywhere due to their close location to the hottest restaurants and landmarks... I will definitely revisit this hotel and stay here again! Highly recommend. I normally dont waste time writing reviews but they left such a positive impression they really deserve a positive remark! Thank you!!!!!

This hotel was perfect for our needs. The location was right around the corner from the ball drop on New Years, and the staff was all very friendly. I also loved the decor and the lighting in the room. Just be careful and DONT TOUCH anything in the minibar or you will trip off the sensors and be charged for each item.

The property was clean and staff was pleasant, however, the rooms are extremely small. No views. The only view I had was of a building adjacent to the property. The rooms are dark, with a S&M type of theme. Overall I would not stay here again because I can get a better view and bigger room for the money I spent. If you are traveling alone it is decent for one person to stay.

It was an ideal location for watching the ball drop. The staff were friendly and helpful. It placed us in an ideal location to get to and from the ball drop. The bar was even opened till 3am. Love the decor of the room.

Such a lovely hotel. Very "boutique" and modern inside. Literally on the door step of Times Square. Room are perfect with all amenities such as fridge, hair dryer, iron, robes, security safe etc. We forgot tooth paste and were given some from reception. Decor is very dark but is lovely and chic inside. All staff very welcoming and friendly. Air con and heating in the room and also super quiet considering location. Aisian restaurant in hotel is super. Amazing food and great price. We would stay here again with out a second thought.

Best location almost in time square it self :), excellent staff, especially the bell captain who knows few words in Arabic.Wilk definitely come back again.200 is too much guys, you want me to narate my life details in the hotel!!!!
great design of lobby and rooms,great rate (with 30% off due to last-minute offer),friendly staff in hotel and restaurant,fantastic sushi restaurant on ground floor,nice little bar in restaurant..

wonderful sleep on an awsome bed in a room that was slightly larger than the bed. Open the windows and you are in a quiet haven in the middle of the action of the theater district of NY! You have to experience it just for the marvel of the design!

The staff as kind and helpful, the hotel was clean, and the color scheme was exciting and fun. The room was small, but comfortable, with a nice clean bathroom. The bed was comfortable and had some nice decorative pillows. The location of the hotel was right next to times square and has a wonderful restaurant on the base floor. Overall, a very nice place to stay. Our room was also nice and quiet, even with being so close the Times Square.

It is a very clean and nice hotel. I just found the bed a little too small and one could hear every sound from outside the room. Staff was always helpful and friendly. I would stay there again! Great location!

When we arrived at the hotel our check in was very fast and Patrick very helpful. The room was sale but elegant. We had a very noisy heating machine that made it hard but not impossible to see. Other than that, it was a very nice hotel

i very much enjoyed my stay at the night hotel. was a little concerned about the room size when i first got there but after realizing i wouldn't be spending much time in my room, it was not a big deal. my only complaint is the lighting. the lighting in the entire hotel is incredibly unflattering and very dim. would have been nice to have some brighter/more flattering lighting, in at least the room.

The internet signal in room is very bad. Only in the lobby we have good signal. The people are very friendly, from the reception to the bar. The room is very nice, allways clean. The hotel is near times square 2 minutes walking. Very good location.

Very nice hotel. Great location for theater district and Times Square. Hotel very clean with great bath amenities and comfortable bed. Decor suited to couples and adults moreso than families. Friendly staff.

I wanted location, low price, clean and neat. The night had everything on my list and my room was very stylish: however, the shower didn't work at all and I had to be moved after unpacking. They did it quickly and without trouble. If it were not for the shower inconvenience, it would have been 5 stars.

Very very good location, because of this we did not go to time square to wait and bear the cold for 8 hours. The hotel is just next to the ball fall point, though we could not see the ball, we saw the beautiful moment after the fall of the ball. The room is quite small but clean and well designed. We had a good time there!

My girlfriend and I loved being in New York City and Night Hotel Theater District enhanced the experience. When we arrived just after official check-in time, our room wasn't ready yet but we were quoted a 15 minute wait while the room was being inspected. It took exactly 15 minutes to check us in so kudos to the front desk for speedy, amiable service. All other employees were warm, friendly, knowledgeable and we loved the hotel restaurant as well.

The hotel was awesome! The rooms were a tad small but for a romantic get away it is perfect! Just steps away from time square (literally) it was perfect. And the staff was all super friendly! If you're looking to sleep in and relax..no worries! While it is only steps away from time square, we did not hear a single car and since it is in between buildings, the sun does not come into the windows waking you up! We truly enjoyed this hotel and would certainly come back!

The rooms are absolutely tiny. The bed is actually a full size bed and nothing bigger. It is a rip off and feels like you are sleeping in a closet. Nothing like the pics shown online. Not a 4 star definitely a 1-2 star hotel but it is conveniently located. No windows or view. Trust me take the subway and get something at least livable

The hotel is good on general, the location is nice, near Times Square and Rocefeller center, and it is convenient to go shopping and experience night life in New York.But it is a little bit noisy at night, and the free internet service it promised you cannot actually get.

Fabulous hotel in a great location. Extremely clean and very chic. There's even a cool bar/lounge downstairs. Staff is very accommodating. We would defiantly come here again and we plan to soon. Thanks for a great stay.

Booked a king and convinced I received a full size bed. My husband is 6'3" and was completely uncomfortable. Location was great but hotel was horrible. You can find many more hotels in the area for the same price and much better quality!
user_name:
jessicafW9269BK
New York City, New York

review_body: Hotel was in a great location, everything was clean, the staff was fantastic, and the price was affordable given the location. I'm over 6ft and the room, though on the small side, was perfectly fine for me. I will stay at this hotel again the next I'm in NYC.

My boyfriend and I were going to NY for little weekend getaway before Christmas and were looking for somewhere fun and different to stay. We found it! The lobby is all done in black and white with a noir feel. Overall a romantic setting in my opinion. The service was great and they even upgraded us to the penthouse level which was awesome! I wouldn't recommend families to stay here. But, if you're looking for a couples getaway with some fun risqué décor, this is it! They even kept our bags for us after we checked out so we could go sight seeing bag free.

The only negative comments is that the room assigned to us was extremely small for to persons with an extremely small closet and computer space. In addition, you have to leave the premises to obtain breakfast or a late night coffee.

This hotel is in the thick of New York. You are within walking distance to all top attractions, shopping & places to eat. Huge value for money. A boutique hotel with a cosy feel, you can't get better than this!

My husband and I traveled to New York for our belated honeymoon. We were warmly greeted upon arrival. Unfortunately, there was a problem with our room, so we were relocated to the property on 47th Street for our first night with the promise of a junior suite the following night. The Knight on 47th has a beautiful lobby, restaurant, and bar where we enjoyed our complimentary drinks before heading out to the Palm. The room was small but clean and well-appointed. Our second night was fantastic! The manager had champagne and chocolate waiting for us on the top floor of our bi-level penthouse suite. The penthouse was huge, fancifully decorated, and everything one could dream of for a theatre district hotel. A special thank you to the staff at Night Hotel for making our "honeymoon" an amazing experience!

If you want to be in the mix of Midtown, this is a very chic, well-located spot. Clean, updated rooms. (I've seen a few other reviews stating the rooms are small -- welcome to Manhattan.) I'd definitely stay here again.

This hotel had rooms that were small and I mean small. A closet, a small bathroom, and a bed room. The place was clean and the staff was helpful. All windows, and they were small too, opened to a brick wall. I am 6-4 and 270 lbs. Never again.
user_name:
Joseph K
STATE COLLEGE, United States

review_body: Quick weekend getaway for my husband and I before the holiday.. so happy we tried Night Hotel.. amazing decor, friendly staff, comfortable rooms & central to all of Manhattan.. Can't wait to come back.

My wife and I treated my neice and her boyfriend to a weekend in New York. It was there first time in the city so being so close to time square from the hotel was great. We also surprised them with tickets to the Broadway show, Chicago. which also was a perfect distance from the hotel. What I loved the most for me was the city noise didnt keep me up all night.

Hotel staff was wonderful. The location of this hotel was exactly what we were looking for. The concierge helped us find the best restaurant Friday night! Only downfall is small rooms. We would go back

My wife and I went to NYC to experience it during Christmas. We were excited. My wife picked the Night hotel based on price and location, but in hindsight we should have spent more for a better hotel. The only positives I can offer are that the hotel is located very near Times Square and the Rockefeller Center, and the Cranberrys restaurant across the street has great breakfast. When we first arrived, we were greeted by a very nice guy named Patrick, who checked our baggage and gave great directions on the subway, food, and how to get downtown. When we got back, the reality set in.Our room was on the 4th floor. It was about 8ft x 12ft in width and length with a double bed. This was my wife's fault for not requesting a bigger bed. Anyway, the room was very small and poorly lit. It also did not have a dresser. The lights worked on a dimmer switch which did not work very well. The bed had a light under it, supposedly controlled by the dimmer, but we couldn't turn it off. I had to unplug it. Additionally, all through the night, we were awaken by sirens and horns. Also, the hall was very noisy with other guest and kept us awake. Some noise prevention would have been nice.The bathroom was large, but the sink was tiny, with no counter. The modern shower did not have a lip or door, so water poured into the bathroom floor. The bathroom also did not have a fan, which is unpleasant in a 100 sq ft room. Additionally, the ironing board was very small and the iron poured water. The tv reception was awful and refreshed often.Worst of all was the length of the bed, combined with the footboard. I am 6'2" tall, and as a result, did not fit. Anyone over 5'8" would be uncomfortable, but I was miserable. The pillows were also terrible. I complained about this, but was told all of the beds were the same.Lastly, I would complain about the smoking in the hotel. It was bad. The halls smelled of smoke all the time. Having a pregnant wife, this was not ok. Even if she wasn't pregnant, it smelled terrible. I would not recommend this hotel in the slightest. I would gladly have paid double for a better place to sleep.

This is the 2nd time my boyfriend and I stayed at your hotel. The first time we stayed at the 47th street location. W4 enjoyed stating there, but someone was playing the violin all night and kept us up. After speaking with the front desk during checkout they said they would make note of it for a future stay discount. When we called to book a 2 night reservation this past week week they did not have anything in computer so we decided to give the 4th Street location a try. The hotel was beautiful! We stayed in room 29 but unfortunately had issues as well. The air conditioning unit was not working and stayed locked on 78 the first night it was very hot in room. We spoke to the desk and they said they would lower it which we noticed they did. However, the next night it was right back up to being 78 and uncomfortable. The only other issue we had was with the restaurant Red Moon. The food was ok, but service was horrible. Everytime we needed our server whether it was to pay the bill or get a second drink we had to wave her down. Even though we were 2 out of 4 peoplease dining, she was more interested in talking to the bartender and guests at bar. Overall we love the hotel , but wish some of the things were different since it was our first get away in a while for my birthday.

Awesome Hotel & Incredible Experience! This hotel is nothing like we have ever seen before - It's gorgeous on the inside, clean, and modern. We were visiting from California and stayed here one night and had the best service! Patrick at the front desk is AMAZING!!! We loved him so much! He was so kind, funny, very personal, and quick to help us. I ended up getting engaged and he was so sweet to send us Champagne. We also had dinner here and Angie took care of us and she was so great! She was very helpful and so friendly. Thank you NIGHT for such an incredible experience! 5 STARS!

Stayed for a long weekend to celebrate a wedding anniversary. Half a block from the madness of Times Square, but quiet. Clean, spacious King room, and attentive staff. Only negative is a slow elevator

I would highly recommend this hotel. The staff was great and you can't beat the location. The room was small, but that is the case with many hotels in New York. The bar was very good with excellent apps.

Stayed at this property in December of 2015. It's located less than a block from Times Square which was super convenient, but for the money spent I expected more. The room was VERY small, which I expected but the finish was way off for the price. Fixtures were installed poorly, tiles were loose in the bathroom, the fridge in my room didn't work, etc. The hotel has a very "True Blood" feel to it. I expected a vampire to jump out at any moment. Very dark, Gothic furnishings and decor. Great location, and that was really about it. I'd pay more to stay at the Hyatt across the street.

Night Hotel's is a modern boutique hotel. The rooms are very clean. the hotel's location is perfect. It is 2 minutes away from Times Square and the subway is 5 minutes away (42 St/Port Authority). However, they don't offer breakfast at all, which I've never experienced before.Moreover, the queen bed in our room was too short. I am 5. 6 feet tall, a normal height, but my feet nudged on the bed.

The night theatre hotel is an excellent place to stay , warm and friendly welcome and nothing was to much trouble for the staff it was in a great location just off Times Square . I would defiantly stay there again

I have traveled to NYC many times but coming from out of town you always have to brace yourself for New York hotels in that they are not what those of us in the rest of the country are used to. This hotel has a great location and, for New York, about average in price but was not a "bargain". Rooms very small but well maintained. To keep the street sound down my room had NO window. A first in all my travels. Staff was pleasant but my room key would never work and it was annoying to take the only rather slow elevator to get it replaced. They eventually decided the lock was faulty. Still, its steps away from Times Square and theaters and the small bar was kind of edgy. You could do worse.

Location was about a 30second walk to Times Square with rockafella a short walk, the empire a bit further and close to a few metro stations!The room was very clean with lights you can dim and easy to use heating/air con! Large shower ! Staff were fantastic, very helpful and made every effort to open doors and acknowledge us coming in and out! Great place to stay for couples

Very nice and trendy hotel. Well located, right in the middle of Times Square. Room are small but really optimized and clean. This is NY, each foot square is used. Bed is really confortable, staff is kind and helpful. They have a nice restaurant and bar down stairs. I would come again!

We love small boutique hotels and stay once a month at a new hotel in Manhattan. Everyone there was nice but we would not stay again. Our room was a closet, literally. The bed at feathers that stuck out at night, the air conditioner was extremely loud, and the shower head was not tall enough to fit a 6 ft man. We were a bit nervous staying in the room and enclosed - the window looked out to a smoke stack and directly into another building so opening the shades was not an option. There are so many gorgeous hotels for this price point, this just did not fit the bill for us.
user_name:
michaelkV6052CY
New York City, New York

review_body: This is a boutique hotel so don't expect a spacious lobby but the rooms are well kept & clean;the location is excellent [Starbucks is 1 minute, Times Square, 2 minutes, reeadiliy accessible restaurants & theatres]. Staff is helpful, professional & courteous. I'd highly recommend this hotel.

My boyfriend and I stood for two nights. It was okay. The concierge asked if we needed anything once our bags were in the room? I asked for water. He said "There are many stores outside."We had to go outside to Starbucks to get a cup of water. The sheets weren't made as often and the towels were not replenished, when my boyfriend and I got back to our room late that night. The pros is that it's close to all restaurants. The cons were that there isn't enough communication or interaction between staff and visitors.

The hotel experience was excellent - great locations, easy process to check in/out and the room was very nice and clean. It felt like a European hotel in how small it was, but I have no complaints in that regard - it was large enough for my needs. Nice bathroom - again nice and clean. The bed was comfortable but there was a fair amount of electrical noise from the heater or something I presume which was a bit annoying but not all that unusual in hotels The price was right for a 4 star hotel.

I love a dark room so I can sleep late in the morning. Perfect location for my work. The pillows r hard and I prefer mushy pillows. The lobby has a hip feel. The rooms r small but I don't require space since I only sleep and shower there. It wouldn't be good if u had to spend many hours socializing in the room.
user_name:
gary b
Sag Harbor, New York

review_body: This is a definitive NYC hotel! The desk and bar staff were like old friends to us the moment we arrived. Don't be taken aback by the small size of the rooms, this is NYC, and the room is for showering, sleeping, and... well, the over hanging padded headboard helps there [devilish smile]. Stayed in room 63 and it was very quiet. The black, white, and chrome decor is surreal (in a good way). The lighting under the bed gave the illusion of a setting sun along the bottom of the drapes - very cool. Robes were in the room when we checked in. Half a block from the center of Times Square, two blocks from the subway, a 24 hour deli is right around the corner (but they didn't have those NYC blue and white coffee cups) [laugh]. Very clean and the king size bed was very comfortable. Egyptian cotton sheets. Drinks in the lounge are generous and they have great happy hour deals. The menu is Asian Fusion, which I love. Try the Aged Tofu... it melts in your mouth. Five stars all around. Stacie and I will be back soon. Paul

A very quirky hotel in a great location just yards from Times Square. We stayed here for only three nights of our five night holiday as we were a bit worried about reports of the decor and lack of waredrobe space. This proved about right. Our room wasn't huge but definitely big enough, with a nice large bathroom too. The hotel is a bit dark, matching the decor and there is only space for a few clothes on the hanger. But the location more than makes up for this. We stayed on the third floor so we're a bit worried about the noise whilst trying to sleep. Whilst the noise from times square was relatively low and we did get off to sleep each night, we were woken by the sound of trucks making deliveries and collecting rubbish later on. All in all a nice little hotel for a few days but not for a whole week. We would stay again.

Good services and good locationWalkin top time sgaure in 2 min lot of things to do by hotel good taxi services to THE AirPort cheap then normal taxi . Nice rooms wit WiFi . Me Will fine back to this hotel next time

This is an ideal location for sightseeing New York with easy access to all forms of transport as well as walking to many sites , customer friendly with all amenities also a restaurant downstairs also open to non residents

Location is unbeatable but a reservation snafu forced an unwanted - and disappointing switch - to the Night Hotel Times Square, not nearly as chic not sophisticated with even tinier rooms (yes, that's possible.) Wish management could have managed a better solution.

While the location was great our room was very small for a deluxe queen. Not to mention when we had left for dinner, house keeping came in to our room to double check things. I found that odd considering that housekeeping should only come after our stay was complete. The shower was draining very slow and was terrible. The tv in our room kept trying to pick up signal. You won't get cell reception so do your research on the things you would like to do before hand. To overprice for this place

Overall the stay was enjoyable however for the money I paid, I feel that issues such as a loose tile in the bathroom should have been addressed more professionally. The tile was effectively a safety hazard and it still wasn't fixed when we left 4 days after alerting the staff about it. I must stress that someone did try to fix it but obviously a tile takes a while to set and as soon as we stood on it it became loose again resulting in both of us stubbing our toes pretty badly! I also found my sleep was pretty bad- not sure if this was down to the bed or pillow or what but I've left with an aching back and neck.

Great location, friendly staff, and a comfortable room. I would definitely return. I liked the dark colors which is very different from your average hotel. Very chic. The room wasn't very big, but I wasn't in Manhatten to hang out in a hotel room.

We had a good stay but did not received a promised surprise for a 40th birthday nor did we get turn down service. This was promised during check in and we were excited and happy for the thought, but it never happened.

Loved the comfy bed and rainfall showerhead too ...the black and white theme was over the top cool and food and drinks were top notch too ...the staff was wonderfulto us we had a blast ...and location was perfect as well ..a ten last minute trip to see the christmas lights ..

Every one there was very friendly and accommodating. The rooms are a tad small, as with the bed as well, but it is NYC so to be expected! Clean and would come back there for sure!!! Our stay was with two adults and a 1 year old and room was fine for the three of us!

The room was very good and clean. Very good for the price and localization was great. Very kind attendant, gave us all information we needed. Just had a small issue on the check out that I believe they will solve to us.

Needs updating in the bathrooms and having to pay $10 a day for wifi I thought was a bit much. Should be free as it is for many other hotels and even Starbucks. Very noisy room all through the night due to a generator or air duct system or something. However hotel is perfectly located and hotel staff very friendly

Great film noir theme throughout the lobby, floors and rooms. Room size is small as all NY hotels are, but when our heating didnt work in one room we were upgraded to a bigger room which was lovely. Room service staff were very friendly and all in all a very pleasant stay.

Night Hotel has a great location if you are going to theaters and restaurants or doing things near or in Time Square. Also close to taxis and subway. The hotel has a sexy, romantic vibe and capitalizes on its dark, moody lighting. There is beautiful contemporary photography on display. The rooms have uplighting under the bed and the small window is actually a skylight that does not really let in any daylight. The room was tiny and there was no room for a coffee maker or a bureau to put away clothes. There is a cafe but it felt like more of a bar. The staff was friendly and helpful although we had some problems. They sent us an apology note with a bottle of wine to make up for it. I was staying with my daughter so it wasn't as perfect as it would have been for a couple having a romantic tryst. Next time I will stay in a larger hotel with more amenities.

My first impression when I walked in the door... "I wish my husband was with me." This small boutique hotel is right off Times Square, but you wouldn't know it. It's dark and sexy and was so reasonably priced. The staff was nice, but I didn't really ask for much. They weren't like cheerful like the staff at the larger hotels, but it seemed to match chill, dark atmosphere. The room was small, but it's NY... I kinda laughed to myself. The room is basically the bed. You're not going to be working or working out in this room... it's pretty clear your intentions in the room will be focused on the bed (which was really comfortable) ;-) The bathroom was nice and clean and the shower was great, although the lighting in the bathroom wasn't great for makeup. My only complaint was the alley? back courtyard? (I couldn't tell what it was) that my room overlooked (Rm 21) had some people that were either yelling at each other or my windows were pretty thin. Luckily it was early evening and they were gone by the time I went to bed. :) I will definitely come back to this hotel again, but next time with my husband :)
user_name:
C6934AZmeganh
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: A regular Thanksgiving visitor and 4th Yr at Night. Great location and great team always make our stay welcoming and enjoyable. Delighted to see Simon a stalwart of Night and who has the most infectious smile back at the entrance. Perfect location and highly recommended. See you next year guys :)

Great Location near Time Square but still quiet & peaceful. Rooms are small but adequate and very comfy. The staff are very friendly & helpful! Especially Simon, he made our stay special and made us feel like family. We will be back in the spring for another stay & hope to see everyone again. Beats a chain hotel by far!!! Keep up the good work.

It is a nice hotel! Close to everything steps away from Time Square/Radio City/Starbucks is about 20 steps away. 2 Irish pubs/restaurants across the street. As you can see in the images it is not a colorful hotel but it is unique, clean. Rooms are small -but that's what you expect in NYC. Check in/out was basically the quickest of anywhere I've ever been. Staff was friendly and helpful. Only small issue was the fee/tax that they say is mandatory at checkout.

Loved my stay felt like part of a family whilst there for 4days..... Would highly recommend❤️Great location and glamorous feel........ Nothing bad to reportEspecially loved talking to Patrick on a daily basis

Love this hotel - the location is excellent and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. In this location, it is hard to find a smaller hotel that still offers the personal touch. Rooms are small, but that's just the way it is in a central location on a huge city. That said, this was my 3rd or 4th stay here, and this time I had a room that definitely was larger than on previous visits - I had enough space for all my stuff.

The Night Hotel is near everything: theaters, times square, parks, top of the rock...all is walking distance. It was great and the bedroom is very romantic, sexy and comfortable. Patrick in the front desk was very attentive with us and kind. Love it!

Very good location in the heart of New York time square close to theatres and restaurants and the red bus tours the only negative was no tea & coffee facilities in the room but the very comfortable bed made up for it

My babe and I are professionals who work very long hours in NYC. We needed a night of relaxation with a hint of excitement. Upon arrival, we fell in love with Night's sexy decor, perfect location, and wonderful staff. The decor looks exactly the way it does online! Night will make you fall in love or lust with NYC. Right in the heart of the Theater District, a hop, skip, and a jump from Times Square, and very close to Radio City, what more can you ask for?! If you and your spouse are visiting NYC for pleasure or for work….this is the hotel to stay in! Be prepared to be seduced in the alluring ambiance of Night. I am already jealous of your first time! We will definitely be back!

We stayed in the king suite not totally sure it was a deluxe room because the room itself was extremely small. I could not believe how small it was. I loved however the entire bed set up and the black and white used in the room.

The location is good, but it's definitely not a good place for ppl who would like to have a good night sleep. It's very noisy, TS is nosiy, there are trucks coming in the midnight to pick up garbage and bed sheets for hyatt right across the street). The room is extremely small and simply not worth the $$.If you are travelling to NYC, choose somewhere nicer and quite. TS is not the right place to stay. It's more expensive and the overall quality is bad. With the same budget, you can find a better hotel in other locations.

Location of the hotel is just perfect if you want to spend some time in the heart of NY. Good public transportation but you don´t necessarily even need that because of the hotels location.Atmosphere of the hotel was something new in a positive way.

I have stayed in a lot of hotels and without a doubt this is my favorite. I wouldn't think about staying anywhere else when I am in Manhattan. Helpful staff, great décor that was very well done. I could write a lot more, but I'm sure you get the picture. Stay here!

Excellent location, excellent staff, beautiful and modern decor. Rooms are so nice and clean. I can't say enough nice things about this hotel. There are tons of places in Midtown to choose from, hundreds in the city in general... If you are looking for a place in this area, choose the Night Hotel!

One of the worst hotels I have stayed in, unhelpful staff, ridiculously small rooms, noisy rooms, fobbed off with lies from staff. I wouldn't recommend staying there and I certainly won't stay at any of these hotels ever again.

I loved this hotel, the location was unbeatable, with a good price, helpful friendly staff and luxurious rooms with toiletries, robes, minibar and an amazingly comfortable bed. I really liked the decor, the night time theme was very cool, very modern and meant you could easily have a nap day or night with the blackout curtains. This occasionally made planning our day a little difficult as even with the lights on it was still pretty dim but all more reason to enjoy the artsy lobby. There was some noise from the street but this is to be expected 2mins from Times Square. We had a city view room on the 2nd floor, internal rooms or higher floors may be a little quieter but the location more than makes up for it. There were quite a few comments about having to pay for WiFi we didn't have to as it was included in our room booking. It came in handy but there's loads of free WiFi spots so not a necessity. This isn't really a comment on the hotel more visiting America in general, tax is always added on at the end, this includes hotel rates. We booked through a price comparison website so just be aware that the prices quoted exclude tax. It was about $300 extra for our weeks stay. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel for short breaks for couples.

It is a shame that there isn't a good rating as thats what i would have probably rated this hotel as. The decor of the hotel is pretty cool and what really saves this place is the service i have stayed at a very big hotel in NY before and the service was shocking. The staff genuinely seem to be interested and helpful, even when we came back and our door was open and they investigated - nothing was taken and it does appear from their records that we had left the door open, they still left a letter and bottle of wine in the room, which i think showed a genuine care. The issue is that the rooms are very dark with all the lights on and I was prepared for a small room but not quite prepared for how small they were, I did book a superior queen but i wasn't convinced we were in a superior queen as i am not sure how much smaller a room could be. I did find our room to be a little noisy but we were near Times Square in NY. The bathroom was nice with a good shower and it is in a great location. I would personally stay here again but i would have to upgrade to a bigger room.

On check on we were informed that we had been downgraded to single beds from the queen bed we booked. Aircon started working for the first half and me 2 Days in to our stay Wifi did not work for half the duration of our stay and then was very noisy. Came on at 5 in the morning.

I read mixed reviews but as soon as I entered the hotel I knew things were going to be fine. The concierge was chatty and personable offering information on sites and activities. The room was indeed tiny. However, I was impressed with the layout of the room. We didn't stay in there for long and I loved the Black Decor, shower, and even the bedpost was impressive. The room was true to the advertisements. I wish the TV was bigger but by the time we returned to our room we fell right asleep in the comfy Queen bed. Will definitely return here for the convenient location AND impressive decor.

Hotel in a great location, clean and with special decor.The first night we did not sleep well because the air conditioning was too loud we had to close it.The room and the closet were a little 'small, but the room was clean and the bed comfortable.

Great location for being in the hustle and bustle of the City. Walk to the Theatre or Times Square, and restaurants Easy walk from Penn Station. Once inside The Night, it's a quiet haven for R&R. Comfortable. Great price, too, for the location. Would definitely go back.

Overall, this hotel was pretty much what is advertised. Cool vibes, dark and hip. The desk clerks were not overly friendly, but not bad. When we got to our room, were were happy to have a front facing room, although it proved to be a bit loud at night. I didn't feel that the finishing touches were "4 Star" worthy - there was bad grout in the bathroom, chipped tiles, chipped paint - not awful, but not what I would expect from a four star hotel. We lost something, so at one point we were looking under the bed and mattress for our cord and (while the rest of the hotel was clean) these parts were just gross, including a condom wrapper. For us, our main issue was the bathroom. We had an ADA room so the shower was large with no doors. The water temperature wouldn't go above warm, so with the size of the bathroom, it was just too cold to shower. The manager was very accommodating and did everything she could to help us, even the maintenance guy was great. The only room we could move into was much smaller without a window, so overall, we felt very claustrophobic, not necessarily due to size, but size combined with all black walls, floors etc. It just wasn't our style. Again, the manager was great, but ultimately we ended up changing hotels.

We enjoyed our stay very much. A great base to get to know the main attractions of Manhattan. The room was just the right size and quiet (except for a brief squeal when the a/c would come on). The bed was VERY comfortable.

After a slight bungle with our check in, Patrick made sure we were comfortable during his "investigation". We enjoyed a complimentary drink and sushi from the restaraunt. He was genuine, funny & very helpful!The hotel itself was in the perfect location! 2min walk into Times Square, close to Subway & surrounded by eateries. Perfect for our first time in NY!

the hotel was great. Very good location Just near time square (1 minute walk) and you don't hear noise The room is small but convince for a couple goodsWifi in the lobby is free, in the room wifi is extra charge

Am giving 5 stars because of professional staff like Rajiv and Daniela who go out of the way to assist. We felt like in family with you guys. It's perfect place near time Square. Rajiv thanks for the METS game ticket, we enjoyed our first baseball game ever. We will come next year again.

Great location, small room, but fine for a boutique hotel in a BIG city. Perfect location if you are in for a show or want to be steps from Time Square. We where able to walk to/from the Empire State Building, our show a couple of blocks away, Bryant Park, Radio City/Rockefeller Center area and even to Central Park. More than two per room will be tight, roll out bed available.

I needed a place to stay at the last minute because I had an early meeting. It was the perfect place to stay. The rooms were clean and really cool. I didn't need much. The staff was nice and bathrooms were clean and functional.

Liked room/concept. Very trendy. But, have email saying we would be in VIP room with bottle of wine there. Didn't happen. ''free drink" you need to fix that bar maid not helpful, we went elsewhere. need

Loved the feel of the hotel. Dark and mysterious. Perfect location. Loved the all night diner across the street for early morning coffee. Loved standing in Times Square at 3:30 am. Like being at a performance where no one attended. The staff is wonderful. The room is my favorite decor. All great.

We felt more at home,when we got a waterkeddle for tea and coffee to the room on the second day .Its really a kind of relaxing .It was missing.It was fine located and the staff had humor and always very helpfull.for our ideas.

Great place! Patrick was a great host! I would come back to it again. Location was awesome and great local places suggestions by the staff at the hotel! I enjoyed it. Very first time in NYC and was fun

I had already read that the rooms were small but I must admit I was taken aback when I saw how small. Nevertheless the reception staff were very nice and made us feel welcome. We were only there for a couple of nights so the room size didn't really matter. I would stay there again and recommend the hotel to other travellers but warn them of room size

I recently spent a night at the Times Square location. The staff and location are perfect. I booked a queen room without a view, the downside was how small the room was but for one night I didn't find it to be inconvenient. The hotel's atmosphere is very sexy and I would highly recommend this to a couple looking for a romantic hotel.

Great location, walkable from midtown meetings. Tidy rooms the dark theme comes off as stylish more so than morose. Its an understated hotel for a decent price in New York. At 6 feet tall the bed was surprisingly short. And it was hard to find wall outlets to power my devices. Good sandwich bar across the street for a quick breakfast.

The lobby felt like a nightclub, all black and white with dim lighting. The room was very comfortable, staff helpful, location excellent as it's a short work to Times Square. The on-site restaurant food was delicious and room service very efficient. The air con/heating was just a little noisy. Overall great experience for first time NY visit.

Started off our honeymoon with 2 nights in the Night Theater District. Checked in by Robert who upon learning that it was our honeymoon gave us some free drink vouchers for the residents bar and sushi restaurant.All staff we interacted with were extremely friendly and easy talk with, Patrick stands out and the girl who booked our Broadway show tickets.The location is a next door to Time Square and across the road from the Lyceum Theater. You couldn't ask for a more perfect location.The decor is different and definitely adds to the experience. Instead of the expected bible in the bedside locker we found the kama sutra! :-)

Nice hotel, good vibe with a very good location and interiour.Unfortunately: Saturday the 31th October there was a big halloween party in the hotel bar till past midnight. The music was extremely loud and because we were staying at the 2nd floor, we could have sing along with all the songs. Luckily we didn't run the marathon that Sunday ;)

Bring a flash light - the whole place is very dimly lit, the rooms as well. If you are 6 ft. or taller the bed will be too short. At night the air conditioning comes on periodically with the sound of a vacuum cleaner running for a minute or so. Light sleepers will need ear plugs.

Despite it is in the middle of the hot point in New York it is very quiet and relaxing place. Very cool and modern and service was excellent and fast . I will repeat and recommend also for the price which was quite low.

So I am always a little leary when I see "boutique hotel" most often I find them to be run down and dingey, except for the lobby. And some of the reviews were a bit wonky.... but I was only in town for 1 night, and it is a 4 star hotel - so I thought how bad could it be??Not bad at all!! In fact, it was really quite wonderful!! Night is unique, interesting and comfortable.When you walk in, yes it is a tad dark, but the hotel is named "Night" but there are all these lovely candles everywhere that give plenty of light! The front desk was very curious. I arrived before my room was ready, and they apologized and said it would be an hour or so. I am pretty laid back, and I had some work to do on my laptop, so I just hung out in the lobby. Beautiful leather couches!! But within 5 minutes my room was ready. Check in was 10 minutes of that - loved it! When I got up to my room, and opened the door, it did slam into the mini fridge, but this is a new York hotel room. It is supposed to be small. But with the black and white motif, and the floor to ceiling curtains, it made the room seem a lot bigger then it was. The bathroom was small, but it had a window that could open, which was nice! And the toiletries were really top notch!! I was concerned when I couldn't find the ice bucket, but all you have to do is call downstairs and someone delivers it!! And the room has a doorbell. Which is also a nice feature.  Other little touches that i appreciated? Well - every other hotel I have ever stayed in has a bible in the night stand. This hotel had the Karma sutra! Now even when I came stumbling in after my NYC adventure, and my key wouldn't work - the front desk fixed it I all of 1.5minutes. The room service has sushi!! I understand why some people would t like this unconventional hotel, but for me, it was perfect!

After reviewing a lot of hotels in Times Square Area! We decided for this... we had a doubts, but when we arrive to the hotel... the we realize that we had made the best decision of our trip!, If you want to be in the best area in NY, you must choice this Hotel, has a beautiful and modern decoration, and all of the staff we really gorgeous! we had great night at this place!

My partner and I stayed at Night this past weekend for a much needed weekend getaway. Amazing location, beautiful room and very friendly staff.  Night provided the perfect atmosphere for us and we can't wait to stay there again!

This is not a 4 star hotel, there are very few services in the hotel and the size of the room is tiny. The bed was so small I couldn't sleep comfortably. I'm an average sized person so I'm not sure how anyone could be comfortable.

The rooms are comfy, quiet and dark. We have never rested anywhere better. We never hear another guest and the beds are great quality. Also the bath products are bigelow and equalled those that we use at home

While a little on the expensive side this hotel rates highly in terms of location! The staff are really friendly and the hotel is immaculate! Small rooms, but as you spend most of the time out & about this really doesn't matter. Very comfortable beds & good shower.... all you really need. The cost of a drink in the bar is shocking, but apart from that I would highly recommend this hotel!

The location of this hotel is second to none, just moments from Time Square and the interior is trendy and clean but I found the room to be small, the bed to be even smaller and the surroundings everywhere to be dark (including the room itself). The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and the room was clean and presentable.

The location was great and easy to get a cab in front. But...I had to call the front desk every night for a wifi password and my door never fully closed so I heard everything in the hall and light would also shine in the room. I also never had a full minibar. Not the best night's sleep.

Great place for young couples / singles on vacation. Not as good for business travel. I would recommend adding a make-up light in the bathroom. The rest of the lighting is wonderful...calming and romantic.

Great location for Times Square and theatres. Our room was very small. This was especially surprising as when we checked in we were apparently upgraded to a queen room!! Bed very small and very noisy air con.

Das Personal sehr freundlich und stets hilfsbereit. Sauberkeit hervorragend.I was really perfectly satisfied, pleased, content. Well i don`t know what i can tell it more than i was happy to stay in the Night Hotel.

We loved that this hotel was different! The beds are a tad short, so our legs were hanging off, but being a New York City hotel, that's not uncommon. So close to everything!!! Would love if it had a coffee maker, I need my morning coffee! Starbucks is close, though. We asked the staff if late checkout was available and the guy said yes and charged us.....the next day we got a phone call while we were out on Ellis Island, saying that late check out wasn't allowed, we needed to check out. We worked it out in the long run, but it was embarrassing and a tad stressful. Overall, like the hotel and we would stay there again.

just a block to times square, nice room, clean and elegant. i don't like huge hotels and the night is the perfect solution for me. many subway around the hotel. theatres restaurants nightlife are soon available out of the Night.

This hotel is literally a block away from Times Square...great location! Some of the rooms are small, but they work. When we checked in, my 6'2" husband and I ended up with a room with only a double bed. They graciously upgraded us to a larger room since my husband didn't fit into the bed. Thanks!
