Stayed one night to do some site seeing in the city after visiting upstate for a wedding. The hotel was an amazing experience primarily due to the atmosphere. Super cool decor and vibe. Was pleasantly surprised to have so much to see and do right outside the door. Parking garage was perfect and rate was good too. Saw many folks commenting on how it was so dark inside that they had to use flash lights and blah blah blah...they must have had vision issues, we never had an issue. It was darker but that was to give the feel of "night". With the lights above the doorways it is plenty to see with. The rooms were roomy and the bed was amazing! Will deff be staying again!

We had a pleasant experience with this hotel. We arrived a bit before our room was ready, but they were happy to store our bags while we explored the city. The hotel is a stone's throw from Times Square. All staff that we encountered were very courteous and helpful. The hotel had interesting decor, probably not suitable for children. The darkness of the hotel was nice, the rooms were a bit smaller than we expected though.

Night Hotel is a great place to stay if you are in town to see a Broadway show. The staff was wonderful, the room comfortable and well-appointed, the price was great, and it is a short walk to MoMA, wonderful shopping and some of our favorite restaurants. We were on the 9th floor, so it was fairly quiet except for some street noise (to be expected in this neighborhood), and we slept very well in the super comfortable bed. We didn't have a chance to try out their restaurant, Maple, but the menu looked great, and we plan to dine there the next time we stay at Night Hotels. We look forward to returning at some point and would definitely recommend it to friends and family.
user_name:
marykO1385DF
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We love the location of this hotel. We are able to walk to the theater and right to Times Square. The service is always good and we love, love, love being in the heart of everything. Again ... this hotel is about location, location, location.

My girl friend and I had no plans of staying in the city but we found this hotel last minute. It was clean, comfortable, elegant, and very accommodating of the last minute booking. The location is literally in the heart of Time Square and steps from everything NYC has to offer. They also sent up robes which was a nice gesture.
user_name:
sarahhN3451TH
Point Pleasant Beach, New Jersey

review_body: We stayed here for one night whilst on our honeymoon. we stayed here before, and had as great an experience this time as the last. we arrived late due to a delayed flight, but everyone was still so pleasant and nice to deal with. we got upgraded to the Penthouse which we were delighted with, even just for the few hours of luxury, it was great, with a lovely balcony. always worth a return visit! my only complaint is that you have to pay for wifi, which I believe should be free when you are a paying guest of the hotel. its the only hotel in a long time that I have stayed in that requires payment for wifi.

It was a very unique and pleasant experience! The room was set up exactly the way I expected it to be. My request for add-ins was granted, which was sweet and considerate. Our room was very cozy with one-of-a-kind ambiance, and most importantly, very clean. One thing though, the walls are not really sound-proof. I was jolted out of sleep every time a door closed on my floor, which kinda ruin it a little bit for me because sleep is very important to me.Overall, it was an awesome experience. I'm absolutely going back!

The room was awful. I have never stayed in a room that I could compare to this one. Even during the day the window allowed no light into the room. It felt like it was night time at noon. I feel that i was deceived by the pics they displayed of the rooms. Honestly they need to disclose up front that you will be pretty much in a basement type room. disappointing to say the least. The lobby was nice and staff was very polite. Feel like i overpaid for what I received!

The management was very accommodating and helpful. We had trouble parking and she was able to guide me through it on the phone. Upon arrival they upgraded us to a king room!! Which was excellent. Everyone was very nice that worked for the hotel. Also when we were checking out we had several hours left on our parking and they we able to hold our bags all tagged and kept safe till we got the car. Also location to Times Square was excellent

Perfect location in the heart of Times Square. Exceptional decor and ambience with comfortable beds. Staff is very friendly and housekeeping does a great job. The hotel even supplied an umbrella when it rained!

The ambiance was excellent. I wish the rooms were larger with better views of Manhattan. I had a view of a wall:(. I also took advantage of the free drink offer that was in the room by completing the brief survey online. I was excited to have my free cocktail before leaving the city the next day, but was told the bar did not open until 5pm.

we have been in the room 38 minutes until we understand that we make a mistake! The room where dirty and small.. The bathroom was even worse.We went to crown plaza and pay a little more but it save our trip!!!

Beautiful room. Trustworthy staff. Pretty small room, but very comfortable. Looks like sexy-lover decor. Ambience lighting was nice but in general it was too dark. Could hardly see to put my makeup on and lights couldn't be brought up brighter.

Actually your hotel is so bad from check-in until check-out. Unfortunately I paid 1781$ for four nights, it's impossible the hotel deserves that price, so I won't recommend it for anyone of my friends or my diplomat colleagues

Rooms are pretty small, but if you're visiting New York, you probably aren't spending a lot of time in your hotel room. The location is great, it's right next to Times Square, making it really easy to go anywhere around the city with the subways. The decor in the hotel was really different, but in a nice way. Along with the rooms being small, the windows look out to the walls of other buildings. So, don't expect a view (although, I'm not sure why you would considering it's a boutique hotel that's situated 50ft from Times Square). Everything that you would need is right there. Coffee? Starbucks is a 1min walk away. Duane Reade is right around the corner. Bars and restaurants a plenty. The staff are helpful, especially Alexander at the front desk. He was great, he sent me and my husband to a few fantastic restaurants we otherwise would have never discovered. If you want to explore the city a bit and get out of the bustle of Times Square, go to him, he's got some great suggestions!All in all, it was a great place to stay and rest our heads while visiting New York City. I would definitely recommend it others.

We were in NYC for four nights. Busy time with the Pope and President in town.The Night is ideally located in the theater district and is quirky with its moody, black and white themed decor.We were greeted with genuine warmth on checkin.We had an issue with air conditioning and our room was changed immediately (and upgraded) without issue. As if that was not sufficient, that evening we received a personal note apologising for the inconvenience and a chilled bottle of wine. All interactions with the staff (front desk, night staff, bar staff) were all warm and genuinely friendly.

Great location in NYC. Room was small, however, and had absolutely no natural light as didn't really have a window. Decor was interesting. Only ate in the restaurant once but in New York you probably wouldn't want to eat there anyway as there are so many other great options. Absolutely LOVED having access to the equinox gym nearby.

A friend and I stayed here recently for a short trip to NYC. It was clean and the location is great. It is small but many NYC hotel rooms are just as small. This one may seem smaller because its decor is dark black and grey. There was no view (just an alley stairwell) but I expected that from other reviews. The staff was always helpful and curteous. The a/c is loud but it was a white noise hum that helped me sleep.

Surprised by my husband for our first-year anniversary, a night at Night was the best. The hotel itself has a Gothic theme with black and white designs in the lobby throughout the hotel and guestrooms. We stayed on the 7th floor and the room provided comfort with a great location to the theater district as well. My favorite part was the fact that there was only one window, facing a wall; many would not appreciate this, but given the design and style of the hotel it was perfect; especially after a late night and the need to sleep in! Loved the bathrooms as well; awesome shower. Patrick at the front desk was amazing. He exuded fantastic customer service skills and was very helpful. I would happily stay here again when back to the city.

good locationvalue for moneygood bed room & bathroom size and cleanno breakfast or tea/coffee facilities in roomdimly lit roomcan be occasionally noisy from outside [room facing road]bell boy very goodyoung man at reception arrogant

I didn't spend much time in the hotel as I was on a business trip, but I was impressed by the quality of service, in particular by Patrick and Robert from the Front Office Team.Location is very central.

I would definitely recommend hotel. Stayed for 5 nights. Hotel lovely decor, very central and staff lovely. Room quiet small but think that's New York in general. Room cleaning very prompt each day. Will definitely return. E & C Brennan (Dublin)

I would definitely stay there again. The employees were very friendly and welcoming. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. Great family setting or just a little getaway with a significant other. Loved it

Our stay in the Night Hotel - Time Square far surpassed our expectations for a NYC hotel. The hotel décor was chic, the rooms were very nice (albeit room 34, which was ours, was probably the smallest in the hotel; however, someone else in our party had room 61, which was ample sized). The front desk staff, particularly Patrick, were great, and the on-site restaurant/bar was a steal during happy hour.

The place was small and cozy, but very very convenient. Once you get out of the hotel, around the corner is Time Square! I enjoyed the fact that everything is very convenient in our location and would love to stay again in this place!

Great night stay at Night Hotel!The staff is extremely friendly and knowledgeable Superb drinks, rooms are decorated well and the view is amazing. Top notch and best Times Square hotel to stay at instead of paying for a huge impersonal one

I wouldn't recommend this hotel. The bed is extremely uncomfortable, I sleep bad every night. The room is so small that there is no place to put your bags, so daily when you get into the room everything is a mess. The decor of the hotel is totally outdated.

Our stay was great we were close to everythingThe last day, Simo helped us to find a car to reached the airport it was very kindThe negative point was the noise, we hear a lot the others customers in the others rooms

A great place to stay at NY. Big plus with the fact that the place is next to Times Square. The team in here is great and friendly and make you feel welcome. The bartender and the receptionist were great. Definitely would stay here again. Thanks! Alan

Greatttt costumer service, we got there late at midnight on September 9th an the guy who works the late night shift was so welcoming that makes us feel at home. The room quality is good. The only problem was that our room was right next to the service room and it got pretty loud in morning.

The staff - courteous but not overly friendly, efficient in service though. The room - clean and comfortable although in need of some TLC, some of the furniture wasn't in prime working order. They also need some proper shelves in the cupboard, lots of hanging space but the safe takes up most of the 1 shelf there is. Its also very dark(needs a light) so you cant see what you're looking for. We were hoping the 'electronic activated billing' bar fridge could be emptied so we could use it to keep some snacks fresh but it seems they charge for this (quite astronomically) so we couldn't which was rather frustrating.Be warned - there is an electronic service light on the doorbell which overrides your 'please service room' sign you may hang on the door handle. We didn't know so our room wasn't serviced until we discovered it.The shower flooded every time we used it, That said we only slept there as we were out seeing the sights all day, from a location point of view it was great, very close to times Square.

I stayed at night hotel during my last visit to NYC. The personnel are friendly and professional. The bartenders are very very very nice. The rooms are tiny and very dark ( following the name). The location is very good. The restaurant is ok (sushi place). In overall I liked it.

Overall the attention of all the staff was outstanding, really was a pleasure staying in this hotel.The location is unbeatable, close to everything.The rooms are comfortable and the hotel facilities meet expectations.But most important is the care provided in the hotel, the truth that the staff is always willing to help you out, strive to make your stay a pleasant at all times.100% recommendable.

I was initially impressed with the pictures online and the central location of the hotel. I usually love discovering fun and different boutique hotels, but for the price that we paid the level of service and amenities was severely lacking. Our minibar was locked and unable to be opened. We were asked if we would like to instead have something sent up from the bar, and were charged full room service prices for two drinks. There was also no coffee or tea available in the morning either in the room or from the hotel. When we asked where we could get some, the front desk had no suggestions. Has no one ever needed a cup of coffee in the morning at this hotel? Also even though we had a queen room, the bed was too short for my 6ft husband. I could have stayed across the street at the Hyatt for LESS and gotten excellent service and a plethora of amenities. Would not recommend.

Hotel staff lied about the parking fee I paid $40.00 instead of $30.00, I got charged $5.00 for an expired mix trail mini bag the I left in the hotel room so they can see that I didn't even ate it....
user_name:
KellyMichelleV
New York City, New York

review_body: Room facilities were good .Reception was often understaffed. The provision of breakfast as part of the tariff would have helped .My original room allocation had a very noisy air-conditioner. .I was moved without argument Incoming calls to me were seriously delayed....

Amazing location, right on times square. It was my girlfriend's birthday so I asked for something special when we checked in. I was told we would be getting a free upgrade to a special room and we would get afew free drink tickets. I work in a 5* hotel in mexico and we make a real effort to make a special occasion special. This was an extreme failure ! Even though the personnel was nice they failed to deliver anything that was promissed. The special room was pure and utter Bullsh**, it was the basic hotel room with a queen size bed, not even a bath and even after asking 3 times we never got the drink tickets, the person failed to leave them out and the night receptionist didn't have the authority to create them. We got what we paid for a pretty basic hotel room in a great location, why promise more if you are unable to deliver? sad, as it really leaves you with a bad taste.

Great location. Very nice people. I am 6'4" 200 lbs and the bed was very small, feet hung over the edge and the room was also very tight for 2 people. Even for one person it was pretty small. But it was a nice little room. Could of used a small dresser. Bottom line, I did like the place, and would more than likely stay again when in New York. Thank you.

The location was super! It was within walking distance to theaters and great restaurantsThis hotel was friendly and helpful and the staff did a great jobThe rooms are small and the bathroom is not well lighted.The bed was too short.The room was clean. The refrigerator was in the small closet and took up needed closet space

The location was ideal!! In times square. Try Connolly's Pub roof top bar accorss the street! The rooms were really small. Could do with a bigger bathroom. The staff were friendly and helpful. Great for young couples.

I've been to Switzerland and this hotel reminded me of a similar one there. The room was perfect and clean. It was a bit loud because of Brazilian Day celebrations, but that was certainly not the hotels fault :) (the entire length of 6th ave. was closed off) . Very convenient location and great price too.

Yes, this is a good hotel to stay by the Times Square. You walk outside and you are in New York! Many places to eat around the hotel. Very clean, with polite people ready to serve you. The decoration was very dark for our taste. But, this is a Night hotel!

Unless you can afford the penthouse or suite, keep in mind the rooms are tiny. Great location and very nice staff! Quiet and comfortable. I have stayed a few times now and always enjoy. The best location if you are theater bound and great restaurants right across the street!

Very small hotel, small rooms. One elevator and it is very small, we should wait 10 min. Not clean and it is expensive. No valet parking. I booked via express deal and it was awful experience. I don't recommended it. The only good thing about it; its location.

This place was sexy. A bit of a tight squeeze between the bar and desk to get into the bathroom and I'm a small person. A great place to stay for the price. The hallways have a bit of an echo. The air conditioner was great...a bit loud, but what air conditioner isn't. The elevator did what it wanted. I gave up and used the stairs after the 3rd time it messed up. It was a nice conversation starter w/strangers on the elevator...I guess.

Booked hotel for 3 night stay.perfect location near times square, food in hotel was excellent and at resonable prices.Queen room was very clean, slightly small but ideal as only used as a basewould book again

Great location, really cool environment for someone looking for a stylish hotel at a good price. The bar servers are really friendly. They gave me free drinks but I forgot to tip so I feel bad about that.

No help with city advice, no recommendations, no security latch on door it was pulled out of the wall, no in-take fan in the bathroom which for the tiny size of the room is intolerable, theme was not as cool as I thought it would be.

Room is clean but very dark and small. It's awkward to put a mini bar in a small room, and it's hard to move around. The hotel doesn't have its own parking( $30/day). Wifi in rooms is $10/day.--------

Beautiful hotel in a GREAT Time Square location. The hotel is small (8 floors) and the rooms and notably bath rooms are tiny but that is par for the course with a location like this. Nice Sushi restaurant on site and attentive staff.

Great location and ambiance! Amazing staff.Celebrated my birthday there last month and everything about the Night Hotel was perfect...the staff, food, accommodations which included an upgrade to the Penthouse and ambiance. Highly recommend and will definitely be returning!
user_name:
Miriela R
New York City, New York

review_body: price was rite on a random Wednesday night i happened to be in town . Great location for tourists , it's basicly in Times Square , it's a safe place with helpful staff . The room was small but that is very typical in NYC . But the room was on the sexy side I liked it . It was different . In a good way . Great place to bring ur wife or girlfriend .

Loved this hotel! Rooms were cleaned everyday and always came back to everything tidied up clean sheets,clean towels etc.Lighting in the room was relaxing and the room was gothic chic and modern. Bed was really comfortable and good selection of channels on the TV. Shower was amazing.Google says there's a 6 min walk from the hotel to Times Square when literally you walk out of the hotel look left and Times Square is there about a minute walk away. Macy's is only about a 15 min walk and a 10 minute walk the opposite way from Times Square will bring you to Bryant Park where you can see the Empire State Building and Chrysler building.Starbucks is just a few second walk away and you don't hear all the noise from Times Square.Staff were really helpful and gave me a map and marked where the hotel was and explained how to use it and it was a god send the whole trip!They helped me find a bus to get to the airport and even advised me against wasting money on a taxi as it was only 10mins walk which was very true and saved me money.Upgraded to a queen room for only $20 a night which I thought was a bargain and worth it as the bed was super comfy.Already recommended this hotel to friends and will definitely be returning!

The lobby was nice, and the rooms were clean, good service by everyone encountered. Only downside was that the rooms were very, very small, as was the bathroom. Great location by Times Square, though.

wonderful hotel great location so close to the busy times square great friendly staff hotel itself is great so relaxing our bedroom was amazing if I had one negative would be if there had been a kettle and cups to make coffee in the morning then again I probably should have asked highly recommend

Dirty room No Space to store our stuff we had to put our clothes in our luggage AC very noisy Thé shower was dirty They charged twice for internet un thé roomThe staff was not very kind except Patrick

Good place only a couple steps from the center of Times Square. Small rooms but comfortable. Affordable price, liked the fact that they have a discount with a Parkin lot on the other side of the building.

Modern, clean & well located. Good room service. Near Times Square, but not noisy at all at nights. Many restaurants around the area, price was all right. Red Moon restaurant was a fine Japanese. Price/quality quite fair.

Great find in a convenient location with helpful, professional staff and a unique atmosphere. Everything was lovely and we will return to stay here again. Staff was attentive but not intrusive, all amenities were available, and the room was clean and comfortable.

Excellent experience at the Night Hotel. The staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. Location is key as the hotel is located in the heart of the theatre district. Made it easy to get to our show. I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone visiting NYC.

Great location, Great Staff. Sexy room but small. Room are Great, but air condition was very noisy.Good service from Staff and a Great location close to time square. Loven our stay here on our honeymoon.

The hotel design is very unique, never seen something like this before. It is simply amazing, the feel is very modern and clean. The hotel employee's are what makes this hotel special and in the right place. Great service overall. Keep up the good work.

A great hotel for our first trip to NYC. Located right near Times Square and the Theater District, which was a huge plus for us, as seeing shows was a big part of our trip. Robert at the front desk helped us out checking in and out. We did have an issue with the toilet in our room, but when the staff was unable to fix it they switched us rooms right away. I would have no problem recommending this place or staying here again, in fact we plan to!

Best value for money, your in the heart of times square. Service, comfort & outstanding staff. Highly recommended for anyone looking to stay in New York at a very competitive rate and fantastic service.

Loved this hotel!! Staff is outstanding (especially, Patrick)! Room was quiet and well appointed. Perfect location close to theatres and Times Square. Great Irish pub and cafe right across the street. Would stay here again.

I spent 2 nights at this hotel, and I have to say I enjoyed it quite a bit. The location was perfect for me for both business and walking around, and the room (though a bit small) was quite well designed. The only thing I did not like was the fact that you cannot store anything in the room fridge, but they do provide you with ice. However that's not the same thing.....

Stayed in the penthouse on 8/15. Gorgeous! I was very impressed. Will definitely stay at this hotel again. Loved it! It did have a stain on the carpet that was bright red but we definitly overlooked!!

The Hotel is not bad, it has got a particular design: Everything is dark and sometimes difficult to see/find things in the room. Rooms are small but if you don't need much space, they are just fine; bed confortable and bathroom clean. The air conditioning is very loud so you might have trouble to sleep because of that. Staff at the reception is very kind and helpfull and they explain everything there is to know. I personally don't like much this automatic mini bar, as if you don't understand well, you just need to take something out and you will be charged. The bar is ran by some nice and friendly girls and you will enjoy a drink there. Location is good, near time square. There is no closet in the room but just some hangers where you can hang a few clothes.

I was wrongly charged nearly $1,000 by this hotel for 2 nights’ accommodation. I contacted them to resolve the matter: explaining that I live in Australia & was neither in the USA nor planning to be and that the booking address was incorrect and the booking email did not belong to me. The hotel was completely unhelpful - saying I should feel lucky they decided to give me a small refund but would be keeping the bulk of the charge. So, I had to file a charge-back with my bank - who verified the incorrect details used and the fact that my bank records show I was not in the USA anytime around this incident. The case was then awarded in my favor and my money returned.One would think that would be the end, yet, despite the above - this hotel continues to aggressively pursue me for the money, filing claim appeals again and again. 7 months later, I am still filing papers with my bank to defend against the hotels actions. At the end of the day we both could be victims of fraudsters here, but if this is how the hotel treats people and the compassion they have then it's not a hotel I would ever want to stay at.There are so many great hotels around the area, why take the chance. Else who knows you might be the next to have a “ghost stay” at this hotel and spend best part of a year trying to resolve it.

Close to all the useful underground and 10-15 min by feet to penn station and grand central. Basically in time square. Good for enjoying the city. Personnel really courteous and helpful with tips and suggestions. Rooms: small bed (but we were prepared, we know in Times Square you cannot pretend more unless you pay). Room clean, normal dimensions perfectly fine for sleeping. It looks like there was more concentration on the style than on the functionality of the furniture, but for 7 days we could arrange ourselves in a good way.

Awesome, nice, clean and quiet. Easy check in and out. Friendly and helpful staff. Would recommend to anyone and would most definitely stay again. Great value for the location, what more can anyone ask for

We stay for 15 days and the staff and the hotel was perfect. Location, location.They make us feel like home and everything we need they provided very kindly.We hope we would come back soon.Patrick is the best

The room was small but clean and furnished nicely. The bathroom was great and also spotlessly clean. The room was super quiet, which was nice for a loud city!The front desk person was Patrick and he was really helpful. He also was bilingual and was easily able to switch between English and Spanish depending on what a guest needed. We'll be back.

The best thing about this hotel is its location. It is near Times Square and most of the attractions in NYC. One problem that faced is that the room we had was above the bar and most of the sound of the party was heard. But overall it was an excellent stay and to make it complete an amazing staff

Due a change on my flight I had arrive 1 night in advance in NYC and chose this hotel to spent my extra night. The hotel location is amazing - can you believe a calm street at 100 meters from Times Square? This is the location.. people always smiling and helping every time, nice (small) room (as every small room in NYC), clean and comfortable. Nice bathroom, shower, etc. It was perfect for my one night...

The entrance to the hotel is so amazing, as it's very sultry design sends out a quiet and relaxing vibe. This hotel is great for couples. The restaurant is also great for couples that want a romantic evening, the food and service is overall excellent.

Everything was good and the ubication was excellent.The Hotel is small but the rooms are well acommodate and allways very cleanits a good choice They do everything to give us a good guide in NY and the were very nice allways

Everyone was very attentive to my needs as i had a couple of issues, my TV stopped working and then i had to check back in due to cancelled flight. I was upgraded to a king size bed. Overall a very nice experience.

We had an excellent stay at the Night Theater District Hotel. Stayed in one of the two penthouse suites. Everything was great, the staff very helpful, thanks to Andrew and Christopher. See the picture for the bathroom, with two shower heads (it is a handi-capable bath) I was able to create a luxuriant rain fall shower. The bedding is extremely comfortable. Location is very desirable, we walked less than 2 blocks to the Marquis Theater to see Penn & Teller. Half a block to Times Square. The penthouse rooms access a tasteful balcony with a view of 45th Street. The room has everything you would expect, is interestingly and tastefully furnished (taste being an individual thing). The hotel is sexy and seductive, it's fun and funky. It is an experience to stay there. One we highly recommend for open minded adult couples. Warning, this hotel might not be for everyone, the theme is adult in nature. Part of the charm is the dark sensual ambiance of the hotel. Also if you are over 6 feet 3 inches tall you may have to sleep a bit curled up. If you are coming by car check on parking before you arrive. It's at Meyers Parking one block over on 44th Street, only $30 a day.

The room was small but did not intend on spending a lot of time in the room while in NYC. It would have been nice to have coffee in the morning. The location and length to Times Square great. Best part of the hotel is the staff. Amazing customer service from every employee

Great location! Close enough to Time Square, Rockerfeller Plaza & Theater District. Some reviewers said room was too small. We liked our room & thought it was decorated really cool! We were comfortable, slept well and had a nice shower! Friendly and helpful staff..especially Patrick at the front desk! He took the time to help us with a map of NYC. He drew out a route which we were interested in walking. I think we put in over 10 miles this day! Definitely would stay here again!!
This was a very unique hotel with exceptional staff! Located just off the very packed time square but in close proximity to most things. Rooms were a decent size for that area. We would stay again!

Beautiful, moody, well decorated and really comfy bed! Loved the bathroom and the food we ordered from room service was delicious! But the room was a little bit too small, and I think it was a tad too expensive! although it is New York so.... Great experience, would stay again if a better rate came up!

The room was very small but clean and priced ok. Everything in this area is small, but this room seemed exceedingly so - barely room to put down your suitcase and walk around the bed. Same situation with the bathroom. Bed was not extremely comfortable and the air conditioner runs pretty loud.Staff was extremely lovely and helpful. I think people should just know how tiny the rooms are before booking. All I did was sleep there, but it's still hard to handle after a long day (not being able to stretch out at all).

While the location is great, this hotel is extremely tired! The rooms are tiny and grungy. At one time, the finishes were very nice, but that was about 15 years ago. The lobby and hallways are damp, musty, and smelly. We decided to try PriceLine because we had heard what great deals were available. Well, we learned our lesson. Next time we visit NYC, we will stick with the big name hotels we know and love. If you are accustomed to 4 or 5 star, this is not the place for you.

Nice to be close ( quick walk) to Times Square and Broadway venues , but far enough away from the Times Square crowds. Room is a bit small, but worked for just the two of us. Staff friendly and helpful.

I went for business trip in NYC, and the hotel located in a great place, near to all places I needed to go.I guess that going for romantic/tourist trip I would even make better use of the hotel.The staff was really amazing and helpful, always offered to help, and gave directions to anywhere I asked to go to.Will probably come back again there on my next trip to NY.

This boutique hotel was artsy and fun! Mainly a black and white decor, it has a very sexy appeal. Hotel is very clean and the location in the theatre/Times Square area is perfect! I would stay here again!

First time staying in NY and the Night Hotel was Perfect. This hotel was literally in the heart of Times Square (Theater District). Please keep in mind every hotel is small,so it's very small but it was PERFECT. I went to just enjoy the weekend with my spouse and we had a perfect time. The hotel was nice and clean everyone was helpful and nice. This is an ADULT hotel, the pictures that align the walls are sexual so be prepared. It reminds me of a sex scene of something idk but it was a great stay I wouldn't look any further and I booked in advance from NYCGo.com and it was only $244 all together taxes and everything a night. And also if you are coming to Ny to sightsee please please please get on the GREEN NewYorkGoTours bus get the all city tour and you will b set no taxis or nothing!! You get to see every part of NY. And also our hotel room was on the 3rd floor in the back and we heard no noise the entire time.

Excellent!! The Night Hotel is a very nice, clean and charming place to stay if you go and visit New York City! The location is supreme, it's only a 100 meters away from Times Square! It's staff is very kind and helpfull!! We enjoyed our staying at this hotel very much!

I guess in New York, you really do just pay for the location. Pros:- Location, location, location. Half a block to heart of Times Square, one block to Times Square subway hub.- Room décor is kinda swanky with the dark wallpaper- Not AS expensive as some of the other hotels in the Times Square area- They brought us ice pretty fast when we asked for it (yes, I had to call this out as a pro since I couldn't find that much else)Cons:- Room is tiny. I found myself tripping over my luggage and bumping into my SO constantly.- The room furniture is obviously dated, since the theme is dark/night, which causes each chip to show up visibly.- Bed was really cheap, uncomfortable, and not well though out. They took an average mattress, and put a ~3 inch cheap memory foam pad above it. When you put your weight on it, the foam pad deformed. The best way to describe it is imagine sitting in the center and having the edges of the foam pad curl up. The result was a bed that is way too soft that you sink into, offers little/no support, and heats up. In addition, the mattress protector they used was way too small because of the foam pad they added, causing it to ride up all the time. Oh, and the mattress protector was pretty dirty in the corners/along the edges, making me wonder if they actually wash it.- Doors are made of paper. There was a couple in the hall talking one night at 2AM (not even that loudly) and you could hear every single word they were saying as if the door wasn't even there.- Stairs need updating. They're made of stone/marble but are sagging/deforming where people most oftenly step, making it easier for someone to slip. We were on the 2nd floor so we used the stairs often.- Still felt expensive for the product that we got...P.S. Be careful not to get this location confused with Night Times Square just 2 blocks away. We originally pulled up to Night Times Square and realized it was the wrong hotel after the front desk couldn't find our reservation. Was an embarrassing D'oh moment.

the rooms are very nice, but small. for 2 people including bagage is the space to small. the hotel, recepetion etc are very nice. the location in middle of broadway is excellent. the concept of the hotel is good, but very dark.

Are you a vampire, Goth or photophobe? This is your place. Extreme sensitivity to light? Totally color-blind? No problem. Do you go to Disneyland just to hang out in entrance for The Haunted House or Hollywood Tower ride? You'll never want to leave.The Night Hotel strives to be mysterious and dark. It certainly is dark. On a sparkling Manhattan morning, you can't see in the door. Coming in from Times Square at 10PM, your eyes have to adjust to the darkness. There's no colour used in the hotel décor. For some this is trendy or romantic. I found it depressing.My room had only one window facing a closed gap between buildings, far enough below the top that no light ever entered. Black and white bedding, carpet, black furniture and outsize thistle print wallpaper accentuated the gloom. The only colour came from what I brought in. At least the bathroom towels are white.The all-black shower and bath floor undesirably accentuated the dull brown dirt that is in every bathroom tile's grout. Here, the brown jumped out as contrasting colour; even the dirt is brighter than the room! I expect the bathroom was cleaner than many hotel showers but what dirt there was *showed* in an unexpected and unpleasant way.I cannot fully describe the odd psychological effect of my stay. The room should have been very comfortable: soft bed, quality toiletries, fluffy towels. However, the entire hotel was so dark, I couldn't wait to get out in the morning and held off until the last possible minute before coming back.I doubt I'll return.

The room was very cozy and very sexy. The bed was clean and very comfortable. We slept on the 8th floor so the view of the street and roof top restaurant was cool. We only stood one night, but from our experience the staff was attentive and very friendly.

The room and bathroom were very very tiny - but it worked for us. The hotel was in the most perfect location! The staff was most helpful - from the doorman to the front desk clerk. Loved the atmosphere! Will certainly stay here again!

I had a great time during staying in this hotel. this hotel is closed to time squares and shopping shops. the room is clean and very nice. the staff are very kind and helpful. worth of money. i will be back here again.

This hotel was great. The location could not be better! Right next to times square, subway stations, broadway theaters ect. The room was a little bit small but it didnt matter too much. Our room was always clean and the staff always friendly which is the main thing.

We had a great stay in the Night Hotel, greeted welcomingly by Patrick who gave us great tips on where to eat and attractions. Room was lovely but a little small. Didn't really matter though in NYC:)!

Staff was wonderful. When we would call with a question, someone helped us immediately. The location is fabulous, an easy walk to theaters, etc. When we presented your card to the restaurant down the street, they served us complimentary champagne with our breakfast! We enjoyed using your lobby to gather with our family for toasts to our 60th Anniversary. Thanks!

Night is located in the heart of Manhattan, almost everything that matters is on walking distance. Rooms are cozy, although bigger windows would allow enjoying more daylight. Service is flawless, and the restaurant / bar is also great!

I've stayed here several times on business. Great central location and staff is great. I wish the rooms were a little better lit. The concept of all black for night is great but need option for brighter lighting, but all in not a huge issue.

Personally I wasn't that keen on it. Location is great as close to subways and Times Square (if that's what you're after). Staff were good, bedrooms tiny, towels tiny, on site restaurant is average and there's no breakfast option available at the hotel. I didn't love it but I certainly didn't hate it - it's just average in my opinion!Have stayed in better for less money and probably won't return

This is a late review - but in light of my appalling experience with Hotel St James (opposite this hotel) the following year, I wanted to sing the praises of this lovely hotel. My husband and I stayed here in December 2013 for our honey moon. We absolutely loved this hotel and the staff. The rooms are small but have a boutique style and in December were very cosy. The interior of the hotel generally is very nice and we loved the bar so much so that on our return to New York the following year we returned on the day if our anniversary for drinks and to reminisce. Location is without doubt fab! Wish we'd have gone there the following year - its worth the extra money!
user_location: Newcastle upon Tyne, England, United Kingdom
user_name:
Katie F
Newcastle upon Tyne, England, United Kingdom

review_body: Staff was Very friendly and helpful. I can not say enough about everyone from the check in to the dinning to the cleaning staff!! Thank you. You were the best part of New York!! But we are sad for all the lives lost on 911!! The memorial made us cry.

If you want to be in the theater district, but not in the very center of the hustle/bustle, Night Hotel is great. It is a small fun well run hotel. Kinda tacky in a good way. I just wish they had breakfast room service. And I had to walk for 20 minutes at 8am before I could find a NY Times. My up-grade to a penthouse was awesome!!!

I booked two rooms at the hotel and stayed for three nights. Staff were excellent and we enjoyed our stay. The hotel is a walking distance to most of the attractions of Manhattan. Very good hotel.....

Lovely stay here... Loved the chic black/ white modern decor and romantic feel of the hotel. Received a Complementary upgrade... Alexander at the front desk went above and beyond. Alice and Faye at the bar/ lounge were exceptional. Try the CATCH sushi roll at Red Moon. King sized bed was super comfortable! Had a great view overlooking the city and rooftop bar across the street (don't miss this!). Would definitely visit again!!

My wife and I decided to go to a Broadway play for our anniversary. We live in Maryland. I found the hotel using an internet search using a popular search site. The hotel seemed nice and was close to the theater district. We were not disappointed. The hotel was a half block from Times Square but was very quiet. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the price was reasonable for NY city. At checkout we found Patrick to be quite a character. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Book your stay here and make sure Patrick Donnelly is working when you go. He will make your stay in New York all the better. You could not ask for a smarter, funnier, more knowledgeable concierge! Also, the hotel is clean and in a GREAT location. Ask for earplugs at the desk if you are not used to the noise of a big city. One note: If you have kids, know that the hotel decorations are of an adult nature...

We stayed at the Penthouse for few days and it was over all our expectations! The room which was in two floors was perfect with a huge balcony with a view directly to Times Square. Everything was clean and with the aircondition and the new kingsize bed slept we well even the city was still hot at the nighttime. We Can only recommend the hotel :-)

Will definitely return. Service was spectacular especially Patrick at the front desk. Rooms were quiet and I was able to get one of the best sleeps I have ever had traveling to NYC. Location was very central. Great stay.

My husband and I stayed here for one night. The room was decorated nicely and very clean. Staff was very helpful and friendly. The location of the hotel is very close to Times Square. We would stay at this hotel again!

Rooms are small (as expected) but suitable for couples. Decor matches the theme, some may like it, some may not but it is different which is refreshing. Location is excellent for everything NYC incl times square, Broadway, Rockefeller ctr, everything you want to do. A couple of blocks from the times square subway entrance (~5 minute walk). Right next to Starbucks if that is a prereq. Good NYC value.

Great place, great location, great rooms and great staff! It was a business trip but we will come back for business or pleasure. Patrick at the front desk was great and the ladies working at the Red Moon restaurant were great as well. the food was very good and affordable. we'll be back.

Stayed at Night with my daughter. Room was comfortable. Very disappointed I paid $100 for a "City View" and was placed on the third floor with a view of the building across the street. I won't do that again. Bed was comfortable but the noise from the street kept me up.

The hotel is in a perfect location and the staff is awesome. Very friendly and helpful when needed! Rooms are small, but very comfortable with a nice (adult oriented) ambiance!THANK YOU for a wonderful stay!

The rooms and lobby were very clean and tidy. The location was amazing and close to times square. Restaurants were nearby. The bed was extremely comfortable and we slept well! They did a nice job of making limited space feel open and welcoming!

Always a great place to stay!! The service is great the location is key and the lounge service was also excellent. They were able to get me my Broadway tickets and i was able to pick them up while i was working. VERY GOOD SERVICE>

This hotel has been reviewed extensively and is indeed a very nice hotel. But what really made our stay exceptional was the staff. We appreciated Ana's kindness and particularly would like to thank Patrick for his superb customer service skills. Thank you for a memorable stay!

Excellent and fun hotel! Great room! Great location - just ask for a room that doesn't have a street view - it was a little noisy. Great decorations in room and a very comfortable bed. Nice staff!!!!!

Night hotel is a great find. Reasonable price - chic! Would stay again for sure.Right by time square, and a short walk to subway make this a great location for theatre goers. Had great food at the restaurant.

The rooms are a nice size for NYC and you can't beat the location. If you are traveling for business and like a quiet room this is a great hotel. Décor is modern and chic. I've stayed here multiple times and service has always been excellent. This is a hotel I will stay in again in the future.

Found this hotel last minute for a quick night in NY, was very pleasantly surprised. Decor was great, rooms were a little small, but you are in the middle of a city and you sleep in a hotel room, how much space do you need. Very nice room, clean, great toiletries. We even got 2 complimentary cocktails in the bar for filling out a survey! food looked great but we didn't eat here. Staff were great. Had a great stay, very happy!

The rooms are very small but are like most in NYC so that's nothing new. They are very nicely furnished but super dark as well, so make sure to set your alarms because waking up here is very hard! Also don't remove anything from the fridge, even to store your own bought items. They have sensors and the staff tried to charge me for the items even though they were still in the fridge. There is free wifi in the lobby only.Overall a nice hotel which is extremely close to times square.

The artwork is risque. The staff is friendly. The rooms are probably average for New York but small compared anything in the Midwest. Definitely dark and chick. The room was less than half the size of the smallest room I've ever rented.

Enjoyed staying at Night including the room and interior decor. Iron and ironing board included in rooms, and amenities well stocked in room. Have to be a little creative with bed-side "full length mirrors". Of course, has easy access to most parts of Manhattan and an attentive/ professional staff. Will stay again!

Pros:The check in was easyRoom was clean, nice, affordable and the decor was very niceSuper convenient to shows and times squareNo bible in the room (thank you!) but instead a copy of Deepak Chopra: Kama Sutra and that was a nice surpriseStaff was super nice and easy goingNeutral:We were in a room that faced the street, which I liked. Some might say it's too noisy but I'm originally from Philadelphia and the noise was no worse than Philly - honestly you are in NY city, there is going to be noise most of the timeThe room we were in was a bit small but nothing to worry aboutNo access to ice but they will bring you a bucket of ice 24 hours a dayWhen you turned on the TV in our room it was super loud and the remote was having a hard time to change the channelCons:Refrigerator is weight charged so you can't use it for leftovers or to keep water bottles cold. There was a note that said there is a "restocking fee" (Huh?) of $30 to use it as a refrigerator. I would not want to stay at a hotel longer than a day or two without the use of a refrigeratorNo coffee maker in the room and I don't think there was one in the lobby either

Had a wonderful stay at the Night hotel. I loved the decor and the staff. Located in prime location near everything. It was amazing and I was very pleased. The only thing bad is this section that forced me to write more than I needed to due to the character counter above the review box.

Look up the Times Square location and that's where you'll actually be staying, which is nothing like this hotel. They switch you to this less than acceptable hotel without you knowing. We had to walk with our suitcases down a few blocks to get to the Times Square location Night hotel and was expecting it to be like this one, it reeked of cheap febreze, the style was completely different, and the room was tiny and filthy. We spoke to the manager and she did nothing for us. I was able to get one night free of charge but that's not what I wanted. So make sure you call them and say "I'm booking for this location, NOT the Times Square right??" Or you will be very very disappointed.

The Night lives up to its name in that it is dark inside. The entryway is dark, the lobby is dark, the bedroom is dark, and the restaurant/lounge is dark. There was a dead rodent on the floor of the restaurant which was quickly swept up by staff. A dead bulb on a table in the room. The people at the front desk couldn't have been more pleasant and helpful. The location - a half block off Times Square - is great for a theater trip. Room was very quiet at night, airconditioning good, plenty of hot water.

The hotel was great. Excellent location in the heart of Times Square. The hardest part was driving there. We drove to NY and once you get down to Time Square all the construction etc made it a little difficult to navigate. They offer discounted parking at Myers lot around the corner. The hotel itself had a nice décor, the rooms were clean, a decent size (for NY) and came with all your usual amenities. The elevator to me was very tiny, but I’m guessing it’s just a result of squeezing everything in such a tight space. They offered bag check so we could leave or bags there until later and there is a lovely restaurant attached in the lobby. I had two very minor negatives, but that is because I am a little picky. One, the décor being so dark made the lighting in the room poor for us girls putting on makeup. And two, the shower drainage was poor and I hate standing in water puddle. Had we been staying longer than a night, I would have asked that it be cleaned. PRO: Best part of our visit was Patrick. He was extremely helpful, friendly and quick with check-in. He explained close by sightseeing options and gave us a great tips regarding the Stature of Liberty and taking the subway. It’s been a long time since I have had such genuinely good service. He wasn’t just pretending. He truly cared about taking care of us and ensuring we had a pleasurable stay. As a result, I will most certainly recommend this hotel and will make it my go to when I return to Times Square. Overall this hotel was excellent.

I was looking for something different and this was certainly that. Perfect location for Times Sq, 5th Ave in fact just s good location to explore. Our room could of done with a touch up on the paint, tea and coffee facilities. However if you're looking for a flying visit and just want tiger stuck in, definitely recommended.

Our stay at Night Theatre District was awesome. Rooms are really nice. No windows really, but it's NYC so we weren't in our room much anyway. Staff is friendly, location is central to everything, and its quaint size makes it less busy than the big hotels, making for a cool refuge once you step off the busy Manhattan streets.

The staff was very helpful and kind, especially one Caucasian blonde male and one African male. They went out of their way to help us. The Caucasisn one mapped out the city and the other helped with bags.

My stay was awesome!!! It's so close to Times Square and all the fun that the City has to offer. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. The rates are reasonable and the service is great! And they have a nice restaurant /bar in the lobby.

maintained.though the double bed was rather small, mainly short to be exact.In addition, the temperature control display of the AC was faded and therefore we were not able to set the right temperature

I made last minute reservations and I was able to find this wonderful hotel in the heart of Manhattan. Excellent location, couldn't ask for a better One. Stilish and chic the only think I did not like is the fact that there was no free Wi-Fi in the room. I will be back

My partner and I stayed at this hotel between June 12, 2015 and June 18, 2015. The staff were fantastic and so very helpful. Our room was very well equipped with an extremely comfortable bed, an excellent bathroom and high speed WiFi. Thoroughly recommended.

I like both of the Nighthotels. Friendly staff and a nice & clean room. Great bed!What I find tough to deal with is the fact that guest' have to share the same elevators as HSK and other employees. Which means on peak moments there is no lift to use because only two for >200 rooms.

The hotel was very groovy. Austin Powers would have liked this place. Very convenient location to the theaters and next door to a standard fore, Bond 45, maybe the best antipasti bar in town. Friendly staff during our stay.
user_name:
Richard B
palos verdes peninsula, CA

review_body: I came to the Night Hotel Theater District in New York on May 30th and 31st. I had paid for both nights in cash. To my surprise, the hotel billed one night on the credit card I provided for security deposit. I called them for a refund ant told me nothing can be done. Poor service :(

Great hotel in midtown NYC, great service and very comfortable staying. The place though located at the center of the city, there is no noise and quiet and safe place. Convenient location and most importantly the space is so great.
user_name:
yiqianz2015
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Great stay for the weekend. Easy walk to Time Square, shops, food and theatres. Stylish and cosy. Good value. It would be better if there is a kettle in the room though. I would definitely recommend it to other friends who visit NYC.

I was not able to get a room at the Marriott Marquis, so found the night hotel to be very conveniently located and a good value for a room compared to others. Rooms are clean and well organized, just dark and cramped.

Very nice hotel. Staff was very accommodating and helpful. Rooms were small and dark (not in a bad way, just dimly lit, in closet, for example), but it was good for 3 night stay. I would recommend they put a small trash can in the bedroom and make WiFi available throughout hotel.

I love the hotel and its uniqueness. Very sexy. Service is great. Employees are fabulous. The bed is extremely comfortable and the location is perfect too. I would highly recommend the hotel. It is where I stay every year I come to NYC.

The hotel is a great hotel and definitely one of my favorites, it's right in the heart of Times Square, the hotel theme is very cool and the rooms are nice. Great overall worth every penny! the bar and restaurant are right near the lobby and the hotel bar was a great time nice bartenders and the prices are fair on both food and drinks have you complaints about anything.

This small boutique hotel is perfectly situated 30 seconds away from Times Square. We booked in here last minute at arriving at another hotel which we did not want to sleep in. The room we was given was very very small but the decor was lovely, we was just grateful to have a comfy bed and a nice hotel to stay in! There is a bar in the lobby which was good and stayed open till about 3am some nights, the food in the restaurant was also delicious!! I would say it is more for a younger crowd but would not say it is unsuited for families! (depending on room size obviously). There is a really nice rooftop bar just across the road in the Hyatt Hotel that I would recommend! Also the staff on the front desk were always helpful and friendly, as were the ladies in the bar and restaurant. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

The front desk was friendly and fast to check in. The room decor was a bit quirky with all the black, but that is what made it a fun place to stay. I personally enjoyed the darker colours it helped to get used to the time zone. The bed was very comfortable and laying down after a long day felt great. The room was kept very clean throughout my whole stay.The AC was the least enjoyable part of the hotel. It came on every hour or so to a loud thunk that woke me up. I did not sleep well because of it. On the third night I turned off the AC but then was so warm I couldn't sleep comfortably. I think if the hotel were to update the AC system it would be amazing!Also WiFi is not included despite the prices being very high - I spent three days at this hotel and spent over a grand. I kind of expected free WiFi.I think if the hotel fixed those two things I would rate it 5 star - and its proximity to everything is amazing!

Excellent location. Very clean room. Nice decoration. The AC is a little noisy and room is small (which is understandable because of the location). Will definitely stay at this place next time, and will recommend to my friends.

We had a great time in New York and enjoyed our stay at the Night hotel - it was very clean, comfortable and chic. Perhaps if there is any criticism it is that the hotel felt very dark at all times of the day. Also, considering so many other hotels in NYC have wifi included in the room rate, it was disappointing to see that this hotel is a bit behind in that respect and didn't have that offer. Even so, the room was perfect for our needs, the staff was lovely (everyone that we met was helpful) and they were all willing to offer advice. I would recommend that my friends stay here in the future - its a great hotel for younger travellers (20s) because of the stylish decor and the great bar and food downstairs. All in all, thoroughly enjoyed it!
user_name:
Carla F
New York City, New York

review_body: Great location in Times Square. Hotel is clean and has an excellent staff that are very attentive to all requests... This is the second time visiting and will be back again. Big bang for the buck !! Front desk kept sending bottles of wine to the room..

Very nice place to be with a lover I will visit again. I really like the dimmable lights. The only thing that could have made my stay any bett would have been a sub connection to the Bose raido........

A very nice hotel. Like most in NYC, small rooms. Decor was wonderful. Excellent location to Broadway. Very friendly staff that made you feel welcome throughout the stay. One day they had a problem with their internet and called to let us know - that was appreciated.Yummy chocolate with turn-down.Also, even though I booked for a reduced rate via Priceline, there was no difference in attitude or treatment of us. In fact, the staff is one of the best we've encountered in our few stays in NYC.Didn't use room service, but did have dinner in their Red Moon lounge.

The hotel is really just around the corner of Times Square, even so its quiet inside. Its a great place to stay when exploring the theater district and upper Manhattan. The staff is very helpful and made you feel welcomed. Besides the noticeable air conditioning sound there was nothing disturbing. A good place to sleep and relax from all the NYC action around.

The location is the best you can find. The rooms are very calm and the beds are very good.The staff do his best to help you. The bathroom is design and secure. We stay 10days in the hotel and we will come back next time we visit N-Y.

A hotel is only as good as the staff that is representing it. At the Night Hotel in the theater district, you won't be disappointed with how you are treated. Each staff member made you feel like you were the only guest they had. The hotel is very clean which is a huge bonus in New York! The beds are very comfortable. The only negative was the pillows.

Except for Mary, who was hospitable and kind, the staff were extremely rude. If she hadn't come to save the day multiple times, I would have checked out. The rooms are TINY, like 100 sq ft. Even the shower is mini. There was one tiny window looking at another building/alleyway that was covered by dark curtains. It feels like you're in coffin. The sheets and pillows smelled, the air conditioner was loud, and did I mention the attitude of the staff? The closet in the room had no light (or light anywhere near it) so it was totally unusable. I called down to ask about it and the guy at the front desk's answer was "yeah, that's the ambiance of the hotel..." The electrician came up and installed mini stick on emergency lights so you could sort of see what was going on in the 2 square foot box of a closet. He said he had told the hotel about the problem but they hadn't done anything about it. But don't worry--the bondage photography objectifying women throughout the hotel was top notch.The whole experience was bizarre and dizzying. Thank goodness for Mary.

The location of this hotel is everything! Right next to times square and accessible to all the touristy things! Hotel was clean and staff were lovely! The rooftop bar across the street is a nice place to have a drink in the evening

From the moment we walk in, all staff greeted us with a service attitude. Desk staff served as concierge and knew all the train, restaurant and theater information. Room on fifth floor was quiet for sleeping, just seps from the noise of Times Square. Special recognition, in order of contact with them, are Nick, Alexander and Daniela - and housekeeping staff.

Perfect location, very clean, helpful staff ....all of which made for such a fun time. Night Hotel is a boutique hotel which provided us with a perfect experience while enjoying the city for our short stay.

Wasn't sure what to expect before checking in! But it turned out to a beautiful and very comfortable hotel! A block away from Times Square and within walking distance to all the theaters. Fabulous win!

Probably more a place for young people and couples than for a business trip. The Black & White theme felt very New York! Great location, walking distance to everything in the theater district. Rooms were on the small side, but not bad -- the bathroom, especially the shower was not for a broad-shouldered man, but everything was very clean. I would definitely stay there again.

I couldn't believe how much space my suite had, both inside and out. It's unheard of to have a walk out rooftop deck as large as what I had on the outside of my room, especially in the Times Square/ theater district area. I loved it so much I stayed two extra nights!

This hotel is really great boutique hotel near Times Square. Yes the rooms are small but this is New York. The bed is amazing! Patrick at the front desk is very welcoming, and maybe my stay even better. Thank you great hotel would return!
user_name:
Patrick F
Patrick, South Carolina, United States

review_body: Excellent staff small room close to all you need food nearby All main attractions easy accessible . If you have any need just ask reception breakfast fast food stores all very close. We booked on line recommend you book early to get best price

Very stylish and little mysterious hotel. There's a lot black colour used in the interior design and result is looking good. Hotel rooms was really small, at least for two persons. Some people might also find the AC unit disturbing, because it was really noisy. Rooms was clean and room keeping did their job perfectly. Also the reception people was extremely helpful and fun. I would recommend this!

I booked this hotel on Priceline bids. Wasn't sure coming in but upon arrival even though we arrived early Daniela took our bags and sent us out to enjoy the town until the room was prepared. Arriving back we found her greeting us once again and sent us to our room. Please note if you are looking for big hotel rooms this is not the place for you. However, I feel more like I am in New York because of the chic atmosphere and cozy rooms. I have had a blast so far. Daniela is also very knowledgable to ask about the broadway shows.

It was an overall nice hotel to stay at for the weekend. Didn't like the fact that they didn't have valet parking so it took us almost an hour to fight through Times Square traffic and find the parking garage. The day staff was very friendly compared to the staff that worked the late shift. Room was a bit cramped but had all the amenities we were looking for. Would definitely stay there again if they added valet parking.

The hotel has a bondage room vibe and I'm pretty sure it's intentional. Dark, sexy and Tiny! The rooms are very very small not much space to move around so definitely not good for more than a night or two stay. Had I known b4 hand I wouldn't have brought kids to this hotel. Art on walls is provocative (very). This hotel is perfect for a couple that's feeling a little '50 shades....' is the best way to discribe this place. Staff is very nice and accommodating. Fast check out. Bar in lounge.

This hotel is very dark, meaning it's lighting is very low and it uses a lot of black paint and fabric in it's rooms. In fact, it needs to add additional lighting in the bathrooms to shave correctly. The rooms and bathrooms are quite small and the heater/air condition fan was excitedly noisy. The reason I did give this hotel 4 stars (instead of 3) was for its staff which were very friendly and helpful and it's great location for anyone visiting Times Square and/or the theaters.

Room and restroom was extremely small; I know things are smaller in NYC but a few extra square feet would have been nice. Poor lighting! It's nice that the room is so dark when the lights but with all lights on in the room it was still just a soft glow. It was great being so close to Time Square and the Broadway shows!

This is not a 4-Star hotel as advertised. Small, dark, cramped, dirty carpet, soap scum shower, noisy air conditioner. It is not child friendly. Luckily, the location was excellent so my daughter and I tried to spend as much time in Time Square as possible because the hotel room was so depressing.

We enjoyed our stay. Beware that there are two Night Hotels very close to each other! The hotel is very close to Times Square. Our room was very small but this is customary in NYC. Could use better lighting. But the bed was comfortable and the room was clean.

Great price, helpful staff and convenient location for the heart of New York city.Although the rooms are a little on the small side they are adequate for the little time we spent in them and the bed was about the most comfortable I have ever slept in.

Fun boutique hotel, though the décor is so dark one would believe that this is where all the NYC vampires stay. Hip and chic and the staff is really friendly, but putting make-up on in the black tiled under lit bathrooms was a bit of a challenge. Rooms are on the small side but I find that to be typical in NYC. Very comfortable, but dark! I had only a sliver of a window and couldn't tell if it was day or night most of the time. The sushi in the restaurant was great and the female bartenders were gregarious and a lot of fun for a woman like me who was often on my own. I would certainly stay here again.

Loved this hotel. Dark and cozy, with plenty of New York character steps from Times Square. Only complaint would be there in an effort to make the compact rooms as stylish as possible, there was no place to unpack or put your clothes. Do dresser or drawers aside from the nightstand, and a small closet, that accommodated a few shirts. But overall loved the hotel. Staff is incredibly friendly and helpful.

If you are searching a nice hotel in a perfect location to experience the city ... you just found it! Very stylish interior, nice people and valuable pricing. What else do you need to be happy?! +++++

Had a great time. My only complaint would be the rooms are small for a family. The location was steps from Time Square yet there was not all the noise and commotion. The front staff helped us pick a great tour bus line.

This is one of the best hotels with a perfect value-for-money, excellent location and small, but still cozy rooms and comfortable beds! Just 1 minute walk and you're already at Times Square. Friendly personnel. Free wifi. All you need at bathroom. Everyday cleaning.

Lovely hotel, great location. The room was clean, all of the staff were friendly and extremely polite, particularly Patrick on reception. Nothing was too much trouble for any of them they could help us with any requests we had and they were all very knowledgeable of the city and more than happy to help us with directions and/or recommendations. We didn't try the food or bar here. The unique design of the hotel was lovely and we enjoyed the music playing in the corridors (don't worry you can't hear this once your room door is closed!). The windows were big so we could see out a lot and we could open them for fresh air on a morning which I appreciated, (I have previously stayed in hotels in America which have windows that do not open). The room and bed were really comfortable and cosy. The bathroom was gorgeous, spacious and spotlessly clean. The wardrobe was a little bit small and would have preferred more lights in the room. Would also like to be able to use the minibar as a fridge without being charged but I think this is pretty much standard across most hotels now. I would definitely stay here again!
user_name:
Laureng5891
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: We stayed in the penthouse 1 bedroom. This place is so roomy that it is over 2 floors. Great to have drinks out on the terrace. Just close to everything. I loved that you couldn't hear any traffic outside. Best place to recharge and get ready for night out in NYC. Loved it.

The location is good, my hotel room was however extremely small with very little windows, very dark and had squeaking floors. Couldn't use the minibar to cool my water as that would cost me. I am 170cm tall and the bed was too short for me, which was very odd. Overall an ok stay, but just ok.

Certainly a one-of-a-kind, must-see gem in a super central location, with a cool and unique design, helpful and friendly staff who would always respond to requests immediately and quickly. The room was cozy and comfortable. One minor thing that could be changed was the minibar that consumed some space in the wardrobe. The black/white design is unique and truly sexy. The bar is a secret tip - aways a great place to meet nice people. I can absolutely recommend this place and will surely return - hopefully soon :-) !!

Great location a clean room friendly and helpful staff! Lighting a bit low but adequate for our needs. Better than a W Hotel will stay here again. Did not try food and the bar a bit lacking but not the driver for selecting a hotel. The convenience was important and short walks to Rockefeller Center, Hell's Kitchen, Grand Central Station, and Times Square was 1/2 block walk. A wonderful roof top bar across the street on the 54th floor awesome view. Thank you for making our stay memorable. We will be back!
user_name:
Linda L
Kansas City, United States

review_body: Location is superb, hotel is dark as other reviews mention but we liked the theme and there is adequate lighting if you want / need it in the rooms. We had standard room and it was big enough, we have stayed in much smaller! The bedroom door slamming / closing is seriously bad, woke us up throughout the night over our weeks stay and for that reason only we wouldn't return! The walls are pretty thin, street noise was no bother just inconsiderate guests which is not entirely the hotels fault. For us it comes as standard not to shout and slam around in the early hours but obviously not for everyone!

Room small but clean. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Needs more lighting in the rooms. Would like access to the fridge without having the minibar fee. Overall good experience. Would stay again.

A hidden treasure, great location, lovely rooms and great music in the hotel. We enjoyed it so much we have already booked another stay. If you like something a little different then try this hotel, would recommend it.

I booked the 45th St hotel and that location was printed on my confirmation. When I arrived, they told me they booked me at 47th St and that I needed to go there (even though my confirmation showed that I booked the 45th St location). They'd already charged my credit card so I had little choice. The clerk told me to call the manager if I wanted to complain. I thought that was rude and I didn't appreciate the inconvenience for their error.

Thought it was a very decent hotel. It was not far to walk to many spots and close to time square. I would stay here again. The rooms were clean and the bed was nice and soft. It's a very small room but I think all of them in New York are.

Very nice hotel very comfy beds but too dark in the rooms and constantly disturbed through the night by very noisy slamming doors!!Could go with a touch up and more lighting in the rooms especially by the wardrobes that are completely in the dark!!!!
user_name:
Lee I
Greater London, United Kingdom

review_body: This was my second stay in The Night Hotel - it is a very small and dark boutique hotel and all i really used was the bed. It has a lovely foyer and cocktail bar but there is so much just right outside the door that i really didn't use any facilities at all. The rooms are extremely small - you can barely walk around the double bed but then again we were seldom in anyway. It has a fantastic location just off Times Square and was surprisingly quiet. There is a starbucks two doors down which we headed to ever morning when going out and served us also coming back in - would stay again.

I like this hotel. I have stayed there a few times. The hotel is in a great spot - close to times square, central park, subways, etc. I've found the staff to be great - the service is very good. The hotel is small by american standards - but similar to many in Europe. I love the room decor and the small lounge downstairs. It is a great spot to go and I think an overall good value. Parking is a bit of a PIA, but anyplace in NYC really is. There is a nice garage a block over that offers a "discount" to hotel guests.

Great price. Great service. Bottle of Andre was in the room. Classy AF. I also really liked that there is Equinox access as well. It's easy to get in there and they will press your shirt for you. ----
user_name:
Nathan James F
San Francisco, California

review_body: Great room and great service. What a deal! Yes, I really liked it this much. My junior suite had a fantastic balcony and private entry. Patrick at the front desk was more than helpful -- he was fun. You cannot beat the location, and the restaurant's food is excellent.
if you like the time square area and don't mind bad room decor (its not sexy) you might want to check the night hotel out.what you see is what you get - and that's saying a lot in this day and age...
user_name:
Guy K
Tel Aviv District, Israel

review_body: When first entering the Night Hotel I was taken aback by the artwork in the lobby. Although no prude by any means the photos are a little more erotic than I've seen in any other hotel I've ever visited. As I told one friend, it reminded me of the movie "Eyes Wide Shut." Don't let first impressions dictate your stay, however. The artwork adds to the character this hotel is trying to present. It works with the style and decor.The hotel is tastefully done in black and white, and although my room could use a bit of paint touch-up, I was quite happy with it during my two night stay. The room was large enough by NYC standards, with a nice comfortable bed and modern looking bathroom, also decorated mostly in black. The fifth floor room was situated on the back side of the hotel, and very little street noise was heard, even though the hotel was situated just half a block from 7th Avenue.Kudos to the hotel desk staff, as all were very nice and welcoming. The whole staff seemed to be very eager to please. There is a very nice restaurant just off the lobby, Red Moon. Although I usually avoid the hotel restaurants, I decided to give this a try, since Red Moon specializes in sushi, one of my favorite meals. The price is also excellent, again, given for New York City. The sushi was above average and staff very accommodating. I've stayed in many hotels in the Times Square/Theater District and wouldn't hesitate to stay here at the Night Hotel again. It is very comparable to the my other favorite stays here in this area. My only complaint was the $10 service charge for wifi, which I avoided due to piggy-backing my internet by tethering from my phone. Many of the other hotels I've used in NYC has free wifi, which could factor in my decision the next time.

Hotel was clean. Room was comfortable,bed excellent. Wanted a king size bed but they wanted additional charge for that. Not sure why. I would stay there again. We were only there for 1 night so it was fine. Location was perfect for theater and dining.
user_name:
Ronald S
New York City, New York

review_body: BE AWARE THIS IS NOT THEIR "SISTER" LOCATION.
