I booked online expecting two bed's with 4 people and come to find out all rooms are one bed which made this uncomfortable and cramped beyond belief. i asked why falsely advertise the two beds, oh its our sister location so i meekly accepted it, there were no accommodations for me, even when i asked if we could transfer, no one wore name tags. overall was ok but i had to spend little to no time in room because it was so cramped!

I love the rooms, they decor is fun and they are clean. The front desk staff was rude upon my check in and not super helpful or accommodating. My room was not ready, but when i went back they were nicer the second time
user_name:
Amanda E
New York City, New York

review_body: With it's perfect location, literally just around the corner from Time Square. This hotel has everything you need to have the perfect stay in New York.When we arrived at the hotel, the most amazing receptionist (Patrick) made us feel so welcome!The room was clean and fresh without anything to complain about. We really love the black and white interior design.The service was fantastic from day one, and the service alone, will make us come back next time we're going to NYC.Thanks for a great stay!

Excellent location, no breakfast restaurant, helpful staff, walking distance to most of Manhattan attractions...rooms could be bigger and trash truck makes noise round 7amGreat place for friends or couple without kids

The staff was very friendly. The room is small, but it is NYC. Very clean with nice bedding. Comfortable mattress and great pillows. It is a great location. Middle of theater district, close to 5th avenue, 15 minute walk to Central Park. I would stay here again.

This is a really nice hotel, in a great location, just seconds away from Times Square. it has the most friendly and helpful staff. The down side is it's not very well lit up, given the dark theme, so applying makeup or doing any precision work is off the table. Depending on the location of the room wifi could be a bit weak. Also, the air conditioner is making an awful noise, I highly recommend using it before going to sleep, and only if necessary. But all in all, our stay was great, every request we had was taken care of immediately, and we felt almost at home.

Beds to small,beds good for some one 5 ' 7 '' or shorter.. Feet had to hang way over bed.. Rooms were very dark not chery and bright. Another words it was gothic. The Adams family would enjoy there stay there

We loved this hotel! The hotel room was quiet even though it is located in the heart of the theater district and Times Square. Bed was comfy. Room was clean. Daniella was wonderful and very helpful! If you want a little quiet after the chaos of Times Square, pick this hotel. Have a drink at O'lunneys across the way-great staff there.

We had an absolute wonderful time in New York, and were thrilled at not only the location of our hotel and how convenient that was to everything we wanted to see, but that we had a wonderful experience with the friendly staff at the hotel. This was our second stay now, and plan to return again in the future. Highly recommend!

perfect location (3min walk from Time Square and metro station), very nice and professionnal staff, original decoration and design, amazing bed, great sushi bar-restaurant, lights pretty dark but cool

Great location for anything you'd want to do in Manhattan, especially theatre and Times Square stuff. Otherwise, convenient to transportation in all directions. Rooms are pretty small, but I expected that. They are also a bit on the dark side but there is sufficient lighting. One thing I did not appreciate was the disco music pumped into the hallways (and which is audible in the room). If I want music I will play my own. I prefer they stop that practice.

The hotel was very good located, people working there very professional, but the room was really small with a very small window and with and horrible view.Apart of this, we heart a lot of noices coming from other rooms and the doors closing

This hotel is located only half a block from Times Square but is actually in a fairly quiet spot. The interior decor is edgy and the ambiance is nice. Rooms are dark with mood lighting. My room had a crappy view (faced a back wall, getting no sun light), but aside from that the room itself was clean and the mattress was really really soft. Complementary wine and chocolates was a nice gesture.

I only stayed here because it was the hotel I received after bidding on priceline. The rooms are very tiny, my guess is not more than 130 square feet. The location is in a great location if you are looking to stay near times square

It is a wonderful hotel, and the staff is amazing. I stayed from Sunday to Wednesday, and I was able to get a nice lunch recommendation each day. They were also very conversational, and polite during every encounter.

Fantastic hotel in great location. Style of hotel is cool and modern. Rooms kept very clean by staff. Would definitely recommend this hotel.When you check in they insist on a 400 dollar deposit so be aware in case you don't have the funds with you. Some staff at reception can be a little odd at times, ignoring your hellos etc but overall nice. Special word for Patrick at reception for his friendliness and great tips.

We stayed in the penthouse and loved the space! The balcony overlooking Times Square was awesome! The rooms in New York are notorious for being small, but with the two story room we felt more like we were in an apartment. Great 30th birthday! I would suggest only couples stay here as it's more for adults with the decor and the pictures of nudity on the walls. My boyfriend and I loved and and would stay here again! The staff was great and even arranged car service back to the airport.

Stayed here one night while getting away for the weekend to visit Times Square. The check in/out was very quick and efficient. Hotel staff very friendly. Restaurant had great food. The bed is soooo comfy and made me wish I had stayed another night! I wanted to take that bed back to Syracuse with me, it was that great! Would highly recommend staying at this hotel when visiting NYC.

We stayed at this hotel for a week. You absolutely cannot fault the location of this property (you are practically in times square). I would highly recommend going to the roof top bar across the road (bar 54) where you can enjoy a glass of wine with some incredible views. We had a few issues with money being stolen from our suitcase (so make sure you lock up good!) But the staff at the hotel were extremely helpful. They let use there phone to contact the airline and let us send a fax to the airport police - nothing was too much trouble. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel for the location and comfort.If I return to NY I will definitely be staying here again :)

the best of the hotel was the location for us, just next to times square and the city center, but without all the noisethe rooms are quite small but comfystaff is kind, cleaning service is perfectbut our last night before the check out, at 3 AM they passed the bill below the door which was so strange and they did wake up usthey also had charged us some stuff of the minibar which we didn't take, but we said it the following day while the check out, and they quit it

The location is great. The staff was horrible at check-in.Housekeeping was friendly. The rooms were nice minus the blood stained mattress and the stained sheets. We are frequent travelers and I am all about supporting small chains but I will not be back. Even after reporting that our remote was not working no one showed up. I hope upper-management makes changes otherwise this hotel will not be a success. Good luck!

This hotel is ideal location for the proper tourist. Time square 1 block away. It had a very stylish and cool feel for romancing. The rooms however are very small and it felt like a game of Tetris fitting out cases in the room. Patrick on reception was a gent, booked us in for dinner and recommended great places so top marks on the customer service side for Patrick. All round great value place if your looking for somewhere central and only in bedroom for sleep/romance.

Rooms are dark, dark, dark and tiny! good luck waking up on time in this bat cave! No valet. Good luck parking in that area and walking back to the hotel. The bar in the hotel is ok. Overall, there are better places to stay in midtown.

this is a nice hotel that won't break the bank. We enjoyed our stay here. Staff was friendly and helpfulRoom was clean and trendy. Couldn't ask for much more. Also the location is unbeatable. We will definitely stay again in the future.

I had a very nice experience in this hotel. It is in a excellent location, near the main atractions and transport in Manhattan. The room was very comfortable, big and practical, and the staff of the hotel is kind and helpful.

Good hotel, nice location. Close to many sights you have to see (Times Square, Broadway, Fifth Avenue, Rockefeller Centre). Nice people who are very welcoming and efficient! Definitely have to go back :)

This hotel has a great location and was value priced for NYC. I travel to NYC often and understand an average NYC room. However this hotel is Dark! I know the concept of this boutique hotel is supposed to be "Night" and when I booked it I thought gothic decor could be cool. My room (52) was at the end of a very very dark hall and next to the fire escape and I actually felt slightly uncomfortable with the low lighting getting to my room. The rooms are so small It was hard to get work done (business trip) and I could not see well enough in the tiny bathroom to apply makeup. No full length mirror at all (no room for one) added to the issues. The bed which was comfortable would not fit a tall person. I am 5ft 4 and had me feet hanging over. The Check in staff was great but checking out took 25 minutes. I would not stay again.

horrible, terrible to sleep in, so dark, so narrow to stay.but the location is the best to move to anywhere in Manhattan.It's not good to stay again.Next time, I won't go to this hotel.How 4 star-grade hotel??
user_name:
Jae Yun L
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed at the Night Hotel for three days! Overall we had a greta experience! Only some slight issues. First, they recently changed from valet to park yourself at a nearby lot. We didn't find this out until arrival. It was a bit time consuming, but there was a money savings with the hotel voucher. The room was very clean! The location was great! The style was sexy and awesome! The only other issue we had was ice. There isn't an ice machine so you have to call for ice. We called on the first day and waited 40 minutes and then eventually left for dinner, so warm before dinner cocktails for ice. After that we stopped by the bar ourselves for ice, not hassle, but could have a better system.Overall, a great stay and would stay again!

Well placed but a bit noisy hotel. A small and familiar hotel with only 8 floors and no frontal views from the room. Just the tallest floors have views to backyards and ligtning roofs of Time Square. Clean and stylish but poor light in the rooms.

The staff on the first floor was very friendly and accommodating, but the room-service staff was not. I tried to order room service twice and gave up both times. The second time I called down there the guy who answered was so rude I canceled the order. The hotel is pretty and trendy, but very small. There's only one elevator, it's small and the staff use it so you're always crammed in there with someone who's servicing the building. The property is not maintained well. It's not horrible, but there were things worn out or broken that should not have been. The room was tiny (even by NY standards). There wasn't room for a chair at the desk. My sink didn't have cold water and the faucet wasn't secured to the sink so I had to hold it over the sink to keep the water from running all over the counter and floor. And since there was only hot (very hot) water, I had to shave and brush my teeth in the shower to keep from getting burned.

The ambiance of the hotel is young, cool but there's no hotel personel at the lobby, makes you feel unoticed and it's insecure... Room size is a laugh and noise allnight long. Too bad... Traffic is hell in the area, stucked at times square

Absolutely fantastic location right near Times Square, clean, good friendly staff. We were very much helped with an early check-in upon a very early morning arrival from JFK. Small issues - room is cozy and so is the bed, room door is a bit thin so corridor noises are problematic at times, there's also only one elevator which is kinda slow. Also no free wi-fi in rooms. Otherwise, we'd recommend to anyone due to perfect location.

This is a great little boutique hotel right beside Times Square. There are plenty of restaurants and bars on your doorstep too but be prepared to pay a little extra seen as it's Times Square and all. The hotel decor is dark and sophisticated. We didn't eat in the hotel's restaurant but the menu looked very nice. Rooms are bigger than I expected from reading other people's reviews. One thing I do wish they had was some kind of stand to put your suitcase on as they took up a bit of space lying on the floor. Also they could really do with a light in the wardrobe, I couldn't see a thing. Beds are SOOO comfortable and really big, I loved the bed I would say that if your a light sleeper ask for a room away from the front of the hotel as it can be very noisy. There is a lot of construction work going on outside at the moment too which woke us up most mornings. Don't let these things put you off though as the Night Hotel is great. If you need any recommendations too make sure to ask Patrick on reception, he's great and suggested some really cool restaurants.

Great location! But besides that, not much good to say about this hotel as there is much better for the same price, just a few blocks away. The room was small, the a/c incredibly noisy, and the service very average.

Enjoyed our stay here. We liked the black and white modern theme. Comfortable, clean rooms even if slightly small. The only thing the room lacked was a coffee maker/ kettle. Excellent location. Helpful staff. Great value for money.

This hotel is a steal in a prime midtown location. It seems like they're trying to be a bit too edgy with the decor to the point of tackiness - case in point the tubular lighting underneath the bed - but overall it's a refreshing change from the big chain hotels. Also, the rooms are relatively spacious (by NY standards), and the beds are incredibly comfortable. I would definitely recommend it!

Like the decor and the location however the rooms are small! The room was very dirty but I was only staying for one night so I didn't make a fuss. Patrick at the front desk was very friendly and helpful!

Had a wonderful stay. Very clean room. Street side too noisy for my taste but staff was very accommodating and put us on the quiet side. Great location. Decor is amazing. The staff was very friendly. :)

Small room but cosy and good location...Do not use the fridge, it is not free...Very good bed and there is a lot of channels...No view and too dark...Wifi only in the lobby..The hotel and the room are clean...

Love the decor! Rooms were very comfortable and this is a great spot for first time New York tourists! Would definitely come back again. The food was great in the lounge and all the staff are VERY pleasant!

nice hotel. The only problem for us was the lack of a breakfast. Good location close to Time Square. Rooms are small but nice, the bed is very comfortable. A pleasant detail: the weather forecast left everyday in the room.

Our room has one Queen bed, but is much smaller than a regular hotel room and we did not have a window. Though, everything you need is there and it's great for my daughter and I. I must say that the black & white decor is so modern, much nicer than other hotels. If you need a room just close to Times Square and need a bed just to sleep, this hotel is perfect.

Really tiny but at least clean room. Location is very good - footsteps away from Times Sq. Street is surprisingly calm but the air conditioner in the room was very noisy.Booked via booking.com - caused only problems - hotel did not have any information (billing, personal. etc) upon arrival. Email of booking.com said my room was non refundable and prepaid - hotel said it was not charged yet and asked me to check my bank accounts. Upon checkout wifi was charged in the first place (which should have been free when booked via booking.com). Overall location is very good, hotel is okay but not more, staff is not too friendly... Seem to have some communication difficulties with booking.com.
user_name:
Leon K
New York City, New York

review_body: I booked this room through Orbiz. The place is kind of mysterious cause it's so dark everywhere. The rooms was small as are many hotels in the city. I received the King size bed and was very pleased. Everything was comfortable. Bathroom is tiny but very efficient. Good shower strength with good hot water.I enjoyed the stay.
user_name:
josephy91
Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

review_body: I loved the atmosphere at this chic hotel. We (BF and I) stayed in a King room and the bed was so lovely. The room was fairly dark, however I found that to be really helpful when we wanted to get some rest from the busy streets of Time Square. Speaking of, the location is perfect. Time Square was literally around the corner. There is construction across the street and we had a room facing the outside so there was a little disturbance in the AM but nothing too crazy. I would definitely stay here again.

This hotel is clean and tidy but is called The Night hotel for a reason! The rooms are so dark i couldnt see to put make up on or even if my socks matched!!! There was no natural light in our room as our window was blacked out.Most of the staff are helpful. Location is good and just off of times square.This hotel is pretty average seeing as the cost is relativly high.

This hotel is so cute! My friend and I stayed just for a night, and though the room was smaller than the average hotel room, it was perfect for us because we weren't in there long. Decor is lovely, very friendly staff. Right around the corner from all the action of Times Square. Will definitely be staying here again!

Went through to much of a hassle upon check in, there were hidden fees I was not aware of before check in, if I was told about them beforehand no issue would have occurred. My stay at the hotel started with a bunch of drama that wasn't necessary. The manager kinda kept her cool but honestly felt she cared less about my situation, the room itself was nice, kinda small but we made due. Only thing I wished was not to have dealt with so much stress from this hotel. I wish my stay was better if I could do it again I would but probably with a different hotel. I had such high hopes, and it was my birthday so I was looking forward to a great time but the stress I recieved upon arrival made me want to just walk out and never look back
user_name:
Alice L
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed here with my gf for two nights as our get away. It is a wonderful location. Friendly staff. I loved the room. On the small side. I stayed in the room with a king size bed. The beds were very comfortable. I felt at home. Such a fun trip. I will stay here again I loved it.

Gothic chic boutique hotel. Very cool decor. Adult atmosphere. Small rooms, but have all the necessities. But make sure to bring a lighted makeup mirror, as the bathroom lighting is not ideal for makeup and a flashlight for the closet!

Great location...just few seconds walk from Times Square, but far enough from all the noisePerfect for leisure or business travelers. very good bar/lounge on the lobby ( must to try is the Red Tartar )

Great location. Very quiet for a great night sleep!!! I would go back again and recommend it to others!! Price was amazing and it was walking distance to all of our activitiesClean and quiet. Near great restaurants!!

With its cool black (& white) theme you have to know it's here or you'll pass right by it unnoticed with it's alley-width facade. And what a shame that would be! Stepping inside it has a sense of chic, European with a young, friendly, helpful, and professional staff. Rooms are big city average (read small) but functional and adequate. Our room was clean and comfortable with all the amenities you could need. There is an excellent restaurant in-house that is Asian themed and mostly sushi. There's also a lovely little bar where you can get a cocktail. Super location for a visit to Time Square or attending a Broadway play. Easy walk to Restaurant Row. Good for couples but would be a great choice for a single traveler. Excellent price point-great value for the features and location.

This was a girls trip and we had a wonderful time. This location was very accessible to many bug attractions. Staff was so helpful that they gave us their phone numbers in case we needed something while we were out. They all went way out of their way to help us out. We loved it!

Great location! Very boutique, chic vibe. Lots of mirrors, black and white furnishings with a sexy edge. Dark interior. If you are looking for a spacious hotel with large rooms and amenities this is not for you. The rooms and beds are small, as most rooms are in this area. However, who is spending a whole ton of time in their hotel while in NYC? It is clean. The staff is very helpful and efficient. The vibe is cool and edgy. Did I mention the location is great? I would recommend to couples or single travelers looking for a trendy and comfortable/clean hotel in the middle of everything. Would not recommend to family groups or people traveling with children as the rooms only have one bed with limited space. Overall had a great experience! Noise was not an issue. The room was kept very neat and clean over the week we were there. Hotel has a great car service for getting around town or back and forth to the airport and will make the arrangements for you.

The room is small, but it`s fine for I`m the only person. The service is also good. But I was charged 10$ for that free internet access every day. It doesn`t make sence. Also, the room is a little bit noisy.

Near Times square and several monuments mme tussaud, Empire state, grand central terminal, rock Feller center and so on...A very good location to visit Manhattan Quiet room and very clean but it was a little small..... We will go back !!!

This hotel is very central. It is in a great location for easy access to theatre, restaurants and shopping. It was very clean, comfortable and quiet. I have stayed at a number of hotels in the Times Square/Midtown West area and think that this is one of the better hotels in its price range. My only recommendation would be to put lighting in the closet. The room itself is dark and it was difficult to see in the closet.

Loved the ambiance of the night theme with its dark hues romance and mystery. Classy and modern with the basic needs provided. The room was immaculate.. we always had fresh towels, turndown service etc. yet we never saw a maid, cleaning carts or evidence of one anywhere. One improvement i would suggest is to create more storage space in the bathroom area for toiletries etc. The closet smelled very musty and hence I wouldnt hang my clothes inside. Robes were beautiful and very comfortable but a second one would be perfect (maybe even some slippers too :)

This is a really nice hotel. If people are disappointed by the room size, they are delusional about what it means to stay directly IN TIMES SQUARE. Very modern and extremely friendly staff! I would definitely stay here again.

Steps away from time square, definitely a good value for the money. When I checked in a was greeted warmly, check in was very smooth and my requests were accommodated. The hotel has a nice bear and a restaurant. The rooms were modern and clean.

Its overall good experience. Only complaint is the bed was too sof and loud outside because of construction. The staff was friendly, it is really hard to get a cab to penn station because it is too close and no cab wants to take you.

I found a great deal through Trip Advisor for two nights at the Night Hotel. It's literally a half block from Times Square! This is a great boutique hotel that is decorated in gothic-style black and white everywhere. It has a sexy ambiance and the rooms have cool mood lighting under the beds. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I had an awesome time hanging at there cool bar talking to the bar/restaurant staff. I love themed hotels and I also like how it is small and tucked away in the big city. There is nothing bad to say about this place and I will definitely stay here again when I come through NYC. Don't hesitate on this hotel. A great experience!

The overall feeling of hotel was very clean and fashionable. It really was!!!Especially, the location is really nice!!Alao, the agent helps me having very early blackfast!!!!!Hope to visit again!!See you later new york!!

The Hotel is located right in the Center of Theater district, but in a quite street. So the right place to explore the City. Only if the rooms were bigger and better maintained, Towlrag, Toiletpaperholder came of the wall.....But still, a great place to stay

We couldn't have been happier in our choice! This hotel was super clean; the staff was excellent. Everyone working there were kind, welcoming, and warm. The beds were comfy, and the rooms were very stylish. We can't wait to return!

The location was AMAZING! Less than a block away from Times Square and right in the middle of the action. However, that's about all this hotel had going for it.My biggest issue with the hotel was the housekeeping staff. We were barely in the room so there was very little need for housekeeping. Since we kept many personal belongings in the room, when we left we put our "do not disturb" sign up. A couple of times when we were in the room sleeping late the house keeping staff blatantly ignored the sign and tried to force entry in the room. Had it not been for the dead bolt they would have walked in on us several times. There was even a very awkward exchange that lasted at least 2 minutes with a house keeping attendant who tried to force herself in our room when we were half dressed and I had to convince her that I did not need any service.The worst part of it all was when we came back from lunch and caught two housekeeping attendants in our room(despite the do not disturb sign). They were very nervous when we caught them walking out. Their excuse was that we had supposedly called and requested service(which we didn't). The thing about it was, when we caught them, they were leaving the room and even if we had called for service, nothing had been done in the room when they were leaving out. The manager never even got back to me when I called to complain and they gave me some bad excuse but never truly explained what they were doing in our room.It wasn't bad enough to ruin our trip but it came close. The hotel is tiny and dark. There is no color anywhere and everything is black and white. There is one, very tiny elevator that can't fit more than 3 people.The rooms feel more like a dorm than an actual hotel room. Our room had a tiny window in the corner with no view at all. You have no idea of what's going on outside until you actually leave the hotel. The room was very small and a bit dirty. There were no bugs or anything but the white in the black and white decor had seen better days. The carpet was not longer white, but a dingy cream color. The same goes for the white in the very tacky wallpaper. There was a big orange stain on the carpet in the corner. There is no dresser, no microwave and no fridge in the room. There is only a motion-sensored mini bar that is stocked with overpriced drinks and alcohol. We took a beer out for a while to make place for our water and the hotel tried to charge me $10!The beds were comfortable but there was a weird feather-filled mattress cover that was super uncomfortable because many of the feathers were poking through. It felt like a bunch of toothpicks.Where most hotel rooms have a Bible or at least magazines this hotel had a weird sex book in the drawer. Just one more thing to add to the weirdness of this place.The bathroom was tiny as well and only had a shower.There was free wifi, which was a perk I believe since we used booking.com but I believe the wifi for all other guests was $10 per day.Got it for a great price and can't beat the location but I will never stay here again. They try to be hip but you can't beat class and comfort.

The location of this hotel is excellent, and although the decor is cheesy, at least it has some personality. The big problem I had with this hotel is the beds. First its impossible to get the room the right temperature, you have to choose between too hot or too cold. The real problem is that somehow the beds are 6 inches shorter than a standard bed, and have metal bedposts. As a result, I was woken up constantly during the night when my feet touched the freezing cold bed frame. My poor sleep really hurt my vacation experience. I feel bad complaining about such a small thing, but I've never had this problem at any other hotel (I'm an averaged sized guy) and I've stayed here twice (due to priceline's name your own price) and I had the same problem both times.
user_name:
Eric S
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Lobby and hotel were very cool. Room was small but well appointed. No gym onsite. Took a long time to check in and to check out. A small bag of garbage from my take out dinner the night before wasn't taken away when the room was cleaned. I got an amazing rate I found on Trivago but I probably wouldn't stay here again if the rate was normal price ($130 or more). One night it was hard to sleep as someone was having a loud party down the hall.

Extremely small room and bathroom. Waited an extra two hours to check in since the room wasn't clean. No fridge to store my food or drinks in. Place definitely needs a renovation. Alcohol is $14 a glass. Only good thing was that its very close to Times Square. Doors and walls are very thin. You can hear everything that goes on. Promised a street or city view but the only view I got was of the fire escape. Bed is very cheap and uncomfortable. No tub, only shower.

The hotel was great, and the staff was excellent! Free WiFi in the lobby, location meant easy access to everywhere in New York. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Patrick from the front desk was very helpful and recommended a great place for breakfast upon our arrival.

Super location, clean, tidy, nice room, cool and unique decor, very friendly and helpful staff - nothing was too much trouble. Food good too. Peaceful stop over just off busy Times Square, guests should also try the Night Hotel's blackberry and cranberry infused vodka cocktail - delicious!

Great location and fantastic staff.Think the rooms were very small and a bit run down(particularly the bathrooms, could do with a re fresh and very dark )Heating system very noisy.Had to turn off at night.

My girlfriend and I have visited the Night Hotel four times and have always enjoyed our stay. Service is excellent, staff and amenities top notch. It is an excellent boutique hotel and I recommend it for those who value quiet and relaxation within a stone's throw of Times Square and the Theater District.

Great Hotel! Small but great location. I love New York and I am definetly staying in the NIght Hotel next time I go. The service is great. We even got a free bottle of red wine with our room. Great restaurant.

Great place to stay while in NYC. Close to everything! Great customer service, especially Ana!!! Only one block from the Belasco theater where we went to see Michael C. Hall in Hedwig & the Angry Inch. Awesome play! Great hotel! Great trip to NYC!!

This hotel is a good standard, clean and comfortable. It is a great location as just around corner from Times Square. The staff were polite and helpful.The only problem is it only has one lift and it broke down the morning we were leaving, but they did send somebody to assist in carrying our bags down. I would stay there again.

We stayed one night for our anniversary, this was the best location we could have gotten, steps away from shopping, food, and entertainment. The service was excellent, they greeted us warmly, when we came to the room it a smell of smoke, we called the front desk, they quickly changed rooms and even gave is a upgrade while room service went to inspect who was smoking. The room was very clean, and had a comfortable bed. There room has dimmers for the lighting and lights from under the bed. The only downside was: tiny rooms with views of a brick wall.
user_name:
Tzvi F
New York City, New York

review_body: Staying at The Night Hotel is always a pleasant choice. Wether you're staying for the night or a couple days the sexiest hotel of New York is a great call! Friendly staff, amazing room and great decoration.

I loved the hotel, quiet, confortable and the people were always friendly. I have to say that everything worked perfectly. It's like an oasis of peace near the noisy Times Square. I definetely will be back :-)

I went for a long weekend to Night Hotel and it was truly worth every penny spent. We were in the perfect location for everything, Times Square literally around the corner! The hotel staff was helpful with everything we asked and the drinks at the bar were great. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, especially couples looking for a getaway.

we were glad to stay in your hotel, great location, nice and original decoration, efficiency of staff etc everything was perfect for perfect vacations except maybe the noise from the heating/cooling system

Hotel was nice. We stayes in a king room which was small but cute. Someone in our floor was clearlyrics smoking pot because the whole floor smelled like it and it seeped into our room Which was annoying. The elevator was the other issue we had. It always took forever to get to our floor. But other than those two things it was nice.

Warning: there is no coffee in this hotel. Gregory's Coffee on 44th is a great cup but I would have liked to stayed in my room a little longer. This is a nice NYC escape. The rooms are dark and block out the street noise. My room was near the elevator (which is very slow) and the noise of people waiting was distracting. Plus the cleaning crew starts early and because the room door isn't soundproofed, can be disruptive. But the hotel is centrally located near Time Square and the people who work there have great food suggestions.
user_name:
Julia F
New York City, New York

review_body: Staff are extremely nice, however for $199 a night for the cheapest room...this was definitely not a Hyatt or Marriot of equivalent price. Loud A/C units, in multiple rooms.SLOW wifi is $10 per night.$129 a night would be ok, but...lack of amenities..

This is truly what it is, a hotel in a great location. I would reccomend if you dont plan to stay in your room for anything other than sleeping, this would be your hotel. I stayed here for buisness and this is exactly what I did. Just slept here. My first room was really run down, so they moved me to a "fresher" room, which was in better condition, but still not to the standard that I think a "Boutique" hotel would be able to truly use this name. The decor/set up is nice, with a cute bar tucked in the back of the lobby area. I would say this place is 3 stars, this is largely driven on the location and price point. Until the rooms were fully updated I dont think I would stay or personally reccomend this hotel just yet.

I went to NYC with some friends who hadnt been so I choose to stay at the Night Hotel for its proximity to Times Square. I love this place! It's sleek and modern, 2 things I love in a hotel. Walking distance to everything. Of course jumping in a cab or catching the subway will get you to the east village (or wherever you're trying to go) in a snap. Will definitely book again if I need to stay in this particular location of Manhattan.

excellent location. Some staff friendly. Excellent japanese restaurant in the hotel.I did not like the noise heater and the fact that tjere is no heat in the bathroom. Very cold in New York in February
user_name:
Carmen M
Santiago de Compostela, Spain

review_body: The location is perfect, like most hotels in New York rooms are too small but our stay was pleasant, the decor is eccentric and original, since you enter you imagine you walk into a bar, the staff very friendly, definitely we would go back.

We stayed here as the first part of our honeymoon. When we arrived there had been a mix up regarding payment as we were originally staying at a hotel across the street. Our booking had been moved due to renovations and payment hadn't been received, between the receptionist and the manager they had resolved the issue within the hour and for our inconvenience they gave us a voucher for free cocktails in the bar. I'm so glad our booking got moved to the Night hotel, it's a fantastic location to Times square, the staff are friendly, and while our room would have benefited from a lick of paint it was very clean, spacious and the bed was extremely comfortable. It is a perfect hotel for couples.

First of all, the location is excellent - in the heart of Time Square and the Theatre District. The hotel is clean, the staff congenial...but it is sooo dark! It is just not our style of hotel - the rooms are very small and it really is like "Night" inside - the lobby is dark, hallways are dark and rooms are dark and quite gothic. All this is fine if you like that style of hotel. One word of caution if you have a car...we ordered the car after returning from breakfast and the desk offered to call our room when the car was ready (expect 20 minutes). After 30 minutes we decided to wait in the lobby for it. The desk called again and said it would be a couple of minutes. after 10 more minutes, I decided to go outside and there the car was double parked and the attendant quite upset that he had been there for 20 minutes waiting for us!

I typically recommend this hotel to people in fact i had to travelers who decided to stay here the same i did last week. It did not seem the hotel was completely in sync. There was a flood in the lobby (not their fault), my room on a couple of occasions was not even cleaned our new towels. Plus we asked for the wine/chocolate package and we did not receive the wine or chocolates once during our stay. the heater was super noisy and you could hear it from the hallway. I like everyone who is there, they are very nice. I have never had a bad experience here, however I am hesitant to re-book again, and maybe try something else new nearby later this year.

Great service, great rooms, great look. Perfect location, don't look anywhere else. I have stayed twice and will stay again, very personal service. Sexy modern hotel with great beds, you will get a good nights rest.

Good location, right off times square. Lots of good bars accross the road. good value. Friendly staff. I have stayed there before and would stay there again.Rooms are small but so are most places around times square.
user_name:
Andy P
Pennsylvania Dutch Country, Pennsylvania

review_body: This hotel was beautiful. Nice employees. Complimentary drinks from the bar, comfy bed, clean room. The only thing is the hotel was too dark. You could here people slamming their hotel room door which was annoying at night and it was kind of hard to sleep when you can hear music outside your window at 4am. Lots of tossing and turning in bed.

The location is perfect. Although the name is "Night hotel" some more light in the room would be nicer. The heating system is terribly noisy. Everything else is fine. wifi in rooms is not free. ------
user_name:
Laura B
Province of Vicenza, Italy

review_body: This hotel is definitely grown and sexy, the staff is amazing. Dont get the champagne and chocolates package though, you'll be sent a $3 bottle of Andre and they charge you $40)  Overall we had a great time and had lots of sex

The room is so small and too dark (it really is a NIGHT hotel). Power slots are too hidden under the unmovable drawers. Shower head is too weak and water is not hot enough. Best is the location. There should be many other choices at this price around the area.

Location is superb. Take a left and walk 30 seconds and you're on Times Square. Across from loads of pubs (rude staff in Connollys) and Planet Hollywood. Dark interior throughout and small rooms but very smart. Initial check in guy was great. Bar staff do very little and have the cheek to take a 50% service charge for two drinks. 40$ is a bit steep for a cocktail and amaretto coke. Just avoid - plenty of places to drink close to hotel! Would stay again but for location alone.

Room was fine, cozy (small) but since it looked like a queen, slightly more floor space. Luckily we traveled in one suitcase and had to live out of it as there was no dresser, and that was inconvenient. Had we had another suitcase, there was no place to put it. Bed was comfortable. Lighting was awful as was mirror availibilty. TV remote system has a mind of its own and doesn't work like any we've ever used. However, room and hotel public spaces appeared clean (what we could see in the dark. We felt safe and comfortable

We stayed for four nights at the Night Hotel on 45th St. The rooms are very small, but if you can get past that, they are comfortable, clean, and about as well appointed as a room of that size can be. All staff from the hotel and Red Moon Restaurant off the lobby were uniformly pleasant and accommodating. One should note that the King sized beds are shorter than standard king beds, which is definitely is problematic for tall individuals. By the fourth night (I am a slow learner), I learned to avoid stretching my legs and violently stubbing my toes on the footboard (so much for style over substance). Aside from being too short with a stupid footboard, the mattress and bedding were among the most comfortable anywhere. Our room was very dark, with two dark grey walls and black tile in the bathroom. Our friends had a room with a greater proportion of white background wallpaper, and it was not so bad in that room because it felt a little bigger even though it wasn't because it was less dark. The onsite restaurant was very good, reasonably priced, and I highly recommend the coconut curry crab soup. The shower was narrow, but pleasant with a rainfall shower head, and the water was nicely and reliably hot. The bathroom mercifully had an elongated toilet. It was quiet at night. Nice selection of cable TV stations, including multiple HBO and On Demand, which was very nice. The Cranberry Cafe across the street is an excellent place to grab a cheap and delicious breakfast. Starbucks is practically next door. This hotel is next door to the Millenium Broadway, an ideal location for attending the theatre. Good service and amenities - and location - ultimately outweighed the limitations of a small room, and I would stay here again.Another note for parents - the hotel theme is sex. It doesn't really hit you over the head, but the photos on the wall are mildly suggestive about on par with what you might see at Abercrombie and Fitch - nothing explicit, but if a tasteful, stray bare breast offends your sensibilities, you might want to choose another hotel. I liked it.

The hotel is great! Very clean, staff were awesome and it's in a great location. The staff made us feel and home and they were very genuine. I would definitely stay here again! I had a great time in New York.

This hotel was a great value, great location and even better service. If you are traveling to New York City and Times Square is where you want to be this hotel has it all with a price you can't beat!!!

Nice and cool spot for young couples. Located in the heart of NYC with great surrounding stores and restaurants. Not too expensive either. I reccomend this hotel to anyone looking for a place for a night.
user_name:
connorv997
New York City, New York

review_body: Dark boutique hotel, superbly located right in the heart of Times Square.Everything you might need (restaurants, theatres, shops, museum and entertainments) is just handy.I must admit that not everybody can like its monochromatic design. But I loved it. Small room (it seems a rule in NYC) with all the amenities.Very friendly and helpful staff.

I've stayed at The Night on a few occasions for business. It is a fairly quick walk from Penn Station and a block away from the Subway and Times Square. Haven't had any problems with checking in, and my room has always been clean. If you're traveling alone or with one other, this is a good place to go - the price is right for NYC. Solid sushi restaurant/bar in the back too.Code: TRP

The room is small and it is ok for me, but the noise the heating make don´t let you sleep at all, specially in a small room. Just one guy in the reception made me feel uncomfortable, a white big guy, the guy who gave me that room, the other staff in the reception were more friendly. Sorry for the good people who works there but for one guy I am never going back . And who knows how many rooms the heatings are broke making really bad noises, when you travel you need to sleep, you pay for that.

My partner asked me where in the world i wanted to be on the 6th February for our 10 year anniversary and i knew straightaway it would be New York and a trip to the Statue of Liberty. As there are so many hotels in New York we chose this hotel purely on location and cost, but were very apprehensive as the cost was half the price of other hotels in the same area. We arrived and the front of the hotel looked impressive, the door was opened for us by the doorman and we went to the reception desk. Check in was very quick and simple and we were given our room number on the 6th floor as i had requested high floor room.Room was immaculate, all furnishings were black and white but i loved it. Lovely cushions on the bed, great mirror and chair in room and free to use safe. Bathroom was spotless, great shower and free toiletries. The room is quite small but we didn't book a trip to New York to stay in a hotel room, we only wanted a clean bed and that was definately what we got. The decor is dark, sexy and modern and this was perfect for our anniversary trip.Every member of staff we encountered were very friendly. The most romantic part of our trip was on our anniversary day we got up early to spend the day at the Statue of Liberty, on our return to the hotel early evening to wash/change for the evening we found a bottle of wine and a 'Happy Anniversary' card left in our room. This was a lovely gesture.On departure the doorman carried our bags out and advised us if we return to the hotel then transport to/from the airport can be arranged for us. We will be returning!!!

room was fine, but since it was so small, you need to find someplace to offer more drawer storage space. also remotes don't operate tv well (my experience and that of people i was traveling with). beds are short so it would be better if feet can hang over comfortably---metal rails prevented this.

My boyfriend and I recently spent this past weekend at Night and could not be more impressed. The decor is dark, sexy, and modern. Check in was simple and fast (as was check out). All staff we encountered were very courteous, eager to please, and always had a smile on their face. Who doesn't like that? The hotel is centrally located ( walking distance to various restaurants, shows, liquor shops, Duane Reade, etc.) which makes it an amazing value. The room was spotless and nicely decorated. The bed was super comfortable, though we didn't really end up sleeping much;-) This is the kind of hotel that definitely puts you in the mood. Loved that we each got both one free drink at the bar for completing a very short survey as well. Even though the complimentary drink tickets were all gone, Alejandro (I think that's his name; he may have been the manager) escorted us personally to the bar to confirm that we receive our drinks. (The drinks were delicious and not weak by the way). We will definitely stay here again for our next romantic getaway!

We were transfered here due to building work at our first choice hotel,not one I would pick,called the night hotel,thats exactly how it is 24/7 almost darkness all day long,if you got bad eye sight your strugglevto read menu etc, basic rooms are small and basic.

Can't beat the price / location of this hotel. The only real issues were the size of the room & bed being rather small and the overall feel of a nightclub turned hotel was a tad odd, but well done regardless. If modern goth is your style and you're not planning on staying in the room for prolonged periods of time then absolutely snag a room here.

The hotel is in a great location for business or pleasure, just a minutes walk from Times Square and considering its location, is excellent value. The hotel is modern yet gothic and the staff are friendly and helpful in every way. I won't stay anywhere else in NYC.

Love this place . Come in they are very friendly yet efficient. I have stayed prior and they seem to know that , they must check and keep a record . Greeted with a bottle of wine in my room . I will be back again , Thank You .

Room was very well decorated, clean and new. window however looked into an air shaft. Overall hotel decor is black and very dark. However it is still one of the nicest hotels and great location. Would stay there again.

Thanks for the upgarde!. However, the suite needs some serious cleaning - the sofa was stained and I did not want to sit on it. TV in the bedroom only had one channel and remote did not work. Maintenance needed.

I liked the unique design, and the cool vibe of the hotel. The rooms are very clean and comfortable, my only dislike was the size of the rooms, they are very small, even for New York City standards. t

Incredible service, very attentive and friendly staff. Unique decor, sleek and clean throughout the property (lobby, hallways, rooms). Well located (near Times Square, not in the insanity of Times Square). Great restaurant on property.Booked through Rocketmiles, earned 8,000 miles for 2 nights.

Me and my partner stayed at the night hotel for 4 nights/5 days. We couldn't be any happier with our stay there. The location couldn't have been any better. You turned left out the hotel and was right in the middle of Times Square. The Hotel it's self was lovely. Very different and quirky-which we both liked. Room was very cool, most importantly clean and tidy, bed very comfortable. Great TV selection if we needed a night in (lots of walking in NY) staff were great couldn't have been more helpful. We didn't eat at the hotel as we was always out, planet Hollywood is opposite, but there's was a Japanese menu to choose from. The lobby bar was lovely always had a great feel toIt. We did have to pay €10 a day for wifi but we didn't have a problem with that. If I was to go back I would happily stay at the night hotel again it completed our holiday for us
Room was standard size for a Manhattan property.Lots of chrome and Black highlights the interiors.Great location - a very short walk to the theatre district and Times Square.Would stay there again.
user_name:
josephf520
Port Jefferson Station, New York

review_body: In a New York minute you could miss the Night Hotel. That being said you are missing out on a really nice hotel in the heart of the action of NYC. If you are looking for hip and trendy then this is the place. The rate was reasonable and the room was well appointed. The staff is very nice and willing to upgrade if they have availability.The bar area is very cool but did not have a lot of action going on. I am sure on the weekend this place is hopping.If you have a chance to get a good rate at the Night Hotel I would highly recommend staying here you will not be let down.

The rooms are a bit small, But not everything can be big in NYC..it is very clean nice decor and the restaurant was also great with a nice staff.The staff is exceptional. I will definetly go back! It is steps from everything to see in Times Square. It is also a great rate.

Booked this hotel purely for the position to Times Square for New Year's Eve ! Was great in that respect ... Rooms are small but I guess that's what you get in NY ! No complaints the concierge were helpful and knowledgable about NY . I would recommend this hotel .

It's a good hotel, as many others already stated. Well located, not to big, modern design and friendly staff. Room was not too small (okay for Manhattan) and well equipped. However, I will not stay here again. For just one reason: I can not stand the color scheme. Everything in (very) dark colors. You have to love that, and I simply don't. I wasn't aware of the design - since it was a business trip it was booked by our team assistent. I admit that is only my fault ;-) but I wanted to "warn" others who - like me - need some bright colors to wake up ...

3rd time I have been to NYC stayed in the W hotel and the Night is by far the best amazing hotel, so friendly and helpful. Patrick helped with most things and saved ourselves time and money. As for the food amazing and the cocktails where fantastic. Nothing to fault really would highly recommend this hotel.

Would definitely stay here again. Everything went smoothly and staff were friendly. Room did need some general renovation/ maintenance but it wasn't bad enough to affect our trip. Little things like scratches, worn down tiles and carpet stains were all over the room/bathroom but we were out in the city the whole trip so it hardly mattered. Room felt clean. Location was amazing and we were able to walk pretty much everywhere. Felt secure and safe. Lobby had a nice relaxing feel with dim lighting and good music playing which was appreciated after long days in the busy and loud city. Glad we picked here to stay!! Thanks Night hotel.

The location is fantastic and the rooms, though very small, are very stylish, modern and well adorned. We were there for year's weekend visit to enjoy theaters and this hotel was perfect choice. We were not planning to be in the room so there was no need for lots of space. The bar and resturant have very intimate feel and after being there a day the staff addresses you by name. The staff was friendly and professional.This hotel was, considering all, a great value.

We stayed her for New Years Eve. The hotel was great and it was an A+++ location. The hotel was very clean and well maintained. Patrick at the front desk is great. He excels in customer service. We will be back.......
user_location: Hudson Falls, New York, United States
user_name:
JohnL350
Hudson Falls, New York, United States

review_body: Daniela Sava and Robert Brito were outstanding at the reception area.Very helpful and exceptionally accommodating . There is a very elegant look about this hotel.All the staff were good. All spoke a good English and had a constant smile on their faces.The bar was very special indeed, as was the sushi. The clientele were all made to feel very relaxed in this venue.Bedrooms very well equipped. Bathrooms are stunning . The location is exactly where you want to be in NYC .

I just spent the Thanksgiving holidays in NYC, this hotel has a great location (two minute walk to Times Square) and service. If you are looking for hotels with lots of amenities (cafe, restaurants, playrooms, pools, spas...etc) this might not be the right hotel for your stay. However, the interior design of this hotel is visually appealing and the sound proof quality is pretty good. There's a small bar lounge on the first floor which is opened late. Lots of restaurants here are 24hrs or opened very late, don't worry about starving! The staffs here are very nice (always willing to help), I asked them a lot of questions about directions and other information. The room was clean and quiet. The only thing I wasn't satisfied was there was no free wi-fi in the rooms. (10 dollars/day)

I stayed at the night hotel in October 2013 as absolutely loved my 3 nights there!Everytime room maintanence came I got a weather report on my bed as well as chocolates!I loved the dark goth look of the rooms and had some of the best sleep in that hotel!The front desk concierge were absolutely amazing and didn't even think twice about helping me with silly little things! Also very helpful with information on doctors SPECIALLY after a friend was told by another hotel to use a fake name and go to hospital!!I tell everyone I know that is going to New York to stay here of they an afford it! Best hotel in New York in my opinion (boutique wise)

I already miss staying at Night Hotel because of two very good employees, Robert and Daniela, who are so nice, professional and made this period the best it could be. I recommend The Night Hotel because rooms are bequem and service is awesome. Try the crab soup at the restaurant. Thank you so much!

Well you certainly can't beat this hotel for its location. Just a couple of minutes walk from Times Square. On arrival greeted by friendly helpful staff and this continued throughout the three night stay. The room was in good condition but as with most hotel rooms in New York on the small side(but you don't spend much time in your room apart from sleeping as there's so much to do and see)The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean and served it purpose. Free wifi in reception and also a bar and Japanese restaurant past reception that were very good.

We stayed at Night Hotel, location is just perfect, staff is WONDERFUL!!!! Hotel is clean BUT... the property is really, really bad maintained... windows do not close properly, air conditioning EXTREMELY NOISY, forniture just destroyed... (NOTE: we stayed 4 days and tried 3 rooms).overall opinion is: NOT a 4 star hotel!It is really a shame because the personnel is one of the best i have ever meet! Patrick, Robert and Alexander are extremely helpful and kind!!! We actually decided to not change the hotel after first night because of them.

Important to note: Night Hotel New York and Night Hotel Times Square ARE NOT THE SAME. NY (on 45th St) does not have rooms with 2 beds. I may have screwed this up because I was surprised to learn our room did not have the 2 beds I needed. I admit it, Im cranky when I travel. Patrick at the front desk refused to allow it. He killed me with kindness. Apologizing profusely for what was likely MY mistake and doing everything he could to remedy it. Nick at the door couldn't help us enough. He was quick about getting luggage, valet, etc. This was my first impression of the hotel: a friendly, calm, patient, understanding, considerate staff that will go to great lengths to accomodate. Half a block off of Times Square, inviting exterior. Valet parking at $55 made me cringe, but it was the night before Thansgiving so...Decor throughtout is black and white, with low lighting. But you dont need night vision goggles as some reviewers lead you to believe. It was like being in a fine dining restaurant. Except the wall art. Its a bit risque, but not the porn some reviewers insinuated. Its very avant garde and reminded me of Abercrombie ads. We ended up with a king size room on the 8th (top, I believe) floor. Yes, the elevator is tiny, but, um...who cares? It was very quick and the three of us had no trouble getting in with our luggage. By NYC standards, the room was average size for the price point. We've stayed at Dream Downtown where rooms were remarkably similar (in size and decor, though their bathroom was a little larger) and double the price and Element, similar in price and not much bigger (same size elevator too!) King bed seemed smaller than standard king, but it was comfy and 6'4" fiance managed just fine. Given some reviews I honestly expected to have to bring my own candles. What are you people talking about?? Nightstand lights on either side of the bed, running lights under the bed, and track lighting above the bed. Some people complained about "the view". What do you expect?? Note to out of towners: NYC is a "concrete jungle" made up mostly of buildings. Rooms with "a view" are always a gamble. To better your chances, choose a hotel higher than 8 floors.Took the survey they provided and used our free beer/wine ticket at the lounge. House music (which I happen to love, so cool for me), also dimly lit (think swanky nightclub.) Staff there too was great! Fast service, friendly, didnt even charge us for teenager's Shirley Temple. Do you know how rare it is to find caipirinhas on the menu? And even rarer when they are made well? Love the lounge for this.What else...water pressure in the shower was good. Better quality amenities like vegetable soap. Kept our bags locked up for us after check-out (which was at noon.) And they have branded chocolate bars. We had a great day and would not hesitate to book there again. Especially since it is rumored that repeat guests get a 15% discount.
user_name:
Sue F
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This was our first time in New York, and I am so glad that we stayed at the night hotel. The location is amazingly close to time square, restaurants and shows. We came over Thanksgiving and wanted to attend the Macy's day parade. The hotel was only a block away from the parade route, so it was perfect for getting to and from the parade. The staff was great, very friendly and attentive. When we checked in, we told them a little bit about why we were in New York and they helped us quickly map out how to navigate the city and gave us a map with some of the things that we had talked about highlighted. They really made sure that we had everything that we needed. It is a smaller hotel, which I loved, they made a point to learn my name and room number, and greeted us each time when we came back to the hotel after going out. It made me feel like I was at a much cooler, better decorated, and hipper version of my own home. The lounge downstairs is a fun place to hang out and the bartender is very nice. The rooms and halls were smaller than I expected, but it is New York, so I will assume that most hotels have smaller rooms than you might find in other places.

Patrick at guest services was fab he definitely could not do enough for us, hotel was fab location right in Times Square. Room and service was great albeit a shame no offer of twin beds but no big deal would definitely stay again ! Recommended !!

Full disclosure: we qualified for a free stay here, otherwise may not have chosen this due to price.Had a delightful weekend stay, very convenient to the two theater shows we were to see. Tiny room was very efficiently designed, reminded me of a cruise ship cabin (a small one, no balcony type of cabin). Room managed to pack in gorgeous original black and white design, shower, tiny closet, refrigerator, even 2 lovely bathrobes (why no slippers?). Surprised at having no hair dryer. It was, probably, available on request, but we did not ask. Wish breakfast was available or a coffeemaker, but a short walk to the lovely Cafe Europa (among many other possibilities) solved that problem. Don't know how it qualified for the "sexiest" tile. Bed was short for my husband who is just under 6 feet. Our room did not even have a full-length mirror, let alone a ceiling mirror, jacuzzi etc. Maybe larger room have more accoutrements...I just think that adding a hair dryer, cheapie slippers and a mirror on the bathroom door would have improved comfort at very little expense.At first I was taken aback by all the black ("Night", get it?) but the floor level soft lighting was very nice and comfortable.Bedding was terrific, soft, comfy, albeit bed could have been longer...And $10 for WiFi in room felt tacky.We did not get any wine on arrival... but maybe freeloaders like us do not merit such niceties...

the staff was very pleasant and helpful... the location could not be better if you are going to the theater..the room was small, but very clean and convenient and cool looking..we were given a complimentary glass of wine upon check in...and the desk manager gave us a card for future stay at 15% off. would definitley stay again

We recently stayed at the Night Hotel. We were very impressed by friendliness and courteousness of the entire staff-particularly Patrick. After a long flight (and an even longer misguided subway ride) Patrick greeted us, helped us get our bearings in the city and, overall, made us feel welcome and comfortable. While the decor and ambiance of any hotel is always nice (and the Night Hotel is definitely nice), the attitude and warmth of the staff can make or break a stay. We'd like to extend (another) thank you to the staff of the Night Hotel for their time, suggestions and smiles. We would definitely rebook there again-- Plus the beds are incredibly comfortable.

Myself and my girlfriend stayed at the Night hotel for a week while in New York and found it to be a stylish and well kept hotel. The hotel is ideally located to Times Square and also close to the subway. While the room was not huge it was a decent size for what I expected from friends who have previously visited New York. On arrival Patrick checked us in and was extremely helpful and took the time to explain the block system and the subway which helped when it came to navigating around the city. I've not traveled to America often and felt this saved us getting lost. He also took the time to point at a few lesser known attractions which we then visited so thanks for the tips Patrick. It was a shame we didn't receive the bottle of wine as expected and that there wasn't any tea or coffee making facilities in the room but there was a deli shop located across the road which was reasonably priced which we used for breakfast before setting out for the day. A great hotel and I would definitely stay here again.

We stayed here for two nights last week to celebrate our anniversary, and it was wonderful. The decor is gorgeous and everything we wanted to do and see was just a short walk away. They were even able to accommodate us checking in a little early without notice!My only disappointment was the fact that we never received the wine and chocolates that came with our package. It wasn't brought by on our first night because we had our 'Do Not Disturb' sign hanging (totally our fault). On following up the second night, we were assured it would be brought by in the evening, but we still didn't receive it. We did receive a phone call from the front desk asking if we still wanted it at 11:20 pm (that woke us both up out of a dead sleep)- but in total fairness, most people probably don't come to NYC and turn in before midnight. We were just exhausted from our first night! All in all, though, it was a great trip and we'd come back again.
user_name:
Victoria R
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Yes, when you first walk into the Night Hotel in New York, you notice the smell and the dim lighting and the ambiance!I really was happy with the hotel logged in between a restaurant and larger hotel near Times square.The rooms are very small and no windows in most, so this really is mostly a good place to stay, and get some good rest, but not spend much time in the room.I loved the decor, even though it was a little worn. The bar downstairs is great for meeting and having a quick bite to eat and relax. The staff is terrific!Nice thing is you can walk out the door and you are close to everything! walking to Central Park is a mere 3 city blocks and also multiple places to get wonderful food!This is New York after all!! go out and explore!!

The hotel upon first impressions is nice, smart and stylish, even being dark and moody. A Great location We arrived and the lovely Lauren booked us in, she was nice and welcoming. The first room had a dodgy door catch, half the lighting system didn't work (you need lights in this place) and was generally grubby. I went down to Lauren and she immediately apologised and switched us to another room.It got worse with the second room. The door latch plate had a screw missing and was flapping about. At this point we didn't spend 2 minutes in this also grubby room as it just wasn't secure so went again to the front desk. Lauren had finished but Jesse was there. I felt he had a bee in his bonnet from the start. He was rude and made things slow and awkward (he admitted they were in between maintenance guys) but he did upgrade us to a bigger room at the front on level 2. This room was bigger but awful! Loads of damage around this also grubby room, the toilet roll holder was hanging off and the sink was smashed. The window was so noisy, at first I thought it was just the New York noise but upon inspection the window frame was loose and the window section has popped out and the seals were either missing or worn. I managed to pop the window back in to seal the noise as my wife had had enough of swapping rooms and said to just grin and bare it as it was only a base to sleep in but then the air con turned on. OMG like a banging jet engine with a goat inside kicking it every so often to make it work!!! So off I was again to the front desk! Jesse was present and refused to come and see the damage so I went and took photos. He then said he would send "someone" to look into the window etc. Nobody came. I rang down to the desk as it was now getting late (midnight) and we were very tired from traveling so Jesse turned up but refused to look at the damage in the shower room so I said about fixing the window but then the air con was awful and it just so happened to turn on when he was in the door. I said this is unacceptable so back down to the desk for another room change!! Finally room 53, a downgrade but was quiet and ok air con was still a little noisy but ok, the sink had a crack but was ok, the walls were scratched and damaged and most importantly there was no safe! But at this stage we needed to be asleep and we realised that it wasn't going to get any better so we stayed put! The next day we spoke to Patrick, a very nice chap and helpful. He said he would try his best to get a discount with his manager, he gave us two free drinks at the bar. We came in after a day's walking and Patrick was still on duty at the main desk. We spoke and he said his manager had given us a 15% discount which we felt was a mediocre gesture! The next day we had a letter slipped through under our door from the manager saying that we will receive a 15% discount upon checkout. The next letter was the bill pushed under the door with 15% added onto the bill so again I had to go down to the front desk with complete and utter dismay and point out yet another mistake.This was rectified by Patrick and we were glad to check out! Throughout the process I must say Patrick was very helpful.The hotel is in a good location but I recommend go over the road to the Hyatt. Starbucks is a stones throw! You will need Starbucks as no tea coffee making facility's in the room. The door men were rubbish if they were there! Never paying attention! The lift was old and very clunky had a mind of its own only one lift to service 9 floors and is tiny! Felt dangerous!We would never stay here again and I would also advise others to stay well clear.

Where do I begin? I took my girlfriend to New York City for her birthday, and wanted it to be really special since she had never been before. When it came to the hotel, I could not have picked a more perfect place. So unique, so SEXY (definitely an intimate little boutique hotel for couples), and I can't stress enough how PERFECT the location is. It is a half a block away from Times Square, and so close to Central Park and many subway stations. Starbucks right to the left of the hotel. The staff also was incredible. I wish I could remember names. They all were wonderful. They sent up a free bottle of champagne as a birthday present for my girlfriend, and later on even stopped by to give us some chocolates and a weather report for the next day. They brought our luggage up to our room and were so courteous and helpful when it came to helping us find our way around town. We also did a survey on the hotel which took all but 2 minutes and we got 2 free drinks out of it at the bar downstairs! The hotel also smells amazing in the lobby and hallways-don't know what it is! My only complaint would be how tiny the rooms are and they have no view, but it's New York City. You're going to have small rooms anywhere you go! Thank you Night hotel for a wonderful stay! I highly recommend this place! My girlfriend and I could not stop raving about this hidden gem.

Came to ask for information, curious about the hotel I had only knew about checking on google maps while walking around Times Square. I do have already a reservation on The Dream, but the desk attendant Robert Britto was so available to answer to my doubts and needs. Very polite and nice. I am now changing my 8 nights stay to The Night. Thumbs up for Robert.

I stayed here luckily just for one night. Yes the hotel is in a good location, that's about the only positive reason to stay here.Very small, dark and dingy room - there were blonde hairs on the floor and stuck on some of the towels in the bathroom was pretty unpleasant!I stayed on a Saturday night on the 5th floor and was quite surprised by how quiet my room was. That was until 2am when a group of loud rowdy men started shouting and at 4am when a group of loud women started shouting.I needed to be near Penn station so the hotel was the most affordable I could find but was very pricey considering there was no tea/coffee, no breakfast and NO FREE WIFI!! This is appalling! It costs $10 a day.I would recommend this place for 1 night maximum. Anymore than that would be depressing as there is no natural light and you'd spend a fortune on using the internet.

Fab location, rooms are small, close to shops and trains, loved my stay here, which ever way you turn when you cone out of the hotel you can get to a place of interest or to a train station to get to where you want to be. I was very happy with this choce of hotel.

We travelled as a group of 6 to NYC In April 2014 for Easter.From the moment we arrived at the Night Hotel i knew we had made a good choice. Robert on the concierge welcomed us warmly and was helpful throughout our whole stay. There was a mix up with the rooms on the 1st night as we arrived very late. But the morning after Jackie Kelley, made sure that all of us were in the right rooms and that we made the most of our stay. Simon also was a great help everyday greeting us with smile and advice on what to do, now the other stuff.One thing you need to remember in NYC is that space is a premium. The rooms in the night hotel are amazing the design is great and perfect for you to relax in after a day exploring the city, and all it has to offer. Top tip the Cranberry Deli over the road is great food 24hrs a day.The location of the hotel is fantastic near to time square and central park all in walking distance. To be honest Cabs are a waist of time as with all the traffic lights and roadworks you can walk or take the subway quicker and cheaper.At night we had drinks in the cocktail bar which is a great place to relax and unwind and the cocktails are amazing.Yes there are lots of hotels in NYC but as a 1st timer in the big apple i couldn't have had a better time and this was made the more special by Robert, Jackie and Simon and all the staff at the Night Hotel. I will be back and will return to the night hotel.

I'm not a picky hotel guest, but I was let down by this hotel from the start. I would just like my very tiny hotel room to be clean. There were hairs everywhere, and uncleaned, sticky coffee stains under the bedside table. The towels always seemed to have hairs on them (way too long to be mine), and the housekeeper forgot on 3 of our 4 nights to bring washcloths to replace the ones she took away. Now, I get that this is New York, and there's this reputation that folks are unfriendly here. I've never found that to be the case, actually, but I expect hotel staff to always be friendly. They get paid for that. Not at the Night Hotel, however. The front desk staff was indifferent to our arrival. The desk agent at check in had all the warmth and personality of an ATM machine.I've stayed at "boutique" hotels in NYC before. I enjoyed those properties' high level of service and unique accommodations, but the Night Hotel was not on the same level. Thumbs down.

We stayed 8 nights in a King Room facing the street on the second floor of this awesome boutique hotel. The reception staff we're fantastic and always helped us with any questions we had about the city and where to go. The location is perfect, as you walk out you have Starbucks on your left, a new york deli to your right across the road and a 30 second walk to your left is Times Square! You are in the middle of everything and really close to many subway stations too, which we used a lot to get to places around NYC. The room itself was lovely, we were greeted to a beautiful King bed with a nice themed room with wallpaper and carpet, big enough TV and 2 windows facing the street for some fresh air. The bathroom is small and can get quite warm when having a shower, but its easily fixed when you open the door. It was very clean, fitted our 2 large suitcases with room to move around, daily housekeeping was also great and attentive. The bed and pillows were so comfortable you would instantly fall asleep! You could hear a bit of street noise (mainly sirens), in the mornings and night, but its not too loud to bother you, after all, it is NYC. The bar and restaurant downstairs was fantastic! We became quite familiar with the girls behind the bar and they would always remember what we were drinking without us saying anything. They were always happy to talk and have a conversation with a smile on there face, they're awesome, very lovely people. There was paid wifi in the rooms, and free wifi in the downstairs lobby. Overall, we would stay here again as all the staff were great, helpful and professional. The rooms we're clean, big enough for NYC and safe and the location is prime. Thanks for making our stay a memorable one!!

Ok so when I first arrived I was a bit shocked at how dark everything was and the photography of half naked people on the wall got me hoping I didn't walk into some strange place. However it's a very nice stay once you overcome all that darkness. Great location, friendly staff, turn down service, robe, chocolates on bed, quaint bar, and very clean. Downside, very small rooms and bathroom, think European small. Small closet, no mirror in room and again very dark. It was quiet though no street noise could be heard from the inside rooms. I would stay here again.

Let me preface this review by saying that I won this property on Priceline using the Name Your Own Price feature. It has put a sour taste in my mouth for ever bidding in this area again.This hotel is not to be confused with the Night Hotel Times Square, which appears to be a considerably different property.Upon checkin, we were told we were receiving an "upgraded" room on the second floor.
