The lobby was small and dark, and the agent was nice enough. Upon arriving in the room we were immediately confused. This looked like a hole in the wall. Literally, the room was the size of a closet. The interior was dark, very dark. Depressing dark. But after a long flight from Seattle, we didn't want to argue, so we decided to go to bed.Trying to sleep in this madhouse was a different story. We could hear a couple fighting in the hall. Screaming, punching, hair pulling type fighting. Upon trying to contact the front desk (who was just one flight of stairs away) we got no answer. The screaming continued through the night. From the other side we could hear a different couple having "alone time". This is the type of place you would bring a girl for hire.Upon further inspection, we could see the filth we had slept in. Stains on the mattress, blood on the mattress cover, mold in the bathroom. It is deplorable that a general manager or owner would allow guest to stay in these conditions.In the morning, it was decided that we could not stay here for two more nights. A quick call to Priceline and some photo evidence of the condition of the room we were granted a full refund. This is NOT a four star property. Beware, this hotel could ruin your entire trip to the Empire State!

Awesome location, loved the bar after a hard days shopping! Only downside was the complimentary wifi in the room was difficult to get connection most days. No view from window but did not really matter as we were busy touring.....

This hotel has a cool, goth vibe that I loved. If you want to be a block away from Time Square and a 5 min walk from Central Park, I HIGHLY recommend this hotel. Staff was helpful and friendly, hotel was clean, wifi, a little cafe and bar in the lobby was lovely. Other guests at the hotel were on the younger side (20's - 40's). I would recommend this hotel for groups of friends or couples looking to have a good time. FYI its NYC, Rooms are on the smaller side and most rooms have no widows. Very Safe! Close to clubs and bars. Restaurants. Museums. Parks.

Not impressed at all, pictures look much better, in person is just terrible. The idea of black is to hide the dirt. Rooms very small, no closet, iron board is a mini one, no bathtub only shower. Every morning the room cleaning ladies will make a lot of noise talking and banging the doors. Location is good, but there are many other hotels around. no pricing for the mini bar so you get the idea.for $400 a night, this is a dump and will never stay again. They claim all rooms have windows, true, mine is directly to a wall, so I guess there's a window.. No lighting so you can't see what's around.Bed very weird and uncomfortable. Weird music is blasting throughout the day in the hall ways so sleeping in the afternoon or sleeping in the morning is impossible.

Times Square, 45th & 6th - you can hardly get more central than this and definitely not at this price and having been voted "Sexiest hotel in the US 2013". As a relatively infrequent guest (every 3-4 months), the staff still remembers me. Rooms are compact - this is not a hotel where you practice your tango in the room - but compensated for by excellent location and friendly helpful staff. Rooms are individual in configuration so discuss your requirements. If you sleep lightly, rooms facing 45th may not be your preference - morning dump trucks will save you the alarm call and ensure that you enjoy NYC's early start. This is (as the song lyrics go) "the city that never sleeps". Triple-glazing may be an option for the future and as Night Hotel presumably have no jurisdiction over the street, urban living has its characteristics.Very friendly staff (from Mr Brito in reception) to the chatty bar staff (who will join in conversation and are always ready to adapt opening hours to your liquid requirements) to the discreet night security guard in the corner (the silent smiling Buddha of the establishment) providing a friendly welcoming nod. Other hotels costing more may provide other comforts but the combination that Night offers is what makes it special for me and a repeat visitor. Having stayed here a number of times now, nights at Night in New York is a tradition.

I took my daughter-in-law to NYC (her 1st visit) for her birthday in July 2014 and found a great internet deal for the Night Hotel and grabbed it because of the location. Best decision ever! The hotel is fabulous, rooms are clean and space used efficiently. The staff was wonderful and always greated us by name. We would certainly stay here again and in fact are looking to return in September 2015 for a girls get-away.

What a great place. Hip, trendy, clean. The staff was amazing, from Patrick at the front desk to Simon taking care of everything at the door, these people made us feel welcome from the first second we arrived. Our third day we woke to a cool rainy day, Simon went out of his way to get us extra umbrellas. Like 90 percent of all hotels in NY, the rooms are small but the decor and comfort easily offset the size. Bed was like sleeping on a cloud. Great location, awesome staff and decent rate; I will stay here again for sure. Richard - Romeo, MI

We arrived early and told that the room assigned to us was not ready. However, she asked if we were willing to check into a smaller room, she could get us in right now. It did have a king bed, so I agreed immediately. By New York standards, I did not think the room was that small.Simon – Concierge/Bell Captain was phenomenal, very pleasant and knowledgeable. He recommended the in-house Japanese restaurant. He advised they were moderately priced and had great food. He was right on both counts.The next morning I asked the Front Desk for directions to Battery Park by bus. I do not remember her name. She advised taking the train would be a straight shot, if I really wanted to do busses, I would have to transfer. She gave us excellent directions to the nearest subway station and advised get on the 1st three cars of the train. I didn’t listen to her, and I should have. When we got to the stop before Battery Park, we were told to move to the 1st three cars.We came back to our room, my husband used the bathroom. When I tried to use it, the door was locked from the inside. We were going out for dinner; I stopped at the front desk and asked that the door be opened. When we came back from dinner, the door was still locked. I went to the front desk, asking where the public bathrooms were located. By the time we got back to our room, it was fixed. About 20 min. later there was a knock at the door. We were given a bottle of champagne and a plate of cookies.My husband goes out for coffee and a paper at 5 am every morning. He came back and advised the whole street was blocked off for a parade. We were going on a cruise and had 3 rolling duffel bags, 2 carry-ons and my purse. I called for Simon to collect our luggage and told him I was kind of panicky re: getting to a taxi. Simon advised I should not worry. Got my folio at the front desk and Simon was already wheeling our luggage out the door. He pushed the rack 2 or 3 blocks and signaled for a cab.My compliments to all the staff at the Night – NY. Everyone we encountered offered great customer service. I know that any future trips to NYC, will mean a return stay at this hotel.

I stayed here for a few days on business. The rooms are small, and like all decent hotels in NYC room rates are high. There is but a single elevator, which concerned me initially, but which turned out not to be much of a problem.If you don't like the color black, you may not be fond of this hotel's decor (the words "Vampire Gothic" come to mind. What makes a huge difference to me, and why I will seriously consider returning to this hotel, is the service. Staff were incredibly attentive, helpful and responsive. The best service I've ever received in any New York hotel. Match this with a location that is super-convenient to the theater district, and you may want to seriously consider giving the Night Hotel a try.

If you answered yes to the above question, then this is the hotel for you.If not, then the lack of natural sunlight may be a problem. After staying for six nights, I am en route back to London in search of some seriously strong vitamin D tablets.I'll also be enjoying making my own breakfast, in my own home, which has not been provided (even as an additional charge) for the last week.And to top it off, in my dark room, hungry, I can only connect to the internet (surely nowadays somewhere among Maslow's hearicahy?) for $10 a day...Yes, if you like lack of light, connectivity and then most important meal of the day - then this hotel, is the hotel for you.If not, then I would nip across the road to the Hyatt.

New York hotels aren't cheap and there is a location/size/price compromise.Night Hotel sits metres from Times Square providing walking access to the majority of the city.It's not cheap, the rooms aren't large but it's clean, modern and the perfect location for most tourists.

I took my husband on a weekend getaway to celebrate his birthday and we stayed at the Night Hotel. The hotel is very conveniently located---right down the street from the theater where we went to see The Lion King; in Times Square; close to Radio City, Broadway and Penn Station. I liked being able to walk where I wanted to go. The lighting in the lobby area was a little dark, but the hotel staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Once I faced the fact that the room was "city living" (think small spaces) and no view of anything except the brick building next door, I was able to appreciate the uniqueness of the decor. The bed was listed as queen, but I don't think it really was as it was shorter than any other queen bed I have seen. But the saving grace for the bed was the lighting under the bed. This hotel was not like any other I've been to, and I would stay there again, because the good outweighed the bad and the location is great.

Traveled to NY with one of my friends for a little fun and business. I'm so glad that she booked this hotel. It was perfect! We had meetings in the neighborhood and everything was within walking distance. The staff was wonderful and the decor was just the right type of provocative and breath taking, with an "Eyes Wide Shut" type of attitude. As far as the room itself, it was beautiful and cozy. Just the right size for folks that don't travel to NY to STAY inside their hotel rooms. However, the bed was comfortable enough, that if I had wanted to stay inside my room, I would have been perfectly happy to do so. The food and service in the onsite restaurant was wonderful. We were so inspired by the decor, that we immediately got to work on the styling for my friend's new theatrical event as soon as we returned home. We've already decided that we will stay here every time we come to NYC. No wifi was not free, but that's what your hotspot is for and there's a Starbucks right next door. No coffeemaker in room...Starbucks in right next door. I'm sorry that I did not get any of the staff members' names. I would love to give them a shout out. If intimate, hip and sexy is your style, you will love this place! Like I said, We'll be back. ;)

This was a trip of a lifetime for my wife and me - New York and Las Vegas. I was particularly excited about this hotel as it was the most unique one I've ever booked. It was indeed exciting! So we check in, nice pleasant service. As we enter the room, we are immediately taken aback by the size of the room - tiny! As was the bathroom. So we digest this aspect of the room, and sitting on the bed, notice the imperfections and what appeared to be stains of soup on the wall, but could've been anything. Then came the killer punch. No word of a lie, a pile of toenail clippings right next to the bin, on the carpet. Yes, eew indeed! It was time to return to reception. Admittedly, the gentleman at reception appeared as shocked and disgusted as us. He even took a picture to presumably show his boss - I wish I had taken a picture too to show you guys! Anyhow, we got upgraded the next night onwards, to a slightly larger room. The room still lacked any tea/coffee making facilities. I must admit, there was always a wonderful aroma when you enter the hotel, and the character on ground floor was still curiously attractive even until the last day. If it wasn't for these two factors, it would definitely have been one star rating. I would most certainly not stay here again. The toenail clippings on the floor is enough to keep us away!

Our tour operator booked us in this hotel on our return from Hawaii.First impression not too good,although the linen & towels were clean they were worn the room was very small no tea making in room. room service not 24hr,wifi not free in room very basic and the area outside did not feel safe

Hotel is in a great location - just off Times square, 5 minute walk to 5th avenue and 5 minutes to times square subway.The hotel staff were all friendly and approachable and there is a noticeable to perfumed fragrance to the hotel.Given this is new York, there are plenty of places to eat, Starbucks is next door but one, deli over the road.Yes the rooms are tight on space, but they're clean and reasonably well maintained.Only down sides are:1. Doors slam shut, so guests returning late will wake u up!2. The air con is noisey and will disturb your sleep and the headboard can angle the air con draft so it hits your face when you are sleeping!3. The doors don't close fully so they rattle

I'm a fan of trying "boutique" hotels and based on photos and reviews, thought I'd give this a try. Won't be a return visitor. Room was small, dark and oddly lit. The track lights below the bed were hip. But would have preferred a working lamp on the table instead. Bathroom, while small, was OK. Loved the rainbath shower head. But didn't like that it dripped almost non-stop. Closet was deep but almost too narrow to enter. Two smallish windows were great - room would have been nearly claustrophic without. But didn't like that one of them wouldn't close properly. No breakfast, ok, but no coffee? $10 daily for in-room wi-fi. And as much as I like the idea of the free bottle of chilled champagne, it had been sitting there for so long that the ice bucket (a) had no ice and (b) drenched the table.
user_name:
mc432014
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We travelled with three friends to New York to combine sightseeing with our wedding day in Central Park and chose the Night Hotel for our accommodation due to the smart decor, the central location and the good reviews. We were very pleased with our stay. The hotel is very well decorated with a gothic/black and white theme and the staff were really helpful and friendly. The rooms are quite small - as we expected in New York - but are well equipped and very comfortable. With a cracking location only a couple of blocks from Times Square, we had easy access to all activities while also being undisturbed by any noise. We were also delighted to arrive to a congratulatory bottle of bubbles in our room. My only criticism was that there was a fee for the use of wifi in the rooms - it was free in the lobby. Given the relatively expensive nature of the hotel, it felt churlish that wifi was not included. That aside, we had a great stay and I recommend it to anyone looking for a slightly different type of hotel.

Great location, cool design, friendly and professional staff. I stayed at the Night Hotel recently for a business trip. The location is a stones throw away from Time Square so if you're interested in everything that mid-town has to offer, you'll love it at the Night. GMA, MTV and Time Square is 1 block away. Theaters are all within a block or two. I loved it and will 100% return.

There was a problem with the door not opening in our room. It the front desk attendant immediate changed our room. This was our wedding night and within 5 minutes of being in the room we received a very chilled bottle of champagne compliments of the hotel. Very nice gesture. The room although king size bed, was a little small but it was perfect. Great scent throughout, very clean and quiet. The decor makes it a very sensual place. Will definitely be back very soon.

I've stayed at the Night in the past when I'm in NY on buisness, and continue to stay at the same hotel every time, it's near to the office, and located in the heart of Time Square which makes it very convenient. The staff is very friendly and the accomodations for NY are not bad, the room is a bit small, but most hotels in NY are built this way. Overall, no complaints. I'll be back!

My first trip to broadway with my daughter and woweee ... how conveniet to walk to broadway from this hotel ... we had such a great trip and the service was excellent. I liked that the rooms were small and I thought the prices were very reasonable. I'd stay again for sure.

The first thing you need to know about this hotel is that although it is a very beautiful boutique hotel, it's also very small & doesn't have a lot of the amenities that many of New York's big hotels have. However, the stunning & very sexy decor & rooms, plus the location & the great rates this hotel offers makes up for it 10x over. I'll admit, the rooms are a bit small but they are very cozy. And when you see them, trust me, you won't even care about their size. The rooms are so gorgeous they'll take your breath away. You won't ever want to leave. The bathrooms are very cozy too, but the showers are very roomy. The staff is very helpful as well. I never had any problems. I would recommend this hotel to anybody who wants to stay in the Times Square area. I would definitely stay here again!
user_name:
Jessica C
Fontana, California, United States

review_body: This hotel is comfortable, and extremely convenient to Times Square/Broadway theaters. The rooms are small, but they are clean, and I personally prefer staying in a small hotel vs. one of the large, crowded, and impersonal chain hotels. This was my second time staying at The Night, and I would return.

My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon and had an amazing time. The decor is absolutely stunning - never stayed anywhere quite like it. Location for NYC was perfect with all major sight seeing locations, right next to Times Square. I would thoroughly recommend staying here for couples in search of a trendy, romantic and memorable stay.

I really enjoyed my stay at the Night Hotel in New York. It was a very comfortable hotel. The service desk was quite helpful. The only complaint I have is the rooms are very small. The location was awsome.

nice black & white ,no gray areas other than the lack of warning stickers on the camoflogued mini-bar for sensors. utilizing frig for anything other than proprieter's snacks & booze is off limits.....thank god we didn't bring the new born......brad & anggie

Middle of time square. Nice place to stay in only compared to a hostile. I recommend this place for short stay customers. Staff is not bad, but they need more training on customer service RegardsMohamed

I love the hotel for the decor and the stylish look the rooms had, but the rooms were very small, and there mini bar will charge you if you remove anything from it... Exactly I never heard of that either.

Very close to Lion King, small quaint and fashion forward boutique hotel. Ideal for a short stay in the heart of time square while being just off the strip enough to be a peaceful hideaway. I would definitely stay again.The small sushi restaurant had a romantic intimate feel and the variety of flavor was great.

As soon as we arrived we were greeted by Patrick. He was super nice and welcoming, he made sure all of our questions were answered, also took the time to go over the map and really explain how to get around the city. He made our stay a little more special. The room was clean. Good size for us, it was only 2 of us so we didn't need a huge room. Bathroom was clean. Decor was nice. The location really is unbeatable, located a couple of steps from Times Square. You can't beat that!

I was with a boyfriend and we last minute decided to stay an extra day in Manhattan. For the price, it was a great value and much nicer (and better decorated) than the hotel we stayed at across the street. The front desk staff was extremely friendly and very patient when the two of us got black out hammered and lost our room keys. Not for families.
user_name:
passportsforpeasants
Charleston, South Carolina, United States

review_body: My partner and I have just stayed at the Night Hotel for 4 nights and overall we were very impressed! The hotel as a wow factor with staff on arrival being very friendly and throughout the whole stay they were helpful with advice and generally courteous when arriving and leaving. The reception is very welcoming with strong Wifi signal in this area and in our room on floor 2. I don't know what smell they pump out of their system but it smells Devine in the whole place! The rooms, very impressed! We had a king room which overlooked the street. It wasn't as small as people made out and there was plenty of storage and the bed was extremely comfortable! Yes there was street noise and the people of NYC beep their horns day and night so sleep can be interrupted. I agree with an earlier post that the air on is extremely loud and we were unable to have it on during the night, therefor waking rather warm, no big deal though. The bathroom was beautiful with gorgeous toiletries left each day, the body lotion smelt lovely! The lighting is dark but there is a dimmer and there were definitely no issues with not being able to see, I suggest people put on all of the lights and put the dimmer to the max...quite simple!!Location of this hotel is brilliant with it being steps away from Time square and subways being close by.Finally the hotel arranged for a cab for our return journey to JFK and a limo turned up much to our surprise....thanks Night Hotel! It was the perfect t end to our amazing holiday.I would definitely recommend this hotel

The room doors were very noisy, so you could hear them closing from your room. It was also unfortunate that they charge for Wi-fi in the rooms. In general we would be glad to come back to this hotel in the future.

Night Hotel is a classic boutique hotel with all the large furnishings one would expect and black (well very dark grey) walls and large print wallpaper of Scottish thistles-I believe by Timorous Beasties. The beds are comfortable and the location good, if you want to be right in midtown, seconds from Times Square and very close to Rockefeller Plaza. We were first booked into a very small room with a window that looked out onto the fire escape and so little room that you could hardly get to your suitcases. It had the smell of tobacco coming in through the ventilation system, even though it was a non smoking room. The second room we had was much larger but close to the elevator, where they pipe-in pop music loud enough we could hear it in our room. We found that annoying, as you can imagine. The best thing about this hotel was the great service. The entire staff was extremely friendly and helpful.

The friendliest staff I have ever encountered in a NYC hotel. Were very accommodating and would go out of there way to help you with what ever you needed. Rooms are clean and comfortable. They do have room service. Night is in times square and just walking distance from MSG. Great room for the price.

My boyfriend surprised me with a little getaway to NYC Saturday-Sunday in August. He booked everything so I had no clue what I was walking into, but I was very pleased! Night hotel was very clean and well kept. The staff was so super nice!! (including the wonderful bartenders) We had a queen bed room which was a bit small but for one night and only 2 people is was definitely manageable. The location is great! Walk to the corner and you're right in Times Square..2 blocks from Toys R Us, Sephora, Express, McDonald's and my favorite restaurant Tony DiNapoli's! There are also bars and restaurants right on the street of the hotel! I would definitely stay here again!

The location and interiors are wonderful but you have to pay extra for the wifi and there is no breakfast served in the hotel. For the same price range one can stay in more established hotel chains (in same area) that offer breakfast, wifi, and bigger rooms.

The staff are some of the friendliest, helpful, fun, attentive and real people I have ever come across when travelling. Nothing was too much hastle for them. Robert, Patrick, Lina (from the bar), and Jesus to name just a few. They printed maps, gave me directions, recommended places to eat and things to do. The room I stayed in was a king, and was plenty big enough for two people. Everything was very clean, the maios were very patient with me considering I didnt leave the room until around 12pm each day. They actually said "no need to put the sign on we wont disturrb you until we know you've left, just let the front desk know. The restaurante and bar is great and is busy and vibrante most nights and lunchtimes. There are loas of bars, restaurants, and theatres near by. Times square is at the end of your road!! I would recommend this placê without hesitation and I've stayed in some pretty cool places. I can't guarantee the dizes of the other rooms but the king is absolutely perfect. Oh, and they do a turn down of the room at 4pm leaving you with a chocolate and news and weather information for the next day. Awesome stay, thanks very much!!

I thought this was a nice hotel to stay. Friendly staff, attentive doorman/bellman to greet you. The rooms weren't spacious but there was a nice sized closet and bathroom. It was clean and comfortable. I would stay again as it is also situated in a great spot in town, especially if theater is on your list of things to do.

We had a nice stay in this hotel. From the very begining at front desk the staff was great. Especially Robert who got us checked in really early cause we were exhausted after long flight to NYC. Thank u Robert!!! The hotel itself has a great location. Rooms are good, clean. Maybe a little bit small. But on the other hand how much time u spend in the hotel room.

I usually don't write reviews because I'm much too lazy to do so, but I felt it was very much necessary after my stay here. Me and my boyfriend stayed here (We live in NY) for my birthday weekend because the theme intrigued us and location was convenient.The room was nice, dim lighting, flat screen TV, very comfortable bed. However, the staff is COMPLETELY standoffish and uninterested when it comes to serving customers. Housekeeping didn't come by because we wanted to sleep in late, and I totally understand that they don't come by the rooms after a certain time. My boyfriend called down to ask for a change of towels and they said it wouldn't be a problem and someone should be right up. They NEVER came by to change the towels or take out the garbage. We literally asked about four times and the man at the reception desk was very indifferent and unapologetic, he simply asked a guy next to him to do it and the guy replied "Really? Do you see the time?" (It was 9pm). Then he hurried away and said he'd do it, but when we came back to the room the garbage was still there and the towels were still there. WE HAD TO TAKE OUT OUR OWN GARBAGE. Also, there was a huge waterbug on their carpet outside that my bf killed, and nobody bothered to clean that up either. That's GROSS. Lastly, they have a scale in the refridgerator in the room so basically if you move anything or put anything in there, they try to charge you as if you drank one of the overpriced beverages in there. Their cleanliness matches their horrible customer service, AVOID AT ALL COST.

Loved it. The room is painfully small, but typical of Manhattan hotels. Friendly staff and very clean throughout the hotel. The location is a great for first time visitors, as it is right in Times Square.
user_name:
pookie1883
New York City, New York

review_body: The pros: stylish & hip feeling, clean, and good location close to the theater district and Times Square.The cons: Our room could not have been smaller, and the bed was super small (what else should I expect book a great deal on Orbitz!). Also, the AC had a rattle that meant we had to turn it off to sleep, which meant it was warm and night. Warm room and small bed made for poor sleep both nights. The dark, gothic interior with pictures of naked, tattooed people might not work for all.I would try it again but hopefully book a bigger room with a bigger bed.

Staff were very helpful and let us keep our bags in the store before and after check in and out. Perfect for couples and the location was second to none, right off time sq!Bed was incredibly comfy and the decor was amazing, Definitely recommend for a cheeky night away!

We stayed here recently and had an average experience. Check in staff were nice but the room was just ok for the price paid. The bed was incredibly small for two people and even though they gave us free wifi (which we appreciated) we did have to go to the desk each day for a new password and explain we were given free wifi, and in the end some days still ended up on our bill. You can't use the fridge to store your own drinks. We complained about the bed size and were told the manager would call, but never did. NY is expensive for accommodation but there are better options than here for the same price

Good swanky looking hotel in an excellent location. The only letdown was that the foyer of the hotel looks really good but the rooms look quite dated. The bathroom was clean but the shelf above the sink was falling off so I didn't put anything on it. The air-conditioning was a little noisy and the room window faced another wall so don't expect a good view. The concierge was helpful but talked a lot (as if he was fishing for a tip, a little OTT). There was free WiFi in the lobby but not in the rooms which was a little frustrating, but it was an excellent location.

Great Location close to the action of Times Square. Rooms are small but in the heart of New York City and for the Price, hardly worthy of a complaint. No Free Wifi is the downer, all other Hotels stayed during our American Honeymoon were Free. Have to mention the cleaners as the Ladies were so Nice and Welcoming, more so then one of the Concierge I encountered. The BEDS were SOOOOO Comfortable and after nearly 25 hours in transit from Oz to LA to NYC this was a DREAM. Honestly a clean Hotel with Friendly Staff and a COMFORTABLE BED are Top Of The List for my Husband and I. Would definetely stay here again. Such a Sexy Hotel for the First Stop on Our Honeymoon as well. PS. You are in New York - Dont forget to see a Yankees Game, visit Niagra Falls and most of all TAKE THE SUBWAY - Its a whole other world in itself. The buskers are awesome and was one of many of our New York Highlights. New York City is everything you dreamed of and then some. Enjoy

I booked on booking.com, followed the TA recommendation. The hotel really is "sexy", clean and staff is very kind. Rooms maybe a bit small, but for 200$ you get to stay 1min walk from Time Square! I did not like the expensive wifi! What a shame for this hotel, they must give you free wifi.

I had abooking for a non refundable room ,and for an urgent situation I sent a request for cancellation 5weeks earlier,although the hotel policy states payment at property or 24 hours before arrival and according to website I booked from ,they were very flexible to cancel but the manager was not helpful at all, I suprised that before replying my email they hurried up to detect total amount ignoring my email and my situation the manager marry tried to make my situation more complicated and forced me to accept what happened, but I think this is not profissional from her, even I lost my money but still im happy not to start a holiday from such a place????!!!!!not adviced to deal with such hotels at allllllllll!!!!!!!!!!!
user_name:
husam a
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: Great little hotel in a great location close to Times Square. Rooms are fairly small, but the decor is very chick, and makes the hotel look very cool on the inside. Doors and walls are a bit thin, can hear sound from the hallway, but in 2 stays at the hotel did not hear anything in other rooms. Would stay there again if the price is right!!!

I am traveling for business , so guess I am not the target audience. The location is great, but the rooms are tiny and dark! I stayed in a lot of downtowns in Europe that have high population densities. But this is the smallest room I have ever seen. It would be fine if I was looking for place to stay after a wild night. But family and business travers should stay far away! Does not even have a coffee maker and you can't use the fridge unless you want to pay a 30$ fee. Well it did encourage me to see more since u could not bear the room.

If you love chic, this is it.If you need a quick over the top fix, this is it.If you want a great location, you're in.If you want a room for more than you and your suitcase, this isn't it.I'd go back because it's just so cool, but only by myself.

The room was set up perfectly for a city that never sleeps! The only complaint that anyone would ever have is that the rooms are tiny, but it's New York City, c'mon people... You can't beat the location and service! This hotel is just what you need while visiting NYC!

Smallest room ever. If you are large or have a fear of small spaces STAY AWAY!!!!!Not even enough room to monouver around bed. Stubbed toe in bathroom. Dark dark dark. I have stayed in all the funky hotels, like the W and dream but this was like a coffin. I should have listened the reviews. Because room was so small the air was constantly blowing in my face and was like a helicopter in my room soon loud. Nope never again. Was funky though.

- location is the key for that hotel- The restaurant serves late and food is really good and not that expensive which is great after a long day walking. Cocktails are really good too.Room is quite dark, but it is the "deco style" wanted by the hotel.Paying for wifi is a real shame I think, not to mention the use of the mini as a fridge for another 30 dollars.But all that with have been bearable, if PATRICK at reception was not so disrespectful, super aggressive, condescending, and not helpful at all. If Patrick is not happy to please customers he should not be put at reception. I read other opinions and all say such thing. Seriously he kind made me angry by arguing with me for no reasons. He does not want to inform people about how to do things in town. Honestly move him at the back, greeting people is not he best quality!!!After 7 days at the night had enough and spent my last two days somewhere else. Will be back in September and will avoid this place as hate paying to be insulted!!Simon, the doorman is super nice, the lady at the bar as well, the maids you meet in the lift always greeting you and smiling the others at reception.

Booked the hotel last week for my gf birthday and wanted to have a comfortable trip in the city. I put the birthday cake in the mini fridge and took all beverages on top of the fridge temporarily. When the time checking out, they charged me all the beverages without checking the room where I already put all the beverages back. I told the staff, an Asian guy ( forgot his name), what was going on with the beverages And the staff unmannerly saying that the fridge is not meant to keep any personal stuff for more than 3 times. I believe they will give me credit back for the beverages. But I strongly recommend the HR of the hotel to re-train the staff how to talk and act in a professional manner. Btw thanks to the guy named Patrick from front desk who helped me to arrange the flower delivery for me.
user_name:
Jcelvan
New York City, New York

review_body: The Night Hotel is perfect! As everyone has stated it's right in time square - location location location! The rooms are small but most are in nyc. The staff was supper nice all the time! Our maid even sang while she cleaned and always smiled! Clean, comfortable, reasonably priced! There is a cheap but great Gourmet deli and salad bar right next door which is a hidden gem, even the coffee was excellent! This is an excellent place to stay!!!
user_name:
RUaVTBaby
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I have stayed at both Night Hotels. The one in Times square is really bad. I felt like I was sleeping in a crypt. This Night Hotel is a bit better, at least the walls were not painted black like the other one. However, the elevators kept breaking down, delaying everyone from getting out of the hotel. It was horrible. Everyone complained about it. The staff didn't seem to care.

This is a nice Boutique hotel close to time square. Décor inside is hip. Plenty restaurants and bars close by. Alex Guarnaschelli's Butter restaurant is close by, fantastic food. Cranberry deli across the street is well stocked. Hotel is clean, room was clean, bathroom was clean also. Stayed four days. Close to subway, rock center and grand central. Simon at the front door is very helpful and always happy.. Also if you drive there it is easy to park out front, unload and valet park.

This was my first trip to NYC in September. I chose this hotel based on price, location and the photos I saw online. And I wasn't disappointed. The lobby of the hotel was dark and mysterious atmosphere with a nice scent. It always smelt good in there! I stayed with a girlfriend and the location was great for walking, shopping, eating and hitting Broadway shows. We were greeted by a lovely bottle of wine as a gift. Room was clean and comfortable and a reasonable size. I would definitely stay here again!

This hotel is perfect for exploring New York and was at a really good price. Although the rooms are on the small side (especially wardrobe space) nicely decorated. We also had a high floor off road so the room was really quiet that was a bonus. We did have an issue with lighting in the bathroom that couldn’t be fixed during the day but the management offered a room swap (declined as not major) and supplied a free bottle of champagne to make up for it.

Lovely little boutique hotel right in the heart of it all !!! We were in new york for a few days and stayed here for 2 nights, very dark inside but lovely, busy decor in room and very small but its boutique right ! .. apart from my view of a brick wall it was awesome and perfect as a base to just get your head down at the end of the day, no one goes to nyc to sit in a hotel room ! .. would come again :)

Best thing about Night Hotel, which I booked May 20-21, is the location—close enough to Times Square and its many attractions, but not too close so you don't feel overwhelmed when you walk out the door. Another plus is the service: very friendly, attentive staff, one of whom provided me with a code/password for free lobby WiFi, which also worked in my room (otherwise, I would have had to pay for it).Also on the plus side: very clean room, and quiet—though I've read complaints about noise from the nightclub downstairs, I had no trouble sleeping in my room on the seventh floor (comfy bed, too). Air-conditioning was a bit loud, so I just adjusted the thermostat accordingly to keep it from going on and off all night.Minuses: Tiny room; I've stayed in many New York hotels, and this might have been the smallest room I've ever slept in. I was a solo visitor so it was bearable, but I can't imagine how two people could manage. Also, there is only one elevator, and it's very slow.Finally, the sexed-up, goth-like decor must have been someone's idea of hip and chic several years ago, but it's now just, well...tacky. The furniture in my room seemed a bit tired around the edges, and carpeting was threadbare in some spots. The bathroom—very clean—was in better condition than the room itself.Didn't try the bar/restaurant, though the sushi menu looked pretty good (and reasonably priced).

Rated as the "sexiest hotel in America"....must be because you will have no choice but to snuggle. The rooms are so small you have to go outside to change your mind! The upside, and the reason to stay there, is the location. Right in Times Square, it makes it easy to catch a show, get dinner at a nice restaurant (don't eat too much or you won't fit back in the room), and walk back to your room. The black décor certainly didn't enhance the claustrophobic room. If you're looking for a funky, convenient place, this is it. If you're looking for elegance, keep looking.

Not a very good choice..the rooms are extra small.. Congested bathroom.. Very small passages..No free wifi in the room.. Poor wifi in the lobby..Receptionists not very helpfulThe pros.. The concierge.. Very helpful and the location is the only reason to live here.. 2 blocks from Times Square!!!

I chose the Night Hotel for our visit to New York City due to its close location to the Rock, where most of our plans were. Night is a clean and quiet hotel in Times Square. I saw NO KIDS!! And we heard no neighbors! So we had two peaceful nights of sleep.It is named the sexiest hotel in New York, so everything is black. That is fine, but it makes things a little dark and hard to see. The lighting in the bathroom was not very bright, but I do not consider the dim lights so bad. The worst part of our trip was that we could not get the cable to work at all during our stay. It was out when we arrived and were told that it was due to a storm, but it was still out the following morning. We called to have someone come up and look at it, but we were ready to leave for the day so my husband told them it was fixed. The desk clerk said that the cable company rebooted the service to fix it for us. No. Not really! So that night we were still without cable. There is no street parking near the hotel, so we had to valet our car, which is just as much as finding parking ourselves. The staff at the desk and valet were friendly and engaged us in small talk while we were waiting to check in and out. All in all, it is a nice place to stay.

Boutique hotel about a 30 second walk from Times Square/Broadway. Just off the busy street you enter a quiet lobby with a very nice lobby bar with couches spread around for some quiet talk, and a small restaurant. Upstairs, my room was typical big-city small with just enough room to walk around the bed. Nice bathroom, though, and your only hanger space was behind the door there.Room and bath were very clean, the bed comfortable, and quiet.

Don't know why would anyone paint the whole hotel black, have black wallpaper, small black rooms and black bathrooms. I am definitely never coming back - our room was facing a wall ! Tiny bathroom and no amnesties - whatsoever You can't beat the location ofcourse

The rooms are TINY. Smaller than a double in the UK let alone what you would expect in the US. But it's clean it's spitting distance from Times Square and the staff are friendly and very helpful so I all in all I would stay here again but maybe look to the bigger rooms on offer!
I highly recommend hiring an interior designer who can convey "night" more as a starry sky and less like a mausoleum. But hey, if it's what you were going for, then you did it.

The experience was great due to proximity of the hotel; the rooms were neat and comfortable but little noisy in the morning especially for someone who would like to wake up little late around 10 as there were consistent noise in the corridor after 7 AM

We recently stayed in the Night hotel in times square nyc. the location was awesome: for we walked to our play and loads of resturants. t The front desk service was excellant ( Patrick was wonderful) the valet car service was very handy also.Our room was very cozy and comforatable. Very cute, boutique hotel. Would stay there again.

We went to NYC to get engaged and the staff made special efforts prior to our arrival especially Rob to went beyond the call of duty.Upon arriving to our hotel we where met by Nick and Patrick who both gave us a warm NYC welcome, Patrick made us feel welcome and also reassured that we were in good hands. Before we choose to stay I read other peoples review and began to doubt my decision, however I was pleasantly surprised at how ideal the Hotel was - Staff, Room and Location all excellent.I feel with some people they will always try faults and if they try hard enough undoubtedly they will but you must take this with a pinch of salt as you must question anyone spending there whole time in there room in NYC!!!!!! Crazy!!We found our room to be all we could want for a place to rest in between dashing around this great city. Placed within a stones throw from T/Square it really is still a place to chill and recover. We are planning to visit NYC again next year and will definitely be returning here.With regards to the Staff we really got to know them and nothing was a hassle or too much trouble. These guys really work hard and long hours however are always professional and polite which is a credit to the hotel. Patrick must get a special mention as it seemed as he didn't ever go home and was always working - You really made a positive impact on our visit and therefore must thank you for your attitude and personal attention - a real gem!!See you soon.Andy & Nancy Hess
Very nice hotel with friendly and helpful staff! Very close to Times Square.Rooms a little bit small,bur very nice!Aircondiotion in room a little bit noisy

The location of the hotel is all that was fantastic and amazing about this hotel. Unfortunately, it lacked personality. The staff at reception were excellent and very polite and friendly and the reception area was very inviting. However, that seemed to be where it stopped. The room we stayed in on the 9th floor was so tiny, even the bed was tiny for two people. We could only fit one suitcase inside the closet, we were just about to walk around the bed, and the door opened straight onto the bed, so claustrophobic. The bathroom was lovely and very clean. The cleaning team respected the 'do not disturb' sign we left up and just left new towels on the bed which was a nice touch. The location of this hotel really saved the day!! Completely overpriced and money would be better spent on other hotels in the area. It would be amazing if the rooms were bigger.

This is supposed to be a "sexy" hotel and by that, the designers must mean bad lighting. Seriously, the lighting is the worst. My friend complained she couldn't take out her contacts the lighting was so bad. I stepped in the elevator and nearly gasped at how old I looked due to the super unflattering lighting (in an elevator)! Restaurant is equally bad, but the service here and at the front desk are great. Very friendly. Great location, less than a block from Times Square. I would probably stay here again due to the location and price.

This hotel is in a fantastic location but that is where the good news ends. Rooms are very small and mine did not even have a window. I think that was my first windowless hotel experience. The "night" concept is interesting but it is dark in the room to the point where the closet does nit even have a light. The bathroom was fairly clean but the ceiling had mold. The Ac was very noisy so I had to shut it off at night. The wake up service called 20 minutes early one day and 30 minutes late the next. So lots of little nagging things. On the positive side,TV programming is like I have not seen before. Lots of channels including on-demand channels for free. My recommendation is to part with another 50 dollars and go to the W Hotel or Hyatt right across from the Night Hotel.

The room was a good size for NY, but our bed was supposedly a double but it was incredibly small for two people. We questioned the hotel staff about the bed and they said they'd have the manager call us but she never did.The wallpaper is also peeling off and there were marks all over the walls.They also charge $10 per day per devise for wifi. They waived this for us but we had to go see them every single day for passwords.

My wife and 22 yr old son recently stayed at this hotel and on the whole we were impressed. The obvious advantage of staying at The Night hotel is its location. You are within a few yards of Time Square, near to the Ticket Booth. Access to the subway system is great and the staff were all very friendly and helpfulIf you want advise on anything ask the concierge. We did and weren't disappointed.As has been stated by others the rooms are small but adequate, unless you intend spending all day and night in them and let's face it, you're in the big apple, so why would you.Facilities inside the rooms were limited to a decent TV, Bose radio and shower. A coffee machine would be niceWe didn't use the bar or restaurant as food and drinks are expensive and there's an Irish pub across the road that provides better valueWe arrived early so left our luggage in the secure room. Again this wasn't a problem.The only real criticism I have is that wifi is not free in the room, there's a $10 charge per day. Although free in the lobby areas, wifi should be free in every hotel these days. Hey it is 2014 after all!Checkout was quick and painless. We wanted a taxi to the airport and the porter sorted this for us for $45 flat fee (la Guardia)

Stayed 4 nights for my birthday with my son and was thriled with the whole experience. The location is fab, its near everything, 30 seconds to Times Square, Our room was lovely and spacious, bathroom nice and clean. the hotel staff where always helpful and gave a few extras for my birthday, Had a fab time :-)

We were staying with 3,5 year old child in “Small Double Room ”. Do not book this room even if you don’t have a child. When you walk in to that room you can not do anything but get on the bed, that’s how small it is. I have never seen anything that small in my life (Even in Paris our hotel was double the size). Location is good, but too many people on Broadway that’s why we had to use 6th Avenue to get to hotel. Most of the people working in hotel are friendly and helpful. I will never book a hotel just because they have a child's cot/crib which BTW they said that it’s optional and might not be available for everyone. My reason for booking this hotel was because they have the crib. When I mentioned that I will write the review, crib became available. No crib sheets or duvet, nothing.

This was my first trip to NYC. The location was perfect - just a 15 minute walk from Penn Station, Times Square right around the corner, 20 minute walk to Central Park. The rooms were just ok. I liked the look and feel but our room was right next to the linen closet; the door was slammed off and on between 8 & 10am each morning. Although I did like the look/feel of the room, there was no way to let any daylight in from the window. The lights are very dim and it made it very difficult to get ready in the morning. The beds were very comfortable, but my toes were touching the end of the bed and I'm only 5'4" tall. On the plus side, however, Red Moon was excellent. Delicious cocktails and fusion food. The front desk staff was very helpful in recommending restaurants (Patrick, specifically). They even held our bags for a few hours after we checked out so we could explore the city, while waiting for our train.

No real issues but expected a 5 star hotel but only 3 star experience.- Very small room- Complicated TV and phone interface- High tech room interface - not everything worked and no cheat sheet provided on what did and did not work

Our room was located above or next to a bar/nightclub and the noise was so loud the floor was vibrating you could not sleep. Horrible horrible experience. Don't stay here if you want to be able to sleep. We bought ear plugs and the music was still too loud. Very disappointed. There rooms should be discounted.

When i saw pictures of the hotel, i became excited. Being an artist, i think the hotel captures really what New York is. The location is perfect... its right by time square. I was hungry in the middle of the night at 4am and I easily got down and bought food. I also love the service, staff is always similing and have so much initiative.

Stayed here with my b/f for a night and would’ve loved to stay longer. Yes the rooms are small, but it’s New York- you didn’t come here to stay in your room! They were clean and the beds and pillows were very comfortable after a long day in the city. Conveniently located right in the heart of everything. The décor reflects the “night” theme of the hotel: mostly blacks, very rich and elegant with a slight gothic appeal. Beyond perfect for anyone with a dark and twisty kink to their personality. :) Bar/restaurant in the lobby. Everyone was very friendly and the concierge held our suitcases in a locked room after we checked out so we could enjoy another full day without rolling our luggage through the crowds.

I enjoyed my stay at this Night Hotel. Never been to NY before and the staff were happy to help with anything I needed at any time. I also found the location very convenient to times square, less than a 5 min walk away. Inside the hotel was always pretty quiet so that was nice. The maid service does a great job too. The only reason I did not give 5 star rating was because I think the room service menu could have more variety.
Everyone was attentive and tried hard to accommodate all of our needs. The rooms were a little small though.
Room very small and claustrophobic. The atmosphere not so great. The only good thing was, it's right in Times Square. I didn't like the large cow hide sofa in the lobby

The hotel is well located and cool but the staff was unhelpful after we waited over an hour after out check-in time to "get the room cleaned" with nothing offered to compensate us for our time and wait. The Penthouse, while very cool, is starting to come apart at the seams and needs detailed maintenance work to bring it back to its original luster.

The Night hotel is a small boutique hotel just off of Times Square in NYC. The hotel was clean and the staff friendly. The room was very small, just fitting the king size bed with very little room for anything else. There was a small table along one wall, a mini fridge, not useable by the guest, that held very expensive drinks, and a small hanging bar above the fridge that would accommodate 4 or 5 hanging items (pants, shirts, coats, etc). The room did not come with a coffee maker, but the staff was able to find one and bring it to the room. We were very pleased with the staff and overall of the room. It would have been better if the bed was a little higher to allow under bed storage of suitcases.

I stayed 9 days at Night Hotel last july with my sister..The decoration was really dark..the carpets , certains , bath room and walls are black but stylish..welcome desk and staffs were really helpfull..service,house keeping and ambiance were good..We had so much fun and we loved that place;)

It's so unique and different from any other place. The staff, the room, the location werr Great! They were so nice, helpful and accommodating! We will Def be spreading the word on Night Hotel and will be returned guests =)

Hotel is clean. Notice their is Night Hotel and Night Hotel Times Square which is 2 blocks over and different inside. Night Hotel is okay. Not as "cool" as advertised. Small lobby area and bar/restaurant is only a few table. Although the food was very good. The room is especially small even by NY standards. There is no closet to hang clothes and really no extra space in the room. If you are on business no desk at all. Ironing board is 3/4 size. TV on wall looks like a 27inch should be bigger. Shower should have curved shower bar but doesn't. Just missing modern functions. Yes location is great, and it was clean. Just a few changes could make it better. Not good for a business traveller. They talk about the "night" theme, really its just dark, nothing more to it.
Great hotel, perfect location, clean room, staff very helpful and friendlyhotel is around the corner of time square, blocks away from rockefeller centereverything you need is there.
user_name:
D J J
Mcallen, Texas, United States

review_body: EXCELLENT location. AWESOME staff. Some parts of the property are due an update but overall my experience was great. The staff was kind and helpful. The room was adequate and comfortable. The walls are a little thin but I was able to sleep fine. Upon checkout I booked a room for a single night and they offered a discount. when I arrived early they gave me the choice of another room that was available immediately versus waiting a few hours for the room they had planned for me. I will absolutely stay here again.

Great location. Room was poorly designed, I thought. Bathroom could have used more shelving for toiletries and essentials. Staff was friendly and did their best to accommodate. I guess location overrode inconviences.

We stayed here for 10 days over the 4th of july and we fell inlove with this intimate hotel. The location is perfect since its just around the corner of Times square. The airconditioner was a bit loud but it only lasted for a minute and after a while you dont even notice it. The bed was really comfortable, like sleeping on a cloud(we had the kingsize). We will definitaly come back here if we ever visit Manhattan again.

The hotel is interesting and the rooms are quite comfortable, although our was very small, we didn't have enough space to open our suitcases. The receptionists were rude, not nice at all, they never say hello to you first and just try to ignore you. We had some requests for our payment that they said they'll do, but they didn't. They did all the opposite of what we've asked, although ourwish was very normal and simple. Also they make a fotocopy of a credit card and the passport and keep it for 3 months in the hotel. The deposit in cash is also imposible.
Great location for business, friendly staff, room smaller than expected, but overall experience was great!

Night is short for nightmare. This at first glance charming boutique hotel lacks any sense of joy or warmth. Everything is black and white and the lighting in the rooms is horrible.When I checked in, they told me that they will charge my credit 100 dollars more than cost of staying at hotel as a deposit. They also told that will release the deposit upon my checked out. Now, it is more than ONE MONTH that I have checked out from that hotel and haven’t received my deposit back. The front desk mangers are not responsive and not even care to answer costumer’s question. The doors are very thin, and you can hear your neighbors coming in and out and even talking in their rooms.The elevator is extremely slow, and there is only 1 of them. Their cleaning people are using the elevators at all hours of the day, making it very difficult to get to and from your room. The shower in the bathroom with no walls is awful. I used to have this in my apartment in Tokyo...when I was 22 and poor!

The room is very nice and the bed confortable , but the room is too small, the suitcases hardly feet inside, we had to moe furnishing to put one suitcase on the floor , the other one should be put in the closet. I think the room missed some lights.

The room was a decent size for NYC swanky and sexy as advertised!!Friendly efficient service!Great Chinese food and drinks right in the hotel lobby!!Very convenient!!Great location in Times Square!!Only minus was for a loud heater we only stayed one night so not sure if it's fixed!!

We visited NYC for 3 weeks whilst on our honeymoon. We stayed at Night the whole time and we loved it! First and foremost the staff were fabulous! So helpful, happy and full of information about the city and surroundings there was nothing they couldn't help with. The rooms are beautiful boutique, well furnished, stylish rooms. Bed was king size and full comfort. The feature lighting and stunning wallpaper just add to the appeal of the luxury rooms. The hotel itself is uber chic, very classy looking with stunning art and details throughout. Location wise it couldn't be more perfect, step out the door and there you have the lights of Times Square! Restaurants, theatres, the diamond district, shops, subway station, Starbucks all just seconds away! We loved our time at Night and can't wait to return! A huge thank you to Patrick, Daniella, Simon, Linda and all the wonderful staff for everything!

It's easy to see why Night is considered the sexiest hotel in New York. From the incredible pictures in the lobby to the mood lighting under the bed, this place screams seductive. The beds are amazingly comfortable, but watch out - if you're planning more than sleeping, it might be challenging. They're just that comfortable.

The hotel is basically in Times Square which is convenient but obviously noisy (avoid if your a light sleeper). The hotel is aimed at couples and have an adult vibe. It's a small hotel and this is reflected in the rooms, I stayed in 37 and it is small but not claustrophobic. There is no full length mirror and lighting is very poor excluding the bathroom, even in there it's not too good. All the doors rattle when a door is shut on the corridor and they could do with getting the paints pots out and going over the scuff and chips but that just me being picky. The room was cleaned very well daily (as long as you don't look under the bed). Some are the staff on the front desk and bar are stuck up but overall it was one of the cheaper hotels in Times Square and was a good base to get our heads down.

Rooms were ok. Staff during the day was helpful but night staff were hard to find or get assistance from.The room was small, but that is to be expected in the area. The problem was that the room was cold and the heater blew cold air and neither us or the staff could get it to change and blow warm air. Nor did they find a room where the heater worked.

My husband surprised me for my birthday with a weekend in the city and upon first entering the hotel, I was very excited. Very sexy and "naughty" pictures on the wall really give you a sense of sexuality which I love, but when we tried to check in they were totally backed up. They offered us complimentary drinks which was nice, but they told us they would call us when the room was ready. So, we hit the streets of the city for almost 3 hours before we got a call. When they took us to our room, it was just okay. The floor could have used another vacuum and there was a lot of hair on the bathroom floor. Speaking of the bathroom....I was beyond excited about the doorless shower, until the entire bathroom was almost flooded. We didn't spray the shower heads outside of the shower, but the water backed up on the floor which made for a very wet experience trying to get ready to go out. Overall, it was an okay stay. I expected more based on the initial appearance.

Overall The Night Hotel was a great choice for our stay in the city. The location is incredible with only a couple of minutes walk to Time Square or the Rockerfeller Centre, we were also able to get to Central Park within 20 minutes by walking up 5th ave which was a great excuse to look at the shops. The Hyatt opposite has the highest rooftop bar in Manhattan which is well worth a visit during your stay.On arrival we were really impressed by the entrance space and even managed to check in early. We were originally put into room 64 but after one night asked to moved as there was a draft in the bathroom which made it freezing cold due to the extreme temperatures but it meant we weren't able to use the bathroom until we had ran the shower for 20 minutes. Reception were more than happy to accommodate moving us and we were in our new room within 20 minutes of mentioning it to the front desk.The staff were incredibly helpful and were very happy to provide any information you needed. I'd 100% stay here again, it was a great location at a great price in a really stylish hotel. I wouldn't advise the hotel for an older couple based on it's unique style and rather dark interior.
This was an awesome hotel to stay at. The staff was very friendly. The food was great. The rooms are nice. The beds are comfortable. I would stay at the Night Hotel again.
Really cool property. Rooms were small but they were very nice. The best value I received while in NYC. Planning a trip with my wife soon.

In Times Square, close to all shops and Broadway theatersVery good bedNice service and personalVery dark room (we had a small room), suite might be more lightAir conditioning not confortable (very dry air)

we really liked our stay. Location is great. the only reason it is not a 5 is because of the lack or any kind of bureau. Would suggest they remove the desk and put in some sort of furniture that would give you a place to put your clothes (the closet is so deep and thin, that we could not hang up 1/3 of our clothes).

We stayed at Night Hotel for 3 nights from the 5th to 8th March. Very dark and seductive decor with some very interesting pictures on the walls and a Karma Sutra book in replace of the usual bed side bible. Great staff, comfortable beds and fab location. The hotel is very small in comparison to other hotels in NYC but that's what attracted us in the first place. The staff were friendly and very knowledgeable, assisting with questions and offering suggestions.The only draw back was the city noise. We were on the 8th Floor and could hear the cities activities. Tbh, it didn't bother us too much as we were sleeping well due to the busy days sight seeing. The complimentary toiletries were not the best but if like me you want to take the minimum in liquids, there's plenty of places to buy toiletries such as dwane reeds, cvs or walgreens. There's one on pretty much every corner! The hotel has a great bar that offers cocktails at a decent price and good measures too. If you prefer a small hotel that offers something different from the conventional hotels then I can't recommend Night hotel enough.

We searched Trip Advisor for a "romantic" place in NYC. This place was perfect! Reasonably priced and right in the heart of Times Square. The room is on the small side but was very clean and the staff was absolutely fantastic. Within walking distance to basically anything you are looking to eat or shop for. Will definitely stay here again and recommend to everyone.

The dude in front of me proposed and got free champaign man! I was trying to my gf to marry me too but couldn't pop the question right there! Instead it became very awkward for us while my gf was eagerly hoping we'd get champaign too! But we didn't. And we didn't get married either so maybe it's your fault night hotel! Sparkling wine doesn't cost a lot, heck, I would've paid a little bit if there was an option for it. One point knocked off the score!On the other hand, in this day and age you don't offer free wi fi? 10 bucks, really!? As a foreign tourist with no cell coverage I am totally dependent on wifi! And I can't use the mini bar (cant put a water bottle or anything in it) at all or ill be hit with this ridiculous charge? Thanks for the heads up but still! Sorry, there goes another point.Otherwise I found the hotel decor exciting, location perfect, service very good and why do you need a bigger room for, you're in Times Square, the point is to be outside! I paid a relatively affordable 200 dollars for one night and not about to pay more for a bigger room. I stayed in room 71 and it was nice and quiet.I will recommend this hotel to my friends.

me and my boyfriend came to new york for my birthday! we booked the night hotel and was not disapointed! we arrived from las vegas to JFK pretty early and the room was not available, but the guy on the reception was very helpful took our number and said he would call as soon as they have a room! we got a call within an hour. the room itself is VERY small, but the cleanliness and extremely comfy beds make up for it. the location of this hotel is amazing. the thai restaurant within the hotel is excellent! we chose to eat here nearly three times! we eat alot of thai food and the pad thai and thai green curry were spot on! I wish i could of remembered the receptionist who was a guy because he was so helpful, he told us were to visit, told us how to get there. he was just really friendly and made us feel very welcome! .. the concierge guy who helped us with our bags was also great, he helped us get transport back to the airport! Thankyou to the night hotel for making our stay very enjoyable! we will be back :-)

I love this hotel!! My boyfriend and I stayed here for a night and had the best time!! The bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on. The location is close to the New York City night life and the people that work there are absolutely amazing and accommodating. I can't wait to go back soon.
My wife and I stayed at the Night Hotel on our honey moon and loved it.The staff is polite and helpful, the rooms are nice and the location is amazing.

My husband and I stayed at Night Hotel the night before a cruise, and were really pleased. It is a modern boutique hotel, decorated primarily in black and white. As in most NYC hotels, the room was small, with a queen bed and the bathroom was great. It was clean, and again, black and white. Walk through the lobby and you'll find an Asian-fusion restaurant where my husband and I had a late delicious dinner (we were celebrating our 47th anniversary !), reasonably priced as well. There is no breakfast but there's a great deli across the street with tables, where my husband had a breakfast sandwich and I had a genuine NYC bagel with a schmear--something I've missed since moving from the NYC metro area 16 years ago!

Needed a place to sleep in the city, nothing more, and this place surpassed expectations. Really attractive modern style, comfortable bed in a quiet room, at a rate I didn't know it was possible to get in Manhattan, much less right off Times Square. Can't speak to bar/wifi/anything else, but if they keep their rates down, I'll keep staying here.
central and good price. bathroom not very clean - i asked to have it cleaned, but this didnt happen. red moon great, but no breakfast or room service in the morning.
great place , and great location loved the layout and very friendly and helpful staff, i would deff book again with night hotel
Relatively cheap and really, really cool inside. Not a huge fan of the area, but great for tourists.

Our room was very clean and neat, but small, but that is New York and you should not stay in the room but only to sleep we would stay there again, all front employees were very polite and helpful. The only problem I had was in the bar area, as I stated below the tip should not be included on the bill, then the employees would ,treat the customers better

I arrived at the Night at about 11:00 on a Friday and immediately loved the decor. Check in process was quick and the front person Patrick was friendly at check in. He told us our room was ready so we went to drop off our bags and hit the city. The room was small but nice and well organized it was very functional. The decor of the room was very nice I loved it. Went to look into the shower and it was awful. It looked like an old worn out gym shower. Everything else about the hotel was excellent. The location about 40 steps from time square and close to shopping galore. Patrick at the front desk saved this stay for us. He was very knowledgeable about good area restaurants. He also we out of his way to do anything he could to make the stay better. They also helped us with a cupcake delivery from crumbs. I will stay here again and hopefully the shower issue was an exception and not the rule. I had a blast in the city and cant wait to got back. This was my first boutique hotel in NY and all in all for the price I think this was a good deal.
A really great location and very fun and sexy room, great decor and friendly staff highly recommend

Stayed here a couple of weeks ago. It took a few minutes for the hotel to find the booking (which I didn't mind at all as the lobby is beautiful and so my taste) and once they found it they bumped me up from a queen size to king size bed which was brilliant of them. The room was a good size for a boutique hotel in NYC and the design of it was very nice. The shower dripped a bit but thiswasno bother. I was only supposed to stay for 5 days and ended up having to stay for 7 and they were more then happy to accommodate and even made it so I could stay in the same room for the extra days. Highly recommend Night. I plan to stay there whenever I am in NYC (which is often).

I have now stayed at the Night Hotel twice and it does not disappoint. Both visits the staff were immensely helpful and friendly. I love the theme of the hotel and how it has been adapted throughout. The sushi and drinks are super tasty and the perfect end to busy day exploring the busy city. Of course, the rooms are a bit small but that is New York. We managed to fit 4 cases in our room and it was fine. Being that close to the busy, bustling Times Square, what more could you ask for. See you again next year!

Travelled with my wife just after New Years to New York. The hotel is very well prices and it is in great location for tourist visit. It is just around the corner from the Times Square and shopping. From the pictures it looked interestingly designed, so we thought it would be a great option to stay. Our room was with a window to the back with a view to a wall, so very quiet from the street noise. It was very clean, bed comfortable. However the black design made everything very dark and you almost can`t see that the hotel was not updated for some time. The weather was very cold at that time in New York, but for some reason the air conditioning was switched on when we have arrived and it took some time to figure out how to warm up the room. We would call the receptionist, but since the moment of checking in, they were so passive and superficial, we did not want to ask them anything. I always seen americans as friendly nation, but this guys were just not an example. Absolutely no smiles no welcome, just taking money for the stay and good bye. All in all good value for money, but without any sensitivity, something you would expect from a designers hotel, which even calls itself the sexiest.

My wife and I stayed for one night while my cousin was here on business. 2 blocks from Times Square and close to many bars and restaurants. The staff was very professional and always addressed you even when you were just walking by them. The room was small but adequate for us, but if you are over 6 feet the bed may be a little small for you. We will definately stay again in the future.

Positives - 100 meters from Times Square and staff were in general good (great check-in from Patrick, very knowledgable). BUT this hotel is simply badly maintained. Carpets throughout are very worn, a lot of chipped marks on the walls both in the public areas & in the rooms and I found alot of dust in the cupboards where the clothing and safe are located. The first room (56) I stayed in had a broken shower and an air-con unit outside of the window making noise all night. Staff were great, apologised and moved me to another room (51). This room however had a problem with the window not shutting properly meaning that cold air (-2 outside) was permanently coming through into the room and I had to stuff towels around it to minimise the impact. Reported it to reception the next morning and was advised that maintenance would come and fix it. They never did and my towels were in the same position when I got back that evening. Reported it again the next morning and was told, maintenance didnt see any issue with the window - thats the way the windows are apparently. If you are in town for one night and dont plan on using the room so much, the location is really great especially if you plan on being in the midtown area - if you are planning to stay more than 2 nights - dont!

Had a fabulous stay. Location fantastic - 5 minute stroll to Times Square - yet room very quiet. Loved the trendy boutique style design. The lighting in the room was great with the bed being lit from beneath. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The only negative for me was the minimal space for clothes hanging/storage. OK for one person but would be a struggle for two. Overall loved the stay and would definitely stay here again.

Everything was so clean! There were nice notes from the hotel waiting for me. The bed was extremely comfortable, better than my own bed at home. The artsy decor was like sleeping in a cool painting. The neon lights under the bed were very different. I had a single room, not huge, but still comfortable, and super trendy. Not to mention the staff, especially Robert were so klind. Am definitely coming back, and already referring friends.
Fine staff, especially doormen!Great location, small but efficient room.Lack of business center only minus.

We stayed at the Night Hotel from the 3rd - 8th October 2013. This was my first trip to the USA and first time in New York for both my partner and myself. I can't really say much apart from how much I want to be back there! The hotel is very cool and sexy like everyone else has said. It is a bit pricey BUT for the standard of cleanliness, friendliness and location, you can't complain. One of the porter's very kindly arranged a car for us to the airport which saved us bussing it - we paid for this service of course but it was nice to have someone else arrange. We were always out and about so didn't use the amenities and it would have been nice if they served breakfast - that was the only slightly annoying thing, having to spend the morning looking for somewhere to eat but this is only because I'm a bit fussy - the location is surrounded by thousands of places to eat. Would book again and recommend endlessly! PS - Definitely a couple's
The hotel look and feel is beautiful, dark and quiet and the staff were very nice. Room Service was delicious and the entire stay was exactly what we needed.

First, the good points. This hotel has a great location for seeing Broadway shows. It's just a half block from Times Square. It is modestly priced, which is the primary reason I booked the hotel, and the savings enabled us to spend an extra night in the city. We had a room with a window to the back. It was very quiet. Absolutely no noise issues at any time of the day. The hotel is clean and feels safe. The hotel staff could be helpful, but you have to ask. The first night we arrived, explained the airline lost our luggage, and the only response we received was crickets chirping. There is a Walgreens down the street, but still, no help volunteer or concern expressed.Now to the not so good points: this hotel promotes itself as the "sexiest hotel in America," which I thought would amuse my girlfriend during our weekend getaway. I guess sexy is dark, and by that I mean pitch black, dark. This hotel has no lights -- anywhere. And true to its name, it feels like it is night 24 hours per day. My girlfriend and I felt like falling asleep every time we walked into the hotel, even if it was 10:00 a.m. and we'd just come back from coffee. Sexy is also small. We had the standard room, and I expected the room to be small like most NYC hotel rooms, but if you're going to market to couples, then a room should be big enough for two people, as opposed to the single business traveler.
