There was about two feet of closet space, the rest of the small closet taken up by the refrigerator for the room. There were no drawers to unpack your clothes, and the only place for your luggage, which could be unpacked only on an "as needed basis" was right in front of the closet door, meaning you couldn't ever open the closet door because it was always blocked by your unpacked luggage. Also, other than about 8 inches of space on the other side of the bed, the space in front of the closet was also the only open floor space in the room. So, if you stay here, don't expect to stand or walk in your hotel room, and of course, there is no room for even a chair. The bathroom was also dark and tiny. It was so dark that my girlfriend couldn't use the bathroom mirror to get ready because she couldn't see anything. The bathroom had no fan, so this hotel is only for established couples who are totally secure in their relationship. Once you open that bathroom door, any unpleasantness is going to come pouring out into the tiny room. Finally, the designer of this hotel was apparently a big fan of the movie Eyes Wide Shut, because throughout the hotel the only lighting comes from black and white, back-lightened photographs that depict soft-porn scenes that seem to have been inspired by Eyes Wide Shut. Suffice it to say, because of these photographs alone, this isn't a hotel you want to take your kids to. So, if your definition of sexy is staying in a phone booth that's been painted black and is lighted by only a cell phone screen displaying a "hot" photo from Eyes Wide Shut, then this hotel is for you. For everybody else, this hotel is good for an amused smirk -- at least until you bump into something, then you'll have a different expression.

Spent an evening at Night hotel this past weekend for a little rendezvous with my boyfriend. Online booking was easy and the price was right. Great value for a couples staycation in the city. I'm not a fan of Times Square but this hotel definitely does not embody the typical experience of the area as it is anything BUT touristy. We stayed in the king size room (#68 to be exact) that had adequate enough space for us. We didn't have luggage so extra storage was not an issue. Room was spotless and decor was very seductive. Bed was super comfortable and the lighting is very inviting. Staff at front desk was very friendly (Specifically a gentleman named Patrick!) and helped me with my small requests during the stay. One tip for anyone considering this hotel is that it is definitely NOT a place for kids. Everyone else, enjoy!
user_name:
KurvayshusBrake
New York City, New York

review_body: This was our 3 visit,hotel still VERY sexy.Ideal central location,just meters from times square.And across the road to mandatory IRISH pubs :0)Hotel restaurant (Red Moon) lovely food (recommend the sea bass and red curry)Drinks a little on the expensive side.....but to be expected.Rooms are slightly on the small side,but the decor more than makes up for it.Ideal for couples.Would definitely stay again......(IF WE GET A BABYSITTER)Enjoy your stay

Everything in this hotel is back or white. The only exception we found was a red cushion on a chair at the bar. The attention to detail is amazing (black bath ropes, napkins, tiles), and the atmosphere with the dimmed light and lounge music throughout the hotel is really cool. If you are looking for colour or flowers this is not your hotel, but the service, overall quality, location and price are excellent, especially in NYC with so many options and choices. The hotel is in walking distance to everything, and we will definitely stay there again.

I've had the pleasure of staying at the Night Hotel several times over the past six or seven years. It had been a while since I've stayed and am happy to report this hotel is still EXCELLENT, and a great overnight experience for a Times Square hotel. The swanky black and white design of the entire hotel still works, its very nicely kept. My room was, as most NYC hotel rooms are, small but perfect for my needs. Comfy bed, with lots of amenities. I love returning to my room at night to find the lights set low, the radio tuned in, my bed turned down, robe laid out on the bed, and a square of chocolate on my pillow. I got a great rate of $104. for my 1-night-stay--Perfect for all this, yes? Check in/check out both speedy and just steps away from Times Square. Looking forward to returning here on my next business trip.

the rooms were very small. the design was kind of cool but still very small. The location was great as it is very close to Times Square. Good place for 2 or 3 nights. no real complaints so if you get this for a good price then go for it

We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights over Super Bowl weekend. There were 3 couples traveling in our party. None of us had ever been to nyc before and were choosing a hotel somewhat blindly. The location is excellent. Couldn't be beat. The rooms were great- clean and roomy enough. The hotel is dark and modern- definitely for couples. The bar was great, as was the front desk staff and door man. Very helpful and friendly. The door man even arranged last minute Escalade airport transportation for our party when our limo could not pick us up due to a snow storm coming in.  Would definitely stay here again. There is also a great Irish bar - Connolly's- across the street. It was a trip we will never forget- especially with our epic Super Bowl victory! Thank you Night hotel and Go Hawks!!!

I've stayed in many hotels in New York and most leave me disappointed. I stayed here in December and it will now be my first choice for all my NY trips. The rooms are full of character and are perfect if you are in town with a companion, as you won't find a sexier room in the city

This would be our 2nd stay at Night hotel and every time is more amazing than the last!Convenient location to times square legit steps away! Also within walking distance from Port authority bus terminal.Upon check in we were offered complimentary drink coupons from the front desk and enjoyed amazing cocktails in the bar/lounge. When we went to our room and we're offered an amenity of a bottle if champagne from the hotel staff. The staff is friendly and VERY helpful. This hotel is the definition of a sultry and sexy. Always such a great retreat away from home. I cannot wait to come and stay again!

My husband and I met up with friends in the city and stayed at this hotel for two nights. The staff is excellent from the bellman, Simone to Patrick at the front desk they were friendly and helpful at all times. We loved the valet parking, The hotel is edgy and dark, I think for adults preferably. Our room was very clean and well kept by the housekeeping staff. We stepped out the door and we were in time square in seconds. Perfect place to stay if you are seeing a show as all theatres within walking distance. We took the subway down to see the Freedom tower and 911 memorial. Great restaurants all around and a starbucks around the corner. There are no coffee makers in the rooms but my husband enjoyed the walk and brought me coffee in bed!! Perfect. The room we stayed in was on the second floor which we would do again as we could just zip up the stairs to our room. Some say the lifts are slow, we never needed them. Our room faced the street and you could here the street noise. I liked hearing it but did put on the bose radio to muffle the sound. If you want a convenient place to stay, this is great. There is some sexy art work so that is why I say no kids. The price was great and would stay there again for sure. the beds are very comfie with nice linens.

Overall our stay at the Night Hotel was enjoyable. Location was perfect, hotel staff were extremely helpful and food was great.Positives would be the rooms were modern, cleanliness was 100% and one of the hotel staff Robert was more than helpful with assisting us in anything that we needed. The bar staff showed professionalism and were extremely friendly.The downsides would be that the rooms are quite small, we had some minor issues with the heating and cooling unit and drinks in the mini bar were not cool.Overall amazing location, great staff, modernized rooms and we recommend this hotel.

The extremely original Night Hotel is with out question one nicest Boutique hotels I have ever stayed in. It has more character than any Kimpton property which is further augmented by very helpful staff. I was upgraded to a junior suite which had a full balcony. The room was very clean and had nice details that are not listed in the description (Such as a Bang & Olufsen entertainment center). The black motif within the rooms is dark, however it quickly becomes welcoming. I plan on staying here again in this summer.

We stayed at the Night for a week and loved it. It has the best location everything is right at your fingertips. This motel is small but has everything you need , the rooms are rather small but very comfortable we had a room at the front of the hotel , it was a little noisy but hey you are in New York and we would have this room again. The staff were lovely and very helpful. This really is a great place to stay.

Location couldn't be better, staff is outstanding, Starbucks two doors down, small market across the street. Rooms are very clean but tiny and dark. The entire hotel is dark and the lighting is moody and, well dark. While I am more of a light person and prefer airy open light rooms, I enjoyed my stay at the Night.If you are a single business traveler (like me) a standard room works great as long as you don't have a lot of luggage. I did find myself stumbling over things because there isn't a lot of room to put things. My room did not have a dresser, but a small closet. Not recommending this hotel for families but hipsters who like a hotel with an edge. In addition their website offered such great room rates that this was a no-brainer. Will be back.

Stayed here for a week in early January and this was the perfect base for all the sights and attractions available in central Manhattan. Located just a short 100 yards to the heart of Times Square or a similar distance to 6th Avenue, you really are right in the heart of the action. The hotel is boutique and has a quirky edge to it which is more suited to couples. The decor is modern and is full of character in line with its theme. The rooms are very comfortable, excellent bed and luxurious furnishings which lead to a comfortable experience after a hard day on the streets of NYC. Excellent little touches from housekeeping who laid out my wife's dressing gown and ensured we were greeted by softly playing classical music when returning in the evenings. The staff at the hotel are extremely helpful but are not over friendly, and are available when you need their help ,which is a welcome change from the OTT approach often provided from the main chain hotels. Robert, Daniella, Patrick and Simon around the reception area, were always available and courteous enough to ensure our stay was very enjoyable without being intrusive. Excellent Cosmopolitans prepared in the bar by Lisa, made for a nice night cap. If you are looking for a great base to explore this amazing City, this is a good place to consider. We'll done guys...see you on our return in the future!

This was our forth stay at the Night Hotel. This was only one night (the other stays were longer) but the staff remembered us, treated us like royalty, supplied a "fragrance free" room, and handled our every request immediately and with a smile. The room was clean, quiet, comfortable, and with every amenity except a coffee maker. Great ambiance. We'll be back.
user_name:
Jo B
New York City, New York

review_body: Its hard to review this hotel as it has so many good things about it but one major thing wrong, how loud the music is pumped down the corridors and around reception. The good-The hotel is in the most amazing location, right in the heart of everywhere but not on the main roads. The room is wonderfully designed, very cool and funky. I arrived to find a complimentary bottle of wine welcoming me to the hotel. What's bad: Its a hotel that likes to portray itself as a party hotel for trendy people. I would like to think I am one of those, being youngish and working in media. However even I have to say that I thought this hotel was pompous. The staff acted like they were the models in the sex-rated photos on the walls. They failed to acknowledge me on arrival, carried on talking to each other, looking at themselves in the mirror until I announced I was checking-in and coming straight off a flight from London. Down the corridors they played loud nightclub style music, which is fine but you can really hear it in your bedroom. Kind of sounds like a party going on next door once your door is shut. The rooms are super dark, very sexy yes but too dark to put your make-up on in, read a book etc. and no ability to turn them up. Also I was missing a coffee and tea machine in the room. I woke in the morning to find not even a bottle of water to drink. Although I think the idea might have been to have opened the complimentary bottle of wine and carried the party on early in the morning! If you're in town to party it's the perfect hotel, if you need a good nights sleep then looks around for somewhere else.

Myself and my boyfriend stayed here in March 2013, and were a tiny bit aprehensive after reading some of the reviews. We couldn't have been more wrong. Everything about this place was perfect, from check in right through to check out. We had a problem with our credit card when booking, but the manager kindly kept the rate for us. We found all staff that we encountered to be very helpful and friendly, and nothing was too much trouble for them.The room was a good size, I think it was the Queen room we had booked, and while the room itself may have been a little dark (perhaps a light over the closet area would be a good idea) the light in the bathroom was fine. We didnt have a view, but that was fine as we spent most of our time out and about, rather than looking at it from a window!Bed was comfy and the overall decor was fab. Our room was spotless when we arrived and cleaned daily to a very high standard, (I am very messy on holidays so that was no easy task).We were so busy shopping and sightseeing that we didnt get a chance to have a drink or dinner in the hotel, but we walked through the bar and once again, like the rest of the hotel, the decor was gorgeous.Location couldn't have been better, literally a 30 second walk to T SQ!Having stayed in a number of different NYC hotels, I would recommned this hotel as the best I have stayed in, in NYc and will definitely stay here again.

Not a bad hotel at all, the lobby area was fantastic, room was big enough little dated but overall very clean. Bed did sink a bit in the middle. But all in all a good hotel, would stay here again. Found the staff very helpful and polite. Rooms were cleaned everyday no matter what time we left.Great find.

My husband and I stayed at the Night Hotel for one evening in January. It is basically in the middle of Times Square, so very central for that part of NYC. Our room (75) was decent in size and was an interior room, which made it quiet from street noise. There was no view, but I preferred having quiet over a street view. The bed was comfortable, with a small exception that it was a bit too short for my husband due to the foot board at the end. Their overnight valet parking is a deal at $55 compared to the rate at the garage right next door ($96). A complimentary bottle of wine was left in our room by the management, which was a nice touch and much appreciated. Next time we stay in the Times Square area of NYC, we would not hesitate to return. The Night Hotel is a stylish hotel and a great value for NYC. (One tip: If you are looking to get your car from the valet during a busy checkout time (i.e. Noon on Sunday), allow plenty of time due to high demand)

Loved this hotel! Rates/room size/online photos - all were as expected. Far enough away from Times Square to avoid noise/lights but close enough to be in the center of it all. Staff was excellent - really enjoyed our time. NOT a family friendly hotel, perfect for couples!Had to really search for something to complain about - the shower curtain would not stop enveloping me. Never sure why so many hotel bathrooms don't have exhaust fans, but I'm really stretching it to find something wrong with our stay.

The room are tiny. This is not the hotels fault. I do not recall reading any thing on the web site about the size of the room. Great for one person or couples that travels w/no luggage or w/overnite clothing. Closets was so small that my overcoat took half the space. The clerks were friendly and courtesy. We spent one night and left the next morning. no issues and fact we were given a depoist back. This is truly a Boutique Hotel. I recommemnd this location for a person traveling alone. Great location. I take the blame for not doing more research.

We went for NYE 2014 and this hotel is situated perfectly in Times Square, however do not expect a view of Times Square. The room is incredibly small but typical of most NYC hotel rooms. When we arrived our toilet and remote control did not work. The toilet was quickly fixed but the remote did not work the entire trip. They do not have dedicated concierges but the front desk handles both duties. I am finding that the best concierges do not pull double duty. During that time of year you really need someone who can help you navigate the city. We were disappointed in their knowledge and we were left to own devices (yelp). The most frustrating part is when we asked for a cab and instead they called a private car to take us to the airport. That move cost double the price. Next time we will stay somewhere with a true concierge.

We had a great stay at this centrally located hotel. It was in a perfect location for us, between Times Square and 5th Avenue's shopping. The hotel staff was friendly and we even received a bottle of wine upon arrival. The decor is great, sexy neo-gothic, but definitely not for children. The elevator is tight and the room was small, but not as small as those in other similarly located hotels. However, we had quite the array of billing issues after checkout. We paid for the hotel with a Citi card and put our valet parking on an American Express. However, the hotel put the $275 valet parking on both my American Express and the Citi Card as well as a double charge for one night and charged me $35 more for the hotel stay. Then, instead of reimbursing me for the $500+, they charged me for another $500 instead of crediting me it. Luckily, I looked at my card statement and noticed it. It took about 9 phone calls to the credit card companies and hotel to get this straightened out. The hotel had to call the card company and at first only got rid of the $500 charge rather than changing it to a credit. I had to keep calling the card company and the hotel and eventually it was fixed but it wouldn't have been if I hadn't kept on the hotel.

We were with a party of 5 in 3 different rooms with Queen beds. The hotel is ideally situated on Time Square. The service is excellent.The lobby, bar and restaurant are beautiful and very pleasant.We were on the 7th floor and our room was rather quiet which was less true for one of the rooms that was situated on the street side.The rooms however are extremely small and it is impossible to be more than one person in the bathroom. There are only 2 (extremely slow) elevators for the entire hotel which are being used by the personnel as well

I was with a party of 8, and we stayed here from 18th December to 22nd December 2013.Checking in was easy and we unable to have rooms allocated on the same floor however they did allocate the rooms so that we were close to the lift which was excellent and appreciated.WiFi is $10 for 24hrs which I think is reasonable. I paid for the first night.The only issue with the stay was that we all had issues with the door keys, we were issued two cards per room. However one would work and the other would not, which made things annoying if we did not return together at the hotel. The hotel staff did everything they could short of changing the actual locks themselves. It turns out it was an issue with most of the locks in the hotel. Staff were baffled by the situation and for the inconvienence we were given free WiFi for the duration of our stay.We found free wine in our rooms which was a lovely touch, the hotel new we were in NYC celebrating my 30th Birthday.The staff were excellent, they chatted to us and were very informative when we had questions to ask. Whether it be the best place for breakfast or a place to get a good cup of coffee. Always had a little chat with them all upon my return from a day out. Really fantastic!The hotel itself is awesome. I love the interior and exterior. I love the darkness and the black and white. The bed was all kinds of comfortable. I stayed in a queen room. Pillows were lovely as was the mattress. Decor is excellent! In the bedside table you will not find a bible, but I shall not spoil the surprise of what was found!! !! Brilliant.On my Birthday I came back to the hotel from the day out, pre evening out, I found a bottle of bubbly with compliments! Lovely gesture considering how well I was already looked after! SO close to Times Square, a one minute walk, and a five minute walk to Rockerfeller Center/Radio City Music Hall.I WILL BE BACK! I normally forget the names of hotels I stay at, such as my previous occasion to NYC 7 years prior. This hotel offers a completely different experience for the better and I cannot wait to re-visit.EXCELLENT!

I stayed at the Night Hotel for 4 nights when I was in NY in autumn 2012. My friend highly reccomended the hotel, so I guess my expectations where excessive, - the value for the money we payed was not fulfilled. If you are looking for something special,- stay there: The rooms are stylish but small. Time Square's just arround the corner and the staff was always friendly and helpful. A 24/7 construction area nicked my sleep.

Professional staff - very accommodating and attentive, as I waited for the rest of our party. Cool urban hotel atmosphere and rooms were typical NYC size, but perfect for what we needed. The MidTown / Times Square location was perfect for our two night stay. We had appetizers and a drink while we waited. Barmaid was personable and recommended the perfect vodka. Also consider checking out sister hotel Dream on W 55th - nice rooftop bar.

Be advised, this is a small boutique style hotel—that smells good! When I say small, I mean small. The lobby itself is compact so don't be surprised/disappointed when you come in. The rooms and hallways reminded me of our last cruise ship vacation. The benefit however; is a no-nonsense hotel lobby with no "loiterers".  After reading tons of reviews, we decided to stay in Time Square for our first time to NY to celebrate our 20 yr. anniversary. Some said the hotel was like a nightclub, and I did not want to be around a bunch of young club-hoppers, but we were pleasantly surprised by the guests. They ranged in age, but we rarely ran into other guests despite the compact size of the hotel. The decor is exactly as the pics show, black and white, sexy, and catered for adults. This was just what we wanted. We didn't want to stay in a "family" hotel with kids because we came to NY to escape our young kids. The hotel doesn't discriminate I'm sure; if you want to bring your kids you can, but it’s definitely a grown-up’s place. No real “security” at the hotel, and sometimes, no doorman. Maybe it would raise prices to have one full-time..hmm. The only noises I could hear from other guests at night was their doors closing. Once closed, I could not hear anything else--thankfully :-). We didn't notice any problems with the elevator speed. The hotel has only 9 floors, so I didn't expect them to be as fast as the WTC or anything. I will say the room we stayed in is starting to show some minor wear. The bathroom tiles were missing grout in some areas, and as other reviewers mention, the lighting was a challenge even though our bathroom had a window. The wood on the bathroom vanity has endured some water damage, and the caulking had a bit of mold...nothing that a little elbow grease could not have fixed. The room itself was good (room 86). The bed was a little "saggy" for my taste, but I didn't lose any sleep over it. As warned by other guest reviews, we didn't touch the minibar due to it being "tripped". A full length mirror in the bathroom and room would be helpful both functionally and aesthetically. Graciously, the hotel sent us a bottle of Champagne to celebrate and allowed us a bit of an early and late check out as a courtesy. All in all, they were very good to us.  The only reason the review lost a star was due to housekeeping. I was a bit disturbed to find that on our first day of check-in, they left one used lotion bottle from the previous guest(s). That kept running through my mind because that was something that I could see, but what else was missed that I couldn’t see? Were the sheets/pillows washed etc.? That is a no-no in my book! Also, the next day while we were out, housekeeping came in to clean as normal and the same hair that was on the countertop and sink was also there when we returned. I was not happy about that either. I'm sure the housekeeping staff is in need of a refresher meeting.  Overall, we enjoyed our stay, and would recommend it if others wanted to stay in a discrete location geared towards adults near the buzz of the city. The location was awesome...only a block from all the action. Close to the 42nd street subway entrance that you will quickly become familiar with if you decide to ride the subway. Patrick gave us a quick Subway 101 crash-course, and we were subway pros by day 4. Patrick also recommended a place called Junior’s down the street for breakfast and it was excellent. He was very nice, although I'm sure us "pesky" tourists ask him the same questions over and over, he obliged us like we were old annoying friends of his :-).

-for couples only!-take stairs and check out cute photos on every floor-great restaurant (dinner only! on weekends)-have to ask for coffee maker; not in the room by default-umbrella/hair dryer to use, so do not drag yours-if you are a Wyndham member (free to join)-you get free wifi-NO breakfast, so plan to order from nearby cafes or bring your own-bring chocolates to treat your special one-free HBO (and other channels) on demand-very helpful staff, just ask
user_name:
KatushaNY
New York City, New York

review_body: I truly do not have a bad word to say about this hotel. We were warmly greeted from the moment we stepped into the hotel to the moment we left.  The hotel itself looks exactly like the pictures on the website, the rooms are not very big but that was fine, everything from room to the foyer was beautiful and well decorated and the location is right at Time Square.. What more could you need?

The Night Hotel on 45th was surprisingly amazing! I stayed there for 5 nights. The place felt cozy and very close to Times Square. A gentleman named Rocky was extremely accommodating. He even comped me a drink at del Friscos. :-) the entire staff was helpful and the rate was reasonable. I had a pleasant experience. I'd stay here again next time I'm in NYC.

We arrived here on 12th December. Our 1st impression of this hotel was very nice & modern. The desk staff were friendly & helpful. Top marks goes to Walter the concierge he was very knowledgable & nothing was any trouble for him. He even organised for a bottle of champers as it was my birthday while we were out there. Our room as a lot of reviews have said isn't the largest of rooms but it was very clean & tidy & had everything you need also the bed was so comfortable I never wanted to get out of it. There were a couple of down sides I found to this hotel which weren't major but just annoyed us a little one being the lifts.........they are so SLOW & don't always to stop on your floor which can get a little bit irritating & the other was our door card we had to have it refreshed 6/7 times & after you have waited for the lift once to have to wait 3 times can be rather time consuming. The other thing I thing could improve hotel is free wifi throughout not just in public areas. I am a light sleeper so as we had a front king room on the 5th floor the notice of the beeping traffic is not good but this is what New York City is all about.On the whole we loved our stay here & would recommend as it is very central in time square.

The staff at the front desk were terrible, Valet parking service was totally unreliable, I was advised to call 15 minutes in advance , it took over an hour to get my car.The front desk person, Patrick had no clue how to rectify the situation .
user_name:
ajfatboy
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed at the Night Hotel for a few nights in November 2013. The hotel was easy to find and the reception area looks great - sleek and modern. They do not accept passports for check in, only accept credit cards. I was initially given a large king room facing the street on the second floor. On the first night, I found out why NYC is known at the city that never sleeps. Even as a deep sleeper, I had issues and when I called the front desk, they asked if I wanted earplugs. I opted for a room change which they dealt with quickly and I was in a new room the next day. This time I was on the 5th floor but still on the street which made no difference to the noise level. However, they could only offer me a smaller room away from the street which I declined.In a rush to get my stuff together to move from one room to another, I forgot to get my passport and some spare cash out of the safe and they brought the safe to me straight away. Nothing was missing.The bed is comfortable and the shower was amazing; good pressure. No chocolate mints on the pillow but something more useful in the form of a daily report detailing the weather for the next few days and places of where to go and where to eat.Pros:Amazing location; you are just off Times Square - it cannot get any betterFriendly staff, happy to help at all timesGorgeous styled room - different to all the boring chain hotels and definitely memorableHuge wet room and lovely toiletriesCons:The level of noise coming from the street is ridiculous - earplugs might be a necessity The rooms are dark and lack good lighting, however the bathroom does have good lightingNo full length mirror; Guys might not be so fussed about this but I like to see what I look like before I leave the houseThe lift takes ages to arrive; just use stairs if you can.Rooms are starting to look a little bit wornThe A/C makes a lot of noise when on, I would turn the A/C on when I left for the day and then turn it off once I got backI sadly didn't try the restaurant but it looked great.I purposely chose this hotel as I wanted something different in terms of style and look and this hotel delivered - if they sorted out the noise issues for the front rooms, it would be a 5 out of 5 review. However, despite this, I would choose this hotel again for their service standards alone.

Extremely close to times square and all the buzz that engulfs it. Very friendly staff including the manager. Cool decor, good food. Really enjoyed using it as a base to explore new york.However negatives are: due to location expect noise. Street facing rooms could really do with triple glazing to offset this. Room starting to need a refresh, i.e marks on wall paper etc. Rooms are not massive, althought this is a major city centre hotel and so cannot complain.

Very comfy room and bed. Perfect location and helpful staff. The only cons is that the rooms are a bit dark, no natural light coming through windows, no views. But the rest is everything really good. Clean, good service, nice staff.

My wife had wanted to go into New York City to see a play. So instead, I decided to take my wife on a little getaway into to the city for a few days (Yes I did take her to see a play too). We stayed in a King Suite on the penthouse level with a balcony. I must say that I am glad that I had chose this hotel, staff treated us warmly no matter what time of the day or night that we came in. Due to the proximity of this hotel to Times Square and Theater District choosing this hotel was a smart choice. I loved the ambiance that this hotel exuded from the moment that we walked in (Dark & Lovely). This hotel definitely has a vibe of its own and I like that. Once we got to our room we were greeted with a complimentary bottle of champagne and a personalized letter (very nice touch). Next we walked out to the balcony where we had a nice view of the hustle and bustle of the city. This definitely a hotel that I will stay in again, it is hard to beat this combination of customer service and attention to detail that this hotel provides. Made the both of us feel like people and not just another number. Thank You for make our stay quite pleasant.

I stayed at the hotel it was very nice but very dark. The service was great. Robert at the front desk was especially helpful and very courteous. The restaurant he sent us to was great and I was very impressed. Thanks Robert

I took a holiday with my fiancée and our chosen destination was New York, a friend of mine recommended Night Hotel so we got our self there and I caught myself with Robert he did all the itinerary and he explained to us how to get through New York City he also got us booked to 3 top notch restaurants in the city last minute it was absolutely brilliant, hes a fantastic staff and also has a top notch customer service.Excellent experience and a fabulous holiday,will recommend to my friends and family.

My husband and I just spent three nights at this lovely hotel. From the time we arrived we knew we had made a good choice. The front desk folks were extremely friendly and helpful. Location was just perfect; within walking distance from Times Square, the Theaters, shopping, and great restaurants that were recommended by the folks at the front desk. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to New York City.

It was my first time in the US, I had a very rough trip arriving to NYC during a storm but once I got to the hotel it just kept getting better. Starting with the location the hotel is situated in the heart of times square which made life much much easier, I was a short walk away from all the spots I wanted to visit. Checking in was a very smooth process and the receptionist with very pleasant, helpful and friendly, I was directed to my room on the 4th floor in no time and was very pleased with the cleanness of the room and the very comfy bed. Whenever I needed anything from the reception the picked up before the phone even rang :D they were very helpful and made me feel welcomed. Upon checking out the receptionist helped me get a cap without even asking. I'm definitely staying at the night hotel again once am back in NY.

my husband and I stayed in the Night hotel NYC in sept 2013 for 5 days and it was the perfect base for our trip. the location was fantastic. right off times square but not too noisey. close to rockerfellar centre and subways. The room was small but had everything we needed and was very boutique and of a very high standard. I would go as far as to say luxury. The bed was very comfortable, the service from the staff was outstanding they could not have been more helpful.the irish bar across the road 'the perfect pint' has a lovely rooftop garden, nice beers and food and free wifi. there was wifi available in hotel at a small charge too.I will be recommending this hotel for a long time and hope to return VERY soon

I took my husband to NYC for his birthday and we stayed at the Night hotel. All of the staff members were extremely gracious and we loved our room. Although somewhat small, the room was beautifully decorated and very comfortable with all of the amenities you could need for a stay. The decor is very cosmopolitan and very exotic. Great lounge and lobby as well. Both Simon and Jeffrey were most helpful and friendly, never making you feel as though you were taking too much time. In fact, when I mentioned that it was my husband's birthday, they had a complimentary bottle of champagne to the room, which of course was not expected. I believe that this will be our hotel of choice for future visits. I have been going to NYC on business since 1987 and generally stayed at a Marriott or other chain hotel and although I had no complaints I am much impressed with the intimacy and feeling of "belonging" that the Night hotel offered. As we were taking in two shows in as many days, the location in Times Square was perfect and actually not too far from the midtown stores, i.e. Saks, etc. We hope to get back very soon and I must say that the hotel staff (particularly Simon and Jeffrey) played no small part in this decision. Thank you Night hotel for your wonderful hospitality!!!!

I stayed here for work and I must say, the very nice gentleman at the front desk made my stay relaxing. I believe his name is Robert and he is such a sweetheart! He extended his kindness and service everytime I stopped by downstairs for questions. Thank you Night Hotel for having such excellent staff! I will recommend your hotel to all of my colleagues!-Lane

I was on a business trip and knew that I would hardly be in the room. So for the few hours I was there it really worked well and had a modern, updated feel. Lighting for reading could be better and the alarm portion of the clock didn't work so you have to have a wake-up call. But bed was comfortable and room was quiet and clean. The front desk was so helpful. The woman helped me map out how I could walk and subway around the city for my three meetings the next day and I was grateful for her time and knowledge. Walked up the street to Evergreen Diner for a delicious, cheap breakfast and then easily to Times Square and Baked by Melissa cupcakes to bring home.

This was an amazing experience. The desk staff was so helpful. It was our anniversary and when we returned for the evening the staff had left a bottle of champagne with a note addressed to us, and music playing softly in the background. It made our visit magical. The room was spotless, beautiful and sexy. Will definitely return.

I have stayed here a lot primarily for work. My office is three blocks away so this hotel is convenient. The prices have gone up though so I have been staying somewhere else due to company budget. One thing that sets this hotel apart is not only the vibe but the staff. I haven't been to any other hotel where the staff actually remembers my name. The food in the restaurant is great too. I always seem to get an upgrade or in one of the better rooms when I used to come here. Get to know the staff, Robert and Luis in particular.

Stayed here as part of our Honeymoon and was impressed with the hotel from the moment we walked in. The guy at the front door helped my wife with her bags and was extreamly polite. The guy behind the check-in desk was also very nice and ordered a bottle of bubbly to our room. Check-in went without a hitch. The rooms are small but from what we read previously this is the norm for NYC. The decor is very stylish with black and white tiling, very chic indeed. The bed was comfortable and the room itself was very clean. The lighting in the room itself was dim but added to the effect the designers were trying to achieve. Music playing in the hallway is very cool and reading the previous reviews IT CANNOT be heard once in your room. The air-con is noisy when on but isnt unbearable and didnt effect our sleep. The room comes complete with a flat screen with lots of channels and on-demand movies. We noticed a crack in the window upon our arrival but this was measured and replaced before we left and were assured that it would not compromise the security of the room. Wifi was complementary as a result. Patrick on the front desk was very helpful and actually saved us a lot of time and money with directing us towards the attractions we wanted to see. His knowledge of the area is second to none and was extreamly polite. The location is excellent as it is literally in Times square with lots of places to eat. Central Park and the top of the rock only a short walk away. Looking to return to NYC in the future and would not hesitate to return to this very well looked after hotel. Thanks very much we enjoyed our stay.

We was greeted and given the key to our room it was compact but just what you would expect and had everything that you would need including an iron! The hotel is an ideal location and a stones throw from Times Square we slept very well indeed the entire hotel is decorated in grey and black which is very stylish although I must say it would be great to have maybe a mirror in the bedroom perhaps full length and also the lighting isn't the best when it comes to doing your make up. Other than that perfect! We went to the reception for advice on bus tours and also to book us a taxi to the airport and they was nothing but helpful. I would definitely come back and stay here again in the sexiest hotel in NYC :-).

I booked this hotel on Expedia, whilst they had a 'sale', still expensive, but it is NY city and you can't argue with the location. I was disappointed that the tax wasn't shown when booking, it simply said 'tax may or may not be included'. That is a failing of Expedia!The hotel itself is very well presented as you enter. Staff are friendly and very helpful should you need any assistance. The attached bar has 'happy hour' specials each evening which is welcome after a long day on your feet. One evening we arrived to find that most of the bar had been booked out to a company so it was standing room only, however we were welcome to take our drinks to enjoy in our room as we got ready for the night ahead. The lifts are very slow, but as we were on floor 3 the stairs were our preferred method of reaching our room without much hassle.Room was much more spacious than other NY city rooms I have stayed in. The bathroom was a decent size and clean.Overall I was satisfied with the stay, it was nothing special and now that I have spent a bit of time in NY I would perhaps stay in a different location that wasn't so filled with tourists. i would consider the hotel if I was heading to NY for a theatre trip.We stayed here in September 2013 when there were roadworks outside the hotel. This added to the overnight noise, but not something the hotel can avoid.

Stayed 3 nights on the 8th floor no noise up there apart from emergency vehicles which seemed frequent. Room small but well presented little space for suitcases but as we only slept there not a great problem. Reception staff very friendly and helpful also the porters? who always had a pleasant word for you. Bar was another matter $16 for 2 Coronas + tax and a reminder on the tab of how much was expected in a tip. Too rich for me and the staff spent most of their time in conversation with their selves. Good location to get about New York

small boutique hotel, great location, easy to find and get to, easy to get anywhere from here. room was clean and very well taken care of while we were out. i thought the rates we had were pretty good for the quality and service, especially right off times square. everbody was pretty cool and helpful, any question or request was taken care of immedialtey, folks were always friendly, polite and had plenty of time for you. Patrick at the front desk was great, full of accurate information, super friendly and very conversational, pleasant guy. entire staff was very good, but he made the difference in the stay...much appreciated.

The hotel is in a great location two min walk from Times Square. The look is cool, dark, and I get what they were trying to do. There isn't much to do at the hotel except sleep but the service was acceptable.

My husband and I stayed at Night hotel for 3 nights to celebrate our anniversary. The staff was friendly and helpful during our stay. They made reservations for us and were always willing to help us. Our room was very clean eventhough it was not the largest in comparison to other hotels but what can you expect in nyc. We had a bottle of champagne in our room which was so thoughtful. The location is a plus. Evrything is just a few minutes away. By the way there isn't a bible in the room but a kamasutra book in the night stand. We were delighted.

We stayed for 4 nights and it was amazing. The location is a short walk to Time Square and Fifth Ave. The rooms were so clean and Alexander at the front desk was the nicest most accommodating guest services person we have ever had the pleasure to deal with. Thank you for making our first trip to New York such an amazing experience.

We found that the main attraction of this hotel is the location! Right by Times Square you really do have everything on your doorstep. The reception staff were really helpful and friendly throughout our stay, although we did find the bar staff could be quite unfriendly. We ordered room service on our last night and were really impressed with the food quality and price. The room we were allocated was absolutely tiny although clean and well decorated- we would love to have had a bathtub but appreciate that this is New York and space comes at a huge price! There was no storage space in the room and we had to try to cram 2 big cases into a tiny wardrobe- there was not really anywhere to even put our unpacked clothing! Having said that I liked the turndown service and little touches like getting a weather report for the next day. One other minor peeve- the music in the corridor outside our room seemed a little too loud and did interfere with sleep quality a little bit...

My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel on October 19, 2013 for one night. We had a lovely time. This is definitely the hotel for a young hip modern couple looking for a romantic night. The black and white decor was fabulous and intriguing i especially loved the shower tiles/wall. It was a great design. There were a couple of downsides but despite those we really did enjoy our stay. One of the downsides really was that the hotel room was smaller than expected. There was also a $30 charge if you wanted to use the refrigerator which I honestly thought was odd. So if I wanted to put my drink or whatnot in there, I'd have to pay $30? The fridge did take a lot of space since it was right in front of the bathroom and basically left little room to get to the other side of the bed. The lock on the top of the door was also broken. You had to make sure the door lock was locked and you put the do not disturb sign on your doorknob. All in all great place although I will definitely look for another hip modern hotel for my next stay.
user_name:
Joan C
Lowell, Massachusetts, United States

review_body: We stayed there for three nights and had a great time. When you arrive you're not sure if it's a restaurant or a club, but keep going. The front desk staff were super helpful for two tired travelers - a big help when you are dizzy after the flight from Europe. The decor is unusual yet original, if a bit dark in places. The rooms are small, but this is New York so no surprise there. The real treat is the location - many key points are within really easy walking distance, there are Metro stations close by and Time Square is literally just round the corner. Prices are not exactly bargain basement but this is the centre of New York so you pay for the location as well as everything else. Do not expect a view of much (no herds of wildebeest or hanging gardens), but why would you?

We had so much fun in this hotel.Beautiful decor!A very nice and helpful staff.EXCELLENT LOCATION!They bring every day a page with the coming weather forecast and a special event that will take place the next day (and a Swiss chocolate).The only thing they need to improve is the sound proofing of the water pipes...

I booked a room on the back of positive reviews on Trip Advisor. The hotel looks like a nightclub inside, which wasn't to my taste, but to be fair that's the theme. As a result the rooms are very dark (decor is mostly black).All of this is understandable, but the rooms are also tiny and ours smelled very strongly of cigarette smoke. This being New York, opening the windows is not an option, and so we were stuck with this awful smell for a night. The front desk staff were rather terse and unhelpful. The restaurant/bar outside area was right below our room and the noise from revellers continued until around 2am.In the end we checked out after only one night and went to a more airy, spacious and bright hotel. I can't understand why this hotel has such a high rating.

I just stayed at Night NY... and had a blast. First off perfect location. Its right around the corner from all the sites (Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park). I was 1/2 a block from my Broadway show (Once). The hotel reminded me I was in the streets of Barcelona's Gothic Quarter. Its dark, its sexy... and its BOLD. I will leave NYC talking about this hotel FOREVER. The staff was friendly and courteous. I wish they had a morning place to dine, but the Front Desk pointed me out to several places within minutes of their front door. I booked a Full bedded room without realizing it and the Front Desk upgraded us to a Queen (thank goodness, otherwise my boyfriend would not have bee happy with me)PS I am a huge starbucks girl- and it was literally like 100 ft away. (im not brave enough for NYC Street Cart coffee).I did eat at the hotel.... I had some Salmon rolls at Red Moon (their lounge/ restaurant) OMG they were delish, fresh, and oh soooooo yummy. I wish I had been there longer than 3 days. I can't wait to go back!

I made a reservation at this hotel and had to cancel, but there was no way to contact the property! Their phone lines did not connect, were busy, or no one answered for the past 3 days. I tried sending an e-mail but got back a message that the mailbox was full. When I I called the Wyndam main number, they also had some difficulty locating my reservation but were finally able to process the cancellation. Personally, I will not deal with any company in which you cannot speak to a live person. I did not stay there and never intend to re-book this visit.

I was here for 3 nights and we where a group together of total 5 rooms. The location is great but the rooms are small and the price was not cheap. The service in the restaurant was terrible in all occasions which downgraded the total experience.

First visit to the Big Apple for a conference and stayed here. Very near Times Square, subway, shopping, etc. Beautiful room; small but typical size for NYC. Very quiet in the hotel; never heard any noise from other rooms. Staff were very helpful and pleasant. I would stay here again if given the chance, and the price was excellent for the area and amenities.

Good overall experience. Most reviews mention the size of the rooms so we were pleasantly surprised to find this to be perfectly adequate for a 4 night stay. Bed was extremely comfortable, room was clean and well decorated and staff accommodated our advance request for a high floor quiet room.The only facility we would have liked would be an illuminated magnifying mirror for shaving/ make up, particularly due to the darkness of the room.

We had such a blast in NYC over our five night visit. I can tell you that our stay at the Night Hotel contributed greatly to the experience. We were in a king sized room.An opinion of a hotel starts with the staff. They are the welcome wagon which can set the tone for your stay. These men and women at Night Hotel were great. Every one of them. I can’t remember the name of the young man who checked us in, but he was so sweet and very professional at every encounter. Patrick too is a real gem. He’s very personable and knows his city. They are all very knowledgeable about NYC and are happy to answer any and all questions. One night we had a lengthy and great conversation with one of their employees (again, I can’t remember his name! rats!) who grew up in Paris and Lisbon and spoke at least a handful of languages. He was so interesting. A++ for customer service.The room is quite small. Although it is a “typical size” for a NYC room, according to so many locals. It was clean. We quickly got used to the size because it was decorated so cool, and it quickly felt like we were staying in a room of a friend’s house. We appreciated the comfortable bed with its nice sheets which made for a good nights sleep. The cosy bathrobes were a welcome touch, and I was glad to know that they were a perk that comes with the room. We were on the 2nd floor and had a view of 45th St. My husband slept like a rock, and I felt that any street noise wasn’t too bad. I would bet that the windows are dual pane. I NEVER heard a peep from anyone above our room, nor did I hear ANY sound through the walls. That really made me happy, and I took notice of how thick the walls must be. They don’t make ‘em like that anymore. An “A-” for the room. They would get an “A” if there were a bathtub, but I learned that none of their rooms have a bathtub.LOVED the location. Enjoyed grabbing a drink at Connelly’s across the street (free wi-fi over there). Your choice of 3 Irish bars complete with munchies, and friendly employees are right across the street. Starbucks is a couple of doors towards TS, and heading towards 6th and across the street is a 24 hour deli. We split a nice little veggie sandwich there at about 3 am on the night we arrived before we hit the hay. A++ for location.Only a couple of blocks from our favorite hole-in-the-wall breakfast and/or lunch/early dinner place called, “Green Symphony” 255 W 43rd St - between 7th Ave & 8th Ave. This is a health food haven and “a must” if you are into SUPER fresh, SUPER tasty recipes at a great price. I'm definitely going to review them on TA.There is a sushi restaurant in the Night Hotel, but as vegetarians we never tried it.OK, that's about it. I will think back on this trip with fond memories, and they were a big part of it.

Rooms are trendy, functional and a little small, but what you lack in room you more than make up for with access to Time Square. Staff were great, didnt dine in house becuase it just appeard too small, down side had to pay for wifi in rooms.

I planed a romantic staycation for me and my boyfriend and what better place than the Sexiest hotel in America!? I have to tell you the hotel lives up to the pictures. It's small but well designed. The atmosphere is cool from the moment you walk in off the street. I came in early in the day to leave some decorations at the hotel and Patrick at the desk was super helpful. I spoke to him prior to arrival and he let me know what I could and could not bring (no candles! that was a close one...). I was hoping my room would be ready but no such luck. I was bummed that I'd have to come back later in the day but Patrick volunteered to place my little decorations in the room himself when the room became ready. LIFE SAVER! As it turns out the room was just as comfortable as the lobby was. It's small but well designed and it really was the perfect romantic getaway for the two of us. I wanted to lay in bed all day on Sunday. I didn't want to leave our little cocoon.Highly recommend!
user_name:
LadyG_212
New York City, New York

review_body: The staff were wonderful. There was glitch in my reservation and to make up for the inconvenience the sent a very nice young man up with a bottle of complimentary sparking wine. The room was more spacious than I expected. King Sized Bed with comfortable mattress topper and nice sheets. I am not a big fan of Art Deco (all that black laquer and silver make the room seem dark) but the room was well appointed. Desk, large flat screen TV, BOSE sound system and and an iron and ironing board were nice additions. It is incredibly convenient. I walked everywhere. I would stay there again.

We've just come back after staying here for a week and what a fantastic hotel, the decor is awesome very sexy from the front desk to all hallways. Highly recommended, The staff were extremely helpful throughout our stay especially Robert who we dealt with most of the time. The location of this hotel is second to none -Times Square is at the end of the street! what more could you want. Would recommend Night Hotel to anyone that's visiting NYC.

The location of this hotel is second to none- Times Square is literally on your doorstep!!!The room was clean and compact (standard size for NY hotel in this area) with facilities including hairdryer, iron, BOSE sound system and a large flatscreen TV. The staff were extremely helpful throughout our stay. Negatives I would have to include is that the air conditioning unit is quite noisy and a bit to cold and no tea/coffee making facilities in the room.

We had a leak in our apartment and had to move into a hotel for the weekend. The service was awesome, and we loved the cool black and white decor. Hotel staff was very friendly. Will definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting nyc.Wish that the rooms had a little more lighting though.

My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel with another couple for 4 nights.Pro: Location is great. It is just steps from Time Square. Bed is soft. Modern decorationCon: Room is smaller than we expected. It is not very clean and since almost everything is in black, you cannot tell what are dirty. However, you could tell that it is not that clean in the washroom, like sink with black mold in the corner, etc. Both my friend and my room have no view, just facing a back alley. We did not even open the blind.Reception has good service. Staff is friendly. Staff told me they actually monitor the fridge closely, so it is better not to touch it if I am not planning to use it anyway.

This was a good enough weekend for 2 gals winging it to NY for a few days to shop and eat, so we didn't spend alot of time in the room. For the 2 of us with our big bags, it was just enough room. The bed was pretty small for 2 people though - I think it was a double. The room is nicely decorated and bathroom was an ok size - not bad for NY. Only negatives were that the toiletpaper was never replaced and they tried to charge us for drinks as we had put stuff in the fridge. Rooms - the aircon was too cold and sooo noisy, so we turned them off and had to open the window as the rooms got hot otherwise. Location - obviously near times square can be very handy but I wouldn't stay so close to Times Square again next time. For me, it was just too manic and crazy. I prefer to stay a block or two further away if I'm going to stay in Midtown. Staff were pretty helpful though - always gave us directions and after a bit of prodding told us how we could get free wifi - once you've made a booking there, you can become a member of their VIP type club and get it instead of paying $10 per night. But they didn't tell us that freely - we had to keep asking questions. We managed to get this for a good deal on hotelclub but I wouldn't stay here for full price as I think you can get better bang for your buck for that price.

Sexy boutique flair. Great location, adjacent to times square. Staff was outstanding. Friendly, courteous. Good looking. Room was clean, and quiet. We heard no street noise. Bed was very comfortable. Got a good nights sleep. Two things the room could have used was a full length mirror and a mini fridge (no space in the mini bar and a possible $30 charge if you use it as a fridge.)

My boyfriend (now husband) took me here for my 30th birthday. The hotel was fantastic - it was a great change from the normal boring corporate hotels. It is in a fantastic location right on the door step of Times Square and opposite 2 Irish bars : )We got engaged whilst we were there - we had already received a bottle of champagne on our arrival but they gave us another one to celebrate. The rooms are small but still lovely. I wouldn't recommend taking young children here though as some of the pictures are a bit rude :)

Great place for couples! Easy access to hotel, Time Square, and all other attractions NYC offers. Very nice staff. The hotel is nice enough to hold your bags before check in and after check out incase you still have things to do in the big apple. Loved the black and white theme of this place!!

Patrick at the front desk was absolutely awesome!!!!!!! Now that I got that out of the way, let's talk about this amazing hotel. I booked this hotel to celebrate my anniversary, and wanted a unique hotel experience. Upon entering you are greeted with the sexiest decor I've ever seen in a hotel. Additionally, there are beautiful black and white images that are not for the kiddies, but add to the sex appeal of the hotel. There is music playing in the halls as you walk to your room. Upon entering, you will notice the eluminated bed... Again SEXY!!!!!! The room was small, but that is what you will encounter in any NYC hotel. The room was exceptionally clean, which is very important to me and my fiancé. The location can be beat, just a block away from the bright lights of Time Square.The restaurant in the hotel was outstanding, as well. It's an Asian Fusian restaurant and very reasonably priced. Seriously, I've stayed at hundreds of hotels over the years and this is definitely at the top oft lost.
user_name:
Geri G
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Firstly the staff were just fantastic. I would sincerely like to thank Paul, Diana, Daniela and Robert for their assistance and guidance. Nothing was too much for them to do. All the guidance and assistance was really appreciated. The hotel location was excellent. The service was equally as good and the only down side was that the room was small and noisy. However it was a great place. Thank you

TV didn't work when we entered the room for the first time. They gave us a free bottle of Chardonnay which was very nice. TV was fixed the next morning. Very small room and bathroom, no tub...just okay. Room was clean and service was good. Bed was very comfortable. Bed was turned down and chocolates on pillow every night when we got home. Our room was on the 2nd floor facing the street but was not noisy. Staff was helpful and courteous. Price was good for location. (We booked on line for a discounted price). Had to fight people traffic to get to subway each day (but that is New York for you). Subway only a couple of blocks away. We would highly recommend this hotel for your visit.

This goth inspired semi modern hotel in the midst of New York City's Time Square is clean comfortable and perfectly located. Staff was helpful and friendly and check in was quick and easy. Perfect if you're new in town or visiting from a different country - as its proximity to Times Square is literally 1 block. Despite its location the hotel was quiet and adequately met all my needs. I felt at home!
user_name:
Brooklyn_SS
New York City, New York

review_body: Excellent hotel and great location in Times Square. Concierge Walter was so accommodating to all of my needs and requests prior to my arrival for my anniversary and my friend's 40th birthday. Every hotel should have a Walter! Hotel was very nice and trendy, clean and great staff! Beds were extremely comfortable as were the pillows. Would definitely stay there again.

Great Hotel, location can't be beat. It's walking distance to Time Square, Radio City, Theatre district, Rockefeller center and many other places. The staff was professional and welcoming.All and all I will definitely stay here again next time I'm in NYC.

My experience here was phenomenal! I definitely recommend this spot for all people visiting New York. The service and staff here were simply amazing. Not to mention the location of the hotel was great as well, we nearly walked everywhere (my family and I) the room was clean and big which was a + out of all the hotels I have visited in New York this is definitely in my top 3!

I picked this hotel after looking at hundreds on the web regarding location and price. This little boutique hotel was in the heart of times square, just 400 feet away, it is surrounded by all the attractions that times square has to offer and the best thing is you do not need more than your legs to go to so many places cause all is close. If you want to go to lower manhattan then the subway and buses are all in times square as well.The rooms are small indeed and some do not have closets for you to hang your clothes, the A/C is a bit loud but you can sleep easily. The hotel has that gothic style to it, the pallat is black, white and silver, Very chick and sexy. We spent 3 nights there and were very happy, the staff were quite helpful, especially Simo from guest services, he gave us lots of tips and advice as to where to go for what and what prices to expect. Patrick at the front desk along with Maringly the manager were all very pleasant, helpful and curtious. I do recommend this hotel and I will go back again if the winds blow us to NY again.By the way, there is no in room coffee or room service, but that did not matter as there are tons of caffee shops and restaurants around

A boutique hotel with a monochrome interior design, romantic lighting in the bedroom, bedrooms small than average, but the décor makes up for it. Clean linens, housekeeping attends every day.Great location on a side street just of the main times sqaure
user_name:
Deborah C
Pinoso, Comunidad Valenciana, Spain

review_body: This place is a blast! The service was outstanding. The room was gorgeous and in phenomenal condition. The staff makes you feel like royalty. Everyone is very welcoming yet professional. And the dim-lit ambiance of the hotel made me feel sexy, hip, and ready to take the city by storm. Oh and not to mention… the location is absolutely perfect.

After saving up for 4 years to go back to n. y we chose this boutique hotel based on location. Stayed 4 nights.On arrival room was small but clean. Our clothes remained in our suitcases as there wasn't enough room to hang them. Never slept the first night due to extremely noisy air con. It was either that or suffocate with the heat. Room was cleaned everyday. We were on the 4 th floor and didn't hear any outside noise. View from our room was a brick wall. On checking out we were told we would have to pay room tax per night. We phoned our travel agent to confirm all was paid and there was no outstanding payment. Girl at desk spoke to travel agent back in the uk who confirmed this however she said her manager would need to speak with them. We left them to sort this out, stored our bags and on return were told we had to pay or they wouldn't let us check out. My partner paid it so we didn't miss our flight home. I am now taking this up with the travel agent. Will not be returning to this hotel.

Stayed here for 4 nights and was a lovely, on arrival we were both greeted with the largest glass of wine you could imagine so that was an excellent start. The room wasn’t overly large but well layout local was excellent to time square and service first-rate would defiantly stay again.

We stayed at the hotel this week and the service was great. Excellent location and clean and beautiful rooms. The sushi restaurant is good albeit small.We will back to stay at this sexy hotel again.We give a shout out to Patrick and Diana who were extremely helpful.

Its half a block from the center of Times Square so the location is great if you want to be centrally located. Furthermore despite how close it was to the center very little of the outside could be heard from the room.The room is very basic, it has a small bathroom, wardrobe and not large draws so don't expect to unpack. There are no coffee making facilities and its hit and miss as to what plug sockets work. This is to be as expected though due to the price and central location in New York. Just don't look of the pictures of the lobby and expect luxury it is a very basic hotel.The Air-Con is the loudest i have ever encountered and there was also a second couple complaining of this while we were checking out. There is also no free WiFi in the room which is disappointing.We stayed for 2 nights and the room was not cleaned in between each of our nights which meant we had to go to reception to request dry towels. Also, there was no duvet cover around the duvet, just loose sheets which caused me to be concerned about cleanliness. Finally the porter who stored our cases in between checking out and leaving New York seemed very keen for us to take the Hotel transfer from New York to JFK - going as far as miss-leading us about the cost of a New York cab (he told us they were $65 plus tolls- however they are $45 plus tolls)

Pros Location. If you want to be right on Times Square you couldn't get closer to the big lights n buzz etc but still far enough into 45th street not to be bothered by it all. Hotel was clean and quiet within (no noise from outside considering its close proximity to TS) Nice bottle of sparkling wine on arrival altough I guess most hotels do this. Reception staff were nice enough without being over bearing altough some people might want that extra attention....not me though!!Cons Price. £900/$1400ish for 5 nights. Most probably the going rate for TS but still a bit steep considering we only spent a few hours in it each night sleeping. $10 for 24hrs of WiFi. Maybe thats the going rate but still, little extras like that add up and leaves one slightly annoyed. Rooms were small with no bath however again seems to be the case for most hotels in TS. Traffic to the hotel from Newark Airport was horrendous. $85 to the hotel in a yellow cab but $100 from hotel in a limo. The hotel had a bar and restaurant however never seemed to be that busy. Hard sell considering the location but I suspect it needs to have one for other reasons rather than wants one. OverallDecent hotel and will suit most people but I won't be going back to a TS location. There are other areas outwith TS that are cheaper and really only a 5/10 minute walk away and don't forget NYC isn't just about TS which by the way is cool to look at but there is so much more going on elsewhere.

My mother booked this hotel for a friend and I as part of my college graduation trip! She described how gorgeous it looked and I couldn't wait to see it for myself.I WAS NOT DISAPPOINTED!!My friend and I were greeted immediately by the incredibly friendly and helpful concierge/ front desk workers.Patrick helped us check in and made us feel welcome right away! Our room wasn't quite ready yet, but the staff safely locked away our luggage and Patrick told us the best place to get some brunch in the meantime. He also gave us a map of Manhattan and gave us a few basic tips on how to navigate the city. Patrick also noticed that our birthdays were not too off from our stay and he sent a complimentary bottle of champagne to our room that night. SCORE! Overall, the concierge was incredible and very friendly. It felt like they instantly knew what kind of things would interest us and could direct there without any problems! We trusted them, and in turn had a great trip!Now the inside is absolutely GORGEOUS. It's a little risque, but for us early 20's girls it was just our speed. The black and white interior made for an elegant and modern feel and made us feel very classy, which we always like. HAH!Our room was the perfect size for two good friends who don't mind sharing a king sized bed. Not to mention, the bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in.The location could not have been better. It is literally a block from Times Square. My friend and I were able to walk pretty much everywhere from the hotel (except for the Statue of Liberty, duh), but we hardly spent any money on transportation which was a HUGE plus!Everyone on the staff, from room service to the front door, was so beyond friendly and welcoming. Our trip would not have been nearly as successful and memorable if it wasn't for Night Hotel!I would recommend Night Hotel to anyone looking for a more exciting, more intimate place to stay. Can't wait to hopefully visit NYC again soon and stay again with Night!
user_name:
Lauren W
North Riverside, Illinois, United States

review_body: The Night Hotel is located in a great area. Everything is within walking distance. My stay was short but great. I wished I had stayed for more nights. The bed was so comfy, I slept like a baby. The rooms are very clean and the staff is great. Across the street there is an Irish pub that has great drinks and a deli open 24 hours. They do not serve breakfast but Starbucks is about 30 seconds from the hotel. At the hotel they have a restaurant Red Moon which serves delicious sushi. I will definitely stay here again when I'm in the area.
user_name:
luckysete
New York City, New York

review_body: It claimed to be the sexiest hotel in America... well it was dark and definitely black and white can be sexy. The good news was that we were upgraded to the Penthouse, But then we had to wait 45 minutes before we could get into it. Outside the door as we went in was bags of garbage (which presumably is what was taken out of it before we could go in... but was still just outside and not totally removed) Yes inside it was sort of sexy... But the TV didn't work... it looked great but all we could get was a little league game. When I called for maintenance they said they'd be right up. 30 minutes later we decided we wanted to go out so I called to let them know ... never mind and before we got out the door he showed up. But then couldn't fix it anyway. The wi-fi cost extra... which happens these days in some places but at NYC prices it seems a bit too much. There was valet service for the car... not on-premises parking. we were told to call 55 minutes ahead for it. We told them when we would be leaving when we went out to get breakfast and they agreed they would have it for us. That was the only thing that wasn't late. But it was there waiting for us when we got back from breakfast ... not 30 minutes later as we had requested. The experience should have been great... but truthfully we have had better times at Best Western. for a LOT less money.

When I usually travel to the NYC I tend to stay with family and commute in. This was a short trip so we decided to stay in the city and location was top priority. I looked at many hotels some double the price point of The Night. However, I don't think they would have given me double the service or value of this hotel. The risque photography and theme of the hotel would be discouraging for families with young children but this hotel was never intended for that sort of clientele. It is well done and doesn't come off as cheap or over the top. The staff is the gem of this hotel. They are very professional and personable which I feel is something that is overlooked. I've stayed in many nice places and the staff at the Night would rival any of them in staff. Patrick specifically was excellent in helping us find restaurants, make reservations & offer other helpful bits of advice. He made us feel as though we were staying at a friend's apartment in the city. His service was 90% of why I would highly recommend this hotel. Other staff were very accommodating as well and made our stay a great one. After reading some previous reviews from others I would like to put some of their negatives to rest. The rooms could be considered on the small side. However, this is NYC and everything is smaller. This room isn't any bigger than it needs to be. People complained about the lighting and needing to constantly use artificial lighting even during the day. However, you're not staying at a resort with an amazing vista. You're in NYC and your there to see the sights. You want day light? Go to the top of the Empire State Building, the Statue of Liberty, or go for a walk in Central Park. You're in the city that never sleeps and that has an endless list of things to see and do. Use the room for what it's designed for, sleeping and taking a break from the city.

Love the black and white palette and overall this boutique hotel is tres chic. Our room was tiny but that was expected. Its funny, the were plenty of lights in the room but it still lacked a true good. lighting feel, after all, it IS called "night hotel". Ps.. I really liked the location.

We stayed for 2 nights in this hotel and my overall impression is actually quite good! The design is nice, all in black and white and I enjoyed a small photoshoot in the room) However the rooms are tiny and dark, we had to keep the lights on even during the day which is a little bit depressing. The shower is poorly lit actually and black tiles are not much of a help. Wifi costs 10 dollars but there's a lovely Irish pub just in front of the hotel whre you can get it for free. The staff is friendly and polite and I liked the bar in the lobby also.

We stayed 4 nights after a 6 week trip around the USA and the staff at this hotel are probably the nicest out of all the hotels we stayed in. Regarding the hotel, it was ok. Small which is normal, but it drives me crazy when a hotel doesn't provide a fridge or a kettle, which this hotel doesn't. It was extremely clean and there intention of being a sexy hotel didn't really hit the mark, but we weren't there for that reason. All in all great stay with a great location

I had the pleasure of spending 2 nights there recently. What a great experience. The staff is attentive and caters to your every wish. I liked the fact that it was a smaller, boutique style hotel yet offered a comfortable, quiet room in the midst of the chaos of Times Square literally a half a block away. The bar/restaurant on the main floor was great place to relax and the food was great and there was a great vibe in the bar. I will definitely stay here again.

We recently stayed at the Night Hotel during our short 1 night say in NYC. We were met by Simon and helped with our stuff to our lovely room! It was really spacious and really comfortable! Members of the front desk team were really friendly, however when we asked about bus tours we were recommended one company and it seemed to be the most expensive out of any that we could have booked on the street. When returning to our room we were really surprised to see a nice bottle of sparkling wine on ice, just what we needed after a lengthy walk around the City! It was really appreciated! We would definitely stay at this hotel again when returning to NYC and would recommend it for couples and adult parties!

Stayed at Night Hotel twice in one week. I would like to thank the team at Night Hotel for attending to our requirements in a very hospitable and flexible manner. A few previous reviews left different reviews but , but as far as our stay was concerned, it was nearly perfect and I can't find any fault. Not only the front of house guest services agents we came across, but also back of the house staff members even the security person were all nice and friendly. In my opinion it is ultimately the people that make or break it, not the facilities. Staff / Customer Service We made 2 bookings via a travel agent, first for 2 nights and second one for 1 night. Prior to our departure from Sydney, we contacted the hotel via their facebook page to reconfirm our bookings, they reconfirmed them straight away.
