We did this because we normally book things by ourselves but for Night Hotel, we used a travel agent so we wanted to be sure. For our first stay however, we got stranded in San Francisco upon transiting because United cancelled our flight. As a result we were put up in a hotel by them in SFO Airport that night, which meant we could only arrive the following day at Night Hotel, i.e. our stay was to be shortened from 2 nights to 1 night. We contacted them via Facebook, no problem at all, they revised our booking and even told us they would not be charging us for the cancelled night (which we will tell our travel agent so they can refund us the money for the night). This all happened on the day of our original check-in date so I would have expected no-refund. So this was a very nice gesture by the hotel. Upon check-in, the receptionist was friendly and showed his empathy as to our inconvenience of having to change our booking plan at the last minute. He did mention the mini-bar was very sensitive and advised us to be careful, which we were. Room/Bar The room/decor etc are exactly what photos on this forum show, yes the room was small and there was virtually no significant view from the window. But it is New York and we didn't choose this hotel for the size of the room or view through the window. The cleanliness was perfect (which is important to us), we were given free WiFi and the connection was pretty good. If for whatever reason, you aren't given free WiFi and you don't want to pay for it, there's a Starbucks literally 1 minute walk from the hotel's entrance.The bathroom was spacious enough, with more than adequate amenities and a good strong shower. The air-con unit is "not quiet" but we didn't care. It was not "noisy" and it worked fine. We appreciated the cool breeze coming out of it. We used the lobby bar one night and enjoyed a few cocktails. The staff members were again friendly and made sure everything was good for us. Our rooms were on the mid-level (level 3 and 4 I think), so we mainly took the stairs next to the lift to get to/from our rooms. But the lift was fast too, we just didn't mind walking up and down the stairs.In between our two staysWe asked the hotel to hold one of our bags between our two stays (there was a 3 night gap in between). They were more than happy to have our bag stored with no charge! Check-out On the day of departure (of our 2nd and final stay), check-out was smooth and the receptionist was informative and helpful. We had to go to Grand Central Station and we were initially thinking of taking a cab but the receptionist assured us that even with our bags it would be very close and easy to get to. He also showed us exactly which street/avenue to take. LocationAs almost all reviews have written, if your priority is to stay close to/within Times Square district at a quite reasonable (by NYC standard) price, I would happily recommend Night Hotel. It is on 45th Street, close to all the theatres (such as Lion King, that's on the same street), Times Square, Forever 21 (shopping!) etc. Overall, as mentioned we enjoyed our stay and would definitely look to Night Hotel for our next visit to New York.

I stayed here again on a recent trip to the Big Apple! Great location and perfect if you like shopping and theatre as well as an abundance of dining choices. Very courteous and helpful staff always makes me feel good when away from home. Thank you Night!

We stayed for 6 nights at this hotel. We are a couple in our sixties and were on holiday with my son, daughter in law and grandchild. The decor is black and white, which we knew about. What we did not expect was the lights under the bed, a window that only looked into the space between the two buildings and extremely noisy air con. Saying all that, we were upgraded to a larger room, the rooms were clean, the staff were pleasant and the location was good.

We spent 6 nights at the hotel, all in all it was ok ,but I would advise the following: The rooms are small, noisy AC units, tiles were missing in the shower it is a little run down.Happy hour is good, food is also good an the location is good.

We had a lovely stay here but very disappointed that our debit card had several hundred dollars taken out of our check in for incidentals and we were told on our checkout that after a few days it would be re credited to our account . 3 months later and after 2 emails we are still waiting for our money to be returned . Be aware of this when you stay here

Our stay was awesome. First everyone was so friendly, it was like a home away from home. Check in and out was easy. When we asked about places to eat, where to go, and even the best way to get there they helped in every way. One night we ate at Del Frisco's that they recommended for steak and it was the best steak I have had in a long time. We ate at the in house restaurant one night and I love Thai and the red curry was great. Besides the great and friendly service the rooms were were nice, they did have a black and white decor but they were very clean and nice. This hotel is about a block from Times Square, two to three blocks from Hell's Kitchen, and the shows. What else can you say, get hotel with great service and location was awesome. We will definitely go back. I did use their fitness and pool area but it was down the street at Equinox, it was very nice.

Trying to be cool, in shades of black. The whole place is dark. Imitation club vibe, with no one clubbing, which made the whole thing just noise and the music piped in the hallways on the floors is disturbing, the more so because those hallways are narrow and already pretty noisy. Maybe at least turn off the music at night? My room was small (admittedly booked last minute at a discount) and looked out - if at all - on a back wall. Bed on the soft side and cut a few inches short than normal to gain space, which made it not very comfortable and that is a key point of course. Airco unit loud. Wifi supposed to be free, but they try to charge $10, for any number of devices. Location is great, but there are much better choices for the same price in the Times Square area...

Staff members are very unkind. As far as I remember, I talked to 3 people at the front desk but none of them was kind. Didn't see a single smile throughout my stay. Especially, a female staff (with dark skin, no glasses on) was the worst. She was the one who checked me in and out and she was always rude.The highlight comes here. On the day of check-out, I was accidentally charged a minibar. So, I told her that I never even touched the fridge and just after I said this, she started pushing me into coner by telling me I touched the fridge, otherwise it would have never happened. I told her 'no' and she kept on saying the same thing in a very rude way. I mean what is the point of this? She could have just sent up a person upstairs and check out right?Also,me and my partner were asked to leave 3 seconds after we finished our meals at the 1st floor Japanese restaurant just because there were people waiting in line. What kind of a hotel restaurant does this to their guests? Room is very small and unclean with a very tiny window. Hallway is super narrow too. The Time Square location is only positive thing about this hotel. Really none other than this! I feel like I can write more negative comments but I will just stop here.Avoid this place.
user_name:
kingandc
New York City, New York

review_body: They help with every detail at the front desk. I have to mention Especcially Simon !!! He helped us with locations,taxi,what to do around. Great trip we had ! Thank you Simon :) Rooms are enough big for NY. Cleaning is just great.I can just say wifi is not working all the time in upper flors. But everything was just great with the Night Hotel.

Close to everything. Couple irish pub's across the street. Times Square around the corner. Short walk to metro. Good service. Wifi very poor and costs 10$ for 24 hours. Room was clean. I will definetly stay here next time. So far best hotel in NYC were I have been.

If you're looking for a spot near times square with a pub across the street this is the place. They even hold your bags for up to 24hrs after you check out. Fairly cheap in comparrision to other hotels nearby. One negative about my stay was that I specifically asked for a nonsmokers rooms and I when I walked in the stench of old tobacco smacked me in the face. :( overall a nice place to stay. Staff is quite friendly and professional.

The location of this hotel is definitly perfect, right on Time square. The rooms are rather small, but still decent for American standards. The fact that they are well decorated (modern) gives an impression that the room is bigger than it is in reality. The bathroom had all the needed comfort. Very friendly and helpfull staff. Can recommend this hotel, espacially if you only stay a couple of days in NY and you want to go to one of the Broadway shows.

We stayed for one night in July while seeing a show. The Night Hotel is steps away from every Broadway theater, so convenience is its chief asset. Delis across the street and a Starbucks a couple of doors down. Rooms are tiny but clean and comfortable. Modern black and chrome look. Large flat screen tv, but not hi definition, I don't think. There was an odor in the room that we couldn't pin down - was it second-hand cigarette smoke (although this is a non-smoking hotel)? Moisture lingering in the rugs, drapes and bedspreads? Not sure, but it needs to be taken care of. Hotels don't ever get a chance to throw open the windows and air out! This odor is a problem with so many hotels.The Night Hotel bends over backwards to impress you with service. You can't walk out the lobby door without someone holding it open for you. The desk was prompt, efficient and helpful with directions. Price ended up being over $300 for one night, but that's competitive.We would stay there again.

My 16yr old son and I recently spent 4 nights at this hotel. Fantastic hotel with great location and absolute friendly and helpful staff. They even allowed us an early check in after a long flight from Johannesburg. We loved every minute of our stay and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in NYC.
user_name:
Narisha G
Johannesburg, Gauteng, South Africa

review_body: This hotel is a prime location because it is near all the major attractions in the heart of the city. I had tickets to see the Lion King musical and the walk was only five minutes from the hotel. The service was great, Patrick helped me check in and he was very helpful, the rooms were clean too! Cleanliness is a major plus for me so I was definitely happy about that. Overall the experience was stupendous!
user_name:
ViajanteDos
New York City, New York

review_body: I recently stayed at this property and had a great time. First off, it is right in the middle of everything!! Subways, plays, restaurants and night life. They actually have a nice sushi place in the hotel called red moon. The decor is on the darker side but very cool. My fiance and I loved every minute of it and you will too!
user_name:
Brad C
Jersey City, New Jersey

review_body: We liked this hotel a lot. Location is great, close to most attractions. Staff is wonderful, very helpful and friendly, from the doorman to agents and managers. We were there for two nights celebrating my anniversary and received a free bottle of champagne from management on our first night. Front desk staff helped us with restaurant reservations. We also had dinner at the sushi restaurant on-site. Great sushi and sake. The bed is to die for, so comfortable. Rooms are boutique style, therefore they are not suite style, but have everything you need. Rooms reflect the theme of the hotel, so they are black and white, which is fun!We will be back for sure, thank you to the staff, we wish we could have stay there longer.

We recently spent a weekend in NYC and stayed at the Night Hotel, Times Square. Although the room was on the small side, the staff could not have been more accommodating. Our room didn't typically come with a mini-fridge but the staff went out of their way to provide us one, which was greatly appreciated! Everyone was very, very friendly, courteous and efficient. One employee stood out to us and we would be remiss in not mentioning our concierge, Mr. Walter Carmona! He was so knowledgeable of the city and went out of his way to help us find the best way for us to see as much as we could with our limited time because we had a matinee show in the afternoon, which broke the day up. Walter took his time and gave us both superb recommendations and great directions! Thanks to him, we were able to make the most of the day!

We stayed at the Night Hotel this past weekend after reading all the reviews on the site. Excellent location, within walking distance of the theaters and good food, and while the room was small (to be expected in Manhattan), it was extremely comfortable and very quiet. We didn't hear any street noise, and the decor (primarily modern black) darkened the room very well and enabled late-morning sleep!

I stayed here for two nights in June. Overall I was quite disappointed with the so called "urban Gothic aesthetic" of the Night Hotel. The entire place was overwhelmingly dark. My room, which was very small even by NYC standards, was entirely devoid of any color - everything was either black or white, including the bathroom which contained a black tiled shower stall and black shower curtain. The lighting system in the room was extremely poor, and when coupled with the absence of any natural light (the room had two small windows facing another building) produced a dark and oppressive feeling. Those who crave (or need) light, or who are claustrophobic should stay elsewhere.Other cons: 1) The air conditioner was extremely noisy, which effectively prevented me from getting a decent night's sleep. I can honestly say that it was one of the loudest hotel air conditioner units that I have encountered in recent memory. The level of noise produced was simply unacceptable, and this issue alone would keep me from returning to this hotel.2) The room was not exactly in tip top shape. The walls were scuffed, electrical sockets were loose in the walls, and the black shower was in need of renovating. 3) There was no in-room safe.4) The television did not function properly, with channels periodically freezing or losing reception.5) A password is required to use the WiFi (hardly noteworthy), but oddly this was not provided during check-in. I had to call down to reception to request a password for my mobile phone, and then call down a second time to get another password for my laptop. On the positive side, the location of the hotel is excellent for access to Time's Square. The bottom line: unless you have an overwhelming urge to experience the Gothic décor, and are willing to accept small, dark and noisy quarters, consider one of the many better hotels in the area.

I have to mention that we stayed here last year but since I just joined Trip advisor I wanted to make sure I wrote a review on this particular hotel. Night hotel has one of the best locations in NYC! We have been to NYC 3 other times at 3 different hotels and this hotel (by far) is one of the best we have stayed at. The location is great! just steps from Time square, easy access to subways, and attractions. The hotel itself is so unique. Although the rooms are small (but look where you are) the rooms are decorated so unique that you forget all of that. The bathroom was a nice size, the bed was comfortable, and the room was very neat and tidy. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We had about a million questions everyday and they were very helpful and entertaining. My husband took me to celebrate my 40th bday there and it was really nice hotel for the two of us. I would recommend this hotel as a couples hotel or single. Not family.

This hotel was our first stop on our honeymoon and what a great choice it was. Quick easy check-in, room was of a good size we upgraded to a larger king room which was perfect for our 3 night stay, the location is also perfect if you are in NY to see the usual sights and sounds. There was also complementary bottle of fizz in the room, which was a nice touch, I can recommend the Deli across the road and the restraint next door for a breakfast. If I would be forced to complain about anything it would be the level of light in the bedroom, could do with some brighter lamps, otherwise I can highly recommended this hotel.

to begin with even after looking at maps we really did not realize the hotel was as close to time square as it is, which made it all the better. even beeng so close it is located on a rather quiet street our room was loocated at the rear of the property and we could not hear any street noise which was great, also we did have a window and the curtains blocked out all light which made for some good sleep ins. the rooms are rather small but manageable, also quiet dark but this added to the atmosphere of the hotel. wifi prices were steep and require a password from the front desk but upon checking out we were told we did not have to pay for the wifi usage as we had signed up for wyndam rewards and it was complementary which was a bonus. also we got a great deal on our room 1100 for 5 nights through the hotel upon checking the rate at a later date it had gone up to 2500. all and all greaat stay and would not hesitate to stay again

Had a fabulous time with my hubby at this hotel. I travel quite frequently to NY for business and usually stay in Midtown or Downtown, away the hustle and bustle of touristy Times Square. However, it was my husband's first time and figured he'd enjoy being in the center if it all. The Night Hotel was in the perfect location on the border of Midtown and Times Square. It was very easy to get around and very quiet despite being right around the corner from center of Times Square. The decor was beautiful as well. Perfect for couples and for the occasional business traveler but probably wouldn't recommend for families.

Location is excellent so close to Times Square. Staff is very helpful and friendly. It's New York, so we did not spent much time in the room (other than to sleep) so we did not mind much that the room was VERY small. if you like some space in your room to move around, this hotel is probably not for you!

A late review as a lot has been going on in our life since returning from New York at the beginning of April. However, we thoroughly enjoyed our stayed at this hotel and found the staff welcoming, helpful and most accommodating. The location is superb - and for the price we paid we feel that we would struggle to get better value in NYC. We would stay here again without hesitation in spite of a few minor negatives which are as as much to do with us as anything. Our room was small but that was not a problem and other reviewers had pointed that out before. The rooms were also dark and although this was generally not a problem, it could prove difficult to read things or find things that had dropped on the floor and with a dodgy light switch as well it was even more difficult. As I said, as much to do with our ailing eyesight (and carelessness in dropping things in the first place) as anything else! We were also a little disappointed that internet access was an extra cost as most of our daily planning of what to do was researched while there and maps etc. were downloaded to iphones to take with us. This is one area where it seems the UK is ahead of the US in that hotels are happy to give complimentary internet access (almost an expectation now) although we noticed that even the airport lounges in USA tend not to have complimentary access either.Nonetheless this does not detract from what was an excellent experience and one we would happily repeat despite the little moan (rating reflecting this)! Congratulations to managers and staff - you made the experience verty enjoyable for these first-time visitors to the Big Apple. And for us to have Times Square as our front garden for three days made it all the more amazing.

We stayed at the Night for four nights in late June. We had two rooms (43 and 53) in the quieter section of the hotel. The rooms although "New York small" were super clean and had everything we needed. The staff is professional and super friendly. Housekeeping was excellent. Considering the hotel's location so close to Times Square, the room rate was unbelievably reasonable for what we received. Thank you!

I just spent 3 days in NYC at the Night Hotel and I loved it! I really enjoyed the trip, the room was very nice and clean. We were on the 5th floor so we didn't hear any noise at night. The staff was also great and friendly, Robert at the front desk helped us to find restaurants in the city and made reservations. He also suggested great places to go out after dinner ! Simon helped us with our luggage and the valet, he was nice and the fact that he spoke French was a plus !! Overall we were very pleased by the hotel and the service. The room was dark and was exactly like the pictures on the website. That is why we chose this hotel, we wanted to try something different and we were pleased . The bathroom had only a shower, but it was perfect because we never use the baths in hotels anyways. In addition, the location was perfect, we were right in the middle of Times Square and we could easily walk to 6th for restaurants, to 5th to go shopping and Central Park !!

If you want something a bit different this is it. It from the moment you see the outside is different and beautiful. The location is unbelievable. Its next door to Americas times square...literally! From the time the doorman opens the door theres no other hotel quite like it. Its beautiful in a sadistic way and honestly its a bit impersonal but its for one and a partner...kinda speakeasilyish. Black and white, no red, no green but it works PERFECT! The concierge from before the stay and during was great to me. The lobby? Bit different and dark. Goth, but beautiful. The elevators are couple friendly, small, stainless and personal. The rooms? From the opening of the elevator doors your not in kansas. Beautiful pictures of fit, half naked men and women in black and white are what you see artwise. Clean and well lit. The door keys are special and when you get ready to swipe the key and see the fish tank at your fingers youll understand. The rooms are very personal. Wonderful tvs, a refer under the table...beware....touch sensitive. Free safes in the closet. Free use of the robes in the closet, free umbrella in the closet if needed, very mysterious bathroom with all the soaps expected. The bed? AMAZING! A matress topper that if I could have stolen I WOULD HAVE! Lighting under the bed that would make.any room sexy and make you want couple time. The rooms? Decent size or better for nyc. The only problems for me? No in hotel breakfast but hey its nyc. No in room or IN HOTEL coffee maker. Hotel smells better and a starbucks just past good morning america on times square 1/2 block away so no complaints just not complimentary. Regardless? A well enjoyed visit and i do recommend

I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. No twin beds but myself and an old friend shared a king size bed and had plenty of room. Good firm mattress, good housekeeping service, room was a little dark but it is a 'edgy' hotel as a previous reviewer has said - it adds to atmosphere. Nice touches like robes and umbrella, hair dryer but for a 4 * maybe these should be here. Reception staff very helpful. I e-mailed for details prior to trip and got a swift response from Peter. Patrick on reception checked us in and was courteous, explanatory, funny, friendly and very welcoming. As it was to celebrate out 40th birthdays - we had complementary champagne brought up. We were on the 7th floor which did suffer from some surrounding noise but it is not excessive in a city that doesn't sleep. People staggering in can be noisy in corridors but once in a room, all is quite ( phew!) - location is excellent only a couple hundred yards from main Times Square. Only issue is the paying for wi-fi but this varies around NY hotels.I would relish staying in this hotel again.

My company recently relocated their NY office to the Times Square area and I've been trying out different hotels in the area. This was my first stay at Night Hotel and I liked it! It's edgy and modern with unique touches. (Books are ordered every other black and white behind the front desk). The front desk staff was friendly and accommodating. The rooms are VERY dark, (black floors, black walls, black bed) which was cool, but I felt like I needed an extra lamp to do my makeup in the morning! I didn't get a chance to check out the bar, but it seemed like a cozy place to grab a drink. I had a regular sized king bed room which was small, but plenty of room for 1-2 people to get ready in and sleep. Open the nightstand and you'll find a Kama Sutra book... My room was VERY quiet (8th floor, non street facing), though since the beds are close to the door, you will hear hallway noise.
user_name:
Kate G
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We stayed at the Night Hotel for the weekend of Jun 14-16. The room is small, but for the location, it is completely worth it. Not only were we greeted right when we walked into the lobby, I was helped right away. Our check-in time took a little bit longer than expected but with the complimentary bottle of champagne, I did not have any other complaints. Everyone that works in this hotel is very courteous, very namely, Patrick, and I think the woman at the front desk was Christine?, and Simon. I apologize for not remembering all the names, but courteous, helpful, and genuinely engaged in our satisfaction overall. I will recommend this hotel to family, friends, and others. Great location, great price, and overall, the best hotel we could have asked for during this short weekend. Thanks for everything!

We stayed at the Night Hotel for 4 night in mid-June and due to various accomodation needs, this was one of three hotels we stayed at during our trip.The best part of the hotel is the location. Very close to Times Square, Broadway, 5th Ave, and Central Park. Upon arriving to the hotel, my wife was so enthused about the decor of the hotel because it is hip, unique, and swank. The downside of the decor is the dark is never inviting; after a bright day in central park and walking around, the last thing we wanted to come back to was a dark hotel (saying this in comparision with the other hotels we stayed at during the trip). The rooms are small but that was not too much of an issue as we knew what to expect from reading the reviews. At the beginning of our stay, we were put in a room that was along 45th street and even a few stories up, road noise was heard at all hours of the day. We asked for another room but due to the prior reservations, we could not be accomodated until the last night, which greatly improved the noise. The bed quality is less than average (comparing to the other hotels we were in). The mattress is fair at best with a down comforter and the pillows do not hold their shape after a few mintues.One note about our room change - the room we moved to on the back side had mold on the roof of the bathroom and needs repair.Overall, this hotel is ideal for a one night stay and someone who will benefit from the location (although there are too many hotels in the area).

We stayed at the Night Hotel the last week of May for six nights and had a wonderful experience. Although the rooms are small, the bathrooms are very large and everything was so clean. We had large windows in the room which made for great light during the day. However it was great having room darkening curtains in the room, to pull across the windows at night, which meant we were not woken by the light in the morning. Housekeeping came in everyday and did a great job. The bed was so comfortable with wonderful bedding. There is a mini-bar in the room, but apparently it is very sensitive, and if you move anything in the fridge you are automatically charged. Needless to say we did not even open the fridge, but we did appreciate that the staff told us about the sensitivity of it so that we did not have any issues at check out. The location is fantastic as it is only half a block away from Times Square, yet the rooms were so quiet. Restaurants everywhere and close to the Subway. There is a bar on the main level and they have Happy Hour everyday with drink specials. Also a sushi menu and the sushi was delicious.Staff were very friendly and helpful with directions and suggestions when asked. It was our first time to New York and should we ever return we would definitely stay at the Night Hotel on 45th Street.

We stayed at the Night Hotel from 26th May for 14 nights. Although the room was small, it was very comfortable. Considering you are only 1/2 block from Times Square, we were amazed that there was no noise at night (we were on the 8th floor). The decor is very unique. The two major bonuses for this boutique motel is it's location and it's staff. Nearly everything is within walking distance, or there is easy access to the subway. We were very impressed with the front desk staff. Anthony and Robert were extremely helpful and nothing was too much trouble. As first time traveller's to New York, this was a wonderful experience.

We stayed here, found thru hotel discount app. Loved the hotel location-near Times Square but far enough away 2 be sane. Great decor-loved the non-tacky Gothic theme. The staff was very nice & housekeeping brought up non-feather pillows in less than 10 minutes, which has 2 be a hotel record anywhere! Happy hour at the bar (1/2 price drinks) is worth it & good food (sushi & asian). Wish the bar was open late, it would be great 2 hang out there with friends. Ask 4 a room away from elevator, if you are sensitive 2 that sound. Great rooms if you like dark rooms (no light coming thru the windows at 6am-unless you want it). Love actual room darkening curtains. Comfy bed & while you are not in NYC 2 watch tv, this hotel had the best cable line-up I have ever seen (including BBCNews24) which is great 4 those of us with friends & family living aboard (during news events happening elsewhere). Construction is constant in neighbourhood, so some noise but you are in NYC. I am a light sleeper & as long as I'm away from an elevator I'm ok. Only downside is price (if not discount) but I would stay here again & again.
user_name:
TarjaE
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The hotel has an interesting style with everything in black and white. It is a small hotel with an AMAZING location. The rooms are small which wasn't a problem for us, it was the fact they were really dark. An optional bright light would have been helpful but without that, I took my clothes into the bathroom to determine wether they were blue or black. Putting on makeup was a bit of a challenge, because even in the bathroom things were a bit dark. It is called the Night Hotel for a reason. We had a front room and with the single pane windows we were woken up early on a Saturday morning with the construction across the street. However, the location is great, and service was superior. It is NYC so things are loud during the night. It was fun to stay for a couple of nights, it was a unique style, and with a couple of improvements it could be a great hotel.

My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights for her 40th birthday. On hearing this, the manageress had a free bottle of wine waiting for us in our room when we arrived. We chose a “king” room which, although a little tight, was only really for sleeping in. I can understand other reviewer’s frustrations if they took a standard, smaller room, but hey – you’re in New York – your room is for sleeping in, not taking ballroom dancing lessons. Bed is extremely comfortable. It’s about a half hour taxi ride from JFK. Décor we found amazing. We didn’t see any signs of reported wear or tear. All staff members we encountered were faultless. There have been complaints about the hotel being dark – but I thought its gimmick is that is supposed to be eternally Night to give you a break from the bright lights and big city? There is a lovely Bose sound system in your room with, as you would expect, a quality sound. The hotel looked after our luggage on our last day, free of charge, after check out. The even arranged a black cab to take us back to the airport. Yes, it was more expensive than hailing a cab but we were leaving during rush hour and I just didn’t want the uncertainty of being able to find one.I would definitely stay there again.Minus points? We initially thought they could have had some sort of breakfast or coffee and pastries, but after staying there we changed our minds. There is a Starbucks next store and a dinner just up the street called Junior’s if you want a breakfast.

Stayed at this hotel for five nights I was told I would be given a large room (was given a wheelchair access room, i dont use a wheelchair) which was still very small so would hate to see the regular rooms, the decor was nice would have been lovely when first opened however the room was very tatty and worn the wall paper and paint work marked and scratched, it was dusty in the corners and I had to ask after the third day if house keeping would hoover the floor as it had not been done when are beds had been made. Some of the plugs we could not use as when you pulled the plug out the socket was very loose, also the shower floor and shower head was very dirty looking and full of white and brown marks it needed a good scrub, the staff were very nice but I would not choose to stay here again as needs to renovation on rooms.

Booked a room for 5 nights, after all these great TripAdvisor reviews. Generally I love boutique hotels but not this one! The room was dark and tiny with 1 small window. I know NY hotels are small but the dark decor makes you feel claustrophobic! We checked out the next day and opted for a more spacious room at a better hotel. The service at the hotel was terrible besides the manager who was a gem! The location was good if its your first time in NY (Times Square, Rockerfeller center, 5th ave, and Broadway gets old after a while). For a little more money there are much better hotel options and for less money I recommend airbnb.
user_name:
stern1385
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed here during a visit to NYC, location was great, literally steps from Times Square. Decor was great, black and white themed, that have the hotel a very cool funky look. Only issue was the rooms and bathroom were a little small, enough to fit a bed and a little space for luggage. But for the price I paid and the location, can't really find much fault with it.

This hotel is the coolest hotel ever in the best location ever!  From the horse hide couch in the lobby, to the entire black & white decor, to the faint purple lighting under beds, it just doesn't get any cooler. The room was small-ish but from what I hear this is typical of New York and, in fact, apparently these are actually larger than most rooms in New York. The bed was amazingly comfortable and the tv had about a million channels! The restaurant isn't open for breakfast but no matter as there is a Starbucks two doors down. The location can't be beat - 1/2 a block from the center of Times Square! Central to everything else as well. We walked north to Central Park, south to Madison Square Gardens, east to the shore of the East River and west to the Hudson River. The few landmarks you can't walk to are accessible by the many bus tours available or the subway, either of which you can find within blocks of the hotel.  The staff was also great. The front desk girl (who's name we didn't get, sorry!) went out of her way to help us locate a White Castle :) and the door man, Simon, couldn't have been friendlier.  We did request a view of the street, which we got, and we did find it a bit noisy due to traffic and the construction across the street (which starts early even on Saturday & Sunday) but we are city people so it didn't really bother us. Can't comment on the wifi as we didn't use it because we are cheap and didn't want to pay the $10 for it. :)  Would absolutely, positively stay here again without having to think about it for even a second.

We just returned from our second stay at the Night Hotel NYC.The service was just as fantastic as the first trip.This boutique hotel has many charms from its close proximity to Times square (half a block away) to its modern design and extremely comfortable beds.As a return guest, we were welcomed to our room with a complimentary bottle of champagne which was a really nice touch and well appreciated after a day of serious shopping and the hustle and bustle of NYC.We reserved a King size room...which has more to do with the bed than the room size, as the room was miniscule. But, being a frequent pleasure traveller to NYC, we tend to expect small rooms. Although, if you are travelling to NYC for pleasure, you are probably not spending too much time in the room.We met up for drinks with friends in the Red Moon Bar/lounge in the hotel which was really nice and comfortable. This is a great place to charge up the batteries before a night on the town, or a show.We took advantage of the club scene in the city, and as such, we really appreciated that there was no hassle for a late (1PM) check out.Besides the small room size, we really love this hotel and plan on returning on our next trip to the city.....so save us a room!

I stayed ay the Night Hotel for four nights in May 2013.My travel agent booked the hotel which was completely unknown to me. I confess to being a little uncertain as to what to expect when I checked out the hotel's website - voted the sexiest hotel in NYC, and with lots of very "sexy-looking" people all over the place - but I needn't have worried.The hotel is a small, boutique hotel over nine floors. The rooms are very small but function well and the bathrooms are fine. The decor is what hits you - very dark, a bit goth - and I did wonder if the constant theme of black was covering up something. But once I got over the unusual look I found it to be a normal tourist hotel which suited my needs well.The hotel's biggest plus is its location. About 100 metres east of Times Square on W45 St is about as central as you can get in NYC, and this worked well as a base for the things I had planned.The hotel staff were all friendly, helpful and courteous. I didn't use the hotel's bar or room service faciloities, but there were plenty of places around to have meals. Un Deux Trois, a restuarant on the same block, around the corner in W44 St, does a great breakfast from 7 am. I went there twice. O'Lunney's pub directly opposite the hotel did great meals in a sort of pub style, which was fine for me.The wifi wasn't free (unlike the European hotels I've stayed in on this trip) but at $10 a day it was a lot cheaper than hotels in Australia and New Zealand. This $10 covered both my devices, too (phone and laptop). You just need to get a new username and password when the 24 hours on your old ones have expired.Noise is always an issue in NYC but I found the room was comfortable at night with the windows closed, especially as the weather was mild. The air conditioning was very noisy in the room but I didn't need it when I was sleeping. I was on the 8th floor so it might have been noisier lower down.All up I have no real complaints and would stay there agin.

Love this place. It's right next to Times Square. Rooms are cool and little bit bigger than many others NYC hotels. We didn't have view (well, just buildings), but that is common in this city. Very nice and helpful staff. Totally booking my next visit here! Only negative thing is Wi-Fi; it's not free and it sucks.

Certainly not the largest rooms or bathrooms but very comfortable beds. What really amazed me was that we were on the sixth floor toward the rear of the building and we did not hear one bite of noise from the very load function they were having in the dining room and no street noise. Given that this hotel is a stones throw from Times Square the lack of outside noise was amazing! Bathroom had a shower, no tub. We did have to get them to send up wash clothes as there was only one in the unit. For ice you need to call the front desk as there are no ice machines available. The room came with a stocked mini-refrigerator (water, drinks, snacks) but we did not use it. Read their information at checkin as it does say that they can assess your $30.00 if you put your own items in the refrigerator. Can not comment on the restaurant as we did not use it. They have wifi but I think there is a daily charge. Just up the street is a Starbucks and across the street is a deli. Around the corner is the Hard Rock Cafe and Bubba Gump's.

My daughter and I had a girls weekend in NYC and stayed for 1 night at this hotel. The staff were great and so was the room! It was a very convenient location, close to the theatres and time square. We loved the valet parking too. We would definitely stay here again!!
user_name:
Kathryn C
Halifax, Nova Scotia, Canada

review_body: A week before I arrived at the Night Hotel I contacted the reception to determine whether I could get an early check-in as I was arriving from South Africa at 11am. I did not get a response which was not a good start. When I arrived at the hotel, the staff at the front desk were not particularly friendly and did not make an effort to check if I could get a room earlier - which is a travelers worst nightmare after having traveled for approx 23 hrs. I had to hang around for about 4 hours for a room. I told the staff to then call me when my room was ready as I was just going to wait in the restaurant til the room was ready. I ended up spending some time in the restaurant which I have to say was wonderful. The restaurants host and his staff were lovely and a pleasant surprise from the staff at the front desk to the hotel. Staff at reception never bothered to call me to tell me when my room was ready - I had to approach them several times to see whether the room was ready.The room was lovely and the bed super comfortable-the decor and the bedding were the best things about this hotel as it has a very unique feel. Love the gothic theme!The people who represent the hotel were nothing to rave home about. Show some effort, you are in the industry of hospitality and people engagement. Overpriced for the level of service marketed and expected.
user_name:
Chevara N
Johannesburg, Gauteng, South Africa

review_body: Super hotel with réal good atmosphere Idéally placed to discover NYDesign is cool and sexy Rooms are confortableServices are ok and in Line with promisesYou will enjoyWe will return for sure in NY and surely again in that hotel

Night is a trendy, modern boutique hotel close to Times Square. Should you decide to stay here, you are easily within walking distance to most "tourist" attractions.I stayed for two nights for business have already booked a return stay. The quality of service at the front desk was excellent and the room was very comfortable.

POSITIVES: Location--very Central (heavy on construction across the street.) Good restaurant (VERY low lighting) in the hotel and a well-known and high-end steak house with outdoor seating area next door. The housekeeping, front-desk, and front staff were pleasant and tried to be helpful. LACKING: (was only there for two nights, so this may not be the 'norm'): Doorman or anyone to help bring my bags in from the car upon arrival. I booked the reservation via a hotel booking website, and was told upon arrival that there was an issue with my booking. The bottom line: After showing the manager several confirmations including one from the Night Hotel itself, both the reservation and rate were honored. Room: Clean overall. However, the room smelled strongly of smoke-the hotel staff offered to move me, but not until the next day as they were sold out. The window frame was broken (bolt missing). The linens clean overall, but a plastic duvet cover between duvet and sheets would help. No In-Room Safe, No on-site Fitness Center, and No Free WiFi--the internet service was barely existent (so slow that dial-up would have seemed fast. The front desk said "definitely being worked on" but were still going to charge $10.00 per day for the service! When I complained, they ultimately did not charge). Sexiest Hotel? I would describe as more 'Bordello.' For the positives and the lacking, better value elsewhere.

Stayed here for two nights for business, shopping and a show. Loved it! The front desk staff is very nice. Amazing location 1/2 a block from the hustle and excitement of Times Square you find this black and white funky oasis. The rooms and design are so cool! The beds are amazing. Very clean. The only negative I could find is no coffee maker in the room, but Starbucks is two doors away. We also had great bagels and fruit at the deli across the street. We had drinks and sushi in the hotel bar and it was delicious! Stayed in a King room #77 on front of hotel and would choose that room again. I loved the hotel so much I don't want to tell too many people about it! I don't want it to become too popular so I can't get a room. Lol!Two thumbs up.

Pros:- Incredibly convenient location just one minute walk from Times Square- Really nice concept of a hotel where it is always night time- Great décor- Comfortable king size bedCons:- Inconsistent customer service (some of the concierge staff definitely grumpy and unhelpful)- Building in front of the hotel is being renovated and the level of noise is very high from very early morning until late night- No breakfast offered- Really slow and expensive wi-fi access

This was actually my second time staying here. We had friends staying in a hotel down the street so the location worked well, usually I try to avoid the busy Times Square location, but if you have to be in that neighborhood, Night is a good oasis. The rooms are dark and quiet, and the first time we stayed here (apex 2 years ago) my boyfriend said he got the best nights sleep ever. Check-in was smooth, the man that helped us let us know that wi-fi is not free, but if you sign up for their rewards program, then it is complimentary. It was a no-brainer. The decor is very sexy, black and white wall coverings, linens and photography. The room was very tidy, the bf dropped a vitamin, we were on our hands and knees looking for it, so we did a much more thorough check of the floors than we would normally do and we were pleasantly surprised. New York rooms and bathrooms are small, but Night does a good job of fitting in everything that you need without it feeling cramped.The only reason it is a 4 rather than a 5 is there is no breakfast room service. The restaurant is a sushi bar, so they are only serving dinner, but I have stayed at other boutique hotels that form a relationship with a neighboring restaurant so that they can provide more comprehensive room service offerings.We also only got the weather report and chocolate on our pillow on the first evening of our stay. We stayed for four nights total. I wouldn't have cared, but I saw a number of people mention it on here.

I just returned from NY for easter vacation, the Night hotel was a highlight, located just between the 6th and 7th ave, that is one block from 5th and just some steps from Times Square, it has its own japanese restaurant/bar, which is less expensive than most sushi restaurants trough the city, same price if ordered to room service. Everything is black and white! A little dark but, it's the Night hotel, we stayed there for 4 nights, price was a bit high compared to some other hotels, but was 100% worth it, excellent staff at all times, in the morning or at late late night. Small rooms like most of NY, nice new bath, everything looked new, not a lot of natural light at least in our room. We went for our anniversary, and they received us with a bottle of champagne, everyday they leave the weather forecast printed in the room. Recommended 1000%! Very very comfortable bed and pillows. Has a small desk, LED screen, mini fridge, which is not so expensive.

The decorate is different from any hotel I have been to before and creates a relaxed and laid-back atmosphere.The rooms are quite spacious with a decent sized bathroom. A weather report and chocolate where placed in the room each day, which was a nice touch.The staff were very helpful and friendly. Every staff member I met was happy to help, or simply have a little chat.The hotel is ideally located, with less than a 5 minute walk to Times Square. Despite the very close proximity to Times Square, the hotel was very quite at night: very little to no vehicle sounds.Overall, a creative and unique hotel with helpful staff in a great location.However, I would say it is not suitable for children due to the artwork and photography on display.

I love, loved this hotel! The staff was amazing and more than helpful. The location is perfect. The trendy decor was hip and fun! I am planning on taking my daughter NYC and we will definately be booking our stay there!

The hotel is close enough to Times Square to enjoy but far enough away you don't have to deal with the crowds!! Also the staff (Simon & Mrs. Morrobel) were awesome help to us!! The staff bent over backwards to make sure we enjoyed our stay!!

Booked a box room and got a good price but were happy when we were given a free upgrade on arrival without asking. Staff were friendly, location excellent and quiet considering we were near Times Square. Atmospheric without being overpowering. Would stay here again.

This place was perfect for a couple of nights in NYC, it was stylish and fun, food was great, the service was excellent, rooms were comfortable and location was perfect for broadway and shopping. Small rooms but great for a short stay!

I haven't even arrvied at NIght hotel and already I am having more dramas and being treat more disrespectfully then anywhere I have ever stayed before!I booked with night hotel and after 2 weeks of them not confirming or taking out the deposit payment I decided to call night hotel, They informed me they would take out the deposit straight away but instead took out the full sum of my stay. I decided to call them just to make sure that if I needed to cancel I would get my money back, I was talking to a male who out right hung up on me, I called back to hear a rude arrogant voice explaining I hadn't booked at their hotel and they had no records of my transaction and to call someone else, upon telling him I booked through the number I had called him on he sighed and said well when did you book? I told him I had booked a while ago and called 3 days prior to talk about my booking, he then replied in an arrogant manner with well what the hell is a while like an hr ago? I Hung up!Next I called to add an extra day onto my stay and I was told that she wouldn't change anything and that I once again had the wrong number, when I corrected her she then claimed I had to change the booking at hotel.com, After I told her I had never heard of hotel.com and that I made the booking through the phone on this number (which she had a hard time comprehending) she then told me reservations are locked and call back tomorrow and talk to the reservation manager linda, in a very disrespectful un helping arrogant attitude.As a soldier currently deployed in Afghanistan trying to book a hotel for my only rest leave, If they are as rude in person as they are on the phone there will be trouble!

Teeny tiny rooms but ok if you are a thin, young (romantic) couple without too much luggage. Great location, great service. We paid about 100$ a night so it was worth it, not sure I would pay a lot more than that for this hotel.

I felt like I was in a movie of sorts. It was a really nice hotel with extremely courteous staff. Our first room was small and we asked for a larger room. Within 5 minutes, the concierge was at our door to help us move to the 8th floor. The room was much larger. It was within walking distance of all the places we visited. It was comfortable, the shower was nice and very stylish. I love themed hotels. Great for couples, sexy romping, and I would give a party there. Loved it!

Great hotel in excellent location. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Rooms were small but clean and functional, bed very comfortable. The restaurant on site was quite good but with a 20% service charge added ended up expensive.

What can I say about The Night. Staying there made me want to do bad things, and I mean that in the best possible way. I really enjoyed the ambiance of the hotel. The combination of dim lighting, artwork, decor, and music gives the feel of a high class brothel, and again, I mean this in the best possible way. The staff was awesome. Very friendly and helpful. The room was a bit smaller than I am used to but very nicely appointed and clean. My only complaint was that the wifi was $10 per device per day, but that is probably the going rate for most hotels in the area. The location was great. I stayed here with a buddy of mine, but this hotel is best for couples because it will make you feel very sexy.

Stayed for 4 nights with friends - altogether 3 rooms. Check-in was smooth and staff friendly & courteous. Tiny property but it oozes cool. Very handy location to Times Square (just around the corner from the Swatch shop). As the name depicts, the whole place is dark. This did not bother us. Comfy beds. The place got a bit crowded at night. Bar/restaurant on premises must have drawn them in. Tried Red Moon, and liked their food. Affordable but not budget. A shoutout to the great people that holds the place together: Barry, Simon, Patrick and Mimi. Thanks for welcoming us and for handing out great service!It is true, you get a Kama Sutra book (not the graphic kind, mind you), in lieu of a bible.

It was my first trip to NYC and the night hotel was a perfect place to stay. It was located literally a half a block away from Times Square, the hotel is gothic, sensual and swanky, the color theme is perfect, white, grey and black. My hotel room was small but it had everything you needed, there was a window but no view since the hotel is located between two buildings. The bed was amazing! I've never slept in anything so comfortable, the housekeeper was so sweet. Every day someone came and left a sheet of paper with the weather and several chocolates, the front desk was very friendly as was the door man. I arrived about 3 hours early from my check in time, they stowed away my luggage and told me they would call me if my room becomes ready prior to 3. I went and walked around Times Square, got some coffee then returned around 2 and they had my room ready! I thought it was great how they kept my luggage for me so I didn't have to lug it around on the streets :) needless to say, the night hotel will definitely be my go-to place next time I visit NYC. Also I booked my stay through the actual hotel website and not a third party website and I actually paid less than what the other sites were offering!!! They were having a special during the time I booked the hotel that if you stayed more than 3 nights it was 30% off, so my 4 night stay came out to $650 dollars! You can't beat that anywhere!

Very stylish, perfect location right near Times Square , all of the staff were very helpful especially Simon on the door, rooms have everything you need apart from it would have been great to make a coffee. I would recommend it to friends and would go back.

We were very well looked after at the Night. The ambience and decor of the rooms is actually very sexy! I loved my stay here. Patrick at the front desk went above and beyond to accommodate our needs which set the tone for out stay. The other bonus for the Hotel is the restaurant downstairs... food is amazing and with Lisa looked after us so well. Would definitely stay here again.

Rooms can be bigger..and also could be nice to have the possibility at least..to be abble to do coffee into the room..That the only thing i can tell...all was perfect...i will recomend it to Friends and book on your hotel another time to stay in New YorkThe hotel design was enjoyable and great location also..

Very stylish, trendy hotel located in the heart of the Theater District. Here are the things we observed during our stay:- fluctuating water temperatures in the shower- weird lamps that didn't always turn on- strange light switches that were difficult to operate- having to obtain internet codes from the front desk every 24 hrs in order to access the internet- thin walls that provided little sound proof- short bed with super annoying foot board (not ideal for tall folk)- no viewsDespite all of these minor details, we enjoyed our stay! The location was great, and the price was reasonable. Who needs a view when you've got all of Manhattan at your doorstep!

Great location, great service. Love the dark racy decor. The room was small but clean, I liked it but hey its NY. I had a room by the EXIT door, did not like it much. But I would go again. Loved the concierge Patrick. Check in time was 3pm, but the room was not ready till 3:30, i was not angry, they kept my bags while i checked out the city and gave me a free bottle of champagne, Love em
user_name:
gigi g
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I had a great time at this hotel. The staff was very nice and helpful with calling restaurants for us to make a reservations and suggesting places. The room was very clean and not too small and it was honestly the best location we could ask for.

If you're young (20 to 35) and want to enjoy NYC as much as possible I would totally recommend this hotel. Perfect location for sightseeing (literally 2min away from Times Square), amazing interns, unusual and trendy place.The hotel interiors are very trendy (it's been voted as the "sexyest hotel in US"),clean and there is internet connection is WiFi and pretty good (although it's USD 10 per day). Only downside, that may be a big one depending on your expectations, the view from the room is NO existent. You usually see the big flag (if you are lucky) or a black wall that is 30cm from your window (if you are unlucky, like me!). I knew it before booking and requested a room with a normal view (at least the flag coz you feel claustrophobic with the black wall!!) and still got what I got.

Some minor downsides ..... Thin walls, heavy doors that when closing shake 'all' the thin walls and not much sound proofing!Upside - very clean stylish and groovy room and atmosphere.Staff - 1st. Class, helpful and welcomingEverything is on your doorstep ....... Aside from minor points - would stay there again.

Do not book room at this hotel. I booked a room and called to cancel the day before and was told I needed to give them 48 hours notice to avoid a charge. Most hotels will let you cancel as long as you call before 6 on the day of check in. This hotel is not flexible, not concerned about the customers and therefore not appriate for business travel where schedules change.There are lots of other options where the policies are more business travel friendly. Book a room somewhere else.

We enjoyed our stay on February 16th, 2013 for 2 nights. Great location and we were surprised that being so close to the Hustle of Times Square it wasn't loud at all. The room was nice and clean and the bed was very comfortable. The Bose radio was a plus and so was having good tissues (Kleenex). The only thing that good of been better was the shower. The water pressure varied and the handle was in bad shape. The staff was friendly and helpful. I think this hotel is best suited for couples or a single traveler. J. Lavallee and J. Clark from Massachusetts

From the stylish aesthetic to the prime location with Times Square right on your doorstep, the Night Hotel could not stand out better against the massive amount of choices that might overwhelm a young couple looking for the ideal place to stay in the city that never sleeps. The stellar reviews drew me to the Night after looking at several lower priced places that had rather mixed receptions. Arriving in the morning to store my baggage before our room was ready I could not have felt more welcome and knew I'd made the right choice. I was granted immediate access to the free Wi-Fi I had been given as part of my booking and was offered lots of help from the lovely staff at reception. Although the Wi-Fi connection did not prove as strong in our seventh floor room, that was the only small issue I had with our stay.Depending on your own experience of hotels you might find the Queen sized room small, but it was perfect for our three night stay. The bed was robust and wonderfully comfortable, and all the provisions in the room were suitably up to standard and fitted well with the sharp black and white colour scheme that runs throughout the hotel. The bathroom facilities were great and although the TV didn't have the best reception on all channels, it didn't matter as very little of our time was taken up by channel surfing. The ability to order up local food from diners and restaurants in Times Square to our room provided us with some delightful indulgences - as did the delicious chocolate brought to us for free shortly after we checked into the room! The accompanying letter from the general manager welcoming us to the hotel was also a nice touch.Returning to our beautifully remade room after days spent exploring the city was always a pleasure, and I do not believe much more could have been done to improve our stay. We didn't find time to sample the attached Red Moon restaurant's fusion cuisine, but the menu looked like one we should definitely try next time. And there will definitely be a next time, as I can't imagine any better place to stay than the Night Hotel!

Absolutely loved this hotel. Booked another stay while we were there. The staff was wonderful, the food was great at Red Moon. Queen size room is a perfect size. Beds are extremely comfortable. We really enjoyed our stay.

I don't know what matress covers they are using in this place but I want one. The beds were by far the best sleep i have ever had. Me and my girlfriend were looking for an affordable luxury in the heart of New York and that's exactly what we got. The night was voted New yorks sexiest hotel and you can certainly see why. Although the rooms are a little small and dark they do exactly what they need to. The sleep is amazing and it's got a beautiful sexy decor. I had no issue with noise, dirt or quality. The staff at the Night hotel are amazing especially Patrick and the doorman they are extremely helpful. This was my first time in New York and Patrick took a good 30 mins out of his day to mark me up a map and tell me all the best spots for what I wanted. Although its not a sky scraper and doesn't have any bath tubs the night is amazing. You can step out of the front door and your in the centre of time square. This being the case there was unusually no noise in our room. Not from the streets or the other guests which was very relaxing. Also another nice touch is every time you return to your room after its been cleaned there is classical music on the radio, which made the whole experience even more relaxing. If it is your first time in New York this is a good location. The great thing about time square is you are very central to manhattan and can catch any train you need. The time square train station has almost every line stop and there are alot of lines. We both bought a $29 train card for a week which made exploring New York simple quick and easy. Unless you are going to fork out a stupid amount of money for 5 star luxury, go to the night hotel. You will leave feeling happy it is a little dark but bedrooms are for sleeping. Thourghly enjoyed my stay and will return soon.

The location is outstanding for Broadway theater goers, and it is quiet. We had a king size bed which was super comfortable. This boutique hotel is small and deserves its "sexiest" hotel vote. Like almost every hotel room in Times Square, the rooms are small, but the available space is well-utilized and has interesting lighting. They charge $10 for 24 hours of wifi. The minibar has a weight sensor so we used the window ledge for our beverage refrigerator because it's February, and our room didn't face the street.

I came here because they were offering a mid week deal.I brought my 8 year old child and felt it was an appropriate hotel.Some of the photographs on the walls are racy but she didn't seem to notice.Our room was on the 6 th floor.It was very small but clean.Can seem a little claustrophobic at first.Bed was a queen.Seemed small but very comfortable.Bathroom also very small but clean.You do hear a lot of street noise but we just turned the fan on in the room.The staff were very friendly and accommodating.They let me check in an hour early and held our bags for us after check out so we could do things doing the day without dragging all our luggage around.They brought chocolate and the weeks weather forecast each evening.The restaurant didn't serve child friendly food and I am not particular to Asian food.Overall it is a nice hotel for the price but cramped.We dusnt spend a lot of time in the room so it was OK.I wouldn't recommend kids as it is an adult themed hotel and not super kid friendly.

Just got back from a 4 day stay at Night Hotel. Overall we had a great stay. The Hotel has been voted the sexiest hotel in U.S and i does have the feel. Mood lighting throughout contemporary designs and a luxurious feel. The rooms were small but adequate and clean. Simon the concierge was ace and really pointed us in the right direction when ever we asked.He recommended a place called Juniors Diner two blocks down when we asked for a traditional diner and it did not disappoint. The food was great and the portions massive !!! Would really recommend this hotel for its great location as Times square is at the end of the road less than a minute away.Three couples went and we all said the same thing our only complaint is the lighting is so moody you cant see what your doing when your packing to come home. Not much of a complaint i know but it would be nice if you could just turn the lights up a tad now and then.

Night is a beautiful boutique hotel two minuets walk from Time Square. The staff are lovely, the place is lovely, deffinately worth a visit. I've stayed at a few places in NY but this was a unique experience. This is more of a couples hotel rather than a family holiday - the artwork is quite sexual Check what's in the bedside draw ;)

My wife and I stayed at the hotel during the weekend of the New England blizzard and we found the staff very helpful in providing advice, assisting with directions and in making our stay a fine experience. We were able to walk to our Theater, to a number of restaurants, and to Central Park with ease. The room was fine for us in all respects and was very quiet. When we checked out the manager at the front desk inquired if our stay was enjoyable and provided us with a card with future promotional information.

My husband and I took a late winter weekend trip to NYC for our anniversary. Prices are typically a little cheaper during this time of the year; however, the Night Hotel had one of the best prices. I was surprised when I got there and saw that it truly was in the heart of Times Square. Its right next to the Millennium Broadway hotel. We were able to walk to Madison Square Gardens as well as to the nearby Gershwin Theatre to see Wicked (which was awesome as well). The hotel is sleek and modern. I didn't try the restaurant because my husband doesn't really care for sushi. By far, the best part of the hotel was the manager, Patrick. He made sure we had complimentary chocolates and champagne. He was always readily available and didn't mind that I asked a lot of questions and made several requests. He eagerly printed our tickets out that we purchased online for the Knicks game and gave great suggestions for dinner. This all while wearing a smile and warmness (this was wonderful since it was so freaking cold). I truly enjoyed my trip and will be going back again to stay here when it warms up. Thanks for a wonderful trip.

We stayed here for the first 3 nights of our honeymoon.Working in events I stay in lots of 'chain' hotels so always try and stay somewhere a bit different when we go away, but on a budget it was proving hard to find, until I came across the Night Hotel.The hotel is excellent value for money, it has a very cool boutique style and is situated in the most perfect location for first time visitors to NYC. A stones throw away from the lights of Time Square, a short stroll from the Rockefeller Centre and a lovely 15 min walk to Central Park - perfect! We walked everywhere. The staff, especially Patrick on the front desk, are extremely helpful! I had trouble calling my bank back home, Patrick was so so helpful assisting me with this!!We were delighted to be welcomed to our room with a complimentary bottle if champagne congratulating us on our wedding - a very special touch!The only down sides were the finishing touches. We had a wobbly tap, residue in the shower, our toilet blocked. It's a very dark hotel, which is quite clever as it does disguise a few wear and tear issues but overall we were so happy with the hotel, and would highly recommend it for a very cool base, with helpful staff, in the heart of all the tourist hotspots! Thank you for a great stay!

We had 4 great days here. The location is fantastic, only a stone's throw from Time Square. The rooms are lovely. It's New York so they are not massive and would benefit from a full length mirror. There's a good raneg of Irish bars opposite. The Japanese restaurant in the hotel is excellent.

The staff was very friendly and professional. The decor is all black and white and hip. It has a stylish lounge as you enter. The room is tiny -- I spent 10 minutes trying to locate a closet until a realized that it's merely several hangers on a metal bar over the small fridge-bar. Comfortable bed, small but very clean bathroom. Poor view into a strange alley. Great location, close to place you get half priced play tickets.

Stayed one night to be near theater district. Very accommodating with early check in (7 am), but at a 75$ charge. Decorating is very unique, but some furniture/decor is starting to show some age. The lever to control water pressure in the shower was seriously worn, but the shower was very nice. Room was EXTREMELY small, had a window to an alley surrounded by 3 buildings somehow, literally no natural light (which was fine given the theme). The bed was excellent. It was obvious that the room we checked into hadn't been given any love in quite some time as the window was left open with weather in the lower teens. All of this being said, the staff was helpful and attentive at all times. I would consider other hotels with competitive pricing before booking this again (having stayed at a few 3-4 star hotels in the theater district).

My boyfriend and I stayed here for 5 nights and we were upgraded to the junior penthouse suite. I can't speak for the other rooms but I do agree with some of the reviews about there not being enough light, it could be a lot brighter. However, do not let this deter your decision to stay here. It is a lovely hotel. The staff were always friendly and up for a chat. The bed was super comfortable and we had a balcony all to ourselves! It is in a wonderful location, Times Square is just around the corner and in saying this we never heard street noise apart from sirens on the odd iccasion. Only one thing bugged me during our stay and that is that it took a little while for the hot water to come through in the shower, I had to leave it running for 1-2 minutes. I will recommend this hotel to anyone!

On December 14th I made a reservation to stay from January 6 to January 9th but changed my reservation 4 days later on December 18th to have us staying from January 16th to January 19th. The notice said I could change or cancel it by 4pm on January 5th so there shouldn't have been a problem but when I checked my credit card statement they charged me for an extra nights stay on January 6th. I let them know so they can correct their error but they have refused to do anything about it because I didn't same my confirmation #. I would recommend avoiding this hotel at all costs or it might cost you more than you expectecd

The front desk staff are very accommodating, and while the room I had was well on the small side (read: cramped), I'll definitely be back to enjoy the proximity to the things I'm most often likely to be doing when in NYC.
user_name:
Chris P
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My boyfriend and I were surprised by the style and noirish glamour of this hotel room. The room was small, but the decorating and wallpaper made up for it. Everything was black and white. The only problem we had was how little "natural" light we had. The view from our very slim window was pretty depressing. The whole time we were there, it felt like night time in our room. It was hard to decipher the time (and wake up on time). The hotel staff was very friendly and down to earth. I would suggest this hotel for young people who are coming to visit the times square and midtown area.

I travel to NYC on a monthly basis and have found this hotel to be rather funky but very well situated and comfortable. It's a boutique hotel so the amenities are limited, however the rooms are dark (good for sleeping) and the beds are super comfortable. They have flat screen TV's and black and white furnishing and decor. Overall, I find the staff to be very friendly.I would recommend this place for "adults only" as the decor is not for kids.

Stayed for a week, part business, part tourist. Hotel was booked for me and I'm not sure I'd have chosen it from the photos online! As others have said, the decor is bold and brave. Maybe a bit too brave - I'm told a certain photo is being moved from the lobby to a darker corner!I also visited the sister hotel, currently called Stay, but to be rebranded Night Hotel New York ( and this one becomes Night Hotel Times Square). It too has bold design but is much brighter and colourful.What made this hotel special for me were the staff. The front desk were massively helpful, especially Patrick and Daniela. And also Simon on the door. The house keeping staff would chat and give tourist tips.Minor niggles - the lighting is too poor with the black decor. Now and again you need brighter lighting. I had a lot of black clothes in a black lined case. I dropped something on the floor in the lobby seating area and needed a torch to find it! But the low-level lighting in the bedrooms is genius and so relaxing.And I think the service elevator was out on some days, with housekeeping stopping the lift at every floor leaving guests waiting.But the big question is would I go back and I have to say yes. Location is fantastic, beds are super comfy and the staff really look after you. And that's really what's important.

My husband and I stayed here in december. The hotel was fab,rooms were very comfortable, a great location within walking distance to most attractions. The staff were very helpfull when we asked for anything especially Patrick and Diana who gave us directions and information when needed. Loved New York and can't wait to go back - would def go back to this hotel :-)

I work in NYC, and as much as I dislike the Times Square/touristy part - this hotel is a hidden gem among the bright lights. I stayed for one night while I celebrated my birthday in the city.Front desk - beyond friendly, just very polite, helpful, to the point.The lobby - super cool, chic, modern. Racey - not for children.The elevator, hallway, room - not huge, but perfect size for me and my bf. Very sexy decor, all black with pops of white. Especially loved the mini digital tv's above the room numbers in the hallway. Everything was clean, appeared to be new.There's a bar downstairs that we didn't get a chance to check out - but the staff was friendly, tried to coax us in for a drink, but we had other plans.Completely recommend this place - for adults, especially couples - but not for children.Will stay again, for sure.
user_name:
ceebake
New York City, New York

review_body: The location can't be beat... Close to everything, the day liefe, the night life walking to theaters and restaurants. Service was also wonderful and personable. I needed to change my original reservation and this was done immediately and with a free upgrade. I am glad I found this hotel, it will be my place to stay every January.

Loved the location and the hotel in general. Rooms can be small but that comes with New York. Staff are friendly and helpful. We stayed over New Years and it is very expensive, but then again so are all the others that are in that location.

After a day sight seeing it was great to go back to the hotel, wouldn't have thought we were near times square as the rooms were so quiet. Really chilled ,great sleep. Staff friendly would definately go back.

Just got back after a fantastic holiday. Hotel is amazing looks exactly as it does in the photos. Rooms lots of people on here have said there small but I think there just the right size and are decorated beautifully. The rooms were cleaned every day by lovely housekeeping staff. The staff at the hotel are all very nice and profesional and gave us tips on places to visit. Location is brilliant Times Square is a two minute walk also walking distance to Empire State rockerfella centre Central Park and other attractions. There are three pubs straight facing the hotel for food and drink all of which were excellent Connolys Irish pub The perfect Pint and O Lunneys . There is a Starbucks a few doors down from the hotel for coffee in the mornings and a deli across the road which does very good breakfast. This hotel could not have been any better and would not hesitate to stay here again thank you night hotel for a fantastic holiday.

I loved the decoration; kind of eccentric and minimalist at the same time. If you love dim lights this is your place. I love them and i love kinda dark rooms and candence lights. Service was very professional. Two things you should know: rooms are pretty tiny. They're really cool but I was by myself and I had to rearrange some furniture to be able to open my luggage on the floor. Also, you can hear almost every sound in the hallway.. which is a little annoying if you like to sleep till very late. The rest is cool!

We stayed here for a few days in early January. It is a great location right in Times Square and pretty reasonably priced. Very comfy bed and great shower (definitely a plus considering how cold NYC was!).Staff were pleasant although were not very helpful with some basic concierge services (not through lack of trying though).I did feel that the hotel was trying to rip you off a bit though. Firstly, they take a $50 deposit for each day you are there which is then refunded upon your checkout (this did not happen at any of the two other NYC hotels we stayed at). They also automatically charge you for any thing that is removed from the fridge even if you don't consume it (based on weight I believe).
