If you decide to put personal things in the fridge, you may be charged a $30 restocking fee, even if you don't move anything. Internet is $10 per 24 hours and they did not explain that it is per device logged on not per room so if you log on using three devices, you will be charged three times. We only knew this because another patron told us in the lift after she had seen us ask for the log in details. Unlike our other hotels, you are also charged for local calls (not that this is a big deal).On a side note, this may not be suitable for families. There are some very provocative photos in public areas of the hotel. Housekeeping staff were very pleasant during our stay. My fiancée was sick in bed so we had the do not disturb on. On our second day, housekeeping called to check that we didn't need anything and once they found out he was sick, would call each day and ask how he was feeling.

We took a chance on Night after reading some reviews in this forum, and we were so glad we did. The hotel is in a great location just off Time Square, just far enough away that you can escape from the frenzy. The room was very cstylish. It was small, but that is pretty normal in Manhattan. Patrick and the rest of staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay there on any future NYC trips.

We stayed here the weekend before christmas and it was the perfect location and perfect price. There is not one bad thing to say about this hotel. I will be staying here anytime I come to the city. And the bed was so comfy

I recently stayed for 1 night and it was a great experience. Not only is the hotel itself beautiful and in an excellent location, but the hotel service was superb. The staff member Luis, who checked me in and assisted me was extremely helpful, courteous, and professional. I would stay at this hotel again and would recommend many to stay at this hotel.

Stayed over New Years...great location, quiet rooms. Staff were friendly and helpful. Connollys Irish bar across the street has good selection of draft beer and bar food...go to the bar on the second floor. Highly recommend.

I had a business trip and tried to find a hotel in a "decent" price range that is also decent to stay. I was a bit worried by the tiny elevator and small lobby however the room was great. While not huge it was a fun room and worked perfectly. The price was reasonable compared to other hotels in the same area. Highly recommend for tourists and business people. Staff is friendly and helpful.

Loved the black and white decor. The baby crib was there as soon as we checked in... Not always the case in other hotels we visited in the past. Staff was lovely, friendly and professional. We did forget our iPad in the room the day we checked out and guess what... They had it at Reception waiting for us to pick up. We were relieved AND grateful for an honest staff! Amazing location so close to Times Square and walking distance to many other things. Limited room service time window but otherwise a place we will return to.

This hotel really is a little gem. Firstly the location is ideal for those visiting NYC. It was our first time in NYC, and we couldn't have asked for a better location (literally seconds from Time Square). Don't be put off by the proximity to Time Square, the Hotel is actually very quiet and chilled (a welcome break from the carnage that is Time Square!).There are a number of subway stations nearby (about 4 blocks away), so it is fairly easy to get to, and to visit the many sites of Manhatten. Furthermore, we felt safe walking to here at anytime day or night.The decor of the hotel is fairly funky (possibly not to everyones taste), but we really liked it (black and white everywhere including the bathroom). The room was a good size with a large bathroom (for NY), and a separate wardrobe, it was perfect for the week we stayed there. We weren't wanting for anything, and as others have said the beds are very comfortable (just what you need after a long day walking the sites).The two negatives I would have are that the doors to the bedrooms are very light and can occasionally rattle (only a problem if you are a very light sleeper).Secondly the cost of drinks in the bar are fairly expensive (mind you everything around Time Square is expensive),All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel, particularly for couples.

My wife went to NYC on a last-minute business trip and her travel department asked her to try Night Hotel. You can't beat the price of a room under $300 that close to Times Square and only blocks away from great Christmas shopping. After checking out the website, she was intrigued. She ended up getting the last available room and since it was a handicap accessible room with a double bed (instead of a queen), they gave her a discounted rate and a complimentary bottle of champagne - outstanding service! She thought the black and white gothic-meets-retro decor was fun. She'd never stayed in a hotel room with decorative lights under the bed! She reported that it was a great place for a business travel or couples, but thought it was a little to "out there" for families.

Stayed here 6 nights this week, and I stay at area hotels every quarter for a week. I've tried them all. Simon (concierge) arranged the car, desk staff allowed late check out, and a simple and a smile got a blush from the night managers. They should've charged me more, and I got a bargain that they didn't. Steve R.

A mere one block off Times Square. The Night was central to all the things we had planned for our weekend in the city. I prefer staying in smaller, boutique hotels and I loved the 20's-type gothy look. Patrick (the concierge) was super helpful as was the other staff we encountered. To me, the staff and service are most important. I would Definately stay at The Night again!

Perfect boutique hotel if that is what you are looking for. This time of year (Christmas), is caotic in Times Square but turn the corner to the hotel and it is quiet and peaceful for NY standards. The doorman/bellman Simon is real personable and Patrick at the frot desk was extremely helpful, especially getting us an Italian place to eat before we saw the broadway show we had tickets for. It is not as gothic as the website portrays and is right in the heart of Time Square where you can walk up to Rockefeller or down to Macy's at Herald Square. If you want a good night sleep this is the place as our room had a small window so literally no light got in. If you are over 6 feet tall, the queen bed may be a bit small. All in all, a very positive stay and a solid option.

One of the hotels perfectly located to visit New York off TimeSquare. I certainly appreciated the black and white trendy decoration perfectly illustrated by various contributor's pictures. The staff is very welcoming and that worked for me from arrival to departure. Now as i often do i will list what i liked and did not like so much. On the bright side: the decoration did it for me, It is rather dark but modern and i like dark as it feels cosy. The bedding is very good. Going to bed feels like diving in a cotton ball (maybe a bit too soft for who likes hard bedding). Very clean overall. Wifi is not too expensive ($10/day). Smokers will appreciate the patio - so much nicer than the sidewalk to indulge! Bathrobe in room, ok amenities. Many will appreciate the bar on premises. Minibar in room well filled ($5 for softdrinks if i remember well). Large flat screen and selection of cable channels (a bit of a pain that many of chargeable and not flagged as such : you keep browsing. But TV is not the purpose of a visit to NY ! ) . There are a few things that came short for me. The room was very small. A medium size luggage hardly fit in it. The closet is small and hosts the fridge, there were no drawers and i could not unpack. The door to the corridor could provide better shiedling from corridor noises. I could hear my neighbors come and go as if they were in my room. Otherwise rooms to the back of the hotel are quiet (no traffic noise - beware of construction works across the street these days though. They run thru the night on week-ends - typical of NY ;-). The water in bathroom has regularly been more warm than hot. I seriously lacked power plugs by bedside. And finally two things i found rather not welcoming : there is a charge of $30 per stay if you use the fridge for your own items, and no coffee machine in room, even on demand (first time for me in years of travelling to NY...). The hotel has 8 floors+penthouse. Do not expect a view, And target a high floor for some 'space outside your window'.But do not let all that turn you down , I list to inform fellow travellers in case any of these really matter to you when making a choice. I would say it is a good deal for a short stay in the city and at that location. Surely a trendy and welcoming place.

It was a tiny room - but it was fine for just me. The benefit of my room was that it was super quiet! The staff were also very accommodating with me extending my stay, and leaving my luggage while I was out of town for a day.I would definitely stay there again - I'd probably just ask for a slightly larger room.

We stayed here one night beg of Dec 2012 and enjoyed it. The room we stayed in (53) was plenty big for NYC but it was a king so I'm not sure if they are larger then others. Night is def if the middle of everything if your looking for location. Our room had no view except for the side of the building 5' next door. Room was clean but not 100% spotless. There wasfood crumbs and lots of dust under the bed. I always look there to gauge how well they clean, I know I'm a little strange lol. We didn't have any problems whatsoever with noise from other guests as some have reviewed and we stayed on a Fri night.Staff was friendly but didn't go out of their way to help, not that I expected them to. I booked here because my gf likes the whole dark theme but for $350 a night I think I could find better in the same area. Not sure I would stay again but it was for a birthday and she enjoyed it.

My wife and I stayed in the city on a Monday night as she had tickets to see Madonna. We wanted something reasonably priced given our short stay. I booked direct with the hotel and used a AAA discount. With tax, it came out to less than $200. For a hotel right in the middle in midtown, that's a really good rate.Hotel is well located for those coming as tourists or in town for business. The room we had was a queen bed standard. The room is dark and it is small. But, the bed was fine and our room in the back of the hotel was REALLY quiet, which was perfect. Bathroom had a full shower, which was a plus.Personally, a room this small would stop being enjoyable after a couple of days. If coming to NYC for several days then consider if a small room makes sense. But, if here for a night or two, this is a fine option if looking for a decent price on a midtown hotel.We thought the staff was perfectly fine. No problem on check-in and someone came up straight away when the tv remote didn't function.I don't think I'd opt to stay here with our kids. The artwork is probably a bit more risque than I'd like to expose them too. But, without them, I'd no have problem with coming back for an overnight.

We stayed in Night hotel for 6 nights just after Thanksgiving. Fantastic location for all tourist attractions, just 1 minute off Times Square, a few blocks from Fifth Avenue, Macy's, Port Authority (for Woodbusy Common trips!) The hotel looks exactly as it does in the photos, the room you see is the room you get and it really is lovely. On our first evening, a bottle of champagne was delivered to our room, compliments of the staff, which was a really lovely gesture. Our room was a standard room, and because of the reviews I had read here, I was expecting it to be tiny, but it really wasn't all that bad. We could store our suitcases (&shopping bags!) in the closest space & there was more than enough room. Our room was kept clean for the week & it really was lovely. One thing I would suggest when booking with this hotel, ask for a room high up, or at the back of the hotel. We were on the second floor facing the street, and from 7am each morning, the drilling started right across the road, and the windows are thin enough that it was as though you were out on the street with the builders. So sleep quality was 0 after 7 a.m. The other thing is, get a phone card if you intend on using the hotel phone. My partner used the phone in our room to phone relations in New Jersey & to phone home, using the phone for a total of 13 minutes over the week & this cost $77! When I was paying the bill on checkout, I was told that a calling card could have been purchased at the start of our stay which would have been a fraction of the cost. Also, where the closest space is is very dark. I understand that the hotel theme is dark & I loved that, but there was no lighting at all in that part of the room & at times I felt like I was doing a lucky dip when looking for clothes in the morning!! This aside, I would recommend Night Hotel, and would definatly stay there again when I return to the City.

Night Hotel is walking distance from Grand Central Station and is located very close to Times Square. The bellman can assist with getting a taxi, so it a great location from which to explore the city. It's a really cute boutique hotel with modern furnishings. The building is old but has a very cool, modern feel to it. The price is excellent when compared to other NYC hotels.Our room was on the second floor and very well decorated, but also very small. I am accustomed to small, European-style hotel rooms, but this was about half the size of the smallest hotel room I've ever had in Europe. I'm 5'2'' and petite - I had to turn sideways to wiggle through the space between the bed and the desk to get to the bathroom. I'm not complaining, but be aware that if you are larger you should request a more spacious room. My husband ordered room service while I was attending a meeting and said the food was excellent. My only complaint is that we had a non-smoking room and when we woke up the morning the room reeked of cigarette smoke. We had initially planned for a leisurely morning in NYC but the smell was so bad we just packed and caught an early train. I mentioned it to the front desk and they said it might have had something to do with the ventilation system. My husband and I both have allergies that are greatly irritated by cigarette smoke, so that aspect was very disappointing. This is why I have to rate the hotel as average and not as a 4 or 5.

The staff are very helpful & Friendly able to book transport to the airport. Located on a quiet street. Very clean & comfortable rooms. Location is ideal for Times Square, Bars & Restaurants. Would stay again on our next trip to NY

It is the last hotel I stayed before I leave NY. I booked through Hotel Tonight application which offered a good deal and was deducted by 25 bucks of new member rewarding. I and my GF are impressed by the designed room with sexy lighting. Room is quite small and unmovable but considered the location it is forgivable. Go out the hotel and turn left, you can merger into the flowing of people in the Time Square in 2 min walking distance.
user_name:
Lu Y
Tarrytown, New York, United States

review_body: We stayed at Night Hotel for our 20th anniversary and it was our first trip without our two children. The location is perfect and the hotel is very trendy. Staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Rooms are on the smaller size, but then again we are used to having an extra bed in the room. We did not eat at the hotel but did have drinks where atmosphere is great and the employees were great too!

I would like to take a moment and tell you about my experience at the Night Hotel. I arrived in NYC on November 19 and stayed though November 23. The moment I stepped into this hotel I fell in LOVE! First, the pictures you see of this hotel are EXACTLY the way this hotel looks from the lobby to the room. The front desk was superior and professional! Barry was professional and very helpful. We arrived early and Barry even stored our bags so we could hit the town! The front desk kept me VERY informed on the room and was very prompt on getting us checked in! I can't say enough about the girls that night! Barry and the girls were funny and always polite! When we got to our room we did not have to worry about our bags, they we brought up by Barry. The rooms were AMAZING! I'm sorry AMAZING! Lol! They look EXACTLY like the pictures! The beds were VERY clean and AMAZINGLY comfortable! The black & white decor and gothic look was so cool and elegant at the time. The rooms were set up nice and had a lot of personal touches like a menu for room service and a five day forecast. The papers were topped with little chocolates! The bathrooms are GREAT TOO! I loved the big shower heads and the personal touches that were also in the bathroom. There were extra towels and even a little needle and thread kit! So NICE!!! There is a mini fridge in the room. The snacks and drinks are expensive but, worth it when you’re tired and don't what to leave the room! LOL! I did not eat in the restaurant but, the food looked AMAZING by the menu. The t.v. is mounted on the wall and there is new desk with everything you need! Housekeeping was very nice and helpful! Always asking if you need anything or any fresh towels. The concierge service was great! They were very helpful with anything I needed or anything I was needed to get done. The gentlemen at front were always there to open the doors and greet you EVERYTIME you came and left. Barry, Simon, and the third gentleman (I'm sorry I never got his name) were always helpful and professional. The front desk and door men always greeted you upon arriving and leaving. This was a SUPERIOR hotel to stay. They really set the bar high for other hotels in NYC. I will not stay at any other hotel in NYC BUT, THE NIGHT HOTEL! This hotel left a HUGE IMPRESSION on not only me but, my 11 year old daughter too! I would recommend this hotel to EVERYONE! I LOVE this hotel! I have stayed at a lot of hotels in NYC and by far THIS hotel SUPERIOR! I give these hotel 20 STARS! Thank you for making my stay so amazing while in NYC and I will definitely, be back to this hotel next year!

My 2nd stay at this hotel at Thanksgiving weekend time, and good to see regular faces-simon (at the door) great welcome back, you were as helpful as ever...Perfect location, great styling and good sized rooms for NYCVery well maintained and welcoming and their service was fantastic, they could'nt help enoughI've recommended this hotel to friends whom have stayed and loved as much as meBoutique, ambient, attractive and enticing everything i look for (interior designer/ and letting agent owner) so room sizes, ammenties, service, cost and style all catch my eye and they meet all expectationsDisappointing to read people moan re room service-really in a town full of amazing delis (cafe manhatten 1 block down for the most amazing breakfast) to dos caminos, bills burger bar & Buddakan i could go on-The whole point of visiting NYC is to get out and about-if your not sure where to go then ask Simon or the desk they'll happly point you in the right directionSee you next year guys

I have stayed at this hotel now 3 times in the past year and a half. Perfect stay whether for one night or a week, especially for a couple. Rooms are average size (for NYC), have always been clean well maintained and everything in working order. I cannot say enough good things about customer service. The staff is extremely professional and courteous. They remember us each time we visit and offer small upgrades (such as free wi-fi etc.) for past guests. And they always offer small but convenient ways of assisting us, such as holding doors, letting us keep luggage there and locked safe while we roam the city waiting until its time to go to the airport, and they will always call for car service, cabs or even make us reservations for a romantic dinner. I recommend this hotel to anyone! It also is in the PERFECT location right in TIme Square

First, let me say - for a NYC hotel room it is spacious. Most hotels in Manhattan have rooms the size of closets and at this hotel I've found we've gotten the best value for the space they give. We have stayed at the Night Hotel each time we visit NYC, and they never disappoint! The service is outstanding, the rooms are kept clean, and the feel and decor makes you feel like you're at a one of a kind non-standard/not a chain hotel (which my husband and I love!!). Then on top of it all, it's close enough to Times Square to be convenient but tucked away enough to be quiet and not right in the middle of the hustle and bustle. The staff makes sure to go the extra step to make your stay pleasant. I always look forward to my next stay at the Night Hotel :)

As far as NYC hotels go, the Night Hotel stands out as one of the more interesting properties. It is a boutique hotel in a great location close to Times Square, Broadway and not too far from 30 Roc and St. Patricks. If you like sexy total blackout rooms, this is the place for you. It is reasonably priced, and the service was excellent from the hotel staff. They were very accommodating and get rave reviews for response time and just overall excellent service. If you want a romantic get-a-way this is the place in NYC to stay. Rooms are small, but that is NYC. The bed was very comfortable. If you are tall, make sure you get a room with a bed that fits you. This was a great experience overall.

As others have said, this is a great location in the NY Theatre District, only 300 metres walk from Times Square, yet the hotel itself is quiet and very comfortable. If you like to take the train to/from JFK or Newark airports (which I did), both Penn, and Grand Central, stations are only 1 km away -- an easy 20 minute walk.The bed was very comfortable (although small in length), perhaps because of the feather (rather then synthetic) bedding. The Small Double Rooms #62, #52, etc, have a somewhat noisy A/c unit outside, but the comfortable bed overcame the noise! The room was small, although no smaller than hotel rooms in England or France -- so if you're used to this, it's OK. There was closet/hanging space, but no shelf space. Storage safe and iron/ironing board, but no kettle for making tea/coffee -- but then I guess no-one wants to make their own coffee in NY! ;) There's a Bose CD stereo, but I couldn''t see how to connect my iPod :(Decore is modern chic (I read somewhere it was a "gothic" themed boutique hotel) - great for a risque/romantic getaway, but perhaps not for conservative business or family travellers. And very nice room lighting with dimmers to adjust the lighting for your mood!Check in/check out service was friendly and efficient.Overall a very good hotel and I look forward to staying again.

Firstly you should know that it feels feels like the night - all day long - at the "Night Hotel". That's not necessarily a bad thing. This hotel has a theme and I like that. The sleek-modern-gothic-esque design certainly compliments the name.The main plus of this hotel is the location - right by Times Square. In terms of the service, the check-in was quite fast, and staff and concierge were very friendly and helpful.My room was small but modern and clean. It was fully loaded with a flat screen TV, free wifi, coffee and a small kettle. The bathroom too was small, but not cramped. Overall, I was satisfied with my stay.

Our room was dirty. The carpet was caked in filth. The bathroom was dirty. There was mold in the shower. The room was tiny. It's the smallest hotel room I've ever stayed in. The air conditioner blew directly on the bed. The location was great.

I generally enjoy staying at a boutique hotel when I'm traveling outside of the country or to a beach. When I'm in New York City, I tend to stick with chain hotels as there are certain comforts that I rely on at the end of a busy day and boutique hotels do not always offer these comforts.I was so surprised to find a unique, comfortable and affordable hotel that also offered creature comforts that are usually only found in larger, more traditional hotels! Check-in at The Night Hotel was professional and quick. There was an interesting ambience in the lobby with quiet activity and hospitality. I was offered assistance to get my bags to my room and I was pleasantly surprised at how clean, fresh and welcoming the decor appeared. The room design is striking (the headboard of the bed is quite a design statement), the linens and bed is very comfortable and the bathroom offers all the amenities (shampoo, conditioner, soaps, hair dryer, sewing kit). There was a closet with a safe, an umbrella and full length bathrobes. In addition, the room offered a small refrigerator and everything needed to open a bottle of wine or mix a cocktail (no plastic glasses).Though I rarely watch television, the wall mounted television was high definition, there were movies and plenty of channels, I could borrow movies and games from the lobby (if I desired) or chose a movie to be billed to my room. There was a desk, plenty of outlets and plenty of comfortable pillows. And did I mention the Bose Wave sound system? It was so nice to come back to the room at the end of the day to quietly playing classical music, low lighting and the bathrobe waiting on the bed.Every employee - and I mean everyone - was professional, attentive and helpful. I felt completely safe and though I stayed on the second floor, I had no issues with noise. In fact, I fell into bed each night and felt completely "cocooned"...some of the best night's of sleep I have had in a hotel.The Night is mere steps from Times Square and smack in the middle of the theater district - a welcome proximity as as woman walking back to the hotel alone after a broadway show. There were restaurants and activities of every price point nearby and yet, when you walked into the hotel, there was a pervasive sense of calm that told you that you "were home"....at least for a little while.The Night hotel is in a great destination spot, but the hotel itself is worthy of a visit just to enjoy being pampered a bit. The combination is unbeatable. My son goes to college in New York City and I visit frequently. From now on, The Night will be the only place that I will stay.

As others have said, the location (right off Times Square) is amazing, and it is truly a quiet hotel in the midst of the hustle and bustle of NYC. And as mentioned, the beds are incredibly comfortable, and I'm constantly disappointed by most hotel beds. The rooms are REALLY small. I've never been in a hotel room that was this small. That being said, this is a great place for couples (not for families with small, or at least impressionable, children because of the decor). Because of the size of the rooms, there aren't any closets, at least not in our room, and virtually no room for a lot of luggage, so I'd recommend you stay here for only a day or two. As others have said, the staff was amazing.

Searching here and other places, I settled on the Night Hotel for a recent visit to the City. It was a good choice. The staff quickly learned my name and addressed me by name every time I saw them. They were friendly and accommodating in every way. Yes, the rooms are small, but it works. The TV worked well, and the shower, as others have mentioned, was really good. There's a Starbucks within about 200 feet, and it's just another 500 feet to Times Square. In all, I thought it was a great hotel, and a great value to boot.

I've been in NYC many times and stayed in horrible hotel like the Pennsylvania Hotel. Night Hotel is the best. Amazing location (half block from Times Square), very comfortable room and bathroom with excellent shower.The staff is just incredible. I recommend for couples, family, friends and so on.

We stayed here for one week last year and forgot to give them this review,excellent hotel,nice bedroom,good value and 2min walk to Times Square,I loved the decorations in the hotel very much,very stylish and they did a lot of work to the hotel,our room was black and white and very clean!

This hotel is great value for money, yes the rooms are small, though they are clean, modern and perfectly quiet. If you have stayed in some "lower cost" options in NYC you will know that you will normally end up with a room on the roadside where you are woken up every hour with sirens and passing traffic, For a little more than I was paying elsewhere in NYC this was a large jump in quality. I asked for a quiet room here and that is exactly what I received, best nights sleep I have had in weeks! I was lucky that they had preset the alarm in the room for around 1030 am else I would have slept all day!! The location is great, 2 mins walk from 42nd st Bryant park subway which takes you downtown in no time..I would definitely stay here again.

I have the pleasure of staying here for just over a week. I had a great stay and wonderful service. The rooms are first rate with a very funky vibe. Beds are quite comfortable and the room service is great. Couple of gripes but only minor, the Wifi is very slow and my bathroom had some early onset mould appearing on the ceiling. I will gladly co e back here next time and recommend to all my friends that can afford it.

Night Hotel is in a great location half a block away from Times Square - yet it is relatively peaceful. The interior design is good - dark and brooding, with a fabulous lobby and a black/white color scheme running throughout the property. Staff were friendly, helpful and accommodating - offering advice and tips on what to see in NYC and when. My room - a King room - was small (to be expected in NYC) but well maintained - but overall it was pretty good value for the location. The only drawbacks are: the entire hotel is very dark (as the name would suggest) - which is fabulous from a design point of view but not so good from a more practical perspective. Also, the hotel bar does not open on Sundays - probably pretty normal from a local's perspective, but irritating for a tourist. The alternative is a charmless Irish bar over the road... Having said that, when it is open, the food is tasty and the service good.

The night hotelPositives:Location was fabulous, just off Times Square (on the road that the swatch shop is on)Beautifully designedHelpful friendly staffNegatives:It wasn't immaculately clean, the corners of the carpet were dark grey with dustMy credit card got cloned, it was the only place i used my card :( Small rooms but you don't come to NYC to sit in your roomTips:Buy the top up railcardGetting there from airport- just get the taxi bus, you may have to share with others but its cheapCranberry cafe across the road is great for breakfastGo to Woodbury common

I stayed at the Night Hotel in the junior suite for a Manhattan birthday celebration. The staff were excellent throughout my 2 day stay - everyone was helpful, courteous and personable. I enjoyed the over the top black and white theme for my special occasion. And loved the food at the little restaurant that is tucked away past the front desk, plus the staff there made an afternoon drinks celebration with a revolving cast of guests an absolute success. Also, I took in a matinee of the truly excellent play Peter and the Starcatcher on the day of my birthday and being 1 block from the theater district was perfect.

We chose this hotel for its great location. It is literally a half block off Times Square. In the center of the action, but a quiet, calm place to return to each evening. We had 2 King rooms for the 4 of us. The rooms are exactly as pictured. 100% black and white color scheme. The bed is the focus of the room, with its beautiful, impressive headboard. The rooms are small, but manageable. The bed is super comfortable and the room nice and dark. Made for a great night's sleep. The bathroom is quite small. There is one nice shelf above the sink, but we still struggled somewhat with storage for our toiletries. No problem though- this is Manhattan, and we expected "small". The staff are excellent. Super friendly and helpful. We enjoyed their cozy lounge/bar in the evenings. This boutique hotel is a great value for its location. A few extra shelves in the bathroom and a luggage rack or two in the bedroom, and the stay would have been perfect.

As soon as we walked in we can experienced an Excellent customer service already eventho we checked in at 2am. The room size is small but well equipped n clean, they also give us welcome chocolate bars n weather forecast for the whole week. This location is excellent for tourist that never been to NYC, Time square just around the corner, surrounded by Pubs n restaurants and shops. We really pleased stay at Night Hotel , we also wanna thank Mr.Simo who helped us organise a transport to the airport : )

Excellent location, just a few meters to times sq. Friendly and efficient service. Especially Patrick from front of house, who was always cheery and happy to help. Special thanks to everyone who looked after my sister who's apartment in downtown was flooded by hurricane Sandy. This was our second stay at this hotel and it was a lovely as ever. The rooms are small, but perfectly formed, and are very quiet and private. The decor is very unique and the little notes from the hotel with updates on the weather and news were really helpful. Overall a lovely, quirky hotel in an excellent location with lovely staff! One of the best finds in NYC! We have recommended it to all our friends.Oh and the beds are so comfy we could barely get up!

This was a small, friendly hotel.The rooms were not too large.Our window looked out onto an alley, but it was clean and well equipped.The cleaning standards and general upkeep were extremely good.The location was ideal for access to Times Square.

My partner and I stayed here for 6 nights from 15th October. Our room was small but very comfortable. The housekeeper kept it immaculate for us and they very thoughtfully left us a notice each day with the weather forecast for the following day and interesting things available to do for free in New York as well. The reception staff were very helpful and welcoming right from day one and nothing was too much trouble. We both agreed we would definitely stay there again if we return to New York. It is very well located and near to Times Square, Broadway etc. We pretty much walked everywhere although we felt duty-bound to try the New York Subway, buses and Yellow cabs of course. I should also mention the great all-night deli right across the road from the hotel - although I don't recall the name unfortunately.

Night is on a busy crosstown street, but I asked for a room away from the street and it was eerie quiet. Service is courteous and welcoming. The hotel supposedly is "goth themed" but mostly its decor is silver and black and all the artwork in the hallways is of semi-dressed young people suggestively posed. I don't suggest staying here with small children. The room is small though appointed nicely, but that's Manhattan. It's a block off Times Square, which means lots of tourists, but 50 feet to a Starbucks...perfect. And across the street is Connollys pub. I've been to at least 20 pubs in Ireland and this one comes closest to being an Irish pub of any I've visited in America.For the price, Night is hard to beat in this locale.

Just spent a week at this hotel. Fantastic location just off Times Square. Was worried it would be noisy at night but surprisingly quiet! Right in the heart of everything you need to be near in New York, including tourist favourites and night life. The hotel is classy and comfortable - we were upgraded to a larger room and it was perfect. The staff are really friendly and helpful - especially Simon and the girl bartender (sorry I did not get her name). Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone - especially if you don't want to be in a huge hotel amongst hundreds of guests. Check out the restaurant (very cool) and the bar (small but perfectly formed!). Loved it here. Definitely coming back x

Perfect location near Time Square , wonderful design, friendly and helpful stuff especially the Arabian man called Simo Ana Disla in concierge desk , moderate price. The greatest value for money in New York I have ever seen.

It has been a few years since my husband and I have been to NYC so we decided spur of the moment to go for the weekend. We stayed here and it was AWESOME!! The staff was incredibly kind, service - oriented and made our stay fabulous! The location of this hotel is so close to everything I cannot imagine a better location. Due to our budget we stayed in a standard room...it was quite small but the bed was incredibly comfortable and clean and the room itself was so very very quiet. The surroundings were awesome and design was incredible. My husband and I are definitely coming back and staff assured us when we called they would consider us a VIP and upgrade our room and amenities accordingly.. I cannot say enough about how we enjoyed our stay :)

What a fantastic hotel. It was my friend's first time in New York City and the location of the Night Hotel is perfect! The rooms are pimping and you really feel up-market being there.The staff were great, Simon and Patrick especially making our stay wonderful.We're hopefully going back in December!

We just finished our stay at the night hotel. We found it on hotels.com and went to trip advisor to check out what people thought about it. We were not disappointed in the least. The staff was very friendly and helpful and patrick at the front desk helped with anything that we needed. The location is amazing as were the quality of the bedding in the room and the bed. Great nights sleep and minutes from times square. We will be back. Thanks for a nice stay.......

Have just had the pleasure of spending 7 nights at the Night Hotel. Staff were excellent and accomodating. Privacy was respected and a 1 minute walk to Times Square. Already organising my next visit to NY and will definately be staying at the Night Hotel. Thanks guys for a great holiday.

A really short walk from Times Square. The room was very clean but small. I kept bumping into things but then again I'm a klutz. The bed was so comfortable that it was really hard to wake up in the morning. I do want to say that there was loud street maintenance outside and we couldn't hear it at all in our room. Hotel was beautiful and tastefully decorated. We will definitely stay here again when we visit NYC.

The night hotel is promising from its entry through the bar, however that's when it stops! Room is dated and not pioneering in design at all - in fact it feels like I'm in a cell. I could not call this a relaxing experience. Don't stay here if you plan on spending more than a few hours in the room or want the experience or a top class boutique hotel, as you can't swing a cat and it is anything but luxurious. The beds are barely a double snd you can't walk around it without catching your self on something. Would never come back and I ve only just got here... Debating if early departure cancellation applies! Annoyingly disappointing.

I have to say I was surprised by this hotel, in a GREAT way. This is literally in the middle of the theater district, walking distance to everything. We got great recommendations for lunch from the nice clerk that checked us in and had amazing service the whole time we were there. I was a little worried with being so close the hotel would be loud at night; that was so not the case. Other than doors slamming, we had a great night sleep. The room is small, but totally doable for NYC and the location. We were on a week long vacation with stops in 4 hotels, this was BY FAR the most comfortable bed we slept in the whole week (even with staying at a spa resort). The valet parking was a bit on the pricey side but, again, there was amazing service. We were told to expect 20-30 min for getting our car back, it took 10. Great, great, great hotel.

Excellent location a stone's throw from Times Square. Yes, the rooms are compact but to be expected in such a central location. The rooms are stylish and well equipped with everything you need. The beds are comfortable and kept spotless. I found the hotel staff polite and always happy to help. I'd happily return next time I'm in NYC.

Despite being 1/2 a block from Time Square, it did not feel touristy. Night Hotel was a really nice surprise! It was NOT noisy. The staff were really helpful. Rooms were small but comfortable. Service through my 4 day stay was consistently really good. Front Desk staff was always helpful to make good recommendations and reservations. Rooms were clean. Design of the room was good even if interior design and carpet pattern was a bit over the top black & white modern. All black & white z-gallery-like interior just as photos. Bathrooms were clean and modern. Great AC in room. Only downsides were: 1) No closets in the standard rooms. Only hanging space is an open rack over the mini-bar, but it worked out ok. 2) No room safes. 3) No desks but I was there for business 4) No real natural light, as the building is positioned between two tall buildings but great for sleeping. Overall, I would recommend this hotel.The staff was very patient. Small hotels like this one are so much nicer to stay in than big hotel chains.

The staff here is amazing...Patrick, the concierge, goes the extra mile to take amazing care of you. The bedding is out of this world...the most luxurious I've experienced in 30+ countries and 250+ hotels. The vibe is hip, private, luxe...nothing is overlooked. The perfect getaway for singles and couples, and just steps from all of the action. And it's affordable! Almost too good to be true. I will definitely be back!

We stayed at Night Hotel at the beginning of September after getting a really good last-minute deal. The hotel itself is gothic themed, which does make it dark but also adds to the character of the place. All areas of the hotel were immaculate, and everything looked brand new. The staff were great - very helpful and attentive. The location is fabulous - minutes from Times Square, but you would have known that once you were in the hotel, it was really quiet. I would totally recommend staying here (if the price is right!) it was lovely-we would definitely stay here again.

This hotel was sick... Talked to Patrick over the phone about my anniversary w/my girlfriend and he hooked me up during our stay! (when we checked in there was a girl named Danella w/him who was also really great, my girlfriend loved her and they sent us champagne b/c of our anniversary.)Our room was a queen sized bed and while it was a little small it was awesome (NY rooms are never big). Karma sutra in the bedside table was actually nice.Definitly recommend this place if you want a classy but sexy evening.

we stayed here for 7 loooong nights.. I also apologise in advance for sounding so bitter.upon arrival we were greeted by less than cheerful staff who took our security in cash and a further $50 out of my account. when we checked out we were told they couldnt give us our security in cash (even though when we payed our security, we were assured there would be no problems in reimbursing us with cash). we were then told it would be in my wife's account that same day, 5 days later and its finally in the account.our room was TINY! you literally open the door and the bed is at your feet. there were stains all over the ceiling and it was hard to miss the mould in the bathroom. stains on the carpet and a BIG STAIN on our BED SHEET!! to be a little fair, the location is great! and I found the bed to be very comfortable and made for a comfy sleep.. however trying to get to sleep was a mission of its own because the rooms are soo small and stuffy, you're forced to use the air-con (which sounds like your sleeping under a v8 engine). staying here 7 nights cost an arm and a leg.. and I think I'd rather lose those limbs than stay here again.

the location is perfect less than 100 meter from timesqurethe rooms small and very darkthe floor is noiseythe internet cost 10$ a daywhen i got the room the toilet was stuck and it took almost an hour to send someone to fix itthe tv is great they have many chanels

We stayed at the Night Hotel a few weeks ago for 7 nights. We couldn't have picked a better hotel. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the hotel itself is unique and quite stunning. The rooms are very comfortable. We went to the bar one night to have cocktails and had a great evening. The location of the hotel is unbelievable, only a 30 second walk to Times Square. We will be recommending the hotel to all our friends!
user_name:
Laura D
Aberdeen, Scotland, United Kingdom

review_body: What an excellent experience we had at the Night Hotel. Superbly located and literally 30 paces from time square. The staff were extremely freindly and helpful. The decor of the hotel is stunning and quirky. Unique and unlike anywhere I have stayed before.Rooms are on the small side, but are well kitten out and are spotless. I would have no hesitation in recommending the hotel to others and would certainly stay there next time I visit NYC.

We have just arrived back from a ten night stay within this hotel and wanted to write a review ASAP!I work within the travel indrustry and am so pleased to find a hotel which is exactly what is advertised but actually offers a lot more!This was our fourth visit to New York and we couldn't find any faults what so ever.We have never found staff who were as friendly but also who were interested in ensuring you had a great holiday.Complimentery champagne to cocktails in the lounge, these little touches that the hotel offered, added to our very special holiday.We would highly recommend this hotel to all!
user_name:
Darren W
Shotts, Scotland, United Kingdom

review_body: This is my second visit to NYC, my last visit was good, but my stay was awful, so i tookmy time to choose the right place, to cater my needs.So i took alot of time to decide on NIGHT HOTEL, i booked it online.The rooms are small and comfortable, the decor was unique.Location, just couple of minutes from times square,good restaurants around,likeConnolly just opp to night hotel, brooklyn diners, and many-more. Once i arrived at the hotel, i got a free upgrade, so i was happy.Had a good sleep.started my day, met MR.SIMON at the door, asked him for restaurantsoptions for breakfast, he recommended me brooklyn diners, try the choc-chip french toastyumm...,then did the usual walking around, did some shopping.Next day, i wasnt able to connect my laptop to the internet, so came to the front-desk, therewas this girl cant remember her name ( she was skinny,very bubbly though, and super helpful)she gave a laptop, it was very helpful.MR.PATRICK & MR.PETER Where friendly and helpful.Overall it was a great experience, me being a hotelier i would strongly recommend this place.

Had a week's stay and was impressed overall.Pros: Location!!!, Room size, cleanliness, nice bar, price per nightCons: Expensive wifi, poor concierge service, The location of this hotel is fantastic - literally steps from the centre of times square and a couple of minutes from major theatres, shops and attractions.The hotel itself is quirky, and has a nice lobby, with more than adequately sized rooms (especially for NYC!). No mirror apart from the bathroom one is a bit of an inconvenience. I understand the point of the decor and lighting is to create a 'night' atmosphere, however, this is utterly pointless when the lights from the TV receiver and the alarm clock radio need to be plugged out because they are so bright! Also, if you're a light sleeper, don't expect to be able to have the air conditioning turned on at night. It's about as loud as a car engine (seriously...).Rooms are clean, although housekeeping missed our room on the first night due to our 'do not disturb' button having been pressed before we arrived - we never saw/knew about this until told. Maybe a mention upon check-in might be a good idea?Our hot water was unavailable for the main part of a day which was quite inconvenient. For the inconvenience, management gave us 2 free cocktail vouchers for the bar.Wifi was 10 euro per day (didn't use it - there's a starbucks right next door with free wifi - why bother paying?). Should really be free of charge, considering this is the norm nowadays. Note - was also charged for wifi on nights I didnt use it. Careful to check your bill!Had a major problem with one of the concierge staff. The main concierge was extremely nice and helpful throughout, but there was a younger concierge who seemed to work later shifts that was extremely unhelpful. When asked about travel arrangements to airports, he told us simply that there was no other option other than hiring a car/driver. Upon further investigation, I found both shuttle, train and taxi were all cheaper and more convenient options - makes me think that perhaps he was on commission with the car service. Watch out for this and make sure to research your travel options. Airtrain to both newark (from Penn station, which is only a few blocks away) and JFK are easy, taxi to LaGuardia is also reasonable.Overall a good hotel, but little things add up to make it less than perfect. Wifi should be free of charge (even few mins at a time would be fine!) and maybe a concierge desk with proper information would be helpful.

We stayed at the Night Hotel in NYC on Sept. 1 2012.From the moment you enter this hotel, you know that you are in a different kind of hotel!The Black and white decor really is really a step up from the boring interiors of many hotels.We had originally booked a King sized room, but we were pleasantly surprised to receive a free upgrade to the Penhouse suite!!!!Just half a block from Times square, we could see much of the action from the TWO balconies at our disposal with our room. The hotel, is also far enough away from Times Square that you don't get all of the noise, which made sleeping very good.We were accomodated with a later check-out (1PM) which was great considering the partying that we did the night before.The Staff did their best to make your stay comfortable, they were very polite and very helpful with travelers' needs.On the negative side, there were a few things that we found odd.1) the internet service was down which was a little disappointing, however at $10/24hour period the cost would have been reasonable.2) The modern design of the hotel made for furniture that was a little lacking in what one would expect in the penthouse suite. The layout of the room was also a little odd, not to mention the big red exit sign on the upper level of the room....I understand that this is a necessity since it is the only space on that floor of the hotel....it was just a little odd to have that in your room.The balconies however made up for any inconviniences of the room!!!3) There was no in-room safe, but I when i mentioned this to the front staff they seemed a little surprised....I assume there once was a safe but when the re-did the room, the safe did not find it's way back....that should be an easy fix.Overall this was a great hotel in a fantastic location close to everything. We would definitely stay there again and would definitely recommend it to couples who are looking for more than the ordinary room.This is certainly not an ordinary hotel, it is small but more personable from many of the hotels that we have stayed at in NYC and the design of the hotel will really blow you away if you are looking for a sexy gettaway!

I love black, so it's no surprise I loved this hotel. The atmosphere an decor was dark but chique, clean and new looking. Patrick assisted us, and he was amazing! Very helpful and pleasant to talk to. (good customer service is far and few in ny) My only reservation is location. Perfect for first time visitors as its in Times Square, but I can do without the hustle and bustle of tourists. Gothic much? This is thee hotel for you.

When i saw pictures of the hotel, i became excited. Being an artist, i think the hotel captures really what New York is. The location is perfect... its right by time square. I was hungry in the middle of the night at 4am and I easily got down and bought food. I also love the service, staff is always similing and have so much initiative.

My 13 year old daughter and I stayed at the night hotel for eight days seven nights, this was my daughter’s first trip to New York and as she wants to be an actress, singer, dancer on Broadway some day we wanted to stay in a hotel near Times Square. I choose the Night Hotel because it sounded exactly what I was looking for and I got it at a great price on Hotels.com. We both liked the look of it on the web site and it turned out to be every thing they said it was. The decor was all black with over sized photographs of models every where, very stylish, all the staff we met were very friendly and helpful and there was always some one on duty at the front desk any time we went. The room was small but all the hotels in that area have small rooms so that was to be expected. The room was cleaned daily and had a turn down service every night with chocolate left on the pillow and even though we were only steps away from Times Square the room was quite and comfortable, we both slept very well every night. The bath room was very clean, shower toilet and wash basin however no bath tub, the toiletries were replaced every day. We had a bath robe for our use while staying in the hotel there was only one bath robe so we ask for a second and it arrived in minutes. They have free Wi-Fi in the lobby and they let us use their lap tops as we did not bring any so we were able to check email and print out boarding passes, we both were able to borrow lap tops at the same time so no waiting around. They left a thank you for using the hotel letter for each of us in our room with vouchers for complementary cocktails in the bar on the main floor that was a nice touch, the bar doubled as a restaurant also with black decor and friendly staff. The hotel has a great location just go out the front entrance and turn left take a few hundred steps and you are in Times Square, look to the left or take another few hundred steps and that’s where the ball drops on New Years Eve. The half price ticket booth for all the Broadway shows is also very close, right beside the bus stop for the hop on/off tour bus and the underground and the Broadway Dance Center for drop in dance classes was on the same street to the left of the hotel on the same side of the road about a four minute walk away. We plan to visit New York again soon, this time with my husband along and if the Night hotel has availability we will stay there again, we loved it.

In general the rate of the hotel is so good.Location is perfect.Rooms are small but very confortables and clean. Room style is very fashion but there is no natural light hardly.Air conditionated system was too noisy.

It is a great location close to Times Square and the subway system. My only complaints would have to be the decor. If you like dimly lit, goth scene- then its perfect for you. However for other light loving ppl it is very lacking. The room is tiny- the elevator was a bit claustrophobic for me-but to be expected in NYC. It is all elegantly designed in black and white. My room had a view of a brick wall, so even less light coming in. The staff was attentive and friendly. They seemed to all speak several languages. If location is what you want this is it.

I loved this hotel, my husband not so much. What I loved - - utterly quiet, very comfortable, clean, dark, cocoon-like, chic. convenient. Did I mention quiet? After a day in NYC it's lovely to retreat to such a place of calm and peacefulness. My huisband just thought it was dark. I loved the black and white wallpaper. The beds were VERY good. My husband slept really well but muttered about the lack of natural light. Oh well, the window was a window well. But who cares? I imagined being a vip guest in Batman's own guest suite in the bat-mansion. Yes, that cool. The staff was great, they got it just right. Everything was very easy, all taken care of (car whisked away and brought back in sceonds when needed, anything amiss fixed instantly) so absolutely no complaints at all.
user_name:
Diana C
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I wanted to do something special for my husband's birthday so I surprised him with a trip to NYC. We stayed at Night Hotel. I was a little nervous since he is the one who always organizes our vacations. When we arrived this hotel it had that wow factor, the lobby is chic and stylish. The lighting and decor is really nice. Makes you feel romantic in the big apple. Front desk service was amazing. When we checked in they gave us an upgrade room. We didn't even ask, when I told them its was my husband’s birthday, they gave us a bottle of free champagne. Our hotel room was just lovely. The decor from the lobby continued to our room. The bed alone look like some modern King would have in his castle. The bathroom was really cool with the black title shower. I left the best for last, the locations was perfect! Once we checked in, we just walked less than a block to Time Square. It’s also close to the metro station. We were able to go to the Met’s game and the Village with no problems. Overall my husband and I loved our stay at Night Hotel. Friendly staff, clean, comfortable, stylish room, and great location!

I recently stayed in Night Hotel in August 2012 with my girlfriend. (We are both in our early 20s)The locations is fantastic, it is about a 3min walk to times square.(practically on times square)The room we stayed in was on the 7th floor, and was absolute luxury, so modern and completely spotless. Our room was a good size, a little smaller than your average hotel room but the decor is stunning and location is perfect so it didn't bother us at all. Everything in the room looked as if it was new and the bathroom was the same standard as well.The staff in the hotel were so helpful, always there if we needed anything at all.We were only there for 3 nights so we didn't get the opportunity to try the restaurant/bar, but it looked very nice.Overall our stay was great, for the price we paid we could not ask for much more. The location is perfect and the hotel has a really warm feel to it and i would highly recommend it to anyone who is looking to stay near times square.

*location is perfect and lots of restaurats and coffee houses just sides of the hotel.*staff is perfect and let you know all you need about NYdiscount tickets of all activities available on the desk.*standard rooms are too small for 2 persom , prefer to stay king size room about 30 usd diff/ dayrooms are dark but nice ambiente.back rooms have no seeinng , and have no chance to open curtains or windows because next hotel stays about a meter away from the window.front side rooms is nice bigger and can be see out side from the window and understand how the wheather look like.*bathrooms are clean and nice.*internet per day is 10 usd , and cannot be pay at once all your accomation dates.should have to get everyday pass to connect internet from the reception desk it is not so nice .they have to change or improve internet sytem even offer all customer free or included room price. Attn : only one device be able to access internet with the code....* no breakfast in the hotel.

Finding a hotel to stay at for my wife's birthday celebration in NY was tricky. There are so many choices but once I stumbled upon the Night Hotel, I knew I had found the perfect place. 1/2 a block from Times Square, it was surprisingly quiet and intimate even on the 2nd floor. The beds and pillows were comfortable and room service was very quick.The staff was extremely helpful and friendly and the ambiance was perfect for a romantic getaway despite it being smack in the middle of the busiest tourist center in the U.S. The decor is dark and sultry, but not over the top. The lighting in the rooms were adequate, though it was a little difficult to see what you were doing in the closet without repositioning some of the adjustable lights. The queen room was tiny by normal standards, but not smaller than expected for a NY room. There are no dressers, but there is plenty of space below the built-in desk, the in the ottoman, on the deep window sill and in the closet to accommodate us on our three night stay with at least two outfits per day and 6 pairs of shoes.I've read reviews from some that were turned off by the erotic nature of the photos on the walls. They really aren't that racy at all and fit the decor quite well. If you're worried about your child seeing a boobie, you might not want to be staying in this part of town anyway. I wouldn't recommend the Night for people traveling with children; not because of the artwork, but the vibe is more suited for couples and I wouldn't want to impose on the other patrons.Great hotel, great location, great staff, and great price. This is the place to make your home base when traveling NY with your significant other.

Me & my boyfriend stayed here in early march '12 and I have to say it was fantastic the rooms are small but your in NYC!!! Ur not there to stay in ur room all day & evening! Hotel is so stylish & different from anywhere else we've stayed. The staff all really friendly & nothing was a problem. Would definitely stay at the Night Hotel again.

Even though the place is small, it makes up with quality. Fashionable and clean. Excellent staff at the front desk, bell, and bar. Slept well with no disturbances. Their bath robes make you feel like you are all wrapped in a warm blanket.Not a far walk from all Manhattan offers. Being here on business, only 2 1/2 blocks from work.Will def stay again.

The hotel is wonderfully located between Times Square and Grand Central. Room was nice and clean. The bed was comfortable, it gave me a nice break after a busy day and before dinner. However the front desk staff was unhelpful providing me wrong information of the restaurant she recommended.....the restaurant was closed when I got there. Also, the staffs will say hello to you in the way or may have a conversation with you but then completely forget anything about you the next time they see you. The bed light was out, but no one ever fixed it until I checked out, even though I personally went down to the front desk to remind them. After reading a number of glowing reviews I looked forward to my stay at the Night Hotel, but all those added up and diminished my enjoyment. I think there are other good choices in the neighborhood.

I have stayed at the Night several times now. The first experience was so wonderful that whenever I need to stay in NYC due to my work schedule, I automatically book the Night. The reception staff is excellent, rooms are clean and the atmosphere is extremely welcoming and comfortable. Although I work downtown, i enjoy this place so much that I have no issue adding a subway commute from and to the office even though there are other hotels closer to where i work. I highly recommend the Night.
user_name:
Donna M
New York City, New York

review_body: Getting to the hotel the the receptionists promptly welcomed us congradulating us on our new vows. We got a corner room tight quarters with a modern and gothic look. Champagne bottle on ice gift from the hotel. The restroom was prettier in the pictures and the floor was dirty. The bar down stairs was nice ... When they found out we were on our honeymoon they rewarded us with free drinks. The location was nice in the center of times square walking distance from everything. Upon check out they offered to secure our luggage for free as we explored the city. The Mini bar was nice but expensive ... Don't remove anything unless you want to buy it cuz it charges automatically. Good experience but not the best.

We stayed here for one night in August for my boyfriend's Birthday. The location was perfect for us! Literally just off Times Square - good for playing tourist and super easy to find. We arrived way before check in time just to drop off our stuff, and found some polite and friendly staff - Patrick in particular. We were told that if our room was ready early they'd give us a call and we could get in early. And we did get that call around 1.30pm! I can't think of any other time where I've gotten into a hotel room early. Absolutely loved the room. Very nicely decorated, very clean and actually larger than I was expecting for a room in NYC. Although if we had been staying longer, the lack of drawers would have been a problem. The bed was very comfy, but was all feathers and annoyingly I'm allergic. However, we phoned down to reception and someone came straight up with different bedding. The only slight downers were no free wifi, the minibar has weight sensors we weren't informed of (so minor panic at check-out when we thought we were going to be charged for being nosy at the contents!), toiletries weren't the brand advertised and no coffee in rooms. There's construction going on across the street, but we heard nothing. We actually had a really good sleep thanks to the sound proofing and black out curtains! Also, loved the little touches - like the Karma Sutra (instead of a Bible!), the door bells and the umbrella. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and wished we'd stayed a little longer. Would definitely stay here again.

My friend and i stayed at Night hotel for a week back in 2011. What can i say, this place is pure fire! Not only were the staff attentive and lovely, but the door man was as cute as they come! The room was TINY! But what can you expect for NYC! Lets just say that it was 'very cozy' Decor is dark. From the wallpaper, to the carpet, it is all very goth-chic. The room also comes with a bible in one drawer, and the karma sutra in another. hehe. Ive stayed at alot of hotels in my time and i have to honestly say that the bed in this room was the most COMFORTABLE beds i have slept in,. EVER! The location is a 2 minute walk to Times Square, and right next to a Starbucks for when you need to *ahem* steal WIFI and grab a coffee.If you dont get a deal online, the hotel can be a little costly. So make sure you scout around to find the best deal! We got the room for $2k for 8 nights. Quite reasonable for a boutique hotel in NYC. Only thing that i didnt like about the hotel was that the Wifi wasn't free. Ive taken off a full star for it. This boutique hotel is an awesome alternative to the big chain characterless hotels. Definitely one of the coolest hotels i have ever stayed in. I LOVE Night!!!

Two night stay in NYC (July 14th and 15th). Receptions staff excellent, polite, helpful and very informative in every way. Mulit-lingual too, which impressed me in NYC. Location is fantastic, right in the midst of Time Square and Broadway for choosing that special show. Decor is fab and rooms a tadge on the small side but fab decor. Chambermaids ring bell in the morning to check if room is empty or now. Definitely recommend and use again. Reception staff organised my cab from hotel to JFK airport which was a good deal, and arrived well in advance of booked time.

Night is ideally located half a block of Times Square. The staff was great and we were quickly checked in. Our room was a "larger" king, which is not large, but this is NYC and it was perfect for us. Our room, 77, faced the street yet there was no noise to be heard from outside. Very chic and classy design in room and there was turn down service. The bed was very comfortable with good lighting for reading, watching tv, etc. I was able to get a discounted price by searching the internet and I am extremely happy with the results! I would stay here again and would recommend it to anyone.

There are some really great things going on with this hotel. Location is the best! If you're looking for something near Times Square or Broadway, you'd be hard-pressed to find a better hotel, especially for the cost. Other positives include clean rooms and a nice decor. Other reviews here talk about the positives, and I agree with most of them. As for the not-so-good, there are a few things worth noting for me:First off, two days before our arrival, I emailed the hotel using their website form. I had questions about parking options and was hoping to get answers before driving into the City. Alas, here we're are on the day of checkout and still no response. I would recommend not using their on-line email to communicate with the hotel, as it appears no one checks it. For anyone curious about parking, the hotel offers valet parking for fifty-five per night. There might be lower cost options, but the hotel never responded, so unsure. Secondly, are the rooms. While nicely appointed they are very small, which is to be expected of rooms in NYC at this price range. What wasn't expected was the shower that took five minutes to adjust and the terrible squeak in the floor every time we walked on it. It was obviously caused by loose floor boards. We notified the staff of the noise upon check-out. They thanked us and said they would resolve the problem right away. If you get room fifty-four and the squeak is still there, you'll know they didn't correct it. Lol! The last item is a pet peeve of mine, and I always take away a full star for it. It's the lack of free wi-fi for guests. They charge ten per night, per device, which is crazy to me. For the rate of the room, free wi-fi should be included. If you have to increase the cost up front, fine. Just include wifi. if wifi had been included, this would have been a 4.5 rating, rounded up to five.There you have it. The location and price make up for the squeaks, shower, and lack of communication. If not for those, this would have been a three-star review. As it is, I rate this hotel as 3.5, and would stay here again without reservation.

We stayed at the Night Hotel last week and had a great time. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. Patrick was awesome in pointing out "Restaurant Row" and other points of interest. Check in took a little too long due to some confusion about our reservation. But we were upgraded to accomodate for the delay which was appreciated greatly! The room was dramatic, clean and comfortable. Yes the rooms aren't huge, but we did not spend a lot of time in the room. The location you cannot beat. We were able to walk to where we were going or walk to a subway quickly. I will definately be back and hopefully soon!

When I visiting NYC for the first time, it felt overwhelming looking at hundreds of hotels, but the Night Hotel was the only that truly stuck out for me. When I arrived the lobby was very moden, clean, the staff was extremely helpful/ friendly. Arriving at the room was an exciting experience to see the ambient lights underneath in an all black and white room. Coolest room I've ever visited.When you leave the hotel you are a half a block from Time Square. Coming back to the hotel, it was a nice touch to see there was a DJ in the back lobby.The only thing I could say negative about the hotel is the view from my room was not anything to write home about, but definitely didn't effect my excellent experience. I'm a frequent traveler and this hotel far exceeded expectations and will stick in my mind for a long time. I look forward to visiting NYC and the Night Hotel again soon!
I can not emphasize enough how helpful and friendly the staff is at this hotel. Central location and absolutely magnificent!

Me and my fiance had an absolutely amazing time at the Night Hotel and planning to come back here after the wedding. We came in February 2012 for Valentines and it was perfect!Patrick was fantastic and sets a high standard which I think some of the other members of staff should follow as their attitude and willingness to help seemed below standard. Patrick on the other hand was helpful, chatty, friendly and couldn't do enough for us! Such a pleasure. Also the two door men where very friendly and chatty and it seemed very genuine, not like they were hinting for a tip. The three girls in the bar where fabulous too and such a great laugh to chat too at the bar! Two of the girls were called Angelique & Jess and I cant remember the other girls name. It was her first shift and she seem nervous but was very nice too. I would like to say a big and special THANK YOU to the housekeeper that decorated our room with rose petals and the gifts I had bought for my fiance on Valentines Day. If meant so much that they took the time out to do that. The night hotel is a fantastic location for Broadway and Times Square. When you come out of the hotel and turn left, you're less than a minutes walk away! When your in the hotel you hear sirens and what not (as you would expect) but none of the hustle and bustle of the street. There is a great cafe over the road which is yummy and perfect for breakfast if you dont want to be ripped of for being a tourist. About a 5min walk from the hotel is an Irish bar called the playwright...highly recommended too! The meals where just huge! You get what you pay for. Oh, also, the subways are REALLY easy to get the hang of and Patrick very kindly explained to us there is an unlimited weekly pass you can get for around $30. It is most certainly the cheapest and easiest way to get round new york and it also means you can do more than just visit times square!I cant talk about this hotel, its staff, and its location enough. If your looking for somewhere for a romantic getaway where the interior is a bit sexy and boudoirish then this is the place to go. It has very seductive decor and is perfect for any couple.One minor down point, make sure you check about paying deposits on your arrival as taking a $50 refundable deposit per night on arrival was quite a shock as we weren't informed before hand.Hope Jess had a great time in the UK and we'll look forward to coming back to the Night Hotel in the future! (Apologies for the delayed review!) Thank you again! xXx
I have stayed at this boutique hotel many times. The sensual decor establishes real ambiance and the staff is friendly and helpful. A nice alternative from the impersonal big hotels.

I was really impressed with the room design--very chic--and the branding elements of the hotel in general (I'm in marketing so I notice that stuff!). The room size was pretty average for New York but it felt luxurious and comfortable and not just like a bed stuffed into a closet (typically my experience in most NYC boutique hotels). The location could not be beat if you need to be near Times Square and my rate was pretty incredible; it ended up being less than staying at a Best Western a few blocks away.The rooms were clean and had nice toiletries. The lobby was interesting and had a cool vibe. (Probably not a good family location as most of the art is on the adult side). The only thing that was not good was that the morning I checked in, I found the hotel online for a lower rate and the hotel was unwilling to honor the lower rate that I found. Additionally, I asked to be upgraded from a double to a queen and they charged me an additional $20/night. Not a huge deal but you would think that those two things together they would have compromised and said, "We can't honor the new rate but we can offer you a complimentary upgrade." Honestly, if they had said that I probably would not have even mentioned this part in my review.Bottom line: I would stay at Night again if I needed to be in the Theater District and for the chic design elements.
user_name:
Alexandra G
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I stayed here on my honeymoon in 2008 and found this hotel to be amazing. The location is just off Time Square which is perfect and the black and white theme is stunning. We booked the larger size room and it was very small so if you have a lot of luggage you will find yourself stepping over it to go to the toilet but most New York hotel rooms are small and of the 4 hotels Ive stayed in in NY this one is by far the best.
Loved the hotel. Very stylish and modern. Comfortable beds. Staff eS very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay again.

Booked a stay at Night Hotel and regretted it almost instantly at check-in. Front desk was rude and waited about 20 minutes just to enter my pre-paid reservation. There was no restaurant or room service available. The shower drain was clogged and the water reached up to our ankles. The A/C was so loud and made strange noises throughout the night. The rooms are tiny (even though I upgraded to a larger room at additional fee). The towels hung in the restroom had holes in it. Granted the location is great but I'm a New Yorker and was not there to site-see. Positive note is that they had good TV and cable service in the rooms and the bed was comfortable. Definitely not worth the price, won't be back.
user_name:
OhCheckMeOut
New York City, New York

review_body: Diana, the front desk employee, was extremely kind from the moment I called to ask about the hotel to the moment we checked out. We stayed there for one night, just for fun, as a kind of sexy getaway. If you're a twentysomething guy looking to impress a girl, you're likely to achieve that if you stay at this place. I guess I was particularly impressed by the service - you walk in and see the setting and you expect everyone to be too cool for school, but everyone is just super friendly and professional. I will 100% stay there again...and I live in Manhattan!

I booked this hotel using the Priceline Negotiator and was immediately excited as I read reviews for the hotel. I did have 1 issue. There are 3 of us in my family and upon getting the confirmation with Priceline, I conacted Night to see if they can give us a room with 2 beds. To my surprise Night only has 1 bed rooms bo roll aways or sofas available Either Needless to say I was stuck with the room and planned on having my son sleep on the floor. My check in went smoothly. Our room wasn't ready but to my surprise, Diane offered to take my cell number and call me when it was ready. I also inquired about my room size and Diane told me that I can be moved the next day to a larger room that may be more comfortable for our situation. we ventured out and took in some sights and an hour later Diane called notifying us our room was ready. We returned to Night and got our room key. This room, 42, had a double bed and was very tiny. It is similar to an inside cabin of a cruise ship. It would be sufficient for 1 or 2 people but not for us. There is only 1 small closet no drawers so plan on living out of suitcases. The bed is amazingly comfortable and when I asked for extra comforters and pillows for my son to sleep on, they were immediately brought to the room. The rooms have blackout curtains and when drawn the rooms really do mimic night which made it great for sleeping. The next day I was told we can leave all of our packed belongings in our room and when the king size room becomes available they will move everything for us. I was a bit worried that something would be forgotten but after a day of sightseeing we retrieved our new keys to room 78 and was delightfully surprised. All our belongings made the transfer. Since it was late they turned down our bed and had relaxing music playing. I was definitely pleased. This room was larger.
