We were able to live out of our suitcases comfortably and still have an area for my son to sleep. The location of this hotel is half a block from time square. Starbucks a few doors down, Irish pub across the street as well as a few restaraunts. Literally in the middle of it all. The street is actually quiet and safe. The decor isn't really Goth. It's more like a chic dark hotel. I wasn't offended by the photos. It was clean,and comfortable Diane as well as Robert at the front desk were commendable with their service. There were also 2 door men that were always ready to open the door, greet us as well as help with luggage. Service is more then what I expected. they were very accommodating and eager to help and please. Its a must that I stay at this hotel again. This time just 2 of us in a room. :)

If you are looking to stay in Time square, this hotel is great. The hotel is unique with a gothic or dark design. The rooms are really small but well equipped with all modern amenities. You are not disturbed by any loud noise. Maybe more suitable with travellers w/0 children.
user_name:
Simi M
Baltimore, Maryland, United States

review_body: Great hotel right in the heart of Time Square! You have everything so close! And the decoration, the ambiance everything was just perfect for me! At the bar they have a very nice cocktail menu which I tried and was more than pleased !! Try it!

Night hotel is located I the heart of time square. It is an experience in itself with its unique gothic modern look. The decor is stylish, modern and interesting. All the staff are helpful and the rooms are beautiful. The temperature was perfectly regulated and the bed was so comfy. Complete with a huge tv had wifi been included I don't think you could fault anything about this hotel. I saw it in 2008 and knew I wanted to stay there one day. It is pricey but worth it. I don't understand why they feel the need to charge for wifi come on guys!! sort it out! :) this is only a minor fault though. Loved everything else about it. Deffinately a hotel you need to stay in in new York city!!!Partick on reception was lovely. Will deffinately stay here again :)

We stayed at The Night Hotel for a special occasion for 4 nights and the service was impeccable. We were given a beautiful room on the 6th floor and didn't have any noise issues from the outside. The air conditioning inside was loud but we switched it off during the night anyway. We were given a complimentary bottle of champagne which was such a nice surprise! The staff were extremely helpful. We have unfortunately lost the name of the lady who assisted us on our stay but she also helped us print out our boarding passes and slipped them under the door in the evening, ready for our departure.My only suggestion like others would be to make wifi complimentary in the rooms. The hotel also helped us book transfers to the airport at a cheaper rate than the yellow taxis and this was prompt (early actually!). I guess reading other reviews, suggest you ask for large room on the 6th floor, preferably away from noise. We enjoyed our stay!

Friendly, helpful staff and a superb location, its hard to go past this hotel in New York city. Literally a stones throw from Times Square, easy access to various Subway stations, 24 hour front desk and 3 bars directly across the street. There are some cheaper hotels available, but this hotel is worth every dollar!!Some reviews have stated the rooms are small. They definately aren't huge, but have plenty of room for all your luggage and shopping, with plenty of floor space left. Also, the bathrooms are a decent size, with a superb shower!!Also, one of the most comfortable beds we have slept in...

We stayed 6 nights in a king room and enjoyed our stay. I loved the decor of the rooms, all black and white with wallpaper and nice features. This made me pleased to come back to the room at night after exploring this great city. I have to say if this style doesn't excite you, everything else about the hotel is quite standard. There is plenty of room around the bed to move around and put our luggage. No luggage racks though which is a negative. The king bed was not what we would call a king bed in Australia. It was very wide but not long enough. We're a pretty tall couple and it was annoying that our feet hit the wooden bed end. The low bed end was also a pain when I flopped on the bed and forgot it was there (ouch!). The bathroom is small but clean. Important to note that the little bar fridge cannot be used for your own items unless you pay a $50 fee and you are automatically charged for anything taken out of the mini bar (even if you put it straight back without consuming). Staff in the hotel were friendly and professional (we were given recommendations and assistance several times and had ice delivered promptly to our room) and housekeeping each day was thorough. Location is convenient but very close to Times Square so it can be noisy late at night and the Times Square crowds can get tiresome to navigate. By the end of our stay we avoided the area. We didn't have breakfast or any extras included in our room but overall the hotel was perfect for our stay here.

Me and my husband spent our Honeymoon at Night Hotel in Manhattan. Everything was perfect, the rooms are beautiful and extremely clean. The location is unbelievable, a few steps away from the very core of Times Square. The room service was quick and efficient. Front Desk atendees were supportive and gentile. Night's Daily weather reports and small treats were the icing on this delicious cake!We will stay at Night everytime we visit Manhattan in the future.Highly recommended.

We spend 3 days in a room that was lauded as a special 40% off deal; the place was so small that we felt claustrophibic when spending any time in the room. No place to hang the clothes except for some unlit corner behind the door, 2sqm bathroom. Nice beds (sheets were the best), nice staff, but the place is not only small and dark, but also noisy with AC units humming all night and day, outside - and I can only imagine what it would be like if your room is facing the street:) You can do better even in NYC:)

I slept great at this hotel. Didn't hear a thing all night which is amazing considering its central location. My room was small but just right for one person. I was amazed by the excellent service at this hotel. It was the kind of service that you expect from a 5 star hotel. Every little request I made was attended to immediately. Also, the room had many amenities that are usually found only in more expensive places.I would definitely return here.

I was disappointed after reading online reviews...for the cost, my room was undersized, and uncomfortable. Both the room and the bathroom were so tight that I almost had to walk sideways to move around the bed and the bathroom door. The lighting system didn't work correctly either. The staff was kind and helpful, howwever. Its hard to take in the cool vibe when you feel like you're in a closet. :( I think there are better choices around Times Square.

Love this hotel. It creates quite a swank mood. They accept pets. It's walking distance to everything, including Bryant Park (Fashion Week). Staff is nice. Breakfast. And, I found out later that they even have DJs.

I needed to escape the chaos of my life for a night, remembered fondly how well I was treated by the staff at the Night hotel, as well as how deeply I slept and how relaxing and sensual the hotels atmosphere was so I got online and found that I could make a same day reservation and that was it. I quickly packed my bag and headed into the city. I travel a great deal, and as I said in my last review of this gem of a hotel, the staff here are on par of that of a 5 star hotel, if not better. Not only are they all quite lovely looking, but they are knowledgeable, friendly and accommodating. And this can be said about all of their staff, housekeeping, door staff as well as the front desk. When I checked in I found that they had upgraded my room (lucky me!) and that the beds were as amazing as I had remembered (note to other travelers- these are by far the best beds I have ever slept in at any hotel in all of my travels. If you want a good nights sleep you will get it. The bed surrounds you in an oasis of comfort) the lines were still soft and good to the touch, and the towels (Frette of course) are the kind that feel good to the skin while still wicking away the moisture from your shower.It's quite simply a lovely hotel, that truly echos of luxury, a creative and daring eye in their decor, and sumptuous relaxation, with a top notch staff that I wish could be emulated in the other hotels I frequently travel too.Michelle you are a gem in the hospitality industry and the Night Hotel mirrors your true understanding of customer service and comfort.

My daughter and I stayed here for 2 Nights, and were a little uncertain due to the "theme" of the hotel, but loved the location. It was an adventure. The staff has to be hands down some of the best I have ever seen, especially for NYC. They made us feel welcome and comfortable from the moment we stepped in. Rooms are cozy, but have all that you need. Thank you!
We had an amazing stay at the night hotel. Everything is so cozy, dark and quiet. Location is perfect, employees nice and helpfull.

It's called the Night Hotel for a reason. It's dark and sexy. But cosy and relaxing and the staff made me feel comfortable and did everything in a relaxed and friendly manner. Every thing worked. I really liked staying here. It made me work trip go well.

Airconditioning wasn't working, room was too tiny, dark and congested, didn't sleep very much. Comped one cocktail and free wifi, should have comped the night stay....Next day got moved to slightly bigger room with zircon working. Got a better sleep but decided to move out and stay at the intercontinental at same rate $350. Service was friendly although manager should have comped the room. Would not recommend....

At first the hotel looked a little bit weird, since the majority of things were black (including the walls!) and a little bit of white (much less!), but soon I realised that the employees would make the whole diference during my stay: the nicest hotel employees I have found so far in NYC. That's for sure!The room is small, and I really wish it had at least one good bright light, that we could turn on when we need it! . I missed it because sometimes it was annoying to stay in the dark!!The bed was just PERFECT! So comfortable!! The hotel is very trendy!No breakfast is served there, but there are plenty of places for breakfast nearby.My first impression was that I didnt like the hotel, but after a while, I enjoyed my stay!

Small, high-style rooms in a terrifically hip, dramatically appointed and lit black-and-silver goth-tastic hotel. Staff was fatastic, rooms small but entirely sufficient, and the price was very reasonable for the location. The Night Lounge serves a great Manhattan as well. A much more interesting and enjoyable alternative to the Big Name Times Square business hotels.

We stayed at this hotel as a weekend away. We've stayed in Times Square many times at many different hotels and this hotel is the one we will stay at from now on. The location and service were excellent. The staff at the hotel were the best, especially Patrick, although everyone was great. They went out of their way to see if we needed anything or they could help us in any way. While the rooms were small they were clean and had everything you need, even an umbrella in case it rains. We can't wait to go back.

Stayed at this hip hotel on my recent visit to nyc recently. Very good location. Nicely designed, clean, friendly staff. Eventhough my room was kind of small, but it`s not a big deal. It was $150/night during the time I went. I thought it was reasonable.

We stayed here in late February for a long weekend to see some Broadway shows. While we were nervous about the theme of the hotel (very Eyes Wide Shut) everything was a great surprise. The rooms were clean and updated, the room was about as spacious as you can get in Times Square, and the staff was beyond friendly. And you seriously cannot beat the location of this hotel - off of Times Square enough to not have to deal with all of the noise, but still right in the heart of it. We also managed to get a GREAT deal from booking.com, so there wasn't a lot to complain about. Overall, it was a great experience and I would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting.

A fabulous stay. The dark gothic feel won't be to everyone's taste but we loved it. The room was not exactly large but that's what you get to only be 100 yards from Times Square. The bed was comfy and that's all you really need - a base of operations. Clean, sophisticated and with friendly staff, we'll definitely be coming back.
user_name:
Paul O
Swindon, England, United Kingdom

review_body: Great place to get away from the hustle and bustle of NYC. The staff was very accommodating in making our stay easy and relaxing. The style of the hotel is very different from anything that my girlfriend and I were used to. WE LOVED IT! The room we stayed in was perfect, small and to the point! We had a room towards the back of the hotel I'm assuming because we could not hear a sound of NYC what so ever and the dark shades allowed us to sleep in, which was much needed! Hope to be back very soon!

Small and stylish, the theme is an elegant urban gothic. Staff was very helpful and while the room was small , it was comfortable and quiet. Right in the theater district and very close to Times Square.

Every member of the staff was polite, solicitous and full of good humor. The decor was restfully lovely. Although we appreciate the minimalist approach, our only desire would have been at least one chair in our room. Hope you see us soon!

I recently stayed at Night for 2 nights while in NYC for business. I am a previous Tablet Hotel guest so I go a private sale email after I booked my room. I was in my cancellation window so I changed my room booking to the sale price with no ease. I ended up with a king bed room, small but not for NY boutiques. It was a really cool room but most importantly was that it was clean, had great bedding and a modern bathroom/shower. The lobby is hip and all the personnel were friendly and helpful. Since my room had no closet, I had to call down for an iron and ironing board. They delivered it in minutes with no problem. This is not a family hotel, it's great for a couples escape. There was even a copy of the Kama Sutra in the bedside table. The food in the lounge was excellent and all staff were friendly. Will return. Too close to Time Sq for me.

Just got back from first visit to NY and the hotel was in a great position. Room big enough to sleep in which was all we required. Staff very professional and so helpful it made the trip all the better. A big thumbs up to Simon for sorting out thee transfer and Diane for assistance with airport check-in. Would definitely go back to this hotel and we probably will.

After a long flight, lengthy queues at the airport, and a long wait for a transfer, all we wanted to do was go to bed! We arrived at Times Square around 3pm but unfortunately, the St Patrick’s Day parade was in full force and the road that the hotel is on was closed. As a result, we had to walk through crowds of people with 4 suitcases in an attempt get to the hotel; not something we wish to experience again! We eventually made it through to the hotel to find that there was nobody standing on the door to assist us. We struggled through the glass door with our cases whilst the 2 gentleman behind the reception didn’t move an inch to help. We felt that this was very rude given that we were clearly struggling. It was as if we didn’t exist, which is not how you want to feel upon arrival.The hotel is practically on Times Square but you don't experience any noise from the room at all. The rooms are small but adequate. As we were on the 2nd floor we heard a lot of noise from the bar on occasions, so we would recommend you ask for a room on a higher level. We were also placed right next to the cleaning cupboard and the cleaners insisted on slamming the door at 7am each morning which woke us up every day without fail. The room overall was very clean, which is the most important factor.As it was our first ever trip to New York (and in fact, to the United States) we wanted to book a helicopter tour, which Jonathan at reception kindly arranged for us within 5 minutes. We gave him a $10 tip for his helpfulness.The hotel is a 10 minute walk from Central Park, the Empire State Building, Rockefeller Centre, and Fifth Avenue shopping. We took the subway down to Battery Park one day which was extremely convenient. It cost around $2.50 each for a ticket, and we were there within 10 minutes! The subway station is conveniently located within Times Square; you can’t miss it. You simply cannot go wrong with this hotel given its location!We would recommend this hotel to others given its perfect location however, should we be lucky enough to return to NY, we wouldn’t stay here again given that there are so many hotels to choose from along Times Square.

What a wonderful place to stay very unique when you get use to the concept of there not being much natural if any day light . The staff bend over backwards for you to make you feel welcome , we had complimentary drinks at the bar after we returned from our evening out that hadn't been that successful, and during our stay 2 bottles of bubbly (on seperate nights)in our room for our anniversary, The room was clean and the bed really comfy.Reception staff were fantsatic nothing was ever to much trouble and all queries we had they found out, sorted, and delt with it quickly.Girls in the bar were chatty friendly and geuinely interested in your day or evening and good fun .We would stay here again but NYC is a big place with lots of interesting places to stay. But iwould be very temptedI want to name all the staff that were great but if im honest they all were and wouldn't be fair to name indiviuals .go stay there and enjoy it uniqueness

A hidden gem of a hotel! Central for Times Square and 5th Avenue. From the moment we arrived we recieved 1st class service. How nice it is to be acknowledged by name each time you enter the lobby.Our room (#66) was a perfect size - plenty of room for the shopping etc.and very peaceful considering how close you are to Times Square! The decor is very tasteful and the bed was super comfortable. Added bonus of having the turn down service each night and being given information about the following days weather.The staff were very attentive and nothing was a problem to them - why can't all hotels be like this? Patrick is an assett to this hotel. We received a bottle of bubbly in our room for our return on the first evening and thoroughly enjoyed it - thanksHighly recommend this hotelWe will be back!

What a wonderful place to stay very unique when you get use to the concept of there not being much natural if any day light . The staff bend over backwards for you to make you feel welcome , we had complimentary drinks at the bar after we returned from our evening out that hadn't been that successful, and during our stay 2 bottles of bubbly (on seperate nights)in our room for our anniversary, The room was clean and the bed really comfy.Reception staff were fantsatic nothing was ever to much trouble and all queries we had they found out, sorted, and delt with it quickly.Girls in the bar were chatty friendly and geuinely interested in your day or evening and good fun .We would stay here again but NYC is a big place with lots of interesting places to stay. But iwould be very temptedI want to name all the staff that were great but if im honest they all were and wouldn't be fair to name indiviuals .go stay there and enjoy it uniqueness

The Night Hotel is situated not even 3mins away from Times Square but is nevertheless very quiet once in your room...A lively bar downstairs and sympathetic staff at the reception, overall a good experience and good value for money when staying in NYC.The room are somewhat small but t seems it is what to be expecting when in NYC...No bedbugs, so don't worry about it and clean rooms overall.

I got this reservation as a daily deal, so I wasn't sure what we were getting for the money, but it turned out to be a fantastic deal. We were really pleasantly surprised by the size of our room and how quiet it was, especially considering the proximity to Times Square. The staff was great and of course, the location was fantastic. My friend and I will definitely try to stay here again.Things I liked that other folks might not: the fan/AC unit was loud (I love sleeping w/ white noise) and we had a little window that faced a narrow, dark alley (I loved this, too, as I was in the hotel to sleep, and went outside for the view, etc.).
user_name:
Rebecca C
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: Had a great time here. Rooms are a bit small, but what more do you need for 1 person? I stayed at the bar in the night hotel for most of the night. Beautiful young lady works there, and had a great time talking to her. Everything was clean. Bed was the most comfortable hotel bed i ever stayed in. only complaint would be the WiFi. It was horribly slow, and to pay 10$ for 24 hour wifi that is extremely slow is disappointing. Other than the WiFi, great place, friendly staff, and clean and comfortable room.

My wife & I had a great time at the Night! The desk staff both checking in & checking out were extremely friendly & professional. The location of the hotel is fantastic. We were a block away from Times Square & the Theatre District.Best of all, we were upgraded to a Penthouse Suite by the manager!Thanks for a great stay Night Hotel!

My girlfriend and I celebrated our anniversary and everything was great from start to finish. The staff was extremely helpful and attentive from the minute we walked through the door. We got a room upgrade with a fantastic balcony and complementary bottle service that made it even better. Highly recommended it for a romantic getaway.
user_name:
zdravivan1
New York City, New York

review_body: We had lovely staying ther but when we came back home, I found out they charge my card for the three night that we staed on the hotel and agine they hold more than 2400AED for no resones and it is not solved yet

From start to finish Night Hotel delivered in every aspect. Great staff, ambiance, and overall service. I stay at hotels frequently for work and I must say anytime I'm in NYC, Night Hotel will be my first choice! Night Hotel delivers modern standards of what a hotel should be.
user_name:
Nate C
Laguna Beach, California, United States

review_body: The location is great and that is about all. The hotel is tiny and the elevators are even smaller. The rooms are tiny almost feels like you are in a cubicle. The bathroom is very tiny and dirty and there is no fan or vent so steam from the shower fills up the whole room. No tub, doors are heavy and you hear them slam all day and night. Bar in lobby is tiny and overrated. Maid service does not vacuum or scrub toilets. Basically they just change your sheets and move your things around. Wake up calls are always 10-15 min late. The front desk man Patrick though is very kind and helpful and knows the best spots for a bite to eat or places to see. No iron in room either and you have to pay for expensive dry cleaning if you want clothes washed. Asked for a view of the city and instead got a view of a jack the ripper runned down alley. Stay far away from this place not worth the $$$$$!

The stay in this small Hotel was very nice. The staff is friendly and helpful. The Breakfast was ok. Only a small range of food.The dark design of this hotel was great and also the selection of furniture in the rooms!

Absolutely loved our recent stay at Night Hotel. Picked the hotel based on price and location. We arrived early in the morning and were able to leave our bags for the day, the staff also check to see if a room was available even though it was early in the morning. When we arrived later to check in the gave us a complimentary upgrade to the penthouse suite from the queen sized room we booked which was an awesome treat for us! The hotel was modern and funky, not for families but a great place for couples. Just feet from Time Square and lots of place to eat and shop near by. I would definitely go back again and I highly recommend Night Hotel to others.

Night hotel is probably best left to Goths who find the stimulation of Times Square at night irresistible. Furnishings and finishes are all in a black & white or Black & Beige pattern. The effect of which is to make the uncannily small rooms feel even smaller and slightly soiled. If you insist on staying here (Yes, Times Square is only like 1 block away), spend more and get a larger rooms. The small ones are too tiny to swing a cat. Bathroom (more black) had a shower that looked like it was assembled by Home Depot, except I doubt they carry all black finishes. Cheap black vinyl shower curtain, and nothing inside the shower to hold your toiletries. Not even a tiny ledge or shelf. Minibar is the annoying type that registers beverages as sold even if you just move them an inch. No business-type amenities like a kiosk or computer for printing boarding passes. Good luck with your stay at Night, if you insist on trying it. I'm in search of something a little brighter on my next NYC trip.

I could not recommend this hotel enough, perfect location 10 seconds from the centre of Times Square. The hotel itself has fantastic decor and a great atmosphere, the rooms are a decent size for NYC and presented really well. Nice touches like a small box of chocolates in the room for arrival, nightly turn down service with chocolates on the pillow and a weather report for the next day, makes you feel very special. The maid service was fantastic. Staff unbeleivably helpful and welcoming. I would definatley stay at this hotel again, it makes me want to try the sister hotels in New York, Stay and Dream.Also across the road from the hotel is a deli called Cranberry Cafe, the food is wonderful and reasonably priced, ideal for breakfast and lunch.

I stayed here on a discounted same day hotel service. Upon check in, she told me that I received an upgraded larger room. I cannot imagine a smaller room though. I had to squish past the fridge to get into the bathroom and I'm a petite person. Ive stayed in numerous hotels in nyc and this was by far the smallest. The bathroom was very dark and made getting ready in the morning difficult. Music blared in the hallway and could be heard in the room. Worst of all was the discovery in the morning that the window in room 25 leading to the fire escape was incapable of being locked. It had been unlocked when I went out the night before and all night. I Never would have stayed there if I had known. To it's credit it was clean, the bed comfy, and location excellent.
user_name:
Synchro12
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Amazing Hotel, location is perfect as it's in midtown of Manhattan. You can easily walk to anything. Staf was very friendly and helpful, breath taking decor, room was stuny and very clean. Just perfect for my first time in New York City.

I've stayed here twice so far, the first time I was upgraded to the Penthouse, which is exactly what a penthouse hotel room should be. The second time I stayed only one night but was again extremely impressed. Both times I was helped (and saved) by Patrick. After checkout I got about 10 blocks away and realized I managed to leave my bag in the lobby. No sooner than I could take my phone out I received a message that both the Doorman and Patrick had seen my bag and immediately placed it safely away until I arrived to grab it. May seem small but I've stayed at plenty of boutique and luxury hotels where the attitude and general vibe of the staff made me want to leave. Basically if you need a hotel and your anywhere near the Times Square area, stay here!!!

Stayed Superbowl weekend to celebrate my 10 year anniversary. Staff very friendly and helpful, and room was wonderfully decorated.Upon checkin, the front desk staff was very friendly and had a room for us quickly, even though we were early.The room was a little small, but didn't feel cramped. I am claustrophobic so was a little concerned. But when I saw the room I felt very relaxed. There was plenty of room to walk around the bed, and the bathroom was a nice size. At no time did I feel uncomfortable in the room. The elevator, however, was another story. It is very small and barely fits 4 people (tightly) at a time. I had to close my eyes and hold my breath when someone else was on it with me..The bar area was very dark and the seats are uncomfortable. If you need restaurant recommendations, make sure to ask. Over course of the time we were in NYC, asked front desk about specific types of food and were given great recommendations all within a few minutes walk from the hotel. The location is ideal if you want to do the tourist thing. It was a few minutes walk from either Times Sq or shopping on 5th Ave. Very close to all major subway lines. I also think this must be one of the cleanest hotels I've ever stayed in. My room was spotless, and we saw cleaning people in the hallways every time we were coming in/out of our room and in the elevator.If you feel concerned at all about this hotel, or have any questions, I would suggest you reach out the the management either by phone or email. Response I received was quick and very professional. Overall, this was a great hotel and I will definitely be back. However, be forewarned that this hotel is for couples. There are suggestive pictures on the walls, and a Karma Sutra in the bedside table. Definitely not a place for children.

we have just stayed there, 23 to 28 feb the room was really clean great showers every one was so helpfull patrick could not have done any more to make are stay amazing so close to time square.we would stay again in the blink of an eye. cool bar in the reception, with a really nice deli over the road two minutes from subway. All in all the best place to stay yours sincerely joby godolphin st ives cornwall england.
user_name:
joby g
St Ives, United Kingdom

review_body: I stayed at Night Hotel for 5 nights in February with my wife. The hotel is a boutique hotel with a slight adult theme. Its certainly more for couples than family. Low level lighting and risque photos are the decoration but it's never over the top and not embarassing, however I did find the bar a little pretentious but that's a purely subjective view and as it appeared busy it's clear not everyone shares my view.The hotel is ideally located for all the midtown Manhattan sights and shopping. Based on 45th, just off Times Square, it is mid way between the Empire State Building and Central Park. It's near enough the perfect location for dropping shopping back before heading out to a bar, and there are plenty within staggering distance, or to one of the many local restaurants.Rooms are of a size to be expected in New York but the room is well designed so it doesn't feel cluttered. The most important thing of any room is the bed and here the hotel excels. I found the large bed to be extremely comfortable. Furthermore the air condition unit was quiet and efficient meaning a comfortable temperature at all times. The bathroom, along with the rest of the room, was clean and the shower good. Staff were friendly and room service was efficient without problem.However there were one or two very minor issues that keeps it from getting a 5 star rating. The lack of wifi in the room is disappointing and the hotel's attitude to the mini bar is slightly aggresive. The prices are ridiculous (but if you're fool enough to use it then that's up to you), but there is an emphasis on a $50 restock charge if you use the fridge. Why? What is perishable in there and why put a fridge in there if you then discourage people from using it either with the prices or threats of a charge. A set of drawers would have been a better use of the space. Overall though it was a very pleasant stay in a great location, I'd definitely consider the hotel and recommend it to any couple looking for a well priced hotel in a fantastic city.

We stayed at the night hotel in February for 5 nights , the staff were helpfull and friendly from the minute we walked in. We were given a fantastic room on the 6th floor with plenty of space. No complaints of a small room here unlike some other reviews. It pays to ask in advance as the hotel happily emailed us back confirming our requests, and on arrival a complimentary bottle of champagne was delivered to our room as it was my boyfriends birthday. The rooms were spotless, beds were comfy and the shower was so good we wanted to take it home. The hotel is 2doors down from Starbucks, ideal for breakfast or when returning to the hotel with weary feet. You are also steps away from times square and ideally located to explore all that New York can offer. Even at checkout staff were still helpfull, airport transfer was arranged for $65 and lap top provided to check online and print boarding passes. No complaints will definitely be returning to New York and will definitely be returning to Night Hotel!!!

Stayed here in June 2011...very nice hotel. The rooms are small but it's equipped with everything you need. It was clean and modern and the staff was excellent. It was right in the heart of everything!

Fabulous location in NYC, professional and friendly staff, clean rooms, quiet (if on upper floor)...BUT my credit card was charged the full amt THE DAY AFTER I made the reservation (not on check-out). Wha?? My advice: read the very fine print. No refunds once you make the reservation. Thank goodness there were no weather problems. The hotel has very dim lighting -- to the point of being unsafe. And the rooms are so dark, it was difficult to put on makeup in the bathroom. Also, on my visit to the bar/restaurant on the first floor for a late dinner, I was required to present my credit card BEFORE my food was ordered. And they kept the credit card the entire time! Wha?? I'm a seasoned traveler US and abroad, and I've never experienced this level of weirdness or paranoia. I will have to think long and hard before going back.

We stayed (as part of our honeymoon) in this wonderful hotel which is perfectly located about 30 seconds from Time Square (to the left) and 6th Avenue (to the right). From start to finish all of the staff (especially Patrick Donnelly) were welcoming, helpful and accommodating. The hotel itself is modern, contemporary (call it what you will) but the height of black and white gothic New York cool.There are numerous eateries, deli's and bars for breakfast, lunch and dinner if you want to venture outside although given its sensational location the hotel was perfectly quiet; and this alongside the super comfortable bed and pillows and an awesome power shower made for a relaxing time when inside the hotel/ the room.As for all tourist trap sites (which we loved) such as Rockerfellar Centre, Central Park, Fifth Avenue, Grand Central Station, Empire state (and Magnolia Bakery!) etc all were within reasonable walking distance.In summary, this hotel was perfect for us in terms of style, location and everything else and we cannot recommend highly enough that you stay here!

I would have given this hotel 4 stars if the rooms were bigger and really, it should be given a 3.5 as is. By contrast, though I have not written about the NY Hilton, I would rate them only 3.5 as well being that I'm not a fan of the big chain hotels and having stayed at the NY Hilton many times. But while not the Ritz or Four Seasons, this hotel is great for the traveling salesperson looking for reliable wi-fi, a big screen tv, a clean decently appointed room (though small but average for NYC) all with a bit of flair. The staff were terrific, the chicken club sandwich from room service the best in the world - and I mean - I'd stay there again just for that sandwich. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for a family with small children but for teenagers and older, it would be fine. It is definitely good for someone who is in town for business but does not need to entertain in his hotel's lobby or business center. It's too boutique for that.

I stayed at the Night Hotel on Friday, February 10th to celebrate Valentine's Day a little early with my boyfriend. From the second we checked in, the staff at the hotel was super friendly and accommodating. Because I mentioned that I was celebrating Valentine's Day, the very nice gentleman at the front desk (I unfortunately did not catch his name) offered me two complimentary drink vouchers to use in the hotel's lounge. That was a nice touch that was much appreciated. The room itself, while small (as most rooms in NYC at this price range are), was very clean and chic. The bed was extremely comfortable. The hotel also provides wine glasses and a corkscrew in the room, which came in handy that night.After seeing a show, my boyfriend and I returned to the hotel's lounge to use our drink vouchers. While we didn't make it back in time to try the mac and cheese before the kitchen closed, the drinks we had were delicious.The next morning check out went smoothly, and the gentleman at the front desk I mentioned earlier remembered which show I said I was going to see the night before and chatted with me about it, which I think speaks to friendly dispositions of the hotel's staff. Overall, I had an excellent stay, and I'd certainly stay at the Night Hotel for another staycation.
We had a nice stay in NY in the Night Hotel, which is very convenient localled close to where things happen in NY.

Had 3 days in NYC to explore the city and visit sites. This hotel was in a perfect location one block off Times Square. The rooms were satisfactory size, very clean, and the beds were extremely comfortable. I would recommend the Night Hotel to people looking for a centrally located hotel that is clean, comfortable, and has a fun and unique atmosphere.
user_name:
Brett T
Atlanta, Georgia, United States

review_body: I am a young professional that goes to ny every so often for work. I prefer boutique hotels and when I was traveling a few years ago I did a search for boutique hotels in times square. The price was right so I tried night. After the first visit I loved it so much that I decided to stay there as mich as possible. The staff is friendly and really nice. On subsequent visits they remember you have been there previously and always welcome you back. Just a great welcoming experience. Room is cool and trendy. The beds are comfy. Everything is clean and just plain enjoyable.

Stayed here in January and was a little bit concerned as some of the reviews were a bit negative. Have to say I've no idea why, ok, you are in central NY, its bound to be a bit noisy from the street but this has got to be the best value quality property so close to Times Square, its got a sort of 'Sandersons' feel about it, friendly staff, nothing too much trouble, didn't find it noisy from inside the hotel and the rooms are a fair size for such a central location, would certainly stay here if visiting NY again.

Positive-Clean, easy to get to, close to Madison square garden, short walk to time square and surrounding area. Downside-Rooms were very small. hotel has no fitness facility. You had to pay I believe $15 to use another locations workout facility.

I can't say enough good things about this hotel. First, the location- perfect. Times Square to your left, 30 Rock/5th Avenue a short walk away. Second, the staff- incredibly friendly and helpful, genuinely happy to see you. Patrick at the front desk is wonderful! Third, the rooms- very clean, trendy, the beds are amazing. I booked the hotel for a group of 4 of us (in our 30's) traveling to NYC for a night and did so based on the photos, reviews and price. After staying there, I would not hesitate to book again. If you have a chance, check out restaurant Bond 45 just a few steps away from the hotel for dinner- fabulous food and service, homemade mozz!

Cool, hip hotel right by Time's Square - all black, black & white photos, some nudes, lots of tattoos. Funky room - sink wouldn't drain, toilet overflowed all over and soaked the rug, toilet water ran all night, and room doors slam and are very loud. But, for $150 and a cool location it's worth it.

Just back from my third or fourth stay at the Night Hotel and, once again, I enjoyed my stay very much. In fact, the friendly staff and extra care makes it feel as if I'm staying at my own pied a terre rather than hotel. At check-in they always acknowledge that I've stayed with them before which I greatly appreciate. Yes, the rooms are small - but, this is New York - all rooms are small. What they lack in size they double with interesting decor. The rooms are quiet and yes, dark, but perfect sleeping conditions as far as I am concerned. The rooms are clean, comfortable and the maids are so helpful. I've stayed here for both business and pleasure and both worked out well. It is funky, fun and fabulous. I'll be back soon. My best to Patrick and Michelle.

The main reason i chose this hotel was the pictures it looked amazing, which was a bit risky but the pictures did not do the hotel justice. It is really trendy and clean. Would reccomend it for couples or boys/girls holiday as it has that kind of feel to it but families would love it just as fine. This was my first trip to New York and the staff were amazing, friendly and really helpful. Always someone to greet us at the door and front desk with a warm welcome, chocolates and a weather report on the bed everyday. When we were checking out the front desk staff were really helpful with helping us check in on our flight and printing our ticket, Simon booked us a luxurious car to the airport we could not belive it! unfortunately i cannot remember everyones name but we met alot of the staff and they all were great. The location is literally a stone throw away from times square and close to subway stations and all the restaurants and shops you need. Unfortunately did not get to eat or drink at the bar but there was one night where it looked popular and a great place to mingle. Obviously everyone has different experiences but my one was the best, could not have had better! Would def reccommend it!

As a frequent traveler, often staying in many 4 & 5 star hotels I am accustomed to excellent service, excellent surroundings and superior treatment. On this trip into the city, I continued to find myself intrigued by this hotel which boast of being "sexy". I caved in and decided to try this "sexy" boutique hotel nestled within walking distance to 5th ave and the diamond district. I cannot stress this enough, from the moment I walked in, I was treated as though I was in a 5 star hotel, and the surroundings were sexy and lush..... from the provocative photos lining the walls, the deeply seated couch in the entrance, to the Frette towels and wrap around you like a glove bed. I loved it. So much so that on my next trip in, instead of booking at the Ritz, I will book here again. This is a 4 star hotel for the urban sensual hip crowd, be it in their 20's, 30's or 60's.... it's a hotel meant for those who enjoy quality but not over the top "showy" opulence. Everyone from the front desk staff, to the housekeeping and front door attendant made sure that my stay was first rate. My ONLY complaints would be that there is no chocolate in the mini bar ( a very sensual food) and that even with the do not disturb sign up someone knocked on my door to restock the mini bar of something that was still available in my mini bar (diet coke and a can of pringles, there were still several left) and that I had to have a bit of a mini argument through the door with the person trying to restock even though I had with intent placed the do not disturb sign on my door. LOL, they insisted in restocking, I insisted that I was naked. LOL. Other than that, perfection. If you are a traveler that understands true quality, sensual surroundings and understands the concept of sq footage in a major city ( lack of ) then this is THEE hotel for you to try.JGStayed 1/30-2/1/2012
the hotel is nice , front desk are very helpfull and friendly but the rooms are small overall it's really was a great experiences and i would love to stay in this hotel again and again

I have been doing research on which hotel to stay in on our first trip to NYC. I am planning a surprise 40th Birthday trip for my husband and was looking for a memorable hotel. I had already booked reservations at the Distrikt Hotel which received rave reviews, but I kept coming back to the Night Hotel for a more interesting and memorable experience. I called because Travelocity's website show a couple of different kinds of King rooms. I asked the front desk agent who lacked energy upon calling what the difference was and he said the reservations department would be better equipped to help me. The reservations personnal I was transferred to was very friendly, but she informed the front desk would be able to assist me better with this information. I was again transferred back to the gentleman that obviously could care less about securing business for this hotel. He was curt and not at all helpful. I did explain to him the Night just lost my business because he didn't appear to want to help me. The poor customer service gave me a bad first impression and now I will be sticking with the Distrikt. I hope this hotel selects better liasions for their guests first impression because the property definitely looks like a unique experience!

Stayed here with my with my wife for three nights earlier this month and would highly recommend it to anyone thinking of visiting New York. Most of the reviews here speak of the size of the rooms in this hotel and I can't but agree with them as the rooms are very small but I certainly wouldn't let that put you off. They rooms are beautifully decorated, funky, modern and spotless. Of a really high standard. To the rest of the hotel, the staff were excellently and hugely helpful. Without doubt though the thing that really stands out for this hotel is the location - it really doesn't get much better than this. It literally is on Times Square. Once you come out the front door of the hotel, you're in the middle of Times Square in less than a minute. You are also slap bang in the middle of Broadway's theatre district, there is even a theatre across the street. On top of this the streets all around here are full of great restaurants and bars which add to the appeal of this great hotel. Go book it. On New York itself, this was my first time and I LOVED IT - I will definitely be back and soon - hopefully.

I went to Manhattan last NYE and this hotel was great for the location right next to Times Square. However it was not useful to get inside Times Square in NYE. Great decor, it is modern and nice, everything looks new and clean. Service was excellent, professional and friendly. Decor in the room was also very nice.The room is very small, specially for a week stay, you almost have no closet and the bathroom is also very small, but I guess for Manhattan it is not that bad plus you are encouraged to go outside for a little space and I find that OK. The bed is a very comfortable, the AC a little noisy and the blue light in the cable box very bright, I had to cover it with some papers.Over all I definitely would recommend this hotel for a short stay, specially if location is in your interest.
hiwas there for 1 weekhotel service was excellent, great stuff willing to help about anythingcomfortable rooms, clean room and orginizedinternet speed is good

My daughter and I wanted to get away, so booked a weekend at the Night Hotel. Although the room was small, and what NYC hotel room is not, the hotel was great. My daughter is seventeen and loved the decor. We had room service one evening but the next night we grabbed food at this fabulous deli right across the street. Hotel location was great: the musical we were going to see was only a block and a half away and the hotel staff was very helpful.

The Night Hotel is in a great location a couple of minutes walk from Times Square. The rooms were of an adequate size for a short break. The decor is modern and black and white themed. The rooms are dark and could do with extra lighting. Great walk in shower in the bathroom and very comfortable bed.The staff at the the hotel were very pleasant and helpful and always happy and polite.There is a couple of Irish bars opposite the hotel which are very convenient and also a great deli which serves everything you could want.
It's a nice hotel. The location is good. I like the BLACK colour.
Very pleasant staff on front desk, Dianne was charming, the room was ok, why charge so much for a mini bar though? I would recommend this hotel, it's in. Perfect location

Really lovely hotel, but as other reviews said, dark throughout. Not a family hotel - the very sexual photos throughout the hotel make it a couples-type venue. My room, though small, was lovely, the bed was super comfortable, and the location for seeing theatre could not have been better - 45th, just east of Times Square made it central for running from play to play. Nice friendly desk staff (but not too friendly, just right for feeling comfortable and cared for). Note for the women: the dim "Mood" lighting in the standard rooms makes it extremely difficult to apply makeup and know what you look like...I ended up perching on the chair under the recessed ceiling light trying to actually see my face, and had to check when I got outside to make sure I hadn't applied blush like a clown. Other than that, a great experience.

Really modern hotel right on time square. Most hotels in nyc are small but this wasnt to small. The bathroom was nice and the staff were really friendly. They provide you with a map and there is always someone on reception if you need to ask for directions. There are some nice irish bars opposite the hotel with a good atmosphere. Time square is at the end of the road and has a busy atmosphere. Central park is a walk away but isnt to far and loads of shops on the main roads. Most things within walking distance and the subway is really close. The hotel is quite dark as there is not much lighting but this is the ambience of a boutique hotel, the beds are really comfortable.

When we first walked into this hotel, we loved it. It's dark, tastefully decorated in black and white and give off a trendt vibe. The front desk staff were friendly, but not overly so. When we walked in our room, it was about the size of my closet at home... not an exaggeration.... We booked a queen sized bed and were given a full....which was uncomfortable. the bathroom was spacious, but since the walls were black/dark gray, the light was horrible (actually the lighting throughout the room was horrible...perhaps they are keeping with the theme of their name "night")...The shower leaked all over the bathroom floor.. Overall, this was a good location, trendy... but too small to stay for more than one night (thankfully we moved on to a different hotel for the rest of our stay).
great location close to Time Square and subway stations. Good service and friendly staff.
user_name:
Winnie W
Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada

review_body: Well located for all touristy things, funky decor albeit our room felt a little dated, but great design and really comfortable. Great staff too, very helpful tips on restaurants and the door staff organised airport transportation which was well priced and on time. Would thoroughly recommend.

Especially, if you are going to NYC for the first time and want to be in the center of the crowd, you will have a lot of fun. The location is great (again if you like being at TS) The rooms are tiny but ok, the hotel is very hip and trendy. The decoration is great, the music is great. The staff is polite and helpful.

Wow! Completley fell in love wit this hotel. The decor is amazing, the staff were very helpfull. We stayed on a B&B basis and got a great deal. The breakfast was buffet and although it did not have a massive selection of food it was rather tasty. The hotel is located about a two minute walk from Time Square. Like all NY hotel room's the room's here are rather small. The room's were very clean. This hotel is a gem! I will be staying here on future visit's to NYC.

I have nothing but good things to say about the Night Hotel. The staff is extremely polite, friendly, and courteous; the rooms are immaculately clean and designed in an extremely sleek and aesthetically pleasing manner, and the location in the heart of midtown is absolutely phenomenal, especially when one considers the price. The only gripe anyone might have with this place is the size of the rooms, but while compact they're designed to maximize the space available and do so quite effectively. This is the perfect little spot for a romantic interlude with your significant other or even just for a a stress-free night's rest in the chaotic heart of NYC. I will most certainly return.
user_name:
NyBob85
New York City, New York

review_body: I had the pleasure of visiting my friends at this hotel last year and I was blown away by how amazing this hotel was! Even though I wasn't a guest, I knew from the second I walked in that this is the hotel I am next staying at! I have just booked my holiday to New York on the 16th February, staying at the Night Hotel to celebrate getting married and I can't wait. My colleagues at work regularly fly to New York and I have raved about this hotel to them since last year and already 6 of them have stayed there and they all loved it!!! (I should be their sales rep hahaha!!) Location and hotel are perfect, this is the only place you should be staying in NYC!!!!! See you in February!!!
Cool rooms and a great location. Great price for this time of year. Would stay here again!

We were about 120 yards from Times Square which was great. This also put us in walking distance of all the Broadway theaters. A short walk from 5th avenue window shopping, Rockefeller plaza, Grand Central Station, South side of Central Park (Zoo, horse carriage rides) and many more midtown attractions. There is also a great subway station about 250 yards away (south side of Times Square) that has many lines at it.The hotel was great, very clean. Due to the small rooms and strong sex/goth theme I would probably only recommend it for couples. We felt our room was very clean (besides a somewhat dingy copy of the Karma Sutra that was in the night stand drawer). On our way out we saw someone washing the walls in the hallway - further showing the hotel's emphasis on cleanliness. The rooms were black and white and I think the pictures do them justice. The lobby and hallways had many provocative pictures hanging on them some with nudity and some without.The staff was great. We wanted to see a show on short notice and since they charge for wifi ($10 per 24 hours) we didn't have online access. After getting recommendations from the staff we went to some of the box offices only to find they were sold out. We called back to our hotel and they were able to find tickets online (@ ticket master) and went ahead and purchased the tickets and slid them under our door so we could pick them up after dinner. They also included a complimentary bottle of champagne.We enjoyed the stay, the location was amazing, the price was reasonable and with the theme it was a hotel with a lot of character. Despite the sex/goth theme most of the guest looked like just normal tourist - like us.

we have been very satisfy by the quality of service and by the very good location of the hotel. Team was always very helpfull and available. Very romantic hotel and the location is just perfect for holidays in New York.

This hotel is simply amazing! The room is beautiful, we really loved the look of it. Really clean.The ambiance and the music in the looby is really good.The location is perfect, 2 minute walk from Times Square.Patrick and Michelle were really helpful. Patrick made a reservation for us in a sushis restaurant called Haru Sushis, really good restaurant!! Thahk you both for your help :)We will definitely come back again!

Stayed here for the night with my fiance. When he went to check in he was told that we were given a complimentary upgrade to the penthouse floor at no cost to us. Friendly and accommodating. Large room for an NYC hotel (we've stayed in many). Balcony over looking the city was amazing. The bed was so comfortable...it was extremely hard to get out of it in the AM. Perfect location. Wouldn't have changed a thing and will absolutely be back!!

Iv stayed in a lot of hotels during the past few years and i have to say this one wasn't bad at all. The room was everything that i expected and more. The staff was awesome and did everything they could to help me with anything i wanted, it was worth the money

The photos and reviews make this seem much better than it is. Let me first say, that the hotel is clean and comfortable - I don't have real complaints - but I also don't think it was special.The staff was warm and helpful and the decor is dark and sexy. The first room I was given had been forced open at one time - you could see the marks from the crow bar at the door and you could see into the room from the hall at the point of entry. I was moved to another room, which was supposed to be a queen. I am a big shopper, so I carry a tape measurer with me at all times - it was not a queen bed. There are also no full length mirrors in any of the rooms. The walls were not insulated, so I could hear the neighbor sliding hangers across the bar in the closet and anytime someone walked down the hall.The good points are the decor and service. The room was comfortable enough and pitch black, so sleeping was easy. It was more interesting than a generic chain hotel, but I don't think I'd spend the money to go back.

Recently spent four nights at the night hotel. I loved all four of them. The staff was very friendly and the maid did an excellent job keeping the room clean and left chocolates every night. A co-worker was staying at the Holiday Inn Express down the street and immediately regretted his decision to stay there when he saw the night hotel.The hotel is a block from Time Square and the hotel bar was nice. The rooms are a little small, but the decor makes you feel like a rock star. I especially loved the tricked out bathrooms. Also, I don't think I would recommend this hotel for families because there are abstract pictures of naked woman on each floor. I didn't notice them at first but a co-worker pointed them out during my stay.

This was one of those bookings where i was basically holding my breath until I arrived--expecting that the hotel would not match the pictures found on the web; however, MUCH to my DELIGHT, the pictures were completely accurate and the service was exceptional!! I took my partner there for her birthday and she absolutely loved it! It was very chic, modern and hip, with a superb hotel staff that made sure to give attention to all the little touches that really matter and make you want to come back...I was immediately impressed upon checking in, meeting Patrick behind the front desk, who was incredibly warm and went above and beyond his call of duty to make our stay a positive experience. For example, because it was my partner's birthday, he sent up complimentary champagne for us to toast. Even Simon, the gentleman assisting with our luggage, was incredibly helpful and kind, also exceeding our expectations. The location was fantastic--right in the heart of midtown--making it so easy to walk to so various theaters, restaurants and attractions. This was definitely a hotel that we plan to return to again and again!! Thank you!

It was my first stay in NYC and i couldn't have asked for a more amazing hotel. The decor when you walk in is amazing and the service was friendly but not too friendly. The room is small, but for the amount of time I spent in it, it was fine. The location was great - i arrived late Sunday evening so didn't step out until the Monday evening and it was a 2min walk away from Times Square. And a short distance to 5th Ave and the shops. I checked out Wednesday and my flight didn't leave until later that evening - they happily stored my bag for the duration of the day.They also gave a print out when the cleaner comes through to cover the weather and any touristy sites that I should be visiting. The only minor negative, is some of the paint in room was chipped. but given everything else was amazing it was easy to overlook.Overall a great stay and I am planning to stay there again next year.

Do not know how anyone could not have the time of their lives staying at the Night! Our expectations for a New York hotel are clean, conveniently located, courteous and unique. The Night hotel exceeded our expectations! Our room was properly made up minutes after we left each morning and seen to again late afternoon or early evening when we were out. The staff from the doormen, concierge, front desk and maid service were helpful, polite, friendly and competent. The room could be considered small, but attention was paid to the layout so as long as you are organized you have more than enough room. I have read reviews about the lighting, but we felt it suited the ambiance of the hotel and I personally hate bright lighting. The price for the location and service was amazing. Literally half a block from Times Square and Theater road. About a 10 minute walk to either Macy's or Central Park. We didn't try room service or the bar food (the drinks at the bar were tasty and reasonably priced) as there are three Irish pubs and two delis right across the street, not to mention your choice of what seems like a million restaurants in a three block radius. We plan to book up here again and again for our yearly New York getaway!

As a regular visitor annually to NYC over the thanksgiving weekend with the girls for our shopping-i am seasoned to NYC accomodation / rooms-however i was blown away by the friendly staff, ambience, decor (i am a interior designer), theme and room sizes and will not hesitate to recommend (already have and one of the friends is booked-Nyears). I much prefer a one on one boutique service/ stay rather than the impersonal chain of hotels and cannot emphasis / praise Night or it's team as they made a great long weekend, fabulous. The best way to experience NYC is to get out and about and visit one of its many deli's, restuarants, bars, clubs and sights so dont expect all that to come to you. Fab location yards from TSquare and 2 blocks from 5th, quiet, sexy as hell and a great location/ hotel for a couple/ group of girls/ or a stay with mum-if you want Hilton srvices go to the Hilton-Really guys this hotel has it all going on and $ wise was cheaper than most i have stayed in-NYC rooms are pricey but you get what you pay for-Love it, and booked for going back. Dont be swayed by some of the tripadvisor comments i wasnt and we were rewarded. a gem of a hotel in a priceless location no more i can say really!

I was disappointed by the room service availability. We went to a show Friday night and by the time we got back around midnight we were told the kitchen had closed at 11:00 PM. The next morning we wanted to order in breakfast but were told that the kitchen does not open until 5:00 PM! The limited room service is not conducive to spending a lot of time in the room. Luckily, there is a Starbucks a few doors down the street and many restaurants within walking distance. I should also mention that there is not really a restaurant at the hotel. What they call a restaurant is really getting food in bar.Staff was great. Room was great. Wife thought the lighting in the bathroom could have been brighter as the floor to ceiling tile is black.Also, there is construction underway across the street but it was not disruptive.

myself and my friend are back about a week from new york and i thought that it was convenient to everything. i agree that the hotel is dear for its location and we stayed just bed only. i think that tea and coffee should be provided free in the rooms. the staff were extremely friendly and very helpful. will book again next time i go. ..........brilliant
The hotel has a designed very nice for me. The people was very nice , and the attention too. The hotel is in the center. I liked it.
Beautiful boutique hotel near Times Square. Sexy as hell! We didn't want to leave. Perfect accommodation for a romantic getaway. Contemporary, chic decor. Hip service.

I live a couple hours north of Manhattan and come into the City as frequently as I can; this was my first stay at Night, I have stayed at Dream (a sister property) which I also recommend. The staff are professional and friendly, we left a car curbside for the valet who was efficient and timely both with drop off and pick-up. The lobby and general ambiance of the hotel, dimly lit, white leather, staff dressed in well fitted all black apparel, I very much enjoyed the vibe. It is suggestive and depending on your mindset it may not be your cup, but I enjoyed it. Not at all seedy, it's clean, stylish and sophistocated. We stayed in Room 90, the penthouse, two floors, the entry floor has a modern decor and plenty of seating, a large TV with a fantasic sound system and great outdoor balcony. There is a small powder room and well stocked minibar. The bedroom and a full bathroom on the second level up a austere marble and glass staircase. My husband wasn't a fan of the round bed - he's a little tall and his feet hung off the edge, but I found it just as comfortable as a standard king, soft linens and pillows. Pocket doors separate the bedroom from the dressing room and a second pocket door allows for privacy in the bathroom. There were plenty of towles, and the robes were soft and warm. Double pedistle sinks were a welcome feature of the bathroom and we had plenty of room to ready for the evening without any difficulty, at all. I was positively thrilled with the balcony off the bedroom. We grabbed a quick bite to eat at the restaurant next door at the recommendation of the doorman, it was very good. Starbucks and another coffee shop are also adjacent/1 door down in the opposite direction. As far as a location - if you're looking for a property in the Time Square area - you can't beat it!I don't have a single complaint, I did find the elevators rather small - but given that this is a small property - it wasn't overly problematic. Really - and this isn't a complaint - I wish we could have stayed longer.I have nothing but compliments for this hotel and the staff. We will see you again, Night...

What a great hotel… Never before have I stayed in a fun, hip, themed boutique hotel with such a personable, friendly, and proficient staff. The vibe is fantastic- very cool décor and monochromatic furniture paired with suggestive photographic art- such a welcome counterbalance to the giant neighboring mega-hotels in Times Square. Whatever tier of management is “setting the tone” with this property, is doing a stellar job. Everyone from the doorman to the front desk staff to housekeeping seemed genuinely happy to see you at the hotel. I wish I could have stayed longer!
user_name:
Richard N
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We booked the Duplex Penthouse Suite with the previous General Manager and originally planned to stay for 11 nights but we extended our trip, and stayed for 16 nights instead.Evening 1 Arrived at 12:30am to the suite which had not been made up. I arrived to DIRTY sheets, curtains that wouldn't close, no shower gel, no snacks at the mini bar, no complimentary bottled water, the bathroom tiles had grout all over them, chips in the furniture, patches of paint peeling from the walls, stains on the carpeting and scratches on the floor.I called down to reception and asked for help, and an older man (I think his name was Dickson) was sent up. He giggled and told me that he wasn't going to change any sheets and that he didn't even know how. He also told me that he couldn't help me close the curtains. The person at the front desk (I think his name was Raymond) then came up with some sheets and changed them himself. When he left, I realised that he had not brought a duvet cover. I was too tired to call down again, so that night I slept without one, getting woken up every now and again from the incredible noise that the air-conditioning makes.Day 2I woke up feeling hungry and having no snacks in the room, I called down to ask if there was any room service available. The person told me "no" and that I could go across the road and get myself some breakfast at the Cranberry Deli. I later found out that there IS room service, just not at the time that I had asked. I also asked again for the curtains to be closed. Day 3The bathroom skylight started to leak. I called reception (again) to tell them about it, as well as to ask for the curtains to be closed (for the 3rd time) as there is a gym in the next block that looks straight in at the bed and the wardrobe area. There was also still no shower gel and the towels looked old and some were frayed. The skylight was fixed promptly, and the curtains finally got fixed, thanks to Michelle from Front Office, watching over it all. And therein lies the Night(mare) hotel's only saving grace. The staff ARE friendly and they DO try to help. But that's it. They can only "try". I spoke to the General Manager, Karla [--] and got some apologies and was offered a couple of hundred bucks off the rate I was originally quoted for those first 2 nights, free internet for more than the normal 1 device and some complimentary snacks, drinks and gym passes.Day 4My husband arrived to join me. I had informed Raymond on my arrival that my husband would be joining me on the 20th and that I would like for him to be registered as a guest. This was not done and when my husband arrived, the person at reception, Jonathan, was objectionable and didn't even offer to have someone help him with his bags. Not wanting to deal with this treatment, my husband decided to carry his large bag up the stairs himself. My husband also called down to ask for a DVD player before we went out for the day, as it was stated in the guestbook that they were available on request. When we got back to the room, there was a DVD player, just left by the TV, not connected. So, we had to call down to ask for someone to come and connect it. And after it was connected, we couldn't watch any TV; only DVDs.This type of service continued for the rest of the trip:- the bartender at the bar gave me a bucket of ice and a bottle of wine, to bring up myself, when I ordered it for the room. I carried it to the lift then returned to tell him it was too cold and heavy for me to bring up myself.- another bartender had to refer to a piece of paper to figure out how to make the drinks on the menu. And when we got those drinks, they were terrible and not drinkable.- the bedroom slippers are sized small. My husband had to walk around the room in socks as the slippers were too small.- the reception button on the phone stopped working, and when we went down to tell the Front Desk that it wasn't working, we were told that we should've dialed "0" - as if it was a well known fact.- then the message button on the phone also didn't work, so we couldn't retrieve any messages from the phone.- when we extended our stay, we checked with Lewis at reception if our room would be available for the rest of our stay and he said "yes". We proceeded to change our flight, paying extra to make the changes, and when we informed the front desk that we were confirming the extension, we were told that the room was not available. We managed to stay a few extra days, thanks to the intervention of the General Manager, then we left for the Waldorf. When a service-based establishment cuts corners, it is always obvious to the customer, as they are the ones who are left with a bad experience and inconvenience. The Night hotel needs to invest more in both the hotel and their staff. There are some good employees like, Patrick, Michelle, the maintenance guy who came to fix the leak, etc. But if there is always a high turnover of staff, particularly at the senior (GM) level, there won't be any follow through with systems and processes. And that's when the ball gets dropped. In a conversation with one of the staff, this is what I said, "Don't apologise. I'm tired of hearing "I'm sorry". Saying "sorry" doesn't change the fact that I'm the one that's being inconvenienced. You need to fix this; not just say sorry and leave me to fix a mistake made by one of YOUR staff."Coming from a long-ish stay guest in their Penthouse Suite, I think I can safely say that I doubt we'll return.

It's a really stylish hotel, but I hated my stay. For a hotel named "Night" it was really weird that the room service didn't work at... NIGHT.There's nothing offered as a courtesy (some other NY hotels do this), and I paid an absurd account of $ 193 for international calls which together numbered not half hours, and when I complained the clerk told me that they warn guests that they should use a phone card if you do not want to pay this...And no, I was not warned about it.The elevator always takes too long to arrive, and I hired a wi-fi service to my room that just did not work.It is a really stylish hotel, but it turned into a nightmare.
user_name:
Beatriz M
Rio de Janeiro, RJ

review_body: I really recommend this hotel. I stayed 2 nights and I had a really great time. The personnel are really helpful and welcoming.The room was very nice and clean as it is on the pictures of the web site.It's on a great location, just a min walking distance from times square!! So it's perfect if you are on vacation or even on business that you don't have so much time to enjoy NY because fun it's right next to you!I will definitely go back to this hotel on my next trip to NY!

We stayed at the Night Hotel for 10 nights in October 2011 and loved every minute!! The hotel is very modern and uniquely different to any hotel I have stayed at in the past. Close to everything, which made our first trip to New York so much more enjoyable and easier. The location is so convenient! All the staff were excellent, particularly Daniela, who bent over backwards to organise various tickets for us. She was amazing! Beds very comfortable. The mini-bar situation I agree was a little odd, but doesnt detract from the overall experience. I highly reccommend, and would definitely stay there again without hesitation.

Very cool mid-town setting with an upscale design at affordable prices. We recently stayed at the Night Hotel and we thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The room prices are very reasonable considering the product: on the small side but nicely appointed with very comfortable beds. The service is always friendly, efficient and helpful. As for location, proximity to Times Square can be interesting. The only downside: industrial strength heating/cooling systems in the rooms can be very noisy. Otherwise it's a perfect spot for a short business trip in the center of the city, or for a long weekend near the theater district.Stayed October 2011
user_name:
RowanBenecke
New York City, New York

review_body: 2 Aussies travelling to NYC and I researched this funky hotel thoroughly before we left. I am a travel agent in Australia so was also looking to recommend it to my clients. I would say the staff are great, friendly and bent over backwards to help with anything from directions to Grid Iron football tickets. Thanks to Patrick, Daniele and Diana for being very helpful and attentive.The rooms are great, not too dark (as some reviewers mentioned previously), I was almost not expecting windows! But sure enough, there was natural light to be had albeit without a view, but this wasn't expected in NY anyway. Sure the rooms weren't massive, but that's not expected in NY either. I will say that the hotel was a little pricey, but the location brilliant. Just 1 block and you're standing in Times Square. The hotel is a great base to explore NYC, close to subway, shopping, major sights, Broadway and 2 great little Deli cafes across the road for breakfast or late night munches. The WiFi really should be included though, the a/c a little loud and not being able to use the mini bar fridge is a bit odd also. But the shower was big and the decor and entertainment systems great.All in all I would recommend this hotel to my clients when booking them from Australia. A clean, classy, friendly and well located hotel.
I had a surprise I was updated to a pent house st. It was very clean and large. Front desk leafy was very helpful, and welcoming. Location 1 min walk to timesq Will go there again Very funky decore

Just checked out this morning from this lovely little hotel. Firstly thank you to Patrick who was just brilliant on the desk. Lots of reviews on here talk about the rooms being dark, I expected to have to walk around with a miners helmet on!!! Not at all, yes it's not the brightest of rooms but in no way was it a hindrance! No problem at all getting my make up on as some people have complained about!The bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in!The robe was superb to use after having a lovely shower. The position of the hotel on Times Square was perfect. The only downside was the noise level on Saturday night. Was told music would end about 1 but actually it got louder and went on til about half 2! But still it was onlyOne night. Just like to thank everyone at Night Hotel for making our first trip to New York a great one. Would defiantly stay here again.

This was my first solo trip to New York city being i just turned 21, I flew in red eye got to the hotel around 8am, they let me check my bags and said it would be ready around 1. I walked around for awhile but have seen everything before I went to lounge in the lobby. The door man was very nice Simon was his name i think, he made the hotel for me. He was great at helping everyone with a nice smile, So it gave the hotel its extra bonus. After waiting in the lobby like a zombie they let me buy internet for $10.00, personally i think it should be free but hey. My bed was very comfy however the air condtiotner is very loud and for some reason won't go below 72 even if you set it low. So if you are a light sleeper i would ask them about your specific AC. Other then that everything was great nice and dark for sleeping,good front people and nice staff. I would recommend it to anyone and would love to come back again.

Excellent boutique experience very close to the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Broadway, and around the corner from subways that can take you anywhere you want to go. Super small space, but that's to be expected in NYC. Loved the decor, and the colour scheme (or, lack thereof) with a mostly black-and-white, gothic-inspired vibe. Wasn't too pricey either - check out their site for discount offers. Only snag was we had dirty towels in our bathroom. The service staff exchanged them for us quickly.
