Very pleasant hotel. Very good location. Excelent cleaning. It is not acceptable to have a surcharge for internet access in the room.Wrong and poor information was given at the hotel reception regarding some city attractions.

Check- in was a quick the guy at the front desk was helpful.The room was very nice, clean and comfortble. The location is great 1/2 block away from Time Square. The staff at the front desk were all very friendly, I even got a 15% off card went i check-out. I really enjoy my staying and i would strongly recommend this nice Gothic Hotel.

We have stayed at many fine NYC properties, and in selecting to stay at Night for my husband's birthday, we wanted something different. We were aware of the "night" theme and fully researched the hotel prior to making our one night reservation. We knew the rooms were on the smallish side, expected them to be dark, etc. We are also accustomed to the pleasant "quirks" of small boutique hotels. With this in mind, I requested a room on a high floor, and away from the elevator. Upon check in, I was dismayed to discover that we would be on the 4th floor and near the very noisy elevator. No options to change as they were fully booked. Ok. It was only for one night, we figured, no big deal. What we did not expect was a room so tiny, had we come with even a small carry on, there would be no place to put it. We did not expect a bathroom shelf outlined by rust, and a black shower with a filthy floor and dirty walls. When keeping with the "black" theme the staff should note that black attracts dirt, powder, etc. and make every effort to keep these areas clean. Someone noted that the honeycomb pattern of the tiles collected white "gunk" (my word) and man that was an understatement. We also had no bathrobe, or even glasses in the bathroom. All in all, for us, the funk did not compensate for the lack of attention to cleanliness. To add insult to injury, we were waken at 3 am by another loud guest banging on hallway doors. When a call to the front desk went unanswered, we decided to call it a wash, and checked out in the morning wishing we had stayed elsewhere. Such a shame.

This is the best location you can get! We upgraded to king size beds and had nice rooms witch was big enough. The staff were friendly and helpful. Two things that could have been better: 1. More light in the bathroom. My girlfriend prefer better light for doing her make-up :) 2. Wifi Internet should be for free in 2011 on every hotel! It costs 10 dollar for 24 hours.We recommend this hotel!!

Great hotel! Romantic setting where everything is black and white and dimly lit. One block from all the theaters, restaurant row, times square.. Short walk to rockerfeller center and tons of shopping.. Bryant Park is also in walking distance. We booked the party all night package because the 3pm check-out was intriguing. We got in at 12pm and check in was at 3pm. They had our room available..we were upgraded to the PENTHOUSE!!!! We had a balcony with lounge chairs and a decent size room with dressing area and large bathroom. The bed was amazing, down featherbed, perfect down pillows! I gave it an overall 4 because there was a downside. The walls are thin and our neighbors were obnoxious so we heard way too much when they came in at 3am. Also the shower is odd. There is a drain in the center of the bathroom and no separation between the shower and the main part of the bathroom...so when you take a shower EVERYTHING on the floor gets soaked! You can't blow dry your hair in there because it is hazardous! The restaurant/bar area is very nice, but completely dead.. Our package came with a $50 bar credit so we felt compelled to have a couple drinks.We went for our anniversary and they sent a bottle of champagne up! The staff was incredible! Everyone from the front desk to the doorman, to the maids to the bartender They were very accommodating and sweet!

I booked our stay online and as with most hotels you expect some level of overselling in the pictures etc. but upon arriving at the Night Hotel, I don't believe we were undersold in the least. The Night Hotel delivered exactly what we expected.We were greeted by Patrick and Diana at the front desk and they were nothing but warm, genuine and friendly, and not in a fake sense. The bellman whose name I never did get was just as wonderful and always felt as if they would go out of their way to fulfill a request.Patrick did suggest some good places to eat which we did wander down onto 9th street and enjoyed one of our best meals while in NYC, which without his suggestion we may have missed.The bed was one of the more comfortable beds we stayed in (we stayed in 4 different hotels on our trip to enjoy all of the areas on NYC) and loved the feel and decor of the rooms. We felt the darkness helped us stay in bed once the sun did come up. We stayed on the 5th floor on the back side of the hotel and did not once notice the construction happening whatsoever from our room. The turn down chocolates were a nice little treat as well.The location was good, not too far from Times Square and we did walk to Grand Central with no problems at all. We never did end up spending any time in the restaurant of lounge as the city has so much too offer and experience.I would stay here again in a heartbeat.
user_location: Maple Ridge District Municipality, British Columbia, Canada
user_name:
Melissa D
Maple Ridge District Municipality, British Columbia, Canada

review_body: I loved the dark room and the white bed which was really comfortable. The only thing that was strange (in our opinion) are the tv screens in the hallways. The roomCheck-in at midnight was really prompt and people were nice and friendly. Good location, about 50 steps from Time Square (next to the Swatch store).I would go back again anytime!

My husband and I stayed here for 10 nights in September and we must say that we were very happy with the hotel and enjoyed our stay.The location was perfect, Times Square and Broadway to the left and Avenue of Americas to the right. We ate breakfast every morning at Bond 45, which is a nice diner, where you may see a celebrity just a couple of doors down. A short walk to 5th Ave, Madison Ave, Bryant Park, The Rockerfellar Centre and we even walked to Central Park. We didn't even have to use the Subway or catch a taxi unless we were visiting Soho and the downtown areas of NY.A very sexy and stylish boutique hotel! Rooms are nicely furnished and very clean with a sophisticated Gothic theme. The lighting was dimmed and added ambiance to the room, although I feel as though I needed an extra light in the bathroom, especially when putting on my makeup. Small, every hotel would be and remember you are in New York and you are just there to sleep as there is so much to see. The lobby is gorgeous, very cool concept. The staff kept to themselves but were always polite and helpful when we needed something and housekeeping always left us chocolates and a print out with the weather for the next day.I will definitely be recommending this hotel to all my friends and family that visit New York in the future and may even come back to stay myself one day.

Check-in was prompt. Staff at the hotel could have been alot friendlier instead of putting on an act that they were friendly, weren't sincere at all and just so over their jobs. The only staff that was nice was a girl named Danielle.It was only 2 minutes walk away from Times Square and the Broadway theatres were on the same street jut 5 minutes walk away or a couple blocks. This hotel is right off Times Square where all the action is!The room's decor was very nice, but the lighting in the room and bathroom could have been alot brighter as it was neither bright or dark making it hard for your eyes to adjust and put make up on etc.The room's air-conditioner was so noisy it made it impossible to sleep. It was clean though with bathroom amenities. There was a fridge provided but it was equipped with bar facilities.The flat screen was pretty big, NO free wi-fi, weather report for the week provided, complimentary hershey kisses chocolates everytime they clean your room and black bath robes provided.If the price was right I would stay here again due to the fact it was very clean and comfortable with the perfect location!

Just arrived back from my trip to the Big Apple and had a great time, this hotel just made it even better! Friendly staff and awesome location.thanks to my partner who chose this cozy and fabulous find! Neighborhood was great, perfect for quick get away! Outside area was a bit noisy from construction.( ask for high floor) but hey it is New York.!We loved the whole black and white vibe-so sexy! But cozy as well. Can't wait to come back and see the friendly and helpful staff again! P.S. Thanks Patrick at the front desk!

I may be a bit tough only giving the Night hotel a 3 because I didn’t get a lot of sleep which was probably due to jet lag more than anything else but that is my memory of the place. The rooms are small which is to be expected in New York and I loved the dark theme although there are times that you need some light in your life! Unfortunately don’t expect a view unless a brick wall and an alley is your thing. The staff at check in were good especially a young guy who was a trainee who was very enthusiastic (I am sorry I can’t recall his name) but others were not overly friendly without being rude. The positive is the location which is very central and easy walking distance to everything you need to get there and despite its centrality it is very quite.

We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, having chosen it over many others for it's location and intriguing design. The decor is interesting, although the rooms are too dark. It was very difficult to put makeup on or even get dressed. We booked a King room and asked to be away from the elevator as we'd read a review indicating it's noisy near the elevator at night. We were put in a good-sized room facing the street, which was incredibly noisy, especially with the team of about 100 construction workers across the road that start work at 6:00am. So we awakened daily at 6:00 with steel bars being dropped, hammering and other annoying building noise. Traffic and pedestrians were very loud, too, much of the night. The bed was comfortable with good quality bedding and a feather mattress pad. Having a bad back, my husband did not sleep well... nor did I with bursitis in my hip. A firm mattress would have been much more appreciated. As would sheets that stayed on the mattress. The washroom was small and without a tub. After all the walking in the Big Apple, it would have been great to be able to soak our aching bones and feet in a tub, but the shower was good and worked well.The lounge at the back of the main floor was also incredibly loud, blaring "disco" or dance music most of the time. And the walls in the rooms are paper thin, so conversations in the hallway sounded like they were in our room. One such conversation woke me up before 6:00, before the construction team startedThe staff were mostly very friendly, especially the concierge/porter and some of the front desk staff. I had specifically requested a quiet, special room as we were in New York to celebrate my husband's birthday. The manager had promised to put us in a larger room away from the elevator, which she did. However, it was not at all quiet. She had also said that the hotel would greet my husband with a complimentary bottle of champagne, which never did appear. Not that I'd ever expected such a gift, I was somewhat embarrassed as I'd made the mistake of sharing the email with my husband. The nightly chocolates on our pillow and when we arrived were his treat; a nice touch nonetheless, as with many hotels in NYC.The rate was discounted, but substantially higher than some of the specials offered for other nice boutique and chain hotels we've stayed at in the past in Manhattan, so overall we were a disappointed. The walk to the subway took us through Times Square each time. Many other hotels we've stayed at are a bit closer to transit. Would we go back? I'm not sure. It would depend on rates and if the hotel offered the best price... and a guarantee to be somewhere away from the elevator and towards the back of the hotel.

We stayed in this hotel for one night as a treat having stayed in NYC for a few days. The room was fab, if a bit small (as expected for a hotel in NYC), most importantly it was very, very clean. The location is fantastic, just off Times Sq and the lobby/interior is like something out of a Batman movie.. in a good way! A really unusual hotel, chic and modern. I'd definitely recommend as long as you get a good deal!

Excellent costumer service.. The front desk people were amazing at helping out, but the only problem was that they didn't clean our room :/ besides that it was awesome! The whole night/gothic theme was super cool

I thought the hotel was great and Patrick the front desk agent was really cool. He comped me two drink tickets because the it took a little longer than normal to check in. I was impressed with every aspect of the hotel and the staff and would definitely recommend it to others and stay again.

my wife & I stayed at this hotel recently for 5 nights. It was extremely dissapointing. The location is very good, that is about it for this hotel. The rooms are so dark my wife struggled to put on her makeup etc. We returned to the hotel late one night & the door to our room was broken & we couldn't get in. We were put in another room for the night, with nothing but the clothes we had on. I did ask for tooth brushes & thankfully these were arranged, but that was it. We asked for an address for a restuarant & were sent to completely the wrong place. We asked for a car to be arranged to take us to JFK, this too was screwed up. There is one small lift to service the whole hotel. That gets very tiresome after a few days. The doormen seem to sit on the couch most of the day rather than assist with taxis, bags etc. We won't be returning.

This place is classy, and the attention to detail is excellent. Coolest robes of any hotel I've stayed in. Patrick, the front desk guy, is (As other reviews mention) totally excellent. When the DVD player wasn't available, he sent us a complimentary bottle of champagne and a chess set to use during our stay. The rooms are small, to be sure, but well designed, and overall a very cool hotel.
I stayed for one night. I loved this hotel. The ambience is great. And I have to say, the front desk person, Patrick, was totally cool, wonderful and caring.
user_name:
Bradley C
New York City, New York

review_body: The front desks greeted us very warmly, asked if we needed our bags taken up for us and valet our car. Once we got up to our room it was very nice. We had a queen bed and the room was surprisingly not as small as I had anticipated. I had read a few posts about the room being too dark but I didn’t find that to be the case. The bed was very comfortable and fluffy. The bathroom was small but clean. There was a little rust on the ledge above the sink but it looked like there had been a clear adhesive laid on top of the metal so it wouldn’t touch the products or wash cloths. The next day we checked out at 10 am and wanted to walk around a little more so the front desk held our luggage for us so we wouldn’t have to move our car. All in all the hotel was very accommodating but pricey, but I guess that’s the going rate for a room so close to times square.

We usually stay at the Roommate Grace Hotel on West 45th Street, but it was full for Labor Day weekend. So we chose the Night Hotel. which is almost right across the street. We liked almost everything about the Night. The room was a nice size with a fantastic decor. The bathroom was very nice with a good shower. My only quibble was with the "closet." While one one hand, I admire the ingenuity, it leaves a bit to be desired. What they have done is attach a coat rack to the top of their minibar fridge. It is a clever use of space, but it fails on some counts. First, the distance from the hanger bar to the top of the fridge is too short for most dresses and pants on clipped hanger. Since they provide no normal pants hangers, this point is crucial. And the mirror on the back of this contraption is useless since it is obscured by the hanging clothes. They would serve their guests far better by simply installing a hanger bar on the wall in that same corner and putting a shorter fridge under it. Then a full-length mirror on the wall by the bathroom door would make sense. But, this hiccup did little to detract from our very enjoyable stay at the Night. With a Starbucks just a few doors away, breakfast is easy. The service in the hotel is excellent, and the decor of the lobby is sexy and hip. It is an easy walk to theaters, subway stations, and shopping. You cannot beat the location. I highly recommend the Night, and we gladly would go back.

To start off the review, I would say the hotel is expensive for what we get from it. I mean there is nothing special about this place except location. other than that its pretty much like any 3 star hotel. there is rust in the bathroom shelf. no spcae for clothes in the closet. no enough light in the room. no view or sun light in the morning. OH and you can hear everything going on in the corridor when ever your in the room. It is so rude that even the housekeepers are very loud in the morning, i mean what if i wanna sleep till afternoon, that doesnt mean that you have to go banging and shouting in the corridors when they are suppose to be all quite and caring for the guests. and why on eath do they play music in the corridors when it hits 8am??!!! we were charged between 400 to 450 a night (everyday was a different rate) and we didnt eve have breakfast with it. its def. not worth all the money

Overall, enjoyed our stay at night hotel - all previous reviews gave ample warning about the size and the dimness, but overall it was great.TIP: Register for Wyhdam rewards to get free wifi for your stay!The rooms are VERY small - with a Queen bed we each fit our carry-on suitcases on the side of our bed and that was about all it could handle. The 'closet' fit about 4 items and a pair of shoes so don't count on keeping the room neat and organized! The 'desk' was a nice-looking but impractical setup with a stool and very little space to even lay things on. The bathroom was less than ideal - the metal vanity shelf had visible rust that made me uncomfortable using the facecloths that were folded on it. I also didn't feel comfortable putting my toothbrush or anything like that on the shelf, which meant I had to either leave it on the very small sink area (and be splashed when washing hands) or, as I did in the end, stuck it in the pocket of my partners toiletry bag, because mine didn't fit anywhere.Ladies, this hotel is a nightmare for getting ready to go out. I don't spend too long on makeup and don't consider myself too high maintenance but felt even the little bit that I do was challenged by lack of counter space and ridiculously low lighting. In every part of the room. I would have given up the lights under the bed for a makeup light or anything else. I couldn't see anything!!Finally, the bathroom had a very strong mold smell - couldn't attribute it to the shower curtain but it really bothered me. The all black tiles in the bathroom also showed a white honeycomb pattern after the shower that made me a little grossed out - its probably normal and just unseen on the traditional white/neutral tiles so I blame design in this case.Finally, while I found the staff at the front desk to be very warm and charming, the bar staff seemed quite abrupt and inconvenienced by our presence. On the first day while waiting to check-in I wandered around and someone in the lounge just stared after me, no greeting, no acknowledgement, just a bored look.We actually became engaged while on this trip and when we went down to the bar to celebrate after the proposal with a drink around 12:30am, there were a few people near the bar section so we moved into the lounge to sit at a table. Then a women called out in a really abrupt tone "uh, we're closed" (I don't know how to indicate the 'duh' undertone she had in her voice') There was no apology, no smile, more of a "what on earth gave you the impression we are a functioning establishment in the middle of NYC". My guess is that there wasn't a lot of traffic as it was a wednesday and the staff decided to close early. Which would have been fine - it really was the tone that absolutely ruined our mood and made us feel kind of stupid, like we walked into a private party and were stupid tourists who didn't know how things worked. Looking back, I'm both embarrassed, disappointed, and a little annoyed at that one simple evening. (Totally recognizing that may be disproportionately focusing on this because it was a big night but still.) My fiance was really disappointed because with the rain and everything we didn't feel like venturing out just for a single celebratory drink. So I would sum this hotel up as a great home base with a little bit of attitude - part of which works in terms of the style but another part that tries to impart an air of exclusivity that is inhospitable.

I stayed at the night hotel during fashion week and was desperately looking for accommodation. Whereas the hotel was clean and well presented, I felt like I was bleeding money the whole time I was there. First off, the prices are quotes ex taxes which makes for a little bit of a surprise on your bill. Then wifi was not including and they charge you a whopping 10 dollars per night for the privilege of using their service, then they have sensors in the minibar which tells them how many times you have opened the fridge door and they charge you 30 bucks if you store your own items in there. Finally the rate changed between both nights I was there, for no extra amenity apart from a bath robe (one for two people) which was questionable in cleanliness. Oh and the view, there was none. And no breakfast either. So overall, quite a stressful experience with the fear of being charged left right and centre for what are basic services in other hotels,

While this hotel and my initial room was small, it was immaculate, stylish, hip, and centrally located. The staff was phenomenal -- friendly, helpful, just a pleasure. It didn't hurt that the small bar was also excellent -- you really got the sense that you were in a chic boutique hotel that provided a lot of value for the money, in beautiful surroundings. All black decor, super sexy environment. Very New York. A little closer to Times Square than I normally like, but it was also the center of Midtown, putting you between EVERYTHING. The Park, Chelsea, subways, whatever you wanted. I just adored it and will be back. :)

Very unique place, very dark so if like me you like waking up to sunshine peeking through your window, do not stay here. The window to our room backed onto a brick wall. Can't blame the Night hotel for not informing you, they are very clear about this on the web site. Despite no natural light at all I did enjoy my stay. Staff very helpful & great location.Next visit to NYC will however be somewhere with windows & a view!

Michelle and her staff were welcoming and did everything they could to make our 6 day stay more comfortable. Other reviews regarding the size of the rooms concerned us considering the length of our visit. NYC was part of a 21+ day road trip and we had lots of luggage. While the room is small we had plenty of room to store our bags. Everything worked out as we spent a limited amount of time in the hotel.The location, if you want to be near Times Square, is excellent and the savings we enjoyed compared to other hotels in the area, regardless of the smaller room, validated our decision to stay at the Night. One suggestion, however. There is NO VALUE in charging $20 a night for Wi-Fi service. There is reasonable one time installation expense to the developer and should be one of the "free" amenities to its visitors.Saying that, this is a hotel we would not hesitate to recommend and look forward to staying there again the next time we are in NY.Thanks, Michelle.

Staff brilliant, location brilliant and hotel BRILLIANT!!Nothing bad to say about hotel, rooms, staff or location. Will stay there again for sure!!WE LOVED IT AND WANT TO GO BACK... NOW!!!!I had read some negative reviews about this hotel and i'm so glad i didn't listen too them. If you're after a hotel with a great location, great staff and beautiful clean rooms... The NIGHT hotel is for you.

The Night Hotel is in a great location - right near Times Square but far enough away to avoid some of the noise and crowds when coming and going from the hotel.The rooms are on the small side but very workable for the business traveler. The staff was very friendly and attentive.

I had stayed at Dream, and decided to try this one too. Wow! Beautiful room (small, but most NY hotel rooms are). There was champagne in our room to welcome us. Beautiful, trendy-stylish lobby. Black and white damask wallpaper in our room matched my pajamas. Breakfast buffet in the lobby. Hot restaurant and bar in the lobby too. We loved this spot. No noise despite being so close to Times Square. A perfect spot for our week long honeymoon.

Location is perfect, 1 min from Times Square. The hotel is a bit dark (night hotel) but with a great modern design. The room is small but very comfortable. The worst was getting an interior room with a small window that was useless. Nice bathroom too. If you need light...don't come here, if you don't mind, it will be nice for sure. The music in the rooms hall was too loud at 2 different days but after complaining it got corrected.The complimentary breakfast is good with a a selection of cereals, bagels, juice, eggs, pastries. The manager is very nice and will help you with your needs. I will probably be back when in NY, hopefully getting a brighter room :)

After a mediocre stay at another Wyndham property (Dream Hotel) I was hesitant to stay at the Night Hotel but based on other reviews I took a chance and thankfully it paid off! The Night Hotel is in a terrific location ~ only steps from Times Square! I stayed three nights and was pleasantly surprised at how friendly most of the front desk was and how clean and quiet the rooms were. The hotel only has one elevator but it was very quick. The rooms were very small and had a minuscule closet but turndown service always cheers me up and made me forget about my small room. They did not have a gym in the hotel but offered $15 passes to the nearby Equinox. Overall I was pleased with my experience and I feel that this was a great value for the money (considering the alternatives). I will be back! Bonus: Join Wyndham Rewards and the Internet fee is waived!
user_name:
neverhome007
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: All the staff at the hotel were very friendly and very helpful. The room was on the small side but clean and comfortable. The location was excellent about a 30 second walk from central Times Square. There were plently of delis and bars nearby. The best things about the hotel was the location and its style. The staff were also fantastic. I couldn't fault anything about this hotel. If you want to stay somewhere with style, at a good price, clean and nice staff then this is the hotel for you.We were travelling with a group of people all staying at different hotels and this one was without doubt the best.

My husband and I stayed for 2 nights in July 2011. On arrival at the hotel we were impressed, the reception and bar area is very nice, dark decor, minimalistic and very modern. The girl on reception, I didn't catch her name, was very helpful and friendly. Check in was smooth with no issues. We were given a room on the 7th floor, with myself being 7 months pregnant we opted for the lift. There only seemed to be one lift for the whole hotel and as a result, it was very slow and we had quite a wait for it. We got to our room and couldn't believe how small it was! One of the smallest hotel rooms we've every stayed in and we do travel a lot! Having said that, it was nicely decorated with a black and White theme, again very modern and minimalistic. The bathroom was very small also and decorated in black tile. Some aspects of the bathroom were very worn, such as tiles around the shower area had lost their colour and had been faded/chipped and looked old and untidy. There was also a metal shelf type thing above the sink which had started to rust and generally gave the bathroom an old/tatty feel. I feel for $260 dollars a night we didn't receive value for money. Another issue we had was with the a/c in the room. As I said before, I'm 7 months pregnant and the weekend we stayed, NYC was experiencing a heatwave, it was over 100 degrees so the a/c was very necessary! However this unit in our room sounded like it was 100 years old! It was so noisy and my husband and I didn't feel we really go a great sleep either night due to this. The bed was also small and neither my husband and I are particularly tall but we felt like our feet were touching the bottom of the bed! I dont know how someone 6ft or over could have slept comfortably in the bed!Overall, the hotel is a fantastic location with friendly staff. However, we are due to return to NYC in a few weeks and I will be looking for another hotel to book. I just don't think this hotel is worth the prices it charges.

The hotel is located right near all the typical tourist attractions so it's fine if that's what you're looking for. Aside from that, however, there is nothing much to get excited about. The rooms and bathrooms are small and dark and decorated in a black and white theme. The first room we got was literally the size of our king bed with a few extra inches to get around. We had to ask for another. The hotel tries to turn it's small space into a sexy S&M concept with the black decor and steamy pictures hung up in the dark lobby, but really it just ends up making the place feel small and claustrophobic. Again, just good for location & price for that area and that's it.
user_name:
Coco1320
New York City, New York

review_body: the hotel is awesome! its dark and mysterious feeling calm you down after one day's noise. the room is small but well decorated. very convenient, thoughtful. perfect for couples. the location is great, 1 minute to time square and broadway. many things to do during day and night.we came at the very last minute and the night manager Robert nicely arranged our rooms and even gave us an emergency discount considering we are students and lost one of our luggages.definitely come back again.
user_name:
miyaoyy
New York City, New York

review_body: I had to book a hotel kind of last minute and went to Tablet Hotels to find something that was hip, midtown and reasonable. Much is made of the decor - yes, it's dark - but at its core it's a small, boutique hotel. Remember this is NYC so don't complain about the room size - these rooms are small, but clean and nicely decorated. Most importantly, the beds are comfortable and the customer service was very good.If you're visiting NYC as a tourist you really can't get a better location - a block away from Times Square and smack in the middle of the theater district. You're also within walking distance of several subway lines, and there are plenty of eating options nearby too.However if you're a business traveller - as I was - this is not the place to stay. What serves as a desk is not very comfortable to sit at for any length of time and I actually worked with my laptop in bed. It can also get a bit overwhelming to have to push through the crowds when I'm trying to catch a subway downtown for a meeting. Lastly, you have to pay for wi-fi. In some ways it was easier to head to the nearby Starbucks to grab a coffee and get online there. What was nice though was that the front desk scheduled a car to get me to JFK on an early flight and even gave me a call to let me know the driver had arrived early. A few drawbacks. I saw a couple of comments about the elevator. I had no problems with elevator wait (I was on the 5th floor) and most of the time walked down. And while I loved the black and white decor it doesn't always work for bathrooms, especially if you're a woman trying to put on her makeup in the morning. In Night's favor I found my room surprisingly quiet - I'm not sure if there weren't many people on my floor but aside from hearing a few people in the hall early in the evening I slept very well. What I did hear was the construction noise from across the street, so if you're susceptible to light sleeping bring earplugs. Actually if you're not used to sleeping in NYC you might want to bring them anyway. All in all Night is a great choice if you're a tourist visiting NYC. My next business trip I won't be staying here.

The Night Hotel is located in the heart of all attractions. The standard room is quite small but comfortable. Perfect for a couple that just want to have a room to sleep in. As soon as i got there i was greeted by a gentlemen by the name of Robert. He was very helpful kid. I've never been to New York so i was asking him A lot of questions and he seemed to answer all my questions with out feeling like i was boring him. he was very out going and helpful. The staff was definitely helpful. The hotel is nice and quite. I liked the area and there's plenty of shops just feet away. I definitely recommend staying. The only bad experience i had was when i called room service for an ice bucket and the lady downstairs told me she was going to bring it and it took forever so I called back 30 minutes after and Robert answered the phone and I told him that my ice bucket never came and he brought it with in 5 minutes. I live in Las vegas so i'm use to great service. besides that everything was good. the staff is definitely helpful.

We found this hotel on Priceline.com, so needless to say, we did not pick it ourselves. We lucked out. My husband and I loved this place! It was 1/2 block off Times Square, less than 5 minute walk to Rockefeller Center, an all-in-all great spot for us. The staff was very friendly, suggested good spots for us to eat. The rooms were smaller than average NY sized rooms. The bathrooms were tiny. But everything was brand new and spotless -- very modern. The bar in the Lobby was always filled. We would definitely stay here again.

The manager, Robert, was very friendly and accomodating. When we needed help even in the middle of the night for room amenities he was willing to assist. Robert kept his promises and made sure our stay was good. Our room was comfortable and the bed was very soft. It was great service and we had a blast in NYC that night!

The hotel was awesome, the rooms were beautiful and the bed was comfortable. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Night hotel is an excellent place to stay. We stayed in the city overnight and chose this hotel, it was great choice.

The Night hotel was brilliant. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location was central which made seeing the sights easy to get to. The room was very comfortable. clean, quiet, wi-fi didn't cut out, room service was efficient and the hotel restaurant was lovely for breakfast and dinner. I had a fantastic stay at the Night hotel. I'd highly recommend it.

My thoughts on The Night Hotel: We stayed the nights of 2-3 June, 2011. Our first visit to New York. We loved it and had a great time visiting, what a great place to visit. The doorman was very helpful and friendly, and assisted with the luggage right out of the cab to our room. The lobby was dark; I tripped on the luggage as we headed up to our room, but remember we had traveled for 12 hours and we were tired. The receptionist was very pleasant and helpful. Very professional. The hotel manager had a bottle of champagne in our room for our 30th Wedding Anniversary, very nice touch. The elevator was quite tiny. We went up while our luggage had to wait for the elevator to return to the first floor to allow the bellmen and the cart with our luggage to follow. The room was small, so was the bathroom, reminded me of an inside cabin on a cruise ship. Not much room for our four pieces of large luggage, but was ok once we maneuvered everything in the room. We didn’t eat or drink there, but there was a small lounge and dining area in the hotel on the first floor. The Night Hotel is half a block from Time Square. Very convenient for people who like to walk. On 4 June there was a street fair within a block or two of the hotel where there were a variety of venders with knick-knacks, food and artwork of all sorts. If you like to walk, you could walk to “Ground Zero” and see the progress of the re-building of America. My overall satisfaction was Very Good, but dark and gothicky. Kind of gloomy in the hall ways, pictures throughout the hotel were nice. The whole hotel experience was great, not sure if would recommend it to the finicky traveler. From 1 – 10, I would rate 7.

We stayed 5 nights at teh Night hotel in April. Although the rooms are small, they are well equipped, funky and very comfortable. The hotel location is great, just off Times Square. The staff were also very helpful, assisting with travel arrangements and restaurant bookings. Would recommend to all

We stayed here on two separate occasions in June 2011 - for three days and then two days before and after a cruise. We found the hotel to be very clean and comfortable, and we loved the dark decor - so different to the norm. All the staff we friendly and helpful, and nothing was too much trouble. The only issue (for some people) may be the length of the bed which was almost too short for us - anybody of around six feet in height would have a problem. The rooms are a bit small but we had no problem with that - we were there to see New York, not to sit in the room all day.The hotel is an excellent location, tucked away just a couple of minutes walk from Times Square, yet still very quiet at night.All in all, an excellent experience. Would definitely go back again.

We booked this hotel through priceline and were very surprised at the type of hotel it is. This hotel is out of the ordinary to say the least. There are pictures of men and women all over the hotel donning masks, tatoos and in various states of undress. I was offended by the female nudity in the front lobby. The hotel is all black and white and has a very dark ambiance about it. The rooms are small and dark but clean. The lighting is dim. The location is great, very close to Times Square. I'm glad I didn't have my children with me. I won't be going back.

The service I received during my stay from the front desk to a most excellent bar staff was unparalleled relative to other accommodations I have used in New York City. The rooms are compact but very efficient in use of space with every luxury provided and need anticipated. Thanks so much for a great stay!

Overall The stay at hotel was good. The location was Fabulous... The elevators were claustrophobic. Once you get pass that your fine. The room was very cool. Loved the black and white decor. My only real complaint was you can hear housekeeping ring the bell and calling out at 9am after just falling in to bed at 630.

I stayed at the Night Hotel for two nights to celebrate an anniversary. I choose the hotel based on the reviews here. I was not disappointed at all. The hotel is steps from the heart of Times Square and all the Broadway shows, which is great. The hotel itself is a very small, clean and unique property with black and white motives throughout. The rooms are tiny, but unless you are planning to spend lots of awake hours locked in a room, who cares. The front desk staff are very nice and all helpful as well as the doorman that opens the doors for you each and every time you leave and enter. I emailed the hotel Manager Michelle that it was my anniversary. She responded back right away and left a nice note and a bottle of sparkling wine for us to enjoy upon our return one night. A real nice touch and thank you Michelle! The bottom line is: Would I send friends there and would I return again..... YES!

We stayed at the hotel from May 4th - May 8th, and was very excited to experience our first trip to NY. The staff was very courteous, the location great, but the room was the smallest I've ever seen! There is a minibar in the room that takes up a large portion, and is a huge waste of space. In order to get to the bathroom from the bed, I had to shuffle sideways to get around it, I stepped on the pedestal of this burden the first night, and experienced foot pain during our entire trip, and as much as we walked there, had to suffer through undue torture, the entire time. In fact, to this day, the bottom of my foot is still in pain!!! We asked several times to have it removed, and was assured it would be taken care of, but they never actually did. On our last day, we were notified that it couldn't be removed.Despite the room size and issue with the minibar, we still had a great vacation.

This was our first visit to New York and from the moment we set foot inside this hotel, we were not disappointed. My partner and I were celebrating our 40th birthdays and when we arrived, Tom had arranged for a bottle of wine to be in our room which was a lovely touch. The 'modern gothic' style of the hotel is great, the room we had was a queen size and I must say, having read previous reviews re some of the rooms being on the small size, our room had more than enough space, and the most comfy bed I have ever slept on. I only have one negative comment to make and it's only a small one - due to the lack of natural light in the room/bathroom, brighter lights/lamps would make it easier when putting make up on etc. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone wishing to stay near Times Square and wishing to stay somewhere very 'quirky'.

This is one of the coolest looking hotels I've stayed in. It has a very stylish look both inside and outside the rooms. Amazing lighting too. You are a minute away from all the action of time square and boradway. Staff is nice and tries to be healpfull . They even lent me an umbrella. The room I had was VERY small so if that bothers you, then it might be an issue. For one person I didnt feel I neede more space and the room had everything I needed including a nice TV and a comfy bed. THere are TV screens outside everyroom that tell you to select an aquarium view but they never show anything and I was told they are not touch screen. That was a bit weird. The hotel is not cheap but you are getting style and unbeatable location.
user_name:
wanderingyahud
New York City, New York

review_body: I had a great experience at the Hotel, Diana from the front desk was exceptionally attentive and helpful, when I let her know we were staying at the hotel for our 1st year wedding anniversary she was kind enough to send a bottle of champagne to our room free of charge, and was very nice about it, I think such commitment to guests vastly improves our experience as such. the hotel was very clean and the decor was amazing, location is great and surprisingly noise is kept to a minimum even though its a few steps away from Times Square (I was on the 7th floor). My only negative comment is there was no room service on Sundays for such reason and my wife and I were looking forward to eating in our room after a day of walking around the city. Also, when they left some chocolates in our pillow (hersheys almond kisses) they somehow dropped 3 or 4 aluminum foil wrappers on their way out which resulted in us walking into our room and the first thing we saw was the litter on the floor. Overall I had a great experience and I would recommend this Hotel to any people travelling with their spouse or partner"
Rooms are small but it is spotlessly clean, the service is exceptional, and the location is unbelievable.

Hands down, the best hotel I have come across. This was my fourth visit to NY and first time at Night, and after discovering this gem, I wouldn't settle for anything else in the city now! Absolutely loved everything about the hotel and amazing location. It has a great vibe, funky decor, and as a girl travelling on my own I felt very safe. So close to Times Square, Fifth Ave, Central Park, subway. Great little Irish pub - Connollys - across the road, as well as Starbucks and Cranberrys deli. The room was a decent size for NY hotel rooms, and the price was amazing for the location. Loved coming back to my room after a days shopping - thank you to Tom and the staff for such a fantastic stay!

We reserved a king bed but had to settle for a queen when we got to the hotel. They did give us a voucher for breakfast, a bottle of champagne and a small refund due to the change so I did not mind the down size so much (although my 6'4" husband did mind.) Rooms are very small but you can't beat the location for theater, time square, restaurants etc.

We got this hotel through priceline. That way you know you get a good hotel, but you don't know which. The night hotel is not my style. I guess some people will like it, but I thought it was all to dark. I like lighty rooms and with all the black the lighting was insufficient to make the room bright enough to my liking. This however can not be kept against the hotel. On other points the hotel scores pretty good. The rooms were clean. The bed was comfortable. The service was unobtrusive and therefore good!But hotels please, do not put a footboard on your beds. I'm pretty tall and always have a fight with footboards. This time it was OK, because I was alone and could crash diagonally, but I would not have been able to sleep good if I would have stayed there with my girlfriend.Another bad is the fact that you get fined for putting something of your own in the fridge. I usually keep a bottle of water I like to keep cool. What is the problem if I put it in the fridge?
user_name:
rmnl
Son en Breugel, The Netherlands

review_body: Night is one of the best hotels I have stayed at in a long time. The staff was incredible and the hotel was so clean. The best thing about the hotel is that there are only eight rooms per floor so it is an intimate atsmosphere. I am not into "gothic" decor but the decor is a very taseful gothic, if you will. I was a little worried about bed bugs but am happy to report Night came up clean! Not sure I would take small children here due to nudity of a few of the pictures. But it is PERFECT for a night away with a lover, spouse, friend, etc. I will look no further when coming to NYC because "some things can only happen at night"

I love this hotel. If you are planning a pleasure trip to Manhattan, this is a great midtown location. The hotel is top notch. The decor and ambiance are unique, exotic, and inviting. Rooms are a bit small, but immaculate, with a super comfortable bed. Daily cleaning service, and the staff learns your time routines quickly. Once they figured out we slept in a bit late, they never disturbed us again with early cleaning visits. Concierge was extremely helpful and accommodating. You can store your luggage on the checkout day if you need to run errands before leaving for the airport.

My friend and I had never been New York before and this was a special trip, to celebrate our 40th birthdays. We wanted a hotel that was reasonably priced with a central location and this place scored points all round. Not only was the price great for New York but it was just a minutes walk from Times Square. The location was fantastic. The hotel itself was very unique, just like my friend and I, it was decorated beautifully and stood out, if you stay in a chain hotel you could be in any city in the world, but this had New York all over it. The staff were exceptionally helpful and the service was wonderful. If I ever get to go back to New York, I'll be sure to stay at the Night Hotel again.

We arrived a little early than check in time, but reception staff were friendly and helpful as our queen room we booked wasn't ready they up graded us. The interior of the reception and the rooms, is original and does have the boutique feel, which I really really liked. Breakfast being included as well was a bonus, but limited choice and did get get a little tiresome after the 4th time of having it - but there arent many hotels in New York which offer breakfast included, so you don't need to have it.The room was sooo nice, uniuqely designed curtains and thick comfy carpet, there was a complimentary robe and bath products, room service happend twice a day if we nipped back in the afternoon they would come once we had gone back out. Threy would also leave a weather print out, which was a nice touch.The location of the hotel is amazing, a two minute walk and your on times square, 20mins your at central park, and metro stations are on every other corner, it really felt as though everything was on our door step. On the down side, the bathroom was rather small and did flood a little when the shower was on due to the screen not being big enough. The lift is a night mare, there is only one and it is really slow, but theres stairs which gave us a little more exercise after our long days. Due to the hotel being small/boutique, the hotel lacks a view and is over looked, but again New York is a built up area.Over all I would definitely recommend this hotel, the price we paid was amazing. The interior is fab, the bed was huge and comfy which allowed us to have great nights sleep. It was our first trip to New York and the hotel made it an amazing trip.
Amazing place, fantastic location and awesome staff. Well worth a visit.

The girl at desk who insisted on doing our check in, kept walking away in the middle of checking us in to answer the phone leaving the other girl standing there unable to help us because the other girl had started. THey announced that they had given us a "complimentary upgrade to the Penthouse (so called) suite" Turned out to just be a larger room on the top floor, shared by another guest in a room across the way. NO PRIVACY as you share a balcony with strangers in next "penthouse." With them mulling outside your room's glass wall. THEN roof leaked in SEVERAL places keeping us awake and afraid to turn on anything electrical. THey then charged us FULL PRICE for the so-called comped rm.

I travel monthly to New York City and my office is in Times Square. Night is convenient, has a wonderfully accommodating staff and is more personable than the larger chain hotels in the area. I try to stay here every time I go to NYC for work.
user_name:
ConstantTravelerDC
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We sent four night me and my wife and we had avery nice time the hotel was very clean and quite and the location was excellent and the STAFF WERE VERY HELPFUL AND READY TO DO ANYTHING I ASKED THEM.I WILL COME BACK AGAIN AND i have already recommended t.his hotel to my friendsNIGHT HOTEL THANK YOU FOR A WONDERFUL TIME WE HAD.A/WAHAB

Im due to book into here on the 27th of this month,with my wife ,Its our one year anniversary and my wife is 4 months pregnant, were no strangers to NY as we travel almost twice a year to this city, We've chosen to stay in this hotel to try something new and different and after staying in a lot of hotels around the world and just back from Dubai ,I hope to be writing a favorable review of this hotel on my return to Ireland.

I LOVE THE NIGHT. My bf and I are regulars - we love the privacy and the sexiness the hotel offers. Staff is extremely pleasant. Nick the doorman and the rest of the team always go out of their way to make sure we have a great experience every time. Drinks are made well, Ona is the best.
user_name:
IRISH-ICE
New York City, New York

review_body: Omg I've had a bigger room in a dorm only stay at the night hotel if you are alone or with a very small friend I paid 225 a nite, an than realized I couldnt stay there with my 2 daughters, they only have 1 bed, an forget about a cot, no cots, an no room even an air mattress wouldnt fit against the wall! It also should be an adult hotel, very suggestive pictures fill the walls, very gothic an very dark! The plus side if you don't get claustrophobic, the bed was comfortable, I had to get another room at another hotel, which cost me 200$ more because we all couldn't fit, an the staff is very proffessional an willing to go out of their way for you!

This Hotel is very Funky/Rocker look. I had a great stay and Dianay and Christe where very helpful in all the nice resturants/night life activty. I recommend this Hotel to anyone looking for a Hotel that will not break your pockects and right in the middle of time square.
user_name:
jennywrkjen
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Everyone at this hotel was sweet! I called to confirm my reservation on the day of my arrival and in disclosing that my stay was for my partners birthday, the young lady offered me a complimentary amenity. When I got there, there was a young man at the door who greeted us and offered to help us with our bag. The front desk checked us in and offered to make us reservations for dinner. When we got to the room, there was a complimentary bottle of champagne and a letter from the manager. The room had music playing and lighting underneath the bed. The room was chic and clean with a sweet ambiance. The bed was sooo comfortable and we love the pillows. The location was awesome....right in Times Square. Thanks to the staff and the manager for the personal touch. Definitely come check out this sweet and chic hotel!

The hotel is well placed for Times Square, the subway and visiting Midtown and Uptown on foot. It is very clean and well maintained and the staff are very friendly and efficient.The room we stayed in was VERY small with a small double bed and very little storage other than a small wardrobe with 4 hangers and no shelves and nowhere to store suitcases. This did make our stay slightly uncomfortable as we felt very cramped. We had a window in our room but it was very dark and we did not have any natural light at all and I think the majority of rooms do not have any windows at all. The breakfast was ok but definitely not worth the11.95 charge as you can get much better value outside of the hotel. We were unfortunate to have 2 of our nights disturbed by other guests which left us feeling jaded due to lack of sleep but the hotel staff did take care of this and the guests were removed.

Arrived the Hotel at around 12 noon, the room wasnt ready and was asked to come back at 3pm. Back the hotel at 3PM, waited another 45mins in the lobby. Though the receptionist kindly offered us free wifi for the day.The hotel is nice, decent sized room. but the walls are just so thin and you can hear people walking in the corridor, lift door opening and closing etc. and the bed even shakes when the people in the nearby rooms shut their doors, hence we didnt have very good sleeps through out the trip.One night we actually heard two drunk man, in the corridor and talking about sex at 4am ! we soon rung the reception and someone came up and sort the problem out which is very efficient. The down in the duvet make our night very uncomfortable. they are very sharp which make a lot of scratches on us.The shower room is another problem. a little pool of water will be left on the floor after shower and its stay until the cleaners clean it up the next dayin the plus side, the hotel is in a very good location. door steps from time square, walkable to many attractions. a restaurant nearby is real good. starbucks is nearby where you can get online. very close to port authority which you can find coaches to airport and woodbury outlet which is another plus.

The service was excellent! Came in with no reservations looking for a room and were upgraded to a Penthouse suite. Christine made us feel so comfortable and as if we were VIP clients. The room was nicely decorated and the hotel had a rather sexy element to it. The bathrooms were my favorite, very swanky. Great balcony and an awesome lounge/ bar area downstairs. There's a Starbucks about 20 feet away, that's always a plus. The thing I liked least was not knowing how to work the radio. I definitely look forward to staying here again.... Round 2!
user_name:
winslow20
West New York, New Jersey

review_body: I stayed on the night hotel and this was my 3rd trip back to NYC and i saved the best hotel to last. When we arrived the staff where so helpful and friendly and this was my impression with all staff i came in contact with during my 5 night stay. The room was very clean and the bed was fab. If i had to find 1 fault it was the room was a little dark and could do with a shaving/makeup mirror is the bathroom with a light. Other then that if you want to stay in the heart of Time Sq in a funky hotel but at a good price the night hotel is your choice
My wife and I enjoyed our stay at the Night Hotel. The rooms were clean and spotless. The manager Tom and his staff were amazing and went above and beyond any expectation.
Christine was very helpful, and help made our stay even better

Stayed for two weeks in the Junior Penthouse and had a very mixed experience.... The hotel itself is decorated brilliantly and the location was fantastic! Unfortunately we had quite a few issues with our room, including a ceiling water leak with the only solution being "we will put a larger bucket underneath for you". That being said; management did their best to ensure the rest of the stay went smoothly giving us comp drinks and dinners and also a comp night. Sadly the issues with the room didn’t stop there and we began to feel resentment from management for highlighting some of problems (all of which were serious and required action). I'd recommend this hotel for short stays for couples, but defiantly not suitable for families with a nightclub practically downstairs and private parties permitted in neighbouring rooms.

Think W or Hudson but with bigger rooms. Storage was still limited (no draws for clothes) but had closet to hang everything. Room was very comfortable, good quality Wifi ($10 a day) and excellent TV. Staff were very helpful, nice room for breakfast - did not have dinner there. Room service very reasonable. The room looked out onto a dark alleyway so it was night all day!

My fiance and I went to NYC for a weekend trip and stayed at the Night hotel, upon check in this cute girl named Christine at the front desk was so welcoming and professional, they checked in our luggage, carried it up and amazing we got an upgrade to their penthouse suite. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel was perfect, right in Times Square. Also, the black and white decor is extremely NY chic. LOVE IT, definitely staying here EVERY time we go back!
user_name:
mmurtada
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The staff at Night, specifically Christine at the front desk, made this hotel a pleasure to stay at. This is also an ideal place if you want to take a date to the city for a little holiday. The proximity to Time Square (if that matters to you) is super close, you are in the middle of everything. The only real downside here is the size of rooms (tiny). Which really isnt so bad, just know going in that there are no rooms with two beds and no room to sleep anywhere but the one bed provided in the room. Aside from that, the decor and atmosphere is as unique as it is fun. Thanks for getting us upgraded to a King room Christine.... ; ) - Josh

Well, I must confess I was very worried about this hotel. Fist because of the monocromatic idea I was told about it. Black and white in everything and everywhere. My surprise was when I got there. Rooms are very pleasant, not so small at all (been in smaller ones!!), very confortable beds with lots of pillows and cleaness. The halls are a bit dark, really, you never know if it is night or day, but with confortable music playing everytime you leave the lift.. Nice decoration, great staff (they are really kind and helpful!) and wonderful location. (half a block from Times square!) It´s great too for shopping because you can be back to hotel to leave your achats.I deffinitly recommend this hotel and would really be there lots of times again!!

My cousin and I stayed at the Night Hotel, The staff was accommodating very nice! I love that they play music outside the front door of the Hotel! From walking through the front door of the beautiful boutique hotel to the front desk was lovely. My room was small (but a wonderful king size bed) and Fabulous, the music was playing when i walked in my room very nice music & low! Everyone that I came in contact with was very nice!

We stayed for 4 nights and it was as described. The lighting was dark and there was loud music playing at times. But the room was really nice and the location is absolutely excellent. Shower was good. We will definitely be returning!
What a great experience. this hotel pampers to all your needs.Awesome decor, right in Times Square. the staff is amazinglyhelpful. Wiil be going back soon!

Dispite the very nice location (almost inside Times Saqure), this hotel is not what it pomissses to be. It really has a nice balck and white decoration, but not more than that.We picked it because the price was good and it was offering breackfast. That was our worst mistake. I have never been so poorly served in a restaurant/bar/lounge. The asian lady that was responsible for the breackfast was rude and very unpleasent, allwais looking like if we are not welcome to have brackfast there.Also, the walls are so thin that we overheard an couple figh and a lot more...Good trip, bad hotel choice.

I just got back from a three day stay at Night. I took my daughter for her surprise sweet 16 present and it was perfect from beginning to end!When I made the reservation I let the staff know that we would be showing up early in the morning and that it was my daughter's birthday gift.We showed up at 8 a.m. and I asked if we could just store our luggage until our room was ready but they told me they already had a room ready for us. That's pretty unheard of in NYC. The staff at the front desk were super friendly.The room was small, but I've slept in much smaller. The bed was very comfortable. We had the queen bed and I'm glad we didn't settle for the double. This one was great for us to have our own space. The view is non-existent but we were only in the room to sleep so it was no big deal. The hotel itself is right in Times Square. I had been afraid that it would be noisy so I had asked for a higher floor when I booked. They had us on the 7th floor and I didn't hear a noise once.The best part -- the second night when we came back after a long day, there was a birthday cake waiting in our room for us. Can you believe that? My daughter was soooo happy! I couldn't believe the personal service. That was so thoughtful and went above and beyond any expectations I had.I can't say enough about our stay there. I travel to NYC quite a bit for service and this was one of the better boutique hotels I've stayed at. It was certainly the best for its price. I would stay again without hesitation.In case anyone from the hotel is reading this, I just wanted to extend my thanks again. You made my daughter's birthday unforgettable and I am truly grateful!

Night was perfect! Its right in the heart of times square but, still quiet inside. Very trendy. a My partner LOVED the design and style of it all. We will definitely stay here in the future. The staff was also 100% friendly and helpful. If you are looking for Style in NYC this is the place! The prices are not that bad for NYC either.

I was afraid to stay here because I thought it was a Gothic themed hotel. That's not my personal style, so I thought I would be miserable here. I have to admit I was wrong. Upon entering the hotel lobby, you see the black & white carpet with the black & white avant garde photos. The carpet and room key all had the letter N inscribed.The room is decorated with black & white wallpaper that matched perfectly to the curtains. The bathroom had black tiles with lighting in the shower to add the white element. There was music in the lobby and in the room adding to a chic hip night life vibe.Some positives were being warmly greeted by Christine at the Front Desk. She answered our questions. The room was clean, comfortable, and decorated with a chic motif. The hotel recently became owned by Wyndham and we received a discount booking through them. The hotel was close to all our destinations for our Broadway show and eating. The positives outweighed the negatives, but I like to share these for a well-rounded review. The room size is small compared to other rooms at the same price pointHowever coming here, value is not the first concern. The decor, ambiance, and proximity to Times Square might be your primary concerns. The elevator is small, so there is a bit of a wait time. Luckily for us we were able to walk up and down the stairs to our 2nd floor room.Make sure to heed the warnings about the fridge. Don't open it or touch it if you don't want a fee on your bill.

A great themed boutique hotel right near Times Square. The staff were friendly particularly the bar staff - you know who you are! Everything was as advertised, I read and took on board previous trip adviser comments and knew what to expect so wasn't disappointed in any regard.If I can ever get back to NY i'll stay there again.

I would stay again and recommend to friends and family. We stayed 6 nights - the room was not huge but clean, beautifully decorated and met all of our needs. Staff were friendly and helpful when we had questions. Chocolates at night - compliementary beverage chilling on arrival. Located within steps from Time Square \- within walking distance to everything we wanted to see.

I stayed at Night Hotel for a trip and had a great experience. My room was small, but clean, comfortable and decorated nicely. The truly stellar part of my visit was the front desk staff--Christine, Anna and Barry. They all pitched in and helped me when I needed to print something quickly. They went beyond the call of duty to help me, and I am so grateful. Thanks for a great stay and great service!

We stayed at the Night hotel for 4 nights, and could not fault it. The hotel is exquisitely decorated in a black and white, yet remains cosy and inviting. The room was great with plenty of room for all our belongings. We personally did not find it dark (once we worked out how to use the light switches). They were extremely clean, comfortable and romantic. The room amenities were also excellent.From the moment we arrived, the staff at the hotel were nothing but friendly and helpful. They arranged a transfer to JFK, chatted to us at the bar and when we informed them the mini bar wasn't working they came to fix it within 10 minutes.The bar is lovely and well priced, with very friendly bar staff. The smoking court yard at the back is a lovely addition. The hotel has lovely touches, such as free playing cards in the lobby, postcards, books and timeout magazine in the bedroom. The turn down service with chocolates and the weather report for the next day was a also a thoughtful touch. The location is fantastic, just off times square yet the street was fairly quite. It is situated in a really good location for sight seeing by foot and is close to the metro stations. There are plenty of great bars, restaurants, cafes and delis close by. All in all a gem of a hotel, we can't wait to go back. Can not recommend it high enough.

I will be checking into this hotel late on the 28th of Feb and I will right a review of my stay on the 4th of March. I have stayed at the Dream hotel (its sister hotel) so it will be interesting to see how it compares. If you have any specific things you would like to ask me about this hotel you can e mail me on jay.sihota@yahoo.co.uk

I highly recommend this hotel! Me and my girlfriend stayed for 1 night and couldn't have been happier. Location is unbeatable, literally in the heart of times square! Price was also very affordable. We walked in and were totally shocked to see a complimentary bottle of champagne waiting for us as well! This little gesture went a long way, and it;s safe to say we will definitely be back! I am a native new yoyker and can say this hotel definitely met my expectations. Definitely recommend for couples!

We were a bit worried about our stay after reading some of the reviews but it was perfect. I contacted the hotel about a couple of things before we went and they were very helpful and quick to respond. We didn't find the rooms too dark at all, the only light I wanted to be really bright was in the bathroom so I could do my make-up...and it was, the lighting in the rest of the room was lovely. The room wasn't huge,but I hear that's the same in all hotels in the area. The staff were all very friendly and seemed very genuine. There was music in the halls but we couldn't hear it in our rooms at all so we slept very well and the problem with the shower water going on the floor that some people were talking about has been sorted. There is a laptop in reception that customers can use which was very handy and we got a bottle of champagne in our room which was a lovely touch (I'm not sure if they give this to everyone or if it was because it was our anniversary). I would stay in this hotel again if I was back in New York.

This is a great bijou hotel. Friendly and efficient staff and perfectly located for NY tourists. Right in the heart of the theatre district and within walking distance of the iconic department stores and restaurants.. The hotel itself is themed contemporary and cosy. Good bar when busy. The rooms are well proportioned but if you have a lot of luggage make sure you go for the larger room.. The beds are ultra comfortable and the room facilities are top notch.. Free wifi was available when I booked via iPrefer but this facility may not be available now and you may need to check first. I have stayed in the sister hotel Time, this is more comfortable and more upscale and better located. I will stay here again.

Found this property on Tablet Hotels and got good value for a Times Square 4-star. The pictures are very representative so was very satisfied with the stay. It's quite dark and moody which isn't to everyone's taste but was great for us and the dark rooms helped us sleep and get over jetlag! The room had every amenity we needed for the 4-night stay and though the New York rooms are renowned for being small it was more than adequate. The staff were very helpful and charming and helped make our celebratory stay very comfortable.

We loved this hotel! Amazing location, romantic rooms and great staff. Somehow the safety deposit box in our room did not like us and we hade quite a bit of trouble getting it open. The Management did their best to solve a problem and we were offered an apology together with complimentary drinks in the bar. Brilliant done by Mr Carpenter, the GM. We enjoyed it and look forward to returning.

We've been at the Night hotel previously with friends for drinks in their lounge. It's a different type of hotel, very good for couples - all black & white, modern design. The staff is amazing! The front desk service, concierge, bellmen, bartenders, etc were all so friendly and helpful. We checked in and went upstairs to our room. We approached the room and the door was slightly ajar. When we knocked and entered, we saw a woman (appeared to be a manager) looking around - she was there to approve the cleanliness of the room. She apologized and asked us to wait outside until she gave the room clearance (it was only a minute or two), it was NO big deal at all; honestly we were thankful someone is on staff to check on those things! Later that night when we returned to the room, there was a note and a bottle of chilled champagne as an apology for the inconvenience. We were so surprised!!! This was definitely above & beyond service. Also Christine who bartends on Sunday night, is WONDERFUL!!!

I stayed here with my boyfriend last month, and I was in love with this hotel the minute I stepped in. From The bell men helping us out of the taxi, to the delivery of the menu specials & chocolate hand delivered to our room each evening!This hotel was less then a 2min walk to Time Square, it was dark, sexy, with a gothic urban feel!, This is NOT a family hotel! So don't bring the kiddies....The service we received from start to finish was excellent and the bar in the lobby had great Amaretto Sours! It such a unique experience!The rooms weren't huge, but big enough! It was just a little pricey but it was worth it!. Would definitely go again!
The Night Hotel NYC absolutely lived up to all of the claimes to be "The sexiest hotel in NYC". They made my Valentine weekend one that we will never forget. We WILL be back

The Night is completely unique. It is themed: gothic. The color scheme used throughout the hotel is: black, gray and white. The hotel is lowly lit. It offers a cold, icy feeling, yet intimate, sophisticated and inviting, at the same time. This oxymoron is testament to the hotel's truly unique experience. The pictures on the walls were unneeded. There were multiple black and white pictures of orgy scenes, some involving partial nudity. While these photos would not stop me from returning to the hotel, or recommending it, I would suggest the designers choose photographs appealing to a wider audience. One can exude sexiness without being trashy. All staff were friendly and helpful, and willing to help. The location of the hotel was perfect, just around the corner from Times Square, and just a few blocks from Radio City Music Hall, the venue for the concert my partner and I were attending.The Night offered a nice, one of a kind experience in a city just as unique. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a different experience.

The Night Hotel is in a fantastic location for tourists (being just off Time Square), and it's certainly different from the standard Sheraton/Marriot fare in it's price bracket. The rooms are stylish and comfortable, and above all I found the service to be incredibly friendly and helpful - none of the stony-faced staff I've often found in other boutique hotels.In saying this, what you gain in style you sacrifice in space and natural light. The Queen room I stayed in was well equipt, but had little free floor space and the shower room was difficult to move in. Given the concept is gothic it's unsurprising there's no natural light, but I'd be struggling to spend more than a few nights like that.I'd recommend to someone going for a few nights and looking for something a little out of the ordinary, but on any longer a stay I suspect the novelty would wear off.

The Night Hotel was a last minute booking for me as my Airline cancelled my flight, and I had to book an extra night in NYC, my original hotel couldn’t accommodate me, so I booked the Night.This Hotel is all about service, from Emails I sent regarding a possible late arrival to the most considerate reception staff I have encountered in NYC. This Hotel is not about being a number in hotel but being made feel special from the minute you walk in.The rooms aren’t small or big they are NYC standard, so when people complain about small rooms they should have went to Disney, NYC don’t do big rooms. The rooms are spotless and well maintained, with the most sink into mattress I have ever slept on, I hate my bed at home now. Rooms contained a huge TV and a Bose radio, no I Pod / Phone connection in the room I stayed in. However reception staff charged my phone any time I asked. The Night is also blessed with location just off Times Square, Macys 10 Mins, Rockefeller 10 Mins and a whole host of attractions D & B’s, Ripley’s & Madame Tussauds 5 Mins away with Toys R Us a mare 1 Min. The only negative thing I would report would be the pricing of the bar, $20 for vodka, orange (dash) & a bottle of Heineken is way too expensive and this excludes tip. However a great bar called the “perfect pint” waits across the street and is the only “Irish” bar that is like a bar from Ireland I have been in NYC, a great spot.Deadappletours.com was another great way to see NYC from a hearse and see the spots where the famous perished. All in all a great hotel with a bog thumbs up, and i will return next February for 2012’s injection of NYC.

We are long time NewYorkers who were looking for a romantic break from our routines. Took me ages to find the Night, but it seemed just right. And were we pleasantly surprised. It was fantastic. Quiet and low-key around the corner form the madness of Times Square. And so chic. My partner is something of a fashionista, well-heeled and well travelled. So I was very conscious of pleasing his taste level. I know what I like too...a bit of understated luxury? This Hotel was so PERFECT we can't wait to go back again. Oh and the price was a steal. The staff were lovely. But sshhhh, let's keep it between us, ok?
user_name:
LaLasLand
New York City, New York

review_body: I traveled to NYC with my 2 teens, and 2 of their friends last weekend. My 18 year old daughter is disabled, and uses a wheelchair. She and I stayed at the Affinia Dumont, on 34th and Lex. My son (nearly 20), his girlfriend, 19, and friend, 20, I put into 2 rooms at the Night Hotel. Reasons I did this; I wanted to allow them to be in Times Square, and I wanted them to have the luxury of independence from me. I thought it would be a great learning experience. So, this is it in the nutshell: there are good and bad things about this hotel. First, look at the photos on the website- they are absolutely accurate!! They do not show the "nice" rooms, while hiding the bad stuff...everything is exactly as you see it...in a word, cool. The hotel is all black and white, decorated in a very contemporary way. Several reviews called it "dark". It is. But in a very hip and young way. My son is a tattooed and pierced young man. I picked this place because when I saw the photos and read the reviews, I said, " This is my son. This is totally Cody." We arrived to a very nice receptionist, with a wonderful, helpful demeanor. The rest of the staff? Not so much. I had my daughter, of course (in her wheelchair), and the teens all had luggage. We had the door opened for us. No one offered help to get the luggage to the room or to help us in any way at all. After 5 minutes, while I was still signing all of the papers (paperwork for 2 rooms took a few minutes), the doorman came up to me and said, "Uuummm, what are you gonna do with your car?" (Which was out front), even though it was obvious I couldn't move it yet as I was still working with the clerk. Oh well...we went up to the rooms. Sam's wheelchair and I barely fit into one elevator car. She is not in a full sized wheelchair. If you use a wheelchair...you won't fit!!! Don't stay here!! We went upstairs: I had requested a high floor. We got the 2nd floor. My son's room was one with a King sized bed. The other room was a queen. Both were very, very hip and cool to look upon. Their review of the comfort of the bed? Fantastic! They said everything was feathers and all three loved the rest they got!!! On the flip side: no "Do not disturb signs"!!
