So, although we were there for the weekend, they were disturbed at 8 a.m.! I am told the maid was obnoxious, did not knock, just let herself in, woke them up, and was rude on top of it!! Are you kidding? This doesn't even happen at the Holiday Inn! (neither room needed maid service, incidentally.) They also commented that each morning the noise housekeeping made was just unbelieveable. My son also says this, "Although the room was great, and looked amazing, some things were messed up, like the toilet paper spindle, which was 1/2 detached from the wall...it was cheap-not kept up well." They all say that the location was stellar. It was! It was in Times Square, and they loved walking out of the hotel and into the heart of NYC at all hours of the night and day. We all say this: the rooms are pretty teeny, although if you are there for the atomosphere and decor, it is okay. However, I could not get the wheelchair down the hall, into the room, and turned around. We had to back down the hall to get to the elevator. We never could have stayed there!! The halls are dark. If you are young and don't need light...no problem, it is part of the feeling of the hotel. If you have a problem with that though...not a place for you. The last hour of their stay was the worst, unfortunately, and this is what they will remember. The night before, I called to ask if we were all set for check out, as they had all of my credit card info, and I had signed everything. I was told yes, all set! A few minutes later, I got a call saying I had to go there to check them out. I asked why, and explained that since I was in another location that would make things so difficult. The clerk said if I could just get there by 1:00, since I was leaving my hotel at 12:30, we would be fine. So I was content with that answer. Unfortunately, all three teens started calling and texting me at 12:15 to say they are getting kicked out and I had to get there RIGHT NOW to sign papers and check out or I would be charged for ANOTHER night!!! Getting my disabled daughter out of our place, everything packed, getting the car, etc...all a lengthy process! My last 30 minutes in my beautiful hotel was ruined because I was in panic mode, trying to get out and to the Night Hotel to avoid paying for 2 rooms for another night!! At the last second, as I was already on the way, the hotel called to say, "Oh, sorry, we just need to confirm your information, and you are all set." Unbelievable!! So much stress for no reason at all. And the teens said the level of rudeness was so high that morning that they wouldn't stay there again no matter how cool it was, or how great the location- this from teenagers!! Sooo...you can decide: it is clean, it is cool, it is in a great location!! The prices are good!! But choose wisely: if my negatives wouldn't bother you, try it! If they would, stay away!! (My daughter and I stayed at a hotel called the Affinia Dumont, about 20 blocks away...see my review. It was close in price, but I had not a single negative thing to say about the place) This is a niche hotel. Not for everyone.
For a mid town boutique hotel it was very pleasant stay, also the amenities and price was excellent.
user_name:
joelyun
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed in this hotel for 8 nights; the location is great just around the corner is Times Square. The staff was very helpful and friendly (Christina & Daniela); there is nothing to complain about. Our room was very small but nice and clean; the black&white design might not be to everyones liking but we did like it. Value for money was very good considering the location; we will return for sure.

Very clean, people are very friendly and ready to attend all demands you have. Very well located, close to everything that matters. Everyday they warn the clients about the weather for the next days with godiva chocolates.

The staff was useless, lazy, and extremely rude. I went in advance to book the penthouse suite and they said that I couldn't book it at the hotel or online. However i eventually booked it online using booking.com. They were really snotty. I even emailed the manager trying to book the suite. No response.When I got into the penthouse suite there were only two floors after the website and staff said there were three. THERE WAS A DIRTY USED DOUCHE BAG IN THE DRAWER OF THE MASTER BEDROOM AND LEFT OVER BEER IN THE CABINETS DOWNSTAIRS.When I told the staff they looked at me like I was crazy and then upon return from dinner I realized they sent up a plate of pancakes. Pancakes to make up for a douche bag? Interesting.I will never ever return here.

Great location, only a minute's walk to Times Square. Only a minute's walk but none of the hustle and bustle... The rooms were a bit on the small side and the showers a bit weak, but nice finishes in the room and an the toiletries they provide. Beware of the services charges before thinking of room service or using the internet, as there is a fairly high premium to use these. Apart from that, the staff were really helpful and attentive and know the city like the back of their hands !More attention should be paid to the dining as the choice of breakfast is limited and expensive. Also, it feels like you are squating when eating your meal as the tables are so low down but there is help at hand as there's a little deli across the street that's well stocked and caters for all tastes.For the price, it's a good little find for New York. Ba Da Bing!

My partner and I were really looking forward to staying in this trendy looking hotel. We were disappointed, really disappointed and oddly - the hotel itself eg. the building, is good.. there's nothing wrong with it - small rooms as expected in New York city, trendy carpet, little bathroom that tended to flood somewhat but hey... It's decent. Breakfast in the morning is badly organised with everything sitting in a tiny corner and 20 people all trying to make toast/get coffee etc in a spot that is big enough for 2 isn't the best though good that breakfast was included! The only real draw back, which initially I guess I thought was the draw card... This place is seriously dark. It might be suitable for others but I found it gets you a little bit down being in a dark place so long. The only flaw with the hotel itself is the loudness of the air conditioners, apparently the sound which is similar to a car motor in your room, is normal for New York so could have accepted it had my concerns been handled differently. What I couldn't accept was the rude, useless, lazy and inconsiderate staff that worked in this place. One girl in the bar was lovely but wasn't actually being paid by the company and working for tips so of course she was friendly, a second girl in the bar was scary (!) singing around the place and really making me feel extremely uncomfortable. (Restaurant doesn't have much to offer and very small menu.) The porters/door men I guess you would call them were lovely... but the reception staff! Wow... Cannot describe these people, I asked for ear plugs on the first night to deal with the a/c - ''we don't have any - there's nothing wrong with the air con" - the Manager later states we have a huge stockpile of ear plugs! We had booked for 8 nights - they chose the smallest room they could for us. The staff stare blankly when told there's a problem with the a/c - expect us to wait around indefinately whilst they don't bother to get someone to fix it, they sigh and roll their eyes when we explain our disappointment. They swapped our room 3 times in the end. Once the porter had us pack our bags to move rooms, when we returned to the hotel later that day we were basically acused of lying and told that the porter hadn't said anything and he'd gone home so we weren't moving. No consideration that we'd now packed our bags 3 mornings in a row... Finally on the 3rd move we were offered an upgrade for our troubles but we had to point out to them this was a good idea!! In the end when the hotel Manager returned, he was really understanding and offered a free meal and took a little off our bill. This was good but our stay was already ruined by his staff. Having to walk past them every morning and evening really put a downer on our time New York. We had so many issues whilst staying here. I would recommend you stay anywhere but here.Also - a note on the location - last time I stayed in New York I stayed in Chelsea and not so near to the action (Night Hotel is 2 minutes from Time Square). I think having a refuge from Tourists and crowds such as Chelsea was a much better choice! Food for thought!!

My wife and I returned to Manhattan where we were initially engaged, to celebrate our 10th Anniversary. After emailing several locations with no response, Tom and Jhoanna both contacted me and were very helpful. Staying at the Night was an excellent decision. The service and the room decor was amazing. Even though our reservation was short notice and there were no Suites available, the room was just enough for our stay. The two ladies who handled our reservations were extremely helpful, particularily one to mention ( and I can't recall her name) shared some tips about the area and her marriage. I also want to thank the Doorman for his help. Although our stay was short with respect to timeframe, the Night's location made our ability to manuever around the city on foot so much easier. From our first Broadway show, to walking Central Park, Ice skating at Rockefeller Center, and even a trip to the Statue of Liberty, the location was key. Even Ona, the bartender took care of us after our Show on Saturday and we appreciate her time with us. We look forward to visiting again soon and have even discussed starting an Anniversary tradition of seeing a new Broadway show every year.
The staff were very friendly and really helped us planning our days and find the very best resaturtants. Thanks for a nice stay @Night! We'll be back.

First off let me start by saying that Night Hotel was absolutely my best hotel experience so far, and I have stayed at at least 50 different hotels in different cities around the US, and abroad. Upon arrival, I was told that my room had been given to somebody else, but that because this was their own fault, I would get a FREE upgrade to the Penthouse Suite! The customer service was very helpful, and friendly. The two ladies who helped me were named Anna, and Christi. They were both excellent and should be given a huge raise!The location of the hotel is perfect, right near times square. The rooms are very unique, and look amazing, with sort of a Gothic feel to them. The price of the hotel was also very good.If you are looking for the perfect hotel stay right in Times Square, this is the place.

Just off broadway,this hotel is very modern and smartly put together.Totally made to feel at ease with the brilliant staff this hotel offers compact rooms which are very modern,breakfast ,lunch or dinner is relaxing in a nice dark atmosphere,ideal for couples.

My boyfriend and I recently spent a night in the Penthouse suite and I can sum it up in one word….Incredible!! The gothic black and white décor throughout the suite was tastefully done with an exotic feel. The staff from check-in to check-out from Bell man to bartender was extremely courteous and considerate. The room was spotless and well stocked with everything we could possibly want. The location couldn’t be better being only a few blocks away from Times Square, MOMA, Rockefeller center, etc. We will definitely return for another stay at Night Hotel

Overall, Night Hotel was amazing. It far exceeded my expectations. It is a relatively small hotel, only 80 or so rooms, but you wouldnt know it. The service was superb from the minute we entered the lobby. Our room was ready early, and check in was a breeze. The Lobby had been semi-decorated for the holiday season. My girlfriend and I loved the setting, decor was sophisticated and sexy, they even had a black christmas tree. Black and White everywhere! The room was a great size, we had a King Room. Bed was big and comfortable, room was well laid out. Again, decor was fantastic. All of my pre-planned amenities were present in-room. Truly a delightful experience. Also, the proximity to Times Square was fantastic. We had a great time. Super Clean Rooms, Friendly Staff, Great Lounge in the Lobby. Will be back time and time again. Strong Recommendation.

The Night hotel - is very comfortable and very stylish! ... The rooms are very clean and relaxing , comfortable beds and its quiet! (takes you away from all the hustle and bustle of NYC!).The staff are extremely helpful and friendly and nothing is too much trouble ... making your stay a relaxing and enjoyable experience - staff assisted us with travel adapters, carrying baggage, storing luggage for us, ice buckets etc etc. First class! (Big thanks to Steve and Danielle).The hotel is literally a 2 min walk to Times Square (out the door turn left and you are there!) This was absolutely brilliant!I would definately stay here again and recommend to friends.

Have checked out yet & currently in the room. For $260 per night the room is very small. There is a wet bar in the room that is very expensive with a $50 dollar restock fee. The only outlit in the bathroom for the hair dryer has electrical tape holding it together and does not work. Bad lighting in the room. Not a lot of hot water in the shower. Check in was 3pm. I stayed in a cheaper hotel a few blocks away the night before that was much larger with a better view (broadway plaza). Will not stay at the night hotel again.

I arrived at the Night Hotel on December 28, the day after the big blizzard. My friend and I had to walk to the hotel from Penn Station because the cab line was so long. Just so you know...it's possible! When we arrived we were very impressed with how sharp the hotel looked. The people at the desk were very friendly (although when we asked for a seafood hotel suggestion, one of the girls recommended Red Lobster!). The room was very spacious for New York standards and it smelled great. The lights were on and the radio was playing, which we really liked. We ate at a wonderful Greek restaurant the first night, Kellaros. Jersey Boys was wonderful, and the hotel is steps away from Times Square, yet it's very quiet once you're in the room. At one time, there must have been a free continental breakfast, but that didn't come with our room, so we walked across the street to the Cranberry Cafe and got a coffee and pastry the next morning for $3.00. There is also a Starbucks next door. The next night we tried Bobby Van's next door. We just had bread, two appetizers, and drinks. It ws quite expensive but they were perfectly fine with us just getting appetizers and were very friendly. Back to the room, our towel rack had fallen off the wall so we both had to use the hook on the back of the door, but this wasn't really a problem. The bed was very comfy and there was turn-down service each night (with chocolates). I would definitely stay here again. I think we paid around $245.00 per night and I thought it was a pretty good value for the city.

My partner and I do not regret this hotel. It was very well located. A minute walk to Times Square. Very clean and cozy. There is also good service provided by the ladies of the lobby. Especially Ana Moctar and her colleague Christine were very helpful. Apart from the door of our hotel room one morning no longer wanted to open, it quickly was recovered by the staff. Unfortunately, from December 1, 2010 the hotel does no longer serve free breakfast any more. It is certainly worthwhile to take another go back!

When intially walking into hotel we was greeted with music blaring out of the speaking with rap music - SWEARING in every other sentence! I am young and open minded so did not mind as much but was glad my parents werent with me. To a supposed elgegant classy hotel not such a good start.Room was a decent size for NYC. Bottle of champayne was a nice gesture.When the hotel was built and new you probably could not fault it but the hotel is not maintained so carpets are stained with makeup, hairdryer was hanging of wall but stuck back on with tape, bed and furniture was scuffed and to top if off there was BLOOD on the wall. This was not cleaned off throughout our whole duration of the stay.The hotel made a mistake, we should have had breakfast included and they told us this was not paid for, only when I returned to the UK did I find out it should have been.One day we had breakfast there and I would not have paid for it ,had I known. There was no tables just a lounge and the hot breakfast consisted of dryed plain scrambled egg and bacon!On the plus, we had a comfy large bed and the location was perfect, practically on times square.On our return my friend left an item in the room which is of no value but sentimental, we emailed the hotel on numberous occasions and was finally told it hadnt been found, we know this was left in the hotel as it was not an item you take out. The hotel is overpriced. I would not recomend this hotel to anyone but would the location.

I booked a basic room and got a free upgrade but the room was still very small and very dark (hence Night Hotel) particularly as it looked into quite a dingy light well. All in all the hotel was fine. Great location off Times Square. The only gripes, one lift for the entire place which took forever when it was working and a $30 fee if you wanted to store your own drinks in a fridge!

I arrived earlier than 3pm to check in and the morning receptionist welcome us to the hotel and told us that our room was ready, I think her name was Marilyn, she was very nice and professional, explained to us about the breakfast, gave us vouchers and explain what the hotel has to offer. The same girl also help us booking helicopter tour and recommend a great steakhouse nearby. Location is great, close to eveything, the bed was really comfy and the rooms are nicely decorated in black & white which I love it! I though the bar will be more crowded at night time but most of the time it wasn't but it looked nice and we went downstairs for drinks once, drinks were good. I got a discounted rate coupon upon check out, hopefully I will come back soon to take advantage of it and to be back at this hotel. I will recommed this hotel because you can get a more personalized service than if you go to big hotels, it has a great location and great staff.

So to start, I read the reviews on tripadvisor constantly. We originally had reservations at the Waldorf Astoria for our first trip to NYC and to celebrate our first anniversary. Upon constant bad reviews, I changed our reservations to Night and what a smart move! We arrived 8 hours before check in and expected to just leave our bags and go explore until we would be able to check-into our room. Christine surprised us by saying that she had a room available right then! Wonderful customer service. Our room was great. Was a little nervous of the "goth" look but it is very well done. Bed was very comfortable, room size was fine, room and bathroom VERY clean. Only thing we found wrong was the bathroom fixtures were a little loose and the shower head was broken but still functional (water sprayed in numerous directions). Nothing major in my opinion. Christine also found out that it was our anniversary and there was a complimentary bottle of champagne waiting for us when we returned one night. That really hit it home for us. The Night hotel acknowledged a very special day for my husband and I. So if you are looking for a great location to times square it doesn't get any better than this. You walk out the front doors turn left and walk less than a minute, you are right in the middle of times square!Best customer service, best location, best value for your money. I am very thankful that we changed our reservations to Night. Can't say enough about our awesome experience. Thank you everyone especially Christine and Barry for all of your help.

We have just returned from our stay in NYC and had a fantastic time.The night hotel was a great find at a reasonable price. The staff were helpful and gave us details on the city, where to go and what to do.My husband and I like Jazz music and they booked us a table at Jazz bar and eaterie. They also booked us a helicopter ride over the city.The bar was only open in the evening but this didn't matter as we only used it for pre-dinner drinks. The hotel was right on the edge of Times Square so we didn't need to rely on cabs too much.The only downside to the hotel is the size of the rooms- they are very small. I am told that this is the case in most city centre hotels.The bed was sooo comfy though.In contrast our friends stayed the Excellsior near central park and I found the staff up there very rude and unhelpful.

I booked the hotel knowing the dark decor but thought it would be fun for my 30th birthday weekend in NYC. The hotel lived up to my expectations. It was clean, comfortable and beautiful. Yes, it is dark but the website clearly shows that. Yes, the rooms are small but ALL rooms in NYC are smaller than in other parts of the city.The room was well thought out though and the bed was oh so comfy. The location was amazing and the service was fantastic. The bartender-sorry I forget her name-was so helpful. She helped us find a tattoo shop, restaurant suggestions, discussed how to use the subway and more importantly, recommended a fantastic restaurant to my boyfriend for my birthday dinner and helped us get elusive reservations. She was one of the best parts of the trip and with her great suggestions, made my 30th birthday a trip of a lifetime. We will definitely be staying here again.

Arrived last Saturday for a week. Hotel is well located close to time square. Hotel is sexy even if rooms are small. Our room has no view but is very quiet (we are on 3rd floor). At least we can sleep well without being disturbed by the city noises. It is clean ans staff is friendly and helpful. When we arrived on Saturday our room wasn't ready on time so we got offered a compensation gift. Breakfast is good but damn I still don't get why we news to pay for Internet in a such expensive hotel. I would recommend it, btw returning clients get a 15% off when booking online... Do you want the code ??
We have stayed there four times and love it! a bottle of champagne was delivered to our room when we arrived as a welcome back gesture. Staff so friendly. Will be back
great location, small room, but perfect for new york few days stay. and breakfast too, would stay again.

The black & white palate might not be for everyone but this place was great. Sometimes the more boutique like places in nyc feel cheap or tacky but this one rose to the top. We loved the location, even being in time square. The entire hotel was in a night time theme, combine that with the nightlife offering of the hotel & the city and you have a perfect combination. The lounge was the perfect spot to have our friends meet us for drinks & light snacks. The rooms were not huge, but by new york standards, very comfortable. We really enjoyed our time in nyc & the night hotel.

I love staying here and have several times. I love the decor as it appeals to my own personal taste. Despite being fearfully close to Times Sq. it is not very touristy. Most patrons I've seen/heard are European. The staff are very nice and helpful. The beds are very comfortable and rooms spacious (especially for NYC). It's quiet (also not easy to find in NYC) and the bar downstairs is nice. Love the breakfast too. Great rates can be found online. Well worth the price and easy to get places since it's central.

We chose this hotel before from reading the reviews and it's great decor. It certainly lived up to our expectations. The staff were great! Very helpful they let us use the employee fridge to store milk for our baby and Erica the maid was especially nice. My only criticism is that the shower screen was too small so water went over to the toilet. Okay the rooms were small but this is New York. We expected to be in a smallish room. The location is great right in the centre of times square and very safe to walk through at anytime of the day. The rooms have reasonable lighting but because the theme is black and White the dark walls quash the light and give really intimate close feeling. Overall we loved this hotel and will be booking with them again for sure.

Never again. The hotel's decor isn't cool. it's just dark a probably hides more issues best covered up. My room at 185 sqr feet was smaller that I have ever had in my life ecxcept for that one night in jail back in college. The bed, to accommodate the cramped quarters was so short I literally couldn't fit my 6 foot frame between the headboard and baseboard. The one good thing? Starbucks next door.

I like fancy hotels and I love modern once but I was big disappointed about the Night Hotel in New York. I dont have any kind of problem to spend $350 for a nice hotel. But for this price I dont expact that my laundary disappear and the receptionist just told me after the third call in 3h that he dont know where it is. In the end I went down to the receptionist and told the guy that I have to call the police if all my shirts are missing so he said he will check it again. Went back and found my laundary. For me that was pretty remarkable. The best thing came after my trip when I arrived home and saw that they charged me the trip 5 times on my credit card. After 2 calls they found out that they had a problem and they will rebook it. So they rebooked my friends creditcard instead of mine. He checked in with me but left a day earlier and stayed in a other room. All in all its a hotel on an amazing place directly behind the time square with a stuff which is ridiculous for this kind of price. The rooms are small and there is no day light just walls which are covered with fashionable curtains. The Night is the program or call it coffin! It was so fancy that they forget to build in a wardrobe. So your lugagge will stand somewhere in the small room.

We were in town for a business trip, and our company occupied two rooms in the Night Hotel in October.The Good:The Night Hotel is very stylish, very elegant, with lovely avant garde “Modern Gothic” décor. The location is excellent: it is in the heart of Times Square, walking distance to theatres and restaurants, but despite its central location, it isn’t particularly noisy by Manhattan standards. We were able to sleep with the window open. The rooms are clean, and are the same size as your average Manhattan hotel room. The beds are comfortable enough, though they are topped with feather mattresses that do slide a bit.The Bad:The bathrooms are also stylish, but they are barely functional. The water pressure in the shower is atrocious, and you’re either freezing or scalding. The toilets don’t flush well. The climate control in the room was so noisy that we couldn’t hear each other speak while it was on. The rooms are poorly lit – there are simply not enough lights, and the ones that you do have aren’t bright enough -- and the black on black furniture and decor doesn't help this at all. If you have black accessories, black clothing, or black electronics, they disappear against the black on black on black everything. Plan on spending some time each day just locating your possessions. The staff is indifferent at best, and many of them were just too cool to be helpful or friendly. We were barely acknowledged at all during our trip. The front desk staff is not welcoming. I’m not sure how else to put that. It wasn’t until the last day that the front desk person was pleasant or helpful at all. The complimentary breakfast was as delicious as airline food. Seriously, eat breakfast somewhere else.Very, very little in the way of services and amenities, and the Wifi did not work properly the entire time we were there.We wouldn’t stay there again, and I would not recommend this hotel. We will certainly be looking for other lodging for our future business trips to NYC. Other than the décor, the hotel wasn’t spectacular, and I’d rather spend my money with a hotel that has a staff that cares about their clients.

I was a little apprehensive that the hotel could not possibly live up to how it presented online. I spent three nights and every time I walked into the hotel room I felt the same as the first moment I saw it. From the moment you walk through the doors the atmosphere transforms you.Check in was efficient, staff was friendly and courteous. The room was quiet and clean.The bed was comfortable, shower hot, the breakfast was excellent with good variety. Minor issues with room maintenance that did not in any way diminish my visit.Will definitely stay again.

It was our first time visiting new york and i had a blast. I really like the gothic theme but the rooms are small.The continental Breakfast was kool but open late three mornings. The staffs were friendly, especially Troy he made us feel like we were home away from home the moment he check us in.They need more bellman there was only one there when we were checking out. We wait a while to get our bags.

My friends and I originally had 4 rooms booked across the street at the Hotel St James and when we saw the rooms there, we went looking for another place to stay. We were even willing to have to pay for our first night since they would not give our money back. Well, thank goodness we found Night. The desk staff was very friendly and helpful. They were happy to show us the rooms before we committed to them. Yes they are small, but they are clean, updated, very well decorated. The bed was very comfortable.. sheets were top quality. The included breakfast was so nice. Nothing fancy.... but coffee, tea, juices, bagels toast and eggs. We loved the music in the lobby. After coming in from the hectic outside, it was a pleasant change to come into the sexy lobby with zen music. The room can be a little noisy because the hallways are small and the doors slam... but I didn't find it a problem. Loved the location. Would definitely stay there again.

Like everything in Newyork, the hotel is on the expensive side . The hotel is very close to the times square, so ideal for tourists and business travellers. The staff was very accommodating and helpful. The lights are dimmed and some people might not like it. At least it is different from the standard.

Just back from 4 days in nyc and stayed in the Night Hotel. great hotel location is perfect for tourists. Hotel is spotless and served a good FREE breakfast in the morning which is unusual in ny.Staff were friendly and the rooms were cool with large tv and Bose sound system. Will definatly syay there again if i get the chance.

The location is fantastic , my boyfriend and I were only in nyc for one night so the location had to be good . Times square is at your doorstep ! The reception staff were cordial , they welcomed but you could sense it was because of duty and job description . the guy on the door was cool ( cant remember his name ) he was really helpful and made us feel at home , The room we had was small but enough space to move around , the bathroom was small but managable . A big negative was a tiny window if you could call it that looking out to a back alley ...claustrophobic ,no natural light and room very dark . Having said that I enjoyed my night there as the vibe of hotel was great ,sexy and cool . One night was enough but if I was on a longer break I would not have been comfortable . NYC is a busy and fast paced city and this is captured in this hotel .For the ladys .... there was not enough light in my room to put makeup on , I had to get my boyfriend to take a photo so I could see myself a little better !I would not reccomend this hotel for familiys , If your in NYC for one or two nights to party then go for it .....!!!

Small room made even smaller as we had nowhere to put the suitcases due to a very small wadrobe that had the "sensored" fridge in it,along with a badly postioned safe ,you cant get your hand fully into the safe, could easily leave something inside! Excellent furnishings,decor and toiletries, always very clean, Turn down service could be a bit quieter could hear him calling out from the bottom of the corridoor, but he was such a pleasant guy as were all the staff.Appreciated the "hot" breakfast of scrambled eggs& bacon with good choice of pastries.,though found the lack of space very frustrating you can only get 1 person at a time due to the small area, please management do something about this, suggest you have a seperate table for the coffee/tea etc, even at the loss of 1 table and 2 chairsReception staff were very helpful and friendly, even charged my phone for me as my charger wasnt working, checked inmy flights as the laptop for guests use was always in use whenever I went through receptionReception area very comfortable, nice touches with fresh fruit always available and playing cards. Please management consider tea/coffee facilities available in rooms, even if you only provide on request, this is a must especially as your fridges are pressure sensored so guests cant even use it for their own drinks, move anything in it at your peril!! Even choice hotels provide this facility.My husband and I are "young" pensioners and we loved your hotel, super location, no street noise friendly helpfull staff. .

Perfect location. Our first room was the smallest hotel room I have seen in 10 years of travel, but after an upgrade we were back styling in a beautiful room. Great staff complimented the great theme of the hotel.

We stayed at The Night Hotel during a trip to NYC for a concert. Everything that you read with respect to the room is probably correct. I have stayed in many NYC hotels and this is by far the smallest I have ever been in. We had a window that looked directly onto a brick wall! The beds are super comfortable and I'll admit, if you are spending considerable amounts of time in your hotel, you shouldn't be in New York. It works for a place to sleep but if you are spending more than one night, I wouldn't spend it here. It is simply too small. In addition, we tried to get a drink at the hotel bar after the concert (12:30 am ish) and it was closed. I didn't know anything in New York closed that early. The location is good if you are into Times Square as it is half a block from everything. For the price, I would not recommend this hotel as there are others in the neighborhood that are the same price with larger rooms.

All in all okay stay. The room was exceptionally tiny, but that is as expected in NYC. The front desk staff and bar staff were very friendly and helpful with questions. I was in NYC with my fiancé and we really liked the privacy and intimacy of the hotel bar - perfect way to end an evening. The hotel seemed clean...but it is so dark everywhere it was hard to know for sure. The hotel is trying so hard to be boutique chic...but I don't quite think it makes the mark. The site that I booked from rated the hotel as 4 star...it is 3 star at best. It is 2 minutes from Time Square, but I think next time I would sacrifice location for something a bit more elegant. Oh...and also...the website says it was voted the "sexiest hotel" or something...so be prepared to hear it...the walls - paper thin.

The location is good. The staff are unfriendly. When we returned at 4.00 after a day sighseeing, the room had not been 'serviced', it was how we left it!They charge you $30 for 'using the mini bar as a fridge. This includes putting your own bottle of water in it over night!They have replaced the traditional Bible with a copy of the Kama Sutra - no problem with that except half the pages were stuck together - don't ask!

I know hotel rooms in NYC aren't renowned for being spacious but this was just ridiculous. Knowing that New York rooms can be small, we upgraded to the King Size room - the bed was lovely, but you could hardly walk all the way around the bed and the wardrobe was tucked into such a ridiculous space (and with no light inside it) that it was hardly usable. Also, breakfast was passable but nothing amazing - we mostly ended up going out.Great location and great concept, but I think i'd rather go beige with another foot of space in future.

Stayed for three nights in late Sept 2010 for a business conference a few blocks away. Booked through Hotwire, so didn't know what I was in for...The good facts:I found the bed to be comfortable.The room and hotel were clean.NO sign of bedbugs!The staff was always available and helpful (but never smiled, a la Mike Myer's Sprockets)All the lights in the room actually worked (thankfully).The negative facts:My "upgraded" room had no closet, no desk, no window, very creaky floors, a hole in the wall, a broken privacy lock, and an outlet dangling from the wall that sparked if you tried to use it . (will post some photos in a bit)The rooms are very black, especially the bathroom. There is no full length mirror. There is enough light to make yourself look good for the evening, but not for the daytime :-)The hallways are VERY noisy - your door insulates very little sound, and doors close with a huge bang! Hope you don't get neighbors who come in at all hours of the night. Keep in mind that the hotel also plays loud music throughout the building until about 11pm or so.There is mood lighting under the bed. I want you not to look, though, since you may find things that your predecessors left behind.As for location, it is close to the busiest area of NYC. If that suits you, then the location is good. For me, it made getting around tougher since the streets are always packed.Night Hotel is average for a low-end boutique hotel in the center of NYC that is trying hard.

What can I say about Night Hotel? It was my first time at New York and I´ve searched the web looking for prices of reasonable hotels in the Midtwon and I bumped into The Night. After reading all the comments that other users made at Tripadvisor (despite the negative ones) I decided to spend 6 nights at the hotel and it was the cleverest decision I could take. I have nothing to say but INCREDIBLE, SOPHISTICATED, ROMANTIC and GLAMOROUS. Let me share my comments about others negative comments: a) BREAKFAST: OK. It´s not a Wow breakfast but you have all the stuff you need for starting the morning. Coffe, hot milk, lots of bagels, some muffins, scrumbled eggs and bacon...the same thing (or even more) that you probably get if you go to breakfast at Starbucks. The good thing here that it´s for free!, b) SHOWER: Despite there´s a narrow glass the covers the bathtub it´s not true that the floor gets completely wet. What you only have to do is to throw a towel just beside the bathtub and ready! No water on the floor!, c) LIGHT: You don´t have to be very wise to realize that if you go to a boutique hotel called NIGHT the atmosphere will be related with the "blacks". I love spending my breakfast listening to chill out music in a darky and glamorous ambient as well as my room. Special details as daily chocolates and the printed weather forecast just over the bed were really appreciated, d) ROOMS: I was at a QUEEN room and I should say that it was perfect! It was not enormous but despite our "hundred shopping bags" we can move freely all over the room with no problems. If you go to NY for sightseeing I can swear you that you will leave the hotel at 10 Am and you don´t come back till 7 or 8 pm so what you will only need is a warm shower and an incredible bed and rooms at THE NIGHT get a 10!!!! e) LOCATION: Great! Excellent! You will only have to walk 50 meters to get at 45st and Broadway were everything happens! You want to buy tickets at TKTS? Ok! Just walk 2 blocks and you will find it. Perhaps some presents for your kids at Toys R us? Ok! Walk 2 1/2 blocks and you will be there! Starbucks? 20 mts from the main entrance. Planet Hollywood? Just at the corner!!!! Everything was near there!!!!!! Last, but not least, an special mention to Mr Thomas Carpenter (the General Manager of the hotel) who takes care personally of all our request and the "Morocco" guy who helped us with our luggage, some umbrellas when raininning and a warm and friendly "hello" everyday. ONLY one thing to mention. The Night is definitely a hotel for couples or business men/women. I would not recommed it for familys with very young kids as the ambient and the facilities are not prepared for "the smallest". Anyway I would not doubt to come back to THE NIGHT if I had the chance to visit NY again!!!! Congratulations and keep improving guys!!!!!!!!!

We stayed at The Night Hotel for a week over the St. Patrick's Day parade and absolutely loved it. Fantastic location, good breakfasts, decent size room and bathroom, brilliant amenities, cool staff, especially the doorman. We are returning to NY in October with our kids and were looking forward to staying at The Night Hotel, until we discovered that the rates have increased by a hundred percent and continue to rise each time we contact the hotel. Although this would still be our first choice we cannot understand (or afford) the big difference in price.

This is the most amazing hotel in the premier location in New York City. We stayed for 4 nights on the Labour Day weekend.All the reviews talk about the darkness -- but that is actually it's appeal. The staff is wonderful (especially Simon, who could get you anything you need). We were able to check in early and leave our luggage after check out. Newspapers and fruit available at all times. We love walking up and down the marble stairs that open to the lobby. Beautiful pictures and music throughout (very romantic!!) The room is small, but incredibly clean and well laid out -- the cleaning staff do a superb job!! When you deal with white linens -- they'd better be clean (fabulous)!! We had a small double room and it was small, but with the most comfortable bed. You walk into the room with music playing from a Bose radio/CD player, lights under the bed, 40 inch plasma tv on the wall(conserve space!!), in-room safe, beautiful robe…. The complaints about the shower – it is unusual, but there is never any water on the floor!!The web site is the most accurate you will ever find – it is the sexiest (OK, a little different) hotel in New York City. This hotel is not for stuffy old people that are expecting the Waldorf Astoria and are not in a romantic frame of mind, but I have stayed there and prefer this!!

What a fantastic hotel. It's dark, yes, but this was not an issue....it's actually great if you're jetlagged! it was clean, and the sheets, pillows and bed were all great quality and comfortable. The rooms are smallish, but we stayed for 10 days with two massive suitcases and didn't seem to have a problem. The breakfast is included, and it's minimal but we ate out most days anyways. Staff were all very friendly and there is always someone at reception 24/7. The locations is unbeatable, a few doors down from Times Square. Also - no bed bug issues which is a major issue in NY at the moment! We got the room at a great rate and it was exceptional value for money - We'd stay here again.

Great concept for a hotel, but certain things were lacking. The Bad: Upon check in we were greeted (use that term loosely) with a staff member that was less than helpful and frankly just seemed disgruntled every time we attempted to speak with her. Our shower would not drain properly which resulted in us standing in 4-6 inches of water after only a few minutes. After asking for the fourth time that it be fixed we gave up. It also appeared that the maids gave the room only a once over - as there were stains on the wall and the furniture. The Good: Great location. Good atmosphere, and comfortable room for the price.I give the Night a very reluctant recommendation based mainly on its location and hope we just caught them at a bad time.

First the not so good, we stayed in a Queen room at this hotel after we had been 'upgraded'. I tend to like my hotel rooms with a view, and this hotel well, if you call the back of a wall, and the site of a long winding alleyway a view!! Now the good, for location, friendly staff, good ecletic mix of music, and a kama sutra book instead of the usual bible! this hotel was excellent. The location is about 50ft from the middle of Times Square, Empire state, Rockafella, Chrysler, Grand Central Terminal, even Central Park at a push are all withing walking distance. Breakfast was continental with a little of bacon and eggs to make us Brits feel at home. The air conditioning was noisey but also soothing at the same time, the 40" plasma was nice to look at while waiting for my partner to get ready in the morning. The hotel's location also mean't that there was a steady stream of the 'famous' yellow cabs waiting to be hailed, and it mean't you could get around the city relatively cheaply. All in all there was very little to complain about at the Night Hotel.
